# 灵宝无量度人上经大法

*The Great Method of the Numinous Treasure Sutra of Limitless Salvation*

**Sutra Title:** *The Great Method of the Numinous Treasure Sutra of Limitless Salvation*
Originally attributed to the Heavenly Perfected Sovereign, scholarly consensus holds that it was compiled by Daoist talisman masters of the Song-era Registers of Yuanshu, with its final form completed in the early Ming. A comprehensive compendium of talismanic arts and methods from various traditions, it comprises seventy-two scrolls.

**Source Text:** *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, *Dongzhen* Section, Methods Category.

**The Great Method of the Numinous Treasure’s Limitless Salvation of Humankind, First Scroll**

**The Eight Illuminations Unfolding Wisdom**

The Mystic Master said: The Great Method of the Numinous Treasure was expounded by the Most High Great Lofty Primordial Heavenly Worthy, received by the Jade Clarity Dao Lord, the Five Venerable Thearchs, the Exalted Perfected Saints, the Wondrously Practiced Realized Ones, and the Divine Kings of the Ten Directions—all the supremely true and numinous deities. The Later Sage, the Mysterious Origin Golden Portal Lofty Perfected Heavenly Emperor, transmitted and disseminated its teachings below, so that the world might hear them. It is the thirty-six divisions of the Venerable Scriptures, comprising eighteen thousand scrolls. The root of all Daoist teachings, its profound and recondite mysteries pervade the myriad methods as one.

First, it clarifies the primordial qi of the Originator: from whence did the Jade Scripts first emerge? According to the *Numinous Treasure Jade Scripts’ Inner Sound Scripture*: Before the Three Qi, after the primordial darkness, within it the true essence suddenly transformed, giving rise to the primordial qi. Within the primordial qi there was a spirit, called the Primordial Heavenly King. Its qi congealed and coalesced, co-emerging with the Originator, flowing and transforming to crystallize into fragrance. Neither form nor appearance, now expanding, now contracting. When the kalpa of Extending Prosperity began, the one qi divided into two. From the spontaneous void arose the primordial qi. The two qi intertwined, congealing into the Great Void, pervading the boundless, each character a square foot in size, its eight corners radiating light—none could fathom its principle. The two qi congealed together, enfolding the Jade Scripts. When the kalpa of Dragon Han began, the Primordial Heavenly King apportioned the two qi, and the chaos parted to reveal light. The clear and lofty qi ascended to form heaven; the turbid and heavy qi descended to form earth. From the division and union of the two qi arose the harmonizing qi, called the Mysterious Qi, also known as the Great Brahmā’s Qi. When the kalpa of Vermilion Brightness began, the Originator unfolded the chart, within which the true yang qi transformed into the Cavernous Yang Fire. The Originator wielded the Cavernous Yang Fire to smelt and refine the Three Qi, blending them with the Jade Scripts to produce the Vermilion Script. Thus, the kalpa was named Vermilion Brightness, and the script was called the Vermilion Writ of the Jade Scripts—such is this principle.

Second, it clarifies the generation and nurturance of the chaos, the forging of the myriad patterns. Since the sundering of chaos, the Three Qi formed the script, refined by fire into the radiant qi of the Vermilion Writ. The essence of the yang light became the sun; the essence of the numinous light became the moon. The remaining light dispersed to form the myriad images, while the spirits of the Three Qi divided into the Three Clarities’ sages. Thereafter, all things emerged and were born—none but the Three Qi of the Mysterious Originator. When the kalpa of Opening Sovereignty began, the Three Origins were apportioned, giving rise to the myriad sages. When the kalpa of the Supreme Thearch began, the five kalpas unfolded in succession. The Five Phases took full form, generating the myriad perfected ones and immortals. Within the five kalpas, the essence of the Mysterious Center was produced, and within that essence, the spirit—all were called Supreme Thearchs, hence the kalpa was named the Supreme Thearch Kalpa. During the five kalpas, the upright qi of the Five Phases flowed and spread, taking form. Now gathering, now dispersing; now coiling, now unfurling; now expanding; now embodying clouds, mist, fire, and haze; now resembling stars, constellations, gold, and jade; now assuming the shapes of insects, fish, dragons, and birds—all emerged from the Vermilion Writ of the Jade Scripts. Their forms naturally divided, generating the texts of the Three Caverns and Four Supplements: the Dragon Embryo, the Stone Radiance, the countless charts and books, the three divisions and thousand-fold destinies. The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign and the Grand Perfected Jade Consort inscribed these texts onto bamboo slips, compiling them into registers to rectify the root of generation and completion, to encompass the origin of the myriad images, to mold the mechanism of all beings, and to serve as the pivot for the emergence of immortals and perfected ones.

Third, it clarifies that the Great Method of the Numinous Treasure naturally generates charts and books, encompassing the myriad images as the pivot of the Three Powers—such is this principle.

Fourth, it clarifies that the Great Method is the ancestral teaching of the Three Caverns, giving birth to all sages. After the unfolding of the five kalpas, the scriptures of the Jade Clarity Cavern-Real, the Highest Clarity Cavern-Mysterious, and the Grand Clarity Cavern-Spiritual, along with the talismans of the Four Supplements, all emerged from the Vermilion Writ of the Jade Scripts, taking form through the qi of the Numinous Treasure. In ancient times, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy commanded the thirty-nine emperors of the Supreme Thearch and the Heavenly Emperors of the Nine Empyreans, each recording scriptures and invocations to compose the thirty-nine chapters of the Great Cavern. They illuminated the source of the five kalpas’ unfolding and expounded the method of harmonizing the Three Qi into one, which was entrusted to the Jade Clarity Dao Lord. Subsequently, across the various heavens, the thirty-six divisions of the Venerable Scriptures were expounded. Later, during the eras of the Three Sovereigns, the Later Sage, the Mysterious Origin Venerable Lord of the Golden Portal, descended to transform and teach. During the time of Shennong, he descended as Yu Mozi, tasted the hundred herbs, distinguished the five grains, and expounded the *Scripture of Longevity*. During the time of Fuxi, he descended as Yuan Huazi, rectified the eight directions, elucidated yin and yang, and expounded the *Numinous Treasure Primordial Yang Scripture*. During the time of Zhu Rong, he descended as Yu Huazi, cultivated the Three Bonds, ordered the Seven Governors, and expounded the *Numinous Treasure Five Stars’ Constant Harmony Scripture*. During the time of the Yellow Emperor, he descended as Guang Chengzi and expounded the *Numinous Treasure Daoist Precepts Scripture*. During the time of Shaohao, he manifested as Que Yingzi and expounded the *Numinous Treasure Primordial Treasury Scripture*.

During the time of Gaoxin, he was known as Yuanyangzi and expounded the *Scripture of Subtle Words*. During the time of Emperor Yao, he was known as Wuchengzi and expounded the *Scripture of Governance*. During the time of Emperor Shun, he was known as Yinshouzi and expounded the *Supreme Clarity Scripture* and the *Lingbao Red Writ*. During the time of Yu of Xia, he was known as Zhenningzi and expounded the *Scripture of Fivefold True Writ* and the *Scripture of the Dragon’s Ascent*. During the Zhou dynasty, he was known as Guoshuzi and expounded the *Lingbao Scripture of Red Essence*, the two chapters of the *Dao and Virtue*, and the *Lingbao Scripture of Eightfold Might for Subduing Demons*. During the reign of the First Emperor of Qin, he bestowed the *Scripture of the Forest of Ghosts* along with talismans for summoning and commanding ghosts and spirits. In the Han dynasty, he was known as Chisongzi and expounded the *Scripture of the Three Ones*. During the reign of Emperor Wen, he was known as Heshanggong and expounded the *Chapters on the Dao and Virtue*. The Queen Mother of the West, by the command of the Primordial Beginning, expounded the *Lingbao Thirty-Sixfold Venerable Scriptures*. During the reign of Emperor Wu, she descended to the human realm and bestowed upon him the teachings of the *Supreme Cavern of Perfection*, the *Cavern of Mystery*, and the *Cavern of Spirit*. By the first year of Yongshou during the reign of Emperor Huan, she descended once more to the human realm and expounded the *Orthodox Unity* and the *Great Clarity Cavern-Spirit Dao*. Thus were the Three Caverns completed, all arising from the great Dharma of Lingbao, giving birth to all the sages.

The fifth principle clarifies that the human body’s Dharma originates from the Primordial Beginning, who established the primordial chaos, from which the sacred embryo of the Dharma-body is born within the human form. When father and mother unite in essence, a single point of harmonious qi is contained; the two qi divide and split, first giving rise to the kidneys. The three qi then differentiate, giving birth to the spirit-palace, which is the heart. The four qi intermingle, forming the canopy of the body’s shape. The five qi radiate together like a five-petaled flower, completing the five viscera with qi, resembling the image of the three qi extending to the fifth kalpa. The two qi divide and ascend, giving rise to the mud-pill palace, while descending to the watery abyss of the mysterious valley. The three qi refine with fire, ascending to give birth to the sun and moon, like the two eyes, illuminating the entire body and becoming the myriad images. The principle of the human body is identical to this.

To manifest forms beyond the body, one must know the ancestral qi of Lingbao. The qi of Lingbao, when entering sand, becomes gold; when entering stone, becomes jade; in birds, gives rise to phoenixes; in beasts, gives rise to dark dragons; in plants and trees, gives rise to sacred mushrooms; and in the five grains, contains auspicious omens. When dispersed, it becomes gentle winds; when ascending, it becomes propitious clouds; when descending, it becomes sweet dew. Entering water, it gives rise to night-glowing pearls; dwelling in humans, it gives rise to sages and worthies. Compared to this ancestral qi, it is the essence of the Great Harmony and the Supreme One, the chief of all spirits. Since this great treasure exists as such, just as the human form is born, entering the vast Floating Black Soil in the central cinnabar valley, it completes nine revolutions, divides into five transformations, and forms the Dharma-body. This is the tenfold cycle of the Primordial Beginning, where dried bones are revived.

The sixth principle clarifies that before the formless ancestral qi of the Primordial Beginning, by analogy, it descends in substance to become qi, giving birth to the myriad treasures. What form does it take in the present world? Refining and ingesting this qi leads to true transcendence. The qi of Lingbao exists in all things, such as the dragon’s pearl, the tiger’s treasure, ox bezoar, and crow cinnabar. The flowing essence of jade-light elixir is also of this nature, being the qi of Lingbao. Heaven and earth correspond to the sun and moon. The time when the sun is at its zenith corresponds to the initial union of spirit and qi within the body. Thus, the Supreme One Perfected says: "Always at the Great Ultimate, grasp the pivot; in movement and stillness, the spirit-pearl descends behind the curtain. Since the Lingbao arises in the mysterious valley, even a grain of millet can be sung and chanted in empty space." Those who obtain and ingest this will surely ascend to the rank of Perfected. Therefore, lesser immortals cannot approach this resemblance.

The seventh principle clarifies that within the great Dharma, the Way of the Great Cavern nurtures beings and returns the spirit, enabling ascent in broad daylight. Next, reciting the *Scripture of Long Life, Deliverance from the World, Liberation Through Corpse-Transformation, and Attainment of the Dao* encompasses all methods within the scripture. This treasure scripture guides those lost in the heavens, elucidating the intent of the Primordial Beginning’s discourse—this is the constant principle. Above, it contains the Way of inner refinement, where bones and flesh ascend together; in the middle, the methods of long life, deliverance from the world, and liberation through corpse-transformation; below, the teachings of ascending to the ancestors and delivering the mysterious. In its greatness, it safeguards and stabilizes heaven and earth, rectifies the celestial lodges, and remedies disasters while repelling demons. In its smallness, it possesses the power to cure deep-seated illnesses and revive the dead. In its luminosity, it commands wind and thunder, transforming naturally with spiritual efficacy. In its subtlety, it summons and employs the myriad spirits, perceiving the texts of the ten heavens. Thus, it is said to encompass all methods.

The eighth principle clarifies that the great Dharma has three ranks, each leading to the attainment of sagehood, Perfection, and the immortal Dao. Those who thoroughly comprehend the mysterious and practice the ten superior Ways, with merits and virtues complete, ascend in broad daylight. For others who cultivate and recite, obtaining even one Dharma or one teaching, they achieve long life and deliverance from the world, becoming the foremost immortals of the earthly grotto-heavens. Those who morning and evening pay homage with reverence, serving and making offerings, will surely attain the immortality of corpse-transformation, becoming the scattered immortals of the Ten Continents and Three Islands.

Thus concludes the first scroll of the *Great Dharma of the Lingbao Scripture of Limitless Salvation*.

Preface to the *Great Dharma of the Lingbao Scripture of Limitless Salvation*

The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign compiled this collection. From the Primordial Beginning of the Ancestral Kalpa, it is the root and origin of Heaven and Earth. The *Lingbao* revealed its diagrams, encompassing the pivot of yin and yang. It expounds the principles of the sun and moon’s transformations, governs the mechanisms of stellar transits and celestial movements. Subtly gathering the revolving net, it uplifts the cycles of *zi* and *wu*, comprehends the creative workings of the Five Phases, and pursues the primal origins of the Two Qi. Advancing and retreating with *qian* and *kun*, soaring and revolving with *li* and *kan*, it captures the dragon and tames the tiger, reins the phoenix and rides the simurgh. At dawn, it feasts on the essence of the Purple Palace; at dusk, it drinks the fluid of the Azure Flower. Refining the form with flowing fire, washing the substance in the Eastern Pool, six dragons dance in the layered skies, and the Nine Qi seethe and boil in the Jade Crucible.

Does the Dao give birth to me, yet things have no fixed form? Abandoning things to preserve form, then qi and spirit merge, and the true self becomes luminous. Releasing emotions to nurture vastness, then essence and blood flow freely, and qi naturally congeals. The true fire soars high, flying to support the radiant sun of Mount Fuyou. Water and metal are restrained, flourishing the toad of the Jade Pass. Eight simurghs sing in unison, praising the elegant melody of the empty song. Nine phoenixes chant together, extolling the mysterious sound of the Ten Absolutes. Looking up and down at the numinous mound, the Heavenly Perfected of the Ten Directions gather of themselves. Paying homage to the Most High, the feathered guards of the myriad spirits soar in chariots.

A grain of millet hangs high, its transformations unfathomable. When it contains and embraces the empty pearl, then the countless multitudes all return. When the turbid vie and rush forth, then the thousand qi and myriad Perfected scatter entirely. Gathering qi forms treasures; assembling spirit creates numinosity. *Qian* is pure yang in its vigor; *kun* is pure yin in its depth. The natural qi is formless and nameless. Above, it reaches the Nine Pures, where qi is provisionally named as a designation. Below, it penetrates the Nine Earths, where form is then named as a designation.

Thus, know that in the profound and obscure, the dim and indistinct, when stillness is absolute, response follows upon stimulus, and the Two Qi revolve—Heaven and Earth move in accord with the seasons. The Three Fields communicate with the wondrous; yin and yang revolve to bring about transformation. There is no need for external application; why labor to create for oneself? Preserving spirit and tapping the teeth awaken the gates of the Eight Paths of the Initial Perfected. Refining qi and inscribing talismans clarify the rules for scholars to uphold.

To ingest and swallow the Nine Cycles, one must align with the transformations of the Four Seasons. Circulating the *zhou-tian*, water and fire meet; smelting metal and casting the crucible, refining stone to mend the Mysterious. Stealing the essence of the sun and moon, conjoining the lead and mercury of the spirit and Perfected. First clarify *zi* and *wu*, then distinguish water and metal. Advancing and retreating, drawing and adding, know the seasons and recognize the signs. Warmth, regulation, nurturing, and refinement—without error in the alchemical process.

Do not kill or harm out of desire and greed; do not envy or covet through lust and theft. Distance yourself from hatred and aversion; transform alien bones into kin. Deliver and ferry Heaven and humanity, propagate the teachings in the mundane world. Fathom the profound and investigate the subtle, thoroughly illuminating the wisdom of the grottoes. Bind demons and dispel afflictions, severing the source of the Six Roots’ obstructions. Abandon the false to follow the true, extinguishing the path of the Five Sufferings’ endless cycle. Restrain the hun and control the po, nurturing qi and concealing spirit. The body radiates light, and the form leaves no trace. The Three Luminaries open and clarify; separation and union occur naturally.

Feasting high in the Fragrant Canopy, for ten thousand kalpas on the Cloud Terrace, donning the cap and ascending in flight to the Golden Gates and Jade Mountains, in the boundless realm of carefree wandering. Driving the jade chariot, the Ten Qi manifest flight in the heavens. Controlling the green carriage, the Five Elders of the various heavens incline their radiance. Swiftly eliminating the causes of karmic transgressions, eradicating the path of evil roots.

Wondrous indeed is this Dharma! Thus, it is ranked among the scriptures, awakening the lost and guiding the unenlightened. Formerly, I encountered the Venerable One of Pure Subtlety, who taught me the inhalation and exhalation of the Two Qi. Later, I met the Jade Emperor of the Mysterious Sovereign, who bestowed upon me the oral instructions of the Golden Elixir. Thereby, I understood the primordial numbers of Heaven and Earth, and grasped the mechanisms of yin and yang’s generation and destruction.

The hundred grasses and myriad flowers all guard their roots and secure their stems. Rare birds and strange beasts all embrace the One and contain the Primordial. Thus, know that inverting the Five Phases and overturning the Four Images, stealing the qi of the Primordial One and Flying Mystery, guarding the essence of the true and wondrous body. Establishing the precious crucible on Mount Kongtong, flying the golden essence in the numinous grotto. Meeting the inner and outer water and fire, uniting the upper and lower spatulas. The Primordial Qi circulates, resonating with the Yellow and Mysterious to make the Pearl of Mystery radiant. Encompassing the cosmos, containing the Golden Elixir, its resources are inexhaustible.

Thus, know that Heaven and Earth alone are revered, their transformations formless and without substance. The wondrous Dao of *qian* and *kun*, the beginningless and endless of life and death. The Dao is not sought afar; it does not leave the door and window. Those who draw near are few; those who distance themselves are many. Abandoning the root and forgetting the true, they willingly delight in perishing in the springs and soil. Entering the deviant and forsaking the correct, they vainly endure summer and winter.

Stillness generates strength; tranquility prompts profound reflection. The Seven Emotions stir and fan, yang is severed and yin arises, endangering life and destiny. The Six Desires entice and indulge, essence scatters and form departs, spirit and qi vanish. The Five Viscera shake and sway; the Nine Orifices close their gates. Without knowing the origin of life and destiny, how can one attain the marvelous union of counterparts? How can one understand creation and transformation, or discern the mysterious mechanism?

I invoke great compassion, wishing to uplift the immortals-to-be. Gathering this numinous qi, I compile it as the *Mysterious Chapters*, thus naming it the *Lingbao’s Fish-Trap and Rabbit-Snare*, corresponding to the inner Dharma of the true scriptures. Entrusting it to the wondrous practice, to emerge in the world and ferry beings, manifesting in the Ten Directions under various names and titles, compiling it into scriptures that fill the Ganges’ sands.

Every line is profound; every passage is the Dao. Awakening to this wondrous principle, one enters life and exits death, abiding with the Dao forever. Comprehending this true mechanism, separation and union occur naturally, and coming and going are unimpeded. Those who encounter it are not of ordinary bone; those who practice it are Perfected Immortals of accumulated kalpas. Those who err in the destinies of humanity and Heaven fear straying from the path of enlightenment. Designating names and fixing diagrams, they verify and awaken the Dharma gates. Practitioners conceal it in secrecy; those who realize the true may be delivered.

Respectfully composed.

**Scroll Two of the *Great Dharma of the Lingbao Scripture of Limitless Salvation*: The Five Translations Become the Book**

The Mysterious Master said: The Eight Clarities can open wisdom, yet the Five Translations first complete the world’s scriptures.

The First Translation: The Jade Characters arise before the Void, concealed within the empty and cavernous, named the Great Brahmā Jade Characters. When the Red Clarity revealed its diagrams, fire refined them into script, becoming the Red-Written Jade Characters.

The Primordial Beginning, through the mighty spiritual power of Great Permeation, unfolded the Five Scripts to give rise to divine spirits, expounding and weaving mysteries to complete the great Dharma.

The Second Translation: After the fire refined the script and the Red Writing emerged, each character measured a *zhang* in height, with eight corners radiating light. They covered the myriad heavens, casting their shade below upon the Western Primordium. As the root of the Nine Heavens and the force of flowing gold, their jade radiance and golden truth shone brilliantly across the Great Void. The Primordial Beginning commanded the Heavenly Perfected Sovereign to inscribe these characters, naming them the *Eight Might Dragon Script* or the *Script of the Eight Assemblies of the Myriad Heavens*. They were concealed within the Seven Jeweled Jasper Terrace of the Upper Clarity Mystic Capital Golden Palace, as well as the Eastern and Western Flower Halls of the Purple Tenuity Upper Palace’s Orchid Chamber Golden Chamber, the repository of the Nine Heavens’ Great Radiance.

The Third Translation: The Primordial Heavenly Worthy served as the patriarch of the Dao and its methods, while the Jade Emperor Dao Lord acted as the master of the Numinous Treasure teachings. They composed the *Five Chapters of Numinous Script True Writ*, forming the thirty-two heavens’ jade characters into scriptures, named the *Cloud Seal Luminous Chapters*. The Queen Mother of the West transmitted it to the Yellow Emperor, and the Dragon Might Venerable transmitted the *Five Talismans of the Numinous Treasure* to Great Yu. The Most High and Later Sages also bestowed the *Venerable Scripture of the Numinous Treasure* upon the hundred generations of emperors, all contained within the thirty-six divisions of scriptures. There was yet another transmission involving the Yellow Emperor, who sought the Dao on Mount Emei and personally met the Sovereign, receiving the teachings anew. Later, during the Wu dynasty, the Left Immortal Weng transmitted it to the Supreme Pole’s Xu the Perfected, who disseminated it widely—this was not recounted again as a separate translation.

The Fourth Translation: On the seventh day of the seventh month in the first year of the *Yuanfeng* era of the Han, the Queen Mother of the West descended and bestowed this scripture upon Emperor Wu of Han. The emperor did not comprehend the language of the Great Brahmā. The Queen Mother said: "The Primordial Beginning is a being of the Great Canopy Heaven, and the Dao Lord is a person of the Western Na Jade Land. The languages of Heavenly Square and Divine Continent differ—how much more so the speech of the Great Brahmā?" Thereupon, she wrote it down with a brush, transcribing the Heavenly Script jade characters into contemporary writing. The language of the Great Brahmā—its dignified deportment, vestments, palace names, diagrams, titles, palace chambers, the *jiazi* cyclical signs, hexagrams, and *qi*, as well as the altar forms and great methods within—along with all categories of practices and the thirty-six divisions of venerable scriptures, were rendered into the language of the Han dynasty’s worldly writing, becoming the Dharma speech of antiquity and the present.

The Fifth Translation: The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign transcribed all the characters to establish the correct pronunciation. The Wondrous Practice Perfected composed talismanic writings for the great Dharma’s cultivation and application. The True Stabilizer Perfected, the Dark Radiance Perfected, and the Luminous Wondrous Perfected compiled the thirty-six divisions of true scriptures and talismanic diagrams into the *Central Alliance Precious Register*, forming the *Great Dharma of the Numinous Treasure* from the texts of the thirty-six divisions of true scriptures, thereby transmitting it widely. The Left Immortal Elder Weng transmitted the scriptures, registers, and methods to the Supreme Pole’s Xu the Perfected. The Elder bequeathed them to the Upper Clarity Perfected Yang, encompassing the scriptures and methods of the two ranks: the Jade Clarity Cavern Truth and the Upper Clarity Cavern Mystery. Later generations gradually developed divine writings—this was the Fifth Translation.

**Chapter on Fasting and Discipline**

The Mysterious Master said: All who receive and practice the *Great Dharma of the Numinous Treasure* must first receive the Ten Supreme Precepts:

1. Maintain an impartial mind; do not deceive yourself.
2. Be loyal to your lord and reverently filial to Heaven, Earth, and parents.
3. Extend kindness and benevolence to all beings; live frugally and restrain the self.
4. Be pure, upright, and honest; do not form cliques.
5. Honor the great Dharma and deeply believe in cultivation.
6. Respect ghosts and spirits; do not treat them lightly.
7. All clothing and food derive from the Primordial Beginning’s ancestral *qi*; do not entertain external thoughts.
8. Use ash-water to cleanse impurities; do not indulge in adornment.
9. Recite with the mouth and prostrate with the heart; do not exhaust the body.
10. On the seventh day, enter great stillness; the spirit’s light will become serene, and the Jade Clarity’s realm will appear.

The Mysterious Master said: All who study and recite this scripture, fathom the mysterious and investigate the subtle, practice the Dao to seek transcendence, must first receive and uphold the fasting Dharma and the Twelve Great Precepts:

1. Refrain from killing.
2. Refrain from harming.
3. Refrain from envy.
4. Refrain from jealousy.
5. Refrain from licentiousness.
6. Refrain from theft.
7. Refrain from greed.
8. Refrain from desire.
9. Refrain from hatred.
10. Refrain from resentment.
11. Refrain from ornate speech.
12. Refrain from evil words.

The Mysterious Master said: To honor the supreme Dharma, deliver the dead and save the living, subdue hordes of demons, and command the hundred spirits, receive the Nine Wondrous Precepts of the True:

1. Be respectful and yielding; honor and nurture your parents.
2. Be diligent and loyal to your lord.
3. Do not kill; compassionately save all beings.
4. Do not be licentious; rectify the self and interact with things.
5. Do not steal; extend righteousness and diminish the self.
6. Do not be angry; do not bully others with ferocity.
7. Do not deceive; do not flatter, rob, or harm the good.
8. Do not be arrogant; do not disdain the utmost truth.
9. Do not be dual-minded; uphold the precepts with single-minded devotion.

The Mysterious Master said: All who receive these precepts must take refuge in the body, the spirit, and the life to the Three Supreme Treasures. Do not follow false teachers, nor be swayed by illusions, deceptions, or the demonic teachings of external paths, nor those who claim to be immortals or transcendents.

1. First, take refuge in the Supreme Dao Treasure.
2. Second, take refuge in the Supreme Scripture Treasure.
3. Third, take refuge in the Supreme Master Treasure.

The Mysterious Master said: All the above precepts were spoken by the Heavenly Worthy’s golden mouth. Those who receive and uphold them without violation will be celebrated by the myriad heavens, extinguish demonic trials, and attain transcendence. If one violates them, the Earth Bureau will swiftly report, the Three Officials will investigate, and the Five Emperors will record the transgression. Minor offenses will reduce one’s allotted lifespan; moderate offenses will subject the living soul to examination; grave offenses will calculate one’s merits and lead to downfall, stripping away longevity and emoluments, and demoting one’s rank among transcendents. If the violation was not intentional, repentance is still permitted. However, one must avoid the autumn equinox; repent and do not repeat the offense, for three failures will not be pardoned.

The Mysterious Master said: In practicing the fire Dharma, follow the auspicious days of the myriad heavens to purify and fast. Then, Heaven and Earth will inscribe your name, and the nine mysteries and seven ancestors will together ascend to the Southern Palace. Your person will be pure and auspicious, attaining long life without death. When merits are fulfilled and perfection achieved, blessings will extend to your family. All aspirations will be realized; ghosts and spirits will bow in reverence, and the ten thousand Perfected will come to pay homage.

On the first day of each month, the Jade Treasure August Heavenly Worthy of the East, together with the Nine Qi Heavenly Lords, descends. On the eighth day, the Mysterious Perfected Heavenly Worthy of Myriad Blessings of the South, together with the Three Qi Heavenly Lords, descends. On the fourteenth day, the Supreme Marvelous Ultimate Heavenly Worthy of the West, together with the Seven Qi Heavenly Lords, descends. On the fifteenth day, the Mysterious August Jade Dawn Heavenly Worthy of the North, together with the Five Qi Heavenly Lords, descends. On the eighteenth day, the August Heavenly Worthy of Ascending Transcendence of the Northeast, together with the Brahma Qi Heavenly Lords, descends. On the twenty-third day, the Heavenly Worthy of Life-Preserving Salvation of the Southeast, together with the Brahma Qi Heavenly Lords, descends. On the twenty-seventh day, the Supreme Numinous Void August Heavenly Worthy of the Southwest, together with the Brahma Qi Heavenly Lords, descends. On the twenty-eighth day, the Boundless Supreme Florescence Heavenly Worthy of the Northwest, together with the Brahma Qi Heavenly Lords, descends. On the twenty-ninth day, the Jade Void Luminous August Heavenly Worthy of the Upper Realm, together with the Brahma Qi Heavenly Lords, descends. On the thirtieth day, the Perfected August Cavern Dawn Heavenly Worthy of the Lower Realm, together with the Ninefold Dark Earthly Sovereign, descends. In short months, the twenty-seventh day is omitted.

The Mysterious Master said: On these ten days of heavenly descent, it is fitting to purify, fast, repent of transgressions, and pray for grace, presenting petitions to the Ten Heavens. The Three Assemblies should likewise be observed. The first, the Assembly of Ascension, is held on the seventh day of the first month; the second, the Assembly of Celebrating Life, on the seventh day of the seventh month; and the third, the Grand Assembly of Establishing Life, on the fifth day of the tenth month.

The Mysterious Master said: These Three Assemblies, along with the Three Primes and the fifteenth days, are all times for universal salvation and merit assessment. There are also the Five La Days. On these days, as expounded in the *Sutra on the Profound Kindness of the True One’s Father and Mother*, it is proper to fast, venerate departed ancestors, recite scriptures, perform the Dao, and deliver the deceased—such a one is called a filial child. To sacrifice on other days is not only wanton worship but also fails to reach the departed, and the offering brings no blessing.

The La Days are as follows: the Heavenly La on the first day of the first month, the Earthly La on the fifth day of the fifth month, the Dao-Virtue La on the seventh day of the seventh month, the People’s Year La on the first day of the tenth month, and the Nobles’ La during the twelfth month.

The Mysterious Master said: There are also the Lesser Three Assemblies—on the gengshen day, the jiazi day, and one’s natal day. On the gengshen day, the Corpse Spirit reports one’s transgressions. On the jiazi day, the Great One reviews the registers of spirits. On one’s natal day, the hundred spirits pay homage to the body. On the Eight Nodal Days, the perfected of the eight directions gather to assess merit, demerit, and transgressions in the Eight Radiant Palace of the Upper Prime. These are the four beginnings, two solstices, and two equinoxes.

There are also the Lesser Nodal Assemblies, when it is fitting to perform jiao rites, make offerings, and recite scriptures to invite the descent of the Perfected and obtain blessings: the Heavenly Nodal Assembly on jiawu, the Earthly Nodal Assembly on jiashen, the Four Seasons Nodal Assembly on jiachen, the Human Nodal Assembly on jiazi, the Five Agents Nodal Assembly on jiaxu, the Heavenly Assembly on bingwu, the Earthly Assembly on renwu, the Day Assembly on gengwu, the Month Assembly on gengshen, the Stellar Assembly on xinyou, the Assembly of Transcendent Perfected on dingmao, the Dipper Assembly on the third day, and the Assembly of One’s Natal Day.

The Mysterious Master said: As one who studies the Way of transcendence and cultivates the great Dharma, whenever encountering any inauspicious assembly, one should also purify, fast, burn incense, and recite scriptures. When Heaven and Earth reach their end, when the stellar lodges deviate from their courses, when the sun and moon lose their brightness, when the four seasons fall out of order, when yin and yang are unbalanced, when the sovereign faces calamity, when warfare arises on all sides, when pestilence spreads, when the multitudes perish, or when teachers and friends pass away—these six conditions are precisely the essential occasions for the adept to perform meritorious deeds.

Moreover, when Heaven and Earth reach their end—whether the great or lesser cycles of the nine hundred and six yin and yang periods—there may be cataclysms of celestial and terrestrial rupture or the adversities of exhausted destiny. In such times, one must purify, fast, burn incense, and recite scriptures. Likewise, when the stellar lodges deviate from their paths, when their courses are violated, when baleful comets or ominous stars appear, or when the sun and moon are eclipsed or dimmed, one should also purify, fast, burn incense, and recite scriptures. When the four seasons’ cold and warmth lose their proper measure, when yin and yang bring drought or flood, when untimely commands are issued, when perverse qi engenders calamity, when warfare arises in the nine regions, when rebellions erupt, when campaigns are waged east and west, or when traitors and rebels wield weapons everywhere, one should also purify, fast, burn incense, and recite scriptures.

Should the most sagely and divine persons, even if burdened by past karmic debts, encounter demonic trials, suffer misfortune, or endure adversity, they too should purify, fast, burn incense, and recite scriptures. As for those of shallow learning who fail to grasp the profound realm, how can they escape affliction? Moreover, in this defiled world of the five impurities, with its plagues of locusts, warfare, fire, pestilence, royal law, the Great One’s military destiny, or the collusion of evildoers to reclaim old debts, one should also purify, fast, burn incense, and recite scriptures. By performing such meritorious deeds, one will surely attain the rank of Perfected and become a minister of the Golden Towers.

The Mysterious Master said: The method for reciting scriptures is fully set forth in the *Chapter on Cultivation and Recitation*. The ritual for burning incense is found in the *Canon of Scriptural Weft*. There are four kinds of fasting: the fast of the heart, the constant fast, the pure and tranquil fast, and the perpetual fast.

The fast of the heart entails strictly observing the heavenly precepts, aligning heart and intent, harmonizing inner and outer conduct, freeing oneself from thought and desire, from anxiety and fear, sitting in effortless forgetfulness, embodying the virtue of the Perfected, and uniting with the standard of transcendence—this is called the fast of the heart. The constant fast entails abstaining from pungent flavors and impure foods, refraining from meat and desire. The pure and tranquil fast entails abstaining from the five grains, severing worldly affairs, dwelling in the mountains and forests, drinking primordial qi, upholding the precepts, forgetting worldly attachments, dissolving the bonds of the womb, and cutting off social ties. The perpetual fast entails practicing all three of the above methods for one or two months, one or two years, ten or twenty years—even to the point of ascending in flight, beginning with the first resolve.

According to the *Great Ultimate Code of the Statutes on Determining Transgressions from the Mysterious Capital*: Consuming the five pungent foods while reciting scriptures is the foremost transgression under the precepts. In reciting, cultivating, and chanting, to offend the numinous spirits or defile the true qi brings the retribution of the venomous serpent piercing the heart hell.

The consumption of the three *yan* foods forever extinguishes the hope of immortality. Furthermore, the flesh of the six livestock, as well as the fetuses and eggs of birds and beasts, must not be eaten. To consume them is to harm life and sever destiny. Pork and dog meat are especially forbidden—not only do they violate the precepts and break the fast, but even if one’s merits and virtues are complete, the gates of heaven will be barred, preventing entry, and one’s name will fail to reach the Upper Prime. Only when a Daoist falls ill may they consume dried venison, elk, goose, or duck meat. Once recovered, it is best to abstain again.

**Chapter on the Descent of the Treasured Scriptures**
The *Treasured Scriptures* were sealed and bestowed upon the world. The Heavenly Worthy, in the Azure Beginning Heaven, expounded this scripture and conferred it upon the Dao Lord. Later, in the Great Cinnabar Heaven, he granted the *Great Brahma Sound*, and after the Dao Lord completed its arrangement, it was revered as a treasure in the heavens and concealed within the Purple Tenuity Palace of the Jade Capital in the Mysterious Metropolis. Its sealing and safeguarding are of utmost gravity, transmitted only to the sagely. Later, the Queen Mother of the West petitioned the Heavenly Emperor to descend it for averting the calamity of the *Bao Jia Shen* year, entrusting it to those who cultivate the true. Thus, it remained in the human world.

This scripture comprises the hidden hymns of the myriad heavenly emperors and the secret incantations of the spirit-demons and kings. Within it are expounded the kalpas of heaven and earth, the names and titles of the ten thousand spirits, the intercourse of yin and yang, and the generation and transformation of primordial *qi*. Its meanings cannot be fully explicated; only those who attain enlightenment may naturally fathom them. In heaven, it is transmitted once every forty thousand kalpas; in the human realm, it is conferred once every forty years. To treat it lightly, to leak or profane it, brings misfortune upon nine generations and calamity to the dark yin—how could one not be cautious?

*—This chapter was annotated and determined by Li Shaowei.*

**Chapter on the Origin of the Inner Sound**
The Heavenly Worthy was seated in the Cypress Grove Lodge of the Vermilion Bright World when suddenly clouds and mist surged for three days and nights, plunging the world into unrelenting darkness. The Five Elderly Thearchs prostrated before the Heavenly Worthy and said: "Today, as we attend your seat, we have never witnessed such a phenomenon when the Heavenly Worthy expounds the teachings—mountains and seas fall silent, heaven and earth grow solemn and clear. Yet now, broad daylight is shrouded in gloom, and heaven and earth tremble in fear. We are perplexed and dare not presume the cause."

The Heavenly Worthy replied: "Today, the various heavens have manifested auspicious signs, and numinous responses arise spontaneously. The jade scriptures blaze with radiance, obscuring the light of heaven, compelling all present to await with closed eyes." In an instant, the celestial *qi* surged forth, the darkness dissipated, and five-colored light illumined the ten directions. In the midst of the void appeared sacred writings, each character a *zhang* in size, their resplendent patterns and eight-cornered rays dazzling the eyes, impossible to behold directly.

The Heavenly Worthy addressed the assembled perfected beings: "These are the *Eight Assemblies of the Numinous Scriptures*, whose characters have no fixed form and whose purport is profound and abstruse. You would find them difficult to scrutinize." Thereupon, he commanded the Heavenly Perfected Sovereign Person to transcribe the characters and elucidate their sounds, bestowing them upon the Supreme Dao Lord—a total of two hundred fifty-six characters. The Dao Lord arranged them into text, known as the *Great Brahma Hidden Language*, which he appended to the two subsequent chapters.

The Sovereign Person had once descended upon Mount Emei during the time of the Yellow Emperor, imparting to him the method of the *Three Ones and Five Sprouts*, before ascending once more to heaven.

*—This chapter was determined by combining the* Inner Sound Scripture *with the* Biographies of the Immortals.
