**The Jade Chapters of Recitation and Visualization**

**Chapter on Reciting the Sacred Texts**
**Chapter on Visualization During Recitation**

The Mysterious Master said: For all who wish to recite and chant, follow the transformations of the divine.

Within a quiet chamber, visualize in the mind the names and forms of the thirty-two heavens in the four directions, where clouds and *qi* intertwine in profound obscurity. Amidst them stand palaces, towers, and halls, where the Heavenly Thearchs don their celestial robes and crowns, each detail distinct. Begin by visualizing the Supreme August Heaven, first knocking the teeth once and bowing in the heart. Proceed to the Great Bright Heaven, repeating this thirty-two times. When finished, close the eyes and silently contemplate the Three Fields emitting the dark, primordial, azure, yellow, and white *qi* of the Origin, like threads gradually rising from the body. The *qi* thickens, first entwining a single form, then enveloping the table and mat where one sits, until all is pervaded. It then swirls densely around the chamber before extending outward to encircle the space, eventually merging with heaven and earth in profound unity.

Next, visualize the Azure Dragon emerging from the liver to stand on the left, the White Tiger from the lungs to stand on the right, the Vermilion Bird from the heart to stand before, and the Dark Warrior from the kidneys to stand behind. A lion emerges from the spleen beneath the Cinnabar Field, twelve in total, arrayed to left and right. Imagine nine white cranes issuing from the Mud Pill Palace of the brain, encircling the four directions. Visualize the Palace of the Six Harmonies behind the brows, where sun and moon emerge from the two eyes, nine inches from the face, their light illuminating the chamber with radiant clarity.

Next, contemplate the light of the sun and moon congealing into a halo at the gate of the Great Vertebra, forming a nine-colored circular image like a rainbow, its brilliance shining in all ten directions—all must be vividly clear.

The secret incantations of the Origin comprise three kinds: the incantation of the heart, the subtle incantation, and the secret incantation. The incantation of the heart is a silent invocation held in the mind. The subtle incantation is spoken so softly that only the practitioner can hear. The secret incantation is uttered aloud, yet neither the practitioner nor others can discern its sound.

Ten recitations make one *guo*; ten *guo* make one *zhuan*. Recitation is done in a low voice, while chanting is a resonant intonation. After every ten words, swallow the saliva once; after every hundred words, click the teeth once. Swallowing saliva nourishes the *qi* and moistens the inner palaces; clicking the teeth gathers the perfected and harmonizes the spirits. Externally, this preserves the body from emptiness, preventing the exhaustion of the spirit by the corpse.

If a single character is mispronounced, repeat the preceding thirty characters. If a character is skipped, repeat the preceding fifty. After ten recitations, engage in visualization. Upon completing a full reading, one may eat and rest. In all daily activities and after meals, re-enter visualization as prescribed. Do not allow the mind to wander or mix with extraneous speech. The mouth must not profane the supreme Dao, the methods of the lofty sages and perfected beings. The heart must not fail to revere the Three Treasures, the texts of lord, teacher, and parents. The will must not disrespect the emerald jade, the resplendent and precious scriptures. The body must not neglect the incense and flame, the morning rites and prostrations.

If the mouth recites while the heart wanders, or the form visualizes while the will strays, merely producing sounds for others to hear or rushing through the text for speed, mispronouncing characters or carelessly reciting the divine scriptures—how can one hope to ascend in cloud chariots after ten thousand recitations, or avoid sinking into the Feng and Xian hells after countless repetitions? Such practitioners will only blame the Dao as empty words, unaware that their own conduct is at fault. One must receive transmission from a master and recite in accordance with celestial regulations. If after ten thousand recitations one has not ascended to the Great Void, the fault lies with the practitioner, who will incur severe divine censure and forfeit the rank of immortal and perfected. Those who receive and recite these texts must strive diligently, avoiding the sins of careless recitation and reckless disclosure. To commit such offenses is to lack the Dao’s compassion; heaven’s laws are clear, and the spirits will not show partiality.

**Detailed Procedures for Recitation, Chanting, and Visualization**

On days when scriptures are recited and practices observed, first sweep and purify the chamber, fast to cleanse body and mind, then enter the room. Sit facing east, burn incense, and knock the teeth ten times without letting the ears hear. Silently recite the *Purification of the Mouth Incantation*:

*"Cinnabar Mouth Spirit, expel filth and dispel miasma.
Tongue Spirit of Upright Order, connect life and nourish the spirit.
Spirit of the Thousand Teeth, repel evil and guard the perfected.
Throat Spirit, Mighty Tiger, guide the* qi *and draw the fluids.
Heart Spirit, Cinnabar Origin, enable me to commune with the perfected.
Contemplate the spirit, refine the fluids, and let the upright* qi *abide forever."*

Then close the eyes and silently visualize the Azure Dragon of the east, exhaling rain that mingles with the white *qi* of moonlight and the water of the kidneys, as if bathing in a great sea to wash away the impurities of the five viscera. After a long while, visualize the True Fire of the south descending, uniting with the red *qi* of solar essence and the fire of the heart to burn the body and the Dao chamber into ashes, leaving no trace of smoke or filth. Then perceive a great wind blowing away all dust and grime. Next, visualize the infant within the Cinnabar Field stepping through the Dipper and ascending the altar.

Silently recite the *Purification of Heaven and Earth Incantation*:

*"Within the cavernous void, resplendent is the Great Origin.
The mighty spirits of the eight directions enable me to be natural.
The talismanic commands of the Numinous Treasure proclaim to the nine heavens.
Qianluo Danna, the cavernous stem of the Great Mystery.
Slay demons, bind evil, and destroy ten thousand ghosts.
The Central Mountain’s divine incantation, the Jade Text of the Origin.
Recite once to repel ghosts and prolong life.
Traverse the Five Peaks, let the eight seas hear.
The Demon Kings bow their heads, attending my chariot.
Banish all defilement, let the Dao’s* qi *abide forever."*

Gently inhale the true *qi* of the four directions and lightly blow it over the body, beginning with the east. Silently bow to the ten directions, facing east, and visualize the infant within the Cinnabar Field.

Silently recite the *Mystic Essence of Opening the Scripture Incantation*:

*"Silent, it reaches the ultimate source;
Vast, it stands through kalpas immeasurable.
Profound and boundless, the cavernous script—
Who can fathom its depths?
Entering the path of the Great Vehicle,
Who counts the kalpas passed?
Neither born nor destroyed,
Yet born through the lotus.
Transcending the three realms’ bonds,
With compassionate heart, one unravels the world’s snares.
The perfected of unsurpassed virtue
Become immortals generation after generation."*

Then begin reciting from the head to *"ascend to the Upper Clarity."* Next, close the eyes and silently contemplate the thirty-two heavens, starting from the north with the Supreme August Yellow Brilliance Heaven, proceeding east and south to the four directions, each with eight heavens, situated within the azure firmament and amid purple clouds, in palaces of gold and jade. Visualize the east on the seam above the left ear, the west on the seam above the right ear, the south before the forehead, and the north behind the brain. Within each heaven, see the celestial palaces and towers, where the Thearchs sit solemnly, attended by hosts of guards. From below, the *qi* of each heaven pours down like the radiance of jade mist, entering one’s body.

For each heaven reached, first silently knock the teeth once in unison, then direct the spirit-mind upward to present oneself before the Thearch of that heaven. Upon completion, bow in the heart once. When the thirty-two heavens have been fully traversed, next visualize the Upper Cinnabar Field at the Hall of Impression emitting azure *qi*, the Middle Cinnabar Field at the heart emitting white *qi*, and the Lower Cinnabar Field below the navel emitting yellow *qi*. These mingle with the descending *qi* of the external directions—azure from the east, white from the west, and crimson from the south—each flowing from its respective quarter to merge within the body’s three-colored *qi*. Together they illuminate the chamber, and as one sits within, clouds of *qi* permeate the entire body and the five viscera, both inner and outer suffused in luxuriant abundance, as though seated amid the radiance of a hundred treasures.

Further visualize the azure *qi* within the liver emerging from the left ear to become the Azure Dragon, standing guard on the left; the white *qi* within the lungs issuing from the right ear to become the White Tiger, stationed on the right; the crimson *qi* within the heart rising from the crown of the head to become the Vermilion Bird, leading the way before; and the black *qi* within the kidneys flowing forth from the feet to become the Dark Warrior, following behind. From the Lower Cinnabar Field below the navel emerges a lion, and from the space between the brows above the forehead emerges a white crane, each in groups of thirty-six, guiding the way ahead. Jade lads and jade maidens attend beside the scripture table, arrayed to left and right.

Next, contemplate the six palaces of the viscera: from the two small cavities behind the brows, the sun and moon emerge, their purple and crimson ninefold rays streaming into the nostrils and entering the Golden Flower Palace. From the palace of the Jade Pillow, four inches behind the brain, a nine-colored circular image takes form atop the crown, like a rainbow’s radiance, its light illuminating and penetrating the sacred realms of the ten directions. Visualize the infant within the Cinnabar Field, silently reciting the incantation to the measure of *"Savior of Boundless Beings,"* then proceed with the recitation as intended. After reaching the Primordial Thearch in the recitation before the table, draw in the *qi* of the thirty-two heavens, fully circulating it through the ten directions, and softly recite the scripture ten times.

When drawing in the *qi*, begin again with the Supreme August Yellow Brilliance Heaven, inhaling through the nose and swallowing it. For the *qi* of the eight eastern heavens, visualize it returning to the liver and gallbladder, where its essence transforms into the Venerable Lord of Non-Florescence, dwelling within the liver. For the *qi* of the eight southern heavens, visualize it returning to the heart and pericardium, where its essence transforms into the Controller of Destiny, dwelling within the heart. For the *qi* of the eight western heavens, visualize it returning to the viscera and skin, where its essence transforms into the White Prime Honored Spirit, dwelling within the lungs. For the black *qi* of the eight northern heavens, visualize it returning to the kidneys and bones, where its essence transforms into the Lord of Peach Vitality, dwelling below the navel.

Practice from the first month through the sixth month follows the same method; practice from the seventh month through the ninth month likewise follows the same method.

From the tenth month through the twelfth month, the practice follows the same method.

The first month’s practice is conducted in the lower *dantian*; the seventh month’s practice is conducted in the middle *dantian*; the tenth month’s practice is conducted in the upper *dantian*. These are called the Three Fields, also known as the Three Palaces of Ascent and Descent.

In the first month’s practice, one’s own Infant, emerging from the *dantian*, follows the three-colored cloud-*qi* to ascend and descend within the lower field below the navel, the practice remaining uniform.

In the seventh month’s practice, one’s own Infant, emerging from the *dantian*, follows the three-colored cloud-*qi* to ascend within the middle field above the heart, the practice remaining uniform.

In the tenth month’s practice, one’s own Infant, emerging from the *dantian*, follows the three-colored cloud-*qi* to ascend within the upper field at the *yintang*, the practice remaining uniform.

**Recitation Formula**

The August Person says: Whenever reciting scriptures or practicing the Dao, one must wear the true talisman. By practicing this Way, the myriad spirits will show reverence and follow.

The day of practice refers to the day appointed for scripture recitation, on which one must bathe.

The fragrant water is a decoction of five aromatics: *baizhi* (Angelica dahurica), *qingmuxiang* (Aristolochia debilis), *chenxiang* (Aquilaria), *baitanxiang* (Santalum album), and *gansongxiang* (Nardostachys jatamansi). Take twenty-four *zhū* of each, grind and sift them, then boil in one *dàn* of east-flowing spring water until it bubbles several times. First, disrobe, burn incense, and sit to the left. Visualize the radiant essence of the sun’s five-colored light interweaving and entering the five-fragrance decoction. Visualize five Perfected Youths of the Five Directions and five Jade Maidens burning incense, scattering blossoms, and holding towels and water on either side. Then, stir the water thirty-two times with a ladle and recite the incantation over the water:

*"Five-fragrance mystic spring,
Sun-and-moon radiant essence.
Purify and refine the body’s form,
Dispel the turbid, retain the pure.
Corpse-dust vanishes, viscera shine bright,
Foul *qi* is swept away, the root of calamity scattered.
Riding emptiness through the void,
Soar into the Upper Clarity."*

The talisman for bathing follows.

After reciting the incantation, strike the teeth thirty-two times. First, take a sip of the water, adjusting its temperature to one’s comfort. Then, use another vessel to bathe while reciting the incantation:

The Supreme Thearch loosens his hair to grant me long life.
To my left, the hidden moon; to my right, the root of the sun.
Today, in this pure refinement, the hundred spirits receive grace.

After reciting the incantation, wash the hair and comb it. Recite the incantation:

*"Essence of sun and moon,
Flowing radiance to the Mud-Pill Palace.
Bathing and nurturing the Nine Palaces,
The hundred spirits rejoice.
Corpse-demons vanish, the true master gazes down.
Bestowed the divine tiger, I become an imperial guest."*

After reciting the incantation, bind the hair and bathe the body.

The various methods of the Three Clarities and the wanderings of immortals below also include the plain broth for refining the corpse: four ounces of peach bark and two ounces of bamboo leaves, steeped with pure, empty, and refined substances to make a decoction for bathing—superior to all other miscellaneous methods.

Among these is the green wood fragrance of the Divine Mother. The *Great Possession of the Three Marvels Scripture* states: it is the pure fragrance of the Jade Stem, dispelling the turbidity of worldly dust. It is also called the five-fragrance broth. If sincerely offered to the Supreme Mystery, burning it will dispel worldly impurities and open the path to the celestial realms.

After bathing, don the cap and sash. Recite the incantation:

On this auspicious day, may it align with the Emperor’s grace.
The worldly filth is cleansed, the corpse-soul sinks into obscurity.
Sins, stains, karmic misfortunes—both within and without—are swept away.
Inhaling the sun, exhaling the moon, I tread the Nine Mornings.
Revolving through the Three Terraces, I wander among the Five Stars.
Adorned with talismans and scattered scriptures, clad in phoenix robes and tiger skirts,
I grasp the mysterious texts and chant the *Dongling*.
My voice pierces the Great Empyrean, and the Five Emperors turn their chariots.
They bestow upon me the luminous scriptures, allowing ascent to the Upper Clarity.

The incantation complete, don the cap and sash as usual.

Whenever consuming medicinal decoctions or immortal elixirs, recite:
*With reverence, I invoke the Five Elders of the Five Directions and the Five Numinous Ones,
summoning the celestial physicians and the palace scribes of Bian Que, fifty each.
May I, upon taking this medicine, be freed from illness,
and may the illness depart from my body.
Riding the stellar chariots, ascending to the heavens,
I wander the Nine Earths, my destiny and fortune flourishing.
May I attain long life without death and merge with the Dao in truth.*

The incantation complete, face east and consume the medicine.

In practicing this Way, recite the mysterious texts with measured grace,
every movement refined, every gesture imbued with dignity.
Should one act carelessly, coarsely, or recklessly, ghosts and spirits will mock,
and the Three Officials will record the transgressions, correcting the lapses in discipline.
Thus, those who observe the precepts and fasts must adhere to the prescribed rules:
one who claims to be a Daoist must follow the Daoist model,
and one who claims to be a Perfected must emulate the Perfected’s standards—how much more so for a scholar?

Before eating, recite:
*The hundred grains and five flavors flow into the spleen and stomach.
The five viscera are at peace, the corpse-demons perish and fall.
The seven ancestors rest in tranquility, and I attain long life and enduring vision.*

The incantation complete, knock the teeth thirty-two times, swallow the saliva nine times, then eat.
Meals should be taken before noon; avoid eating after the hour of *you*.
Do not speak of death while eating, nor leave food exposed for long.
Before noon, celestial spirits partake; after *you*, demonic forces feed.
Speaking of death, illness, or disease, or leaving food exposed, invites malevolent *qi*.

Thus, the Perfected abstain from grains and enter the mountains to seek the essentials of immortal ascent.

Before sleeping, recite:
*The heavens have nine stars, the earth has nine palaces.
My hundred joints are accompanied by ten thousand spirits.
The Three Corpses lie hidden, the five viscera flow freely.
The Three Fields and four limbs, in motion and stillness, guard the center.
Dragon and Tiger, the Eight Trigrams, attend my radiant form.
Ghosts, demons, and myriad spirits, do not disturb the Perfected’s palace.*

Knock the teeth twenty-four times.
The incantation complete, knock the teeth again as before.
When lying down, do not close the mouth or sleep like a corpse.

Do not lend to others the garments, caps, ritual robes, or utensils of the Upper Way.
Those who practice *qi*-absorption, guard the Three Ones, or recite the mysterious texts must be especially cautious.

When using the privy, knock the teeth three times and recite:
*Left Virtue Spirit, Right Clarity Spirit,
Left Controller Lady, Right Six Ding Spirits—banish filth and evil,
erase my name from the register of death, inscribe it in the book of life.*

Knock the teeth three times. Do not spit or expectorate, do not face north,
do not gaze upward at the Three Luminaries, and do not allow men and women to share the privy—all invite misfortune.

When leaving the house, recite:
*Emerging from yin into yang, the Four Paths open in clarity.
The Eight Spirits and Six Jia follow me, ensuring good fortune.
The sun and moon assist, the Seven Stars crown my head.*

Knock the teeth seven times, visualizing the Seven Stars upon the head, the *Gang* star pointing forward.

**Bathing Talisman**
Recite the bathing incantation three times. Exhale three times to stir the water.
*Golden nectar, jade saliva, cleanse and purify my form.
Mysterious water washes away filth, purifying my primal destiny.
The Seven Numinous Ones stand guard, the myriad *qi* unfold.
Aspiring to purity and emptiness, I align with the luminous and mysterious.*

**First Month Scripture Talisman**
**Seventh Month Scripture Talisman**
**Tenth Month Scripture Talisman**
The above talisman is also called the *Jade Emperor’s Precious Register for Long Life and Enduring Vision*.

**Eight Festivals Scripture Talisman**
For the four talismans above, inscribe in cinnabar on green paper within the oratory.
Practice them in silence; do not speak of them to others.
Those cultivating the truth write in cinnabar on plain paper,
facing southeast on their birthday, burn the talisman, and consume it mixed with pure water.

**Birthday Scripture Talisman**
This talisman is called the *Divine Talisman of the Jade Clarity Immortal King’s Descent*.

When burning the talisman, recite the Lord Emperor’s incantation:
*Divine spirits, celestial Perfected, Primordial Perfected of Jade Clarity,
Perfected of the Upper Clarity’s Flowery Chamber, Original Lord Lao.
Subtly entering the Great Radiance, illuminating the mysterious texts.
The Seven Spirits fly like springs, the Northern Feng receives the smoke.
I hold the position of Upper King, repelling and uniting demonic hordes.
The Eight Awes spew fire, revering your august spirits.
A thousand thousand expel filth, banishing evil without trace.
Ten thousand ten thousand demon kings guard my life and sever my form.
Hasten as the law commands!*

Recite the Jade Emperor’s incantation three times.

When establishing an altar, circumambulate it three times while sprinkling purifying water.

**Methods for Recitation and Verification**

**Reciting the Two Chapters of the Orthodox Scripture**

On the day of recitation, in a purified chamber facing east, arrange the scripture table and seating.
Enter the chamber, face east with the mat behind you, and perform the three bows.
After bowing, withdraw and sit facing north.
Once the *qi* settles, gradually turn left to face east and sit upright.

Recite the *Xuan Yun* incantation.
The incantation complete, place the hands upon the knees, knock the teeth thirty-two times,
close the eyes, and visualize the thirty-two heavens, each with its Emperor.
Meditate upon one heaven’s name and bow in the heart to its Emperor.
Begin with the *Huang Zeng* Heaven, rotating with the day, circling the four directions,
gradually ascending to the *Jia Yi* Heaven, totaling thirty-two bows.
Though the body remains still, the heart prostrates in reverence.

After bowing, visualize the body enveloped in clouds of cyan, yellow, and white *qi*,
filling the chamber in dense, misty abundance.
To the left, the Azure Dragon; to the right, the White Tiger;
ahead, the Vermilion Bird; behind, the Dark Warrior.
Six lions sit in front, two rows facing each other.
An equal number of white cranes stand beyond the lions.
The sun and moon shine from behind, illuminating the chamber.
A nine-colored halo emanates from the crown, piercing all heavens.
Surveying the visualization, all appears vividly before the eyes.

Silently recite the incantation:
*Supreme Mysterious Origin, Most High Dao Lord,
summon forth from my body the Three and Five Merit Officers,
the left and right attendants, the incense-bearing Golden Lads,
the message-transmitting Jade Maidens, the Five Emperor’s Direct Talismans,
and the Direct-Day Incense Officials—thirty-two each—to convey my words.*

The matters spoken of—these refer to the heavens and earth, the sun and moon, the stars, the sovereign, master, and friends, ancestors, oneself, and all that the practitioner seeks to pray for. When reciting the incantation, upon reaching the word "convey," one should name them aloud. Today is an auspicious day; within this pure chamber, the scripture is cultivated to deliver countless beings.

The practitioner, along with [name] and [name], shall state their wishes in the same manner, saying: *"This servant and [person] for [matter]..."* Upon completing the scripture, they pray for rebirth. May the words conveyed ascend directly to the Most High Thirty-Two Heavens, before the Supreme Venerable of the Primordial Origin, the Celestial Worthy of Original Commencement.

When the incantation concludes, slowly draw in a breath of *qi* from one of the Thirty-Two Heavens and swallow it. Follow the previous method, and upon completion, open the eyes. After reciting the second chapter of the scripture, face south, descend from the mat, bow again, and withdraw.

The above is established by combining the interpretations of Chen Jingyuan with the oral instructions of Zhang Wanfu.

**Illustration of Silent Sitting**
The right-side diagram generally depicts matters within the chamber; there is no need to face south or open the door when reciting.

**Oral Instructions for Recitation**
Recite the sixty-four characters of the Eastern Direction, from *Danlou Acang* to *Sixiang Xuzhen*. Sit upright, knock the teeth nine times, and visualize nine-colored dragons guiding before and behind, with nine layers of azure clouds enveloping the body. Silently recite the incantation:

*Vermilion brightness unfolds the chart,
Eight qi return to the true.
The Mysterious Gate gathers all qi,
Great Divine of the Azure Emperor.
Flowing transformations beyond the nine,
entwining and binding my form.
Sacred sounds of the eight scriptures,
sixty-four chapters.
Penetrating heaven and earth,
uniting with me as an immortal.
Driving the dragon chariot,
ascending to the imperial axle.*

When the incantation ends, draw in *qi* and swallow it nine times, then recite.

Recite the sixty-four characters of the Southern Direction, from *Nanyan Dongfu* to *Shenying Zigong*. Sit upright, knock the teeth three times, and visualize a vermilion phoenix soaring in that direction, with three layers of crimson clouds enveloping the body. Silently recite the incantation:

*Three qi linger and circle,
the numinous phoenix comes in flight.
Jade sounds of eight characters,
radiant within the Purple Tenuity.
Auspicious day, great celebration,
my Dao opens wide.
Crimson cinnabar nourishes,
I gaze upward and absorb the divine radiance.
Body born of water and fire,
robed in crimson and feathered garments.
Ascending empty steps,
feet treading the phoenix ladder.
Circling the eight heavens,
seven ancestors follow.
When complete, draw in *qi* and swallow it three times, then recite.*

Recite the sixty-four characters of the Western Direction, from *Daoli Chanyou* to *Bokong Duxian*. Sit upright, knock the teeth seven times, and visualize white tigers and lions guarding before and behind, with seven layers of pale clouds enveloping the body. Silently recite the incantation:

*Seven qi of golden numinosity,
Eight Heavenly Worthy Spirits.
The White Tiger steers the carriage,
lions bear the axle.
Seven qi entwine and bind,
refining me into an immortal.
Body emits golden light,
illuminating the pale clouds.
Transformations within and without,
ascending into the cavernous gate.
Seven ancestors escape the night,
nine dark realms return the souls.
Eons of deliverance unfold,
abiding with the turning of destiny.*

When the incantation ends, draw in *qi* and swallow it seven times, then recite.

Recite the sixty-four characters of the Northern Direction, from *Juewu Ziyu* to *Youji Duren*. Sit upright, knock the teeth five times, and visualize flying dragons and the Dark Warrior with a lush feathered canopy, divine youths and jade maidens in feathered robes and flying garments, with five layers of black clouds enveloping the body. Silently recite the incantation:

*Mysterious heavens linger and circle,
flowing light ascends to the Upper Clarity.
Great Possession initiates the turning,
eight characters reveal brightness.
Flying mystery settles the void,
the dark yin generates itself.
Five qi entwine and bind,
irrigating my form.
Crowned and girded in the Northern Lattice,
receiving refinement in the cavernous numen.
The kidney palace emerges from the north,
inner and outer radiance refined.
Flying through the Three Realms,
roaming and feasting in the Purple Court.
Seven ancestors share fortune,
rejoicing in kalpas of age.
Within the forest of seven treasures,
returning to the womb for rebirth.
Emerging from the long night,
names recorded in the Southern Palace.
Yellow Registers and White Tablets,
generation after generation born as immortals.*

When the incantation ends, draw in *qi* and swallow it five times, then recite.

**Verses and Ritual Procedures**
The Perfected of the Highest Sageliness have already attained the Way, penetrating the mysterious and investigating the subtle.

The Master says: This passage is not recited by ordinary worldly people. Those who penetrate the mysterious and investigate the subtle, fully comprehending its chapters, obtain merit of the tenth rank.

For the most devoted scholars,
The Master says: Those who are perfected scholars reciting this obtain merit of the sixth rank.

For scholars,
The Master says: Those who are worldly scholars reciting this obtain merit of the third rank.

In reverent offering and worship,
The Master says: All scholars practicing this merit obtain virtuous merit of the fifth rank.

For all who recite this scripture,
The Master says: This also refers to those who have already become Perfected, speaking again of their own merit, karmic rewards, and the liberation of ten thousand ancestors from suffering, ascending to the Vermilion Palace. According to the ranks of the Vermilion Mound, after nine years they are reborn and transformed, becoming noble persons. When their own merit is fulfilled, they ascend to the Golden Gates of the Upper Clarity, permitted to roam and feast in the Jade Capital.

For the most devoted scholars,
The Master says: This refers to the highest learning. They may only attain deliverance for themselves, ascending to the Southern Palace, but their merit does not extend to their great-grandparents.

For worldly people who recite it,
The Master says: They may only extend their lifespan and achieve liberation through the corpse, returning their form to the great void. They do not obtain the fortune of ascending to the Vermilion Mound, and their ancestors scarcely achieve rebirth and transformation.

The demon kings sing the melody,
The Master says: Reciting it a hundred times earns deliverance to the Southern Palace; a thousand times, the demon kings protect and welcome; ten thousand times, one ascends to the great void. This is the song of the Three Realms, not other texts.

Those who hear the numinous sounds,
The Master says: Those whose hearts and forms return to faith, listening attentively to the recitation, obtain virtuous fruit of the ninth rank.

Practicing this merit,
The Master says: Those who resolve to perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scripture obtain virtuous fruit of the second rank.

For the most devoted,
The Master says: The most devoted practicing this merit may attain the rank of minister to the Golden Gates of the Later Sagely Thearch of the Upper Clarity.

Those who understand its sounds,
The Master says: This refers to the middle section. Those who comprehend its text gain equal merit and obtain blessings of the eighth rank.

This sound,
The Master says: The sound of the middle section possesses four kinds of boundless, awe-inspiring, and divine power—warding off, exorcising, delivering, and accomplishing. Those who recite it obtain auspicious responses of the tenth rank.

Presenting gold and treasures as sincerity, swearing an oath to Heaven before transmission, one follows the Mysterious Statutes: once every forty thousand kalpas. Presenting gold and treasures as a pledge of sincerity, one follows the old regulations to report and swear an oath before the Ten Heavens, and only then is the scripture transmitted.

The Master says: These three clauses are the regulations for transmission and reception. The forty thousand kalpas are the measure of the old kalpas. Since the Yellow Thearch received the Chart, Great Yu received the Talisman, and Gaoxin received the Heavenly Scripture, down to the teachings bestowed by the Supreme Ultimate, how could there be forty thousand kalpas? According to the new regulations descended by the Divine Mother, the statutes for bestowing teachings below are revealed once every four hundred years. If there is a suitable person, transmission may be granted again after forty years. Over four hundred years, no more than seven persons in total may receive it. If there is a perfected person every four years, one transmission is also permitted. These three clauses for transmission and reception speak of the two great methods and the forms for reciting the three ranks of scriptures. The melodies of the middle section have separate clear statutes, fully set forth in the Mysterious Statutes of the Immortals’ Ranks. To recite them lightly brings calamity upon oneself. To carelessly leak or slight them brings calamity upon nine generations of ancestors. Leaking or slighting them causes one to fall into hell, with misfortune extending to seven generations of ancestors.

The Master says: These three clauses collectively speak of those who recite the scripture without fasting, bathing, or burning incense, thereby incurring the sin of calamity. If one treats the statutes lightly, carelessly leaks them to the unworthy, or profanes their mysteries; if one does not follow the time limits and transmits them privately; or if one follows the time limits but does not fast, swear an oath, or receive them properly, leaking the secrets to the unworthy and causing them to slight or disbelieve the Mysterious Text—all these fall under the middle statutes, bringing calamity upon nine generations of ancestors. If one leaks or slights them, taking them lightly, seeking novelty through deceit, criticizing the sacred canon, slandering the Mysterious Text, or stealing the Heavenly Treasures—all these fall under this clause, bringing misfortune to seven generations of ancestors.

**Reciting the Mysterious and Evoking Responses**
The Master says: Those who recite the scripture and wish to know its merits should align with the Supreme Mystery, which encompasses one hundred and fifty-one kinds of mysterious responses. Once these responses manifest, the day of ascending as an immortal and rising into the void is near. If no responses appear, one should repent and purify one’s resolve, taking the manifestation of mysterious responses as an auspicious sign.

**Auspicious Signs from the Ten Directions Recited Afar by the Various Heavens** (ten kinds): auspicious signs for the Perfected Saints.
**The Five Thearchs’ Attendants and Guards** (six kinds): auspicious signs for the devoted scholars.
**Subduing and Commanding the Earthly Spirits** (three kinds): auspicious signs for the learned scholars.
**The Prosperity of Households and Gates** (five kinds): auspicious signs for offerings.
**The Various Heavens Arriving Together** (ten kinds): auspicious signs for all reciters.
**Immediately Receiving Liberation** (two kinds): auspicious signs for those who receive and recite.
**Prolonging Life and Extending Years** (six kinds): auspicious signs for the worldly.
**Severing Earthly Bonds and Escaping Servitude** (two kinds): auspicious signs for recitation in the first month.
**Attaining Immortality and Transcendence** (three kinds): auspicious signs for recitation in the seventh month.
**Pacifying and Stabilizing the Realm’s Destiny** (six kinds): auspicious signs for recitation in the tenth month.
**The Perfected of the Nine Palaces** (one kind): auspicious signs for recitation on one’s life-destiny day.
**The Clarity and Rectitude of the Hun and Shen** (ten kinds): auspicious signs for one’s life-destiny.
**Closing the Eyes and Entering Stillness** (nine kinds): auspicious signs for entering the oratory.
**The Three and Five Merit Officers** (six kinds): auspicious signs for summoning and dispatching the Mysterious Bureau.
**Reciting the Cavernous Chapters Ten Thousand Times** (fourteen kinds): auspicious signs.
**The End of Heaven and Earth’s Cycle** (four kinds): auspicious signs for prayers and exorcisms.
**The Shallow Learning of the Latter-Day Dao** (three kinds): auspicious signs for refining the corpse in the Grand Yin.
**The End of Heaven and Earth’s Revolution** (ten kinds): auspicious signs for fasting and practicing the Dao.
**The Various Heavens Recording Names** (five kinds): auspicious signs for performing meritorious deeds.
**Reciting with Understanding of Its Sounds** (six kinds): auspicious signs.
**Nothing That Is Not Warded Off** (twenty kinds): auspicious signs for reciters.
**The Blind Regaining Sight** (ten kinds): auspicious signs for internal recitation, giving birth to the Sacred Embryo of the Primordial Beginning.

**The Jade Morning Lord Recites the Scripture Ten Times, Clarifying Each Recitation**
**First Recitation** – The Perfected Great of the East arrives at the village of An Tai Tang: those with deafness and ear ailments. The spirits float through the void to the World of Accepting Goodness, and all regain their hearing.
**Second Recitation** – The Perfected Great of the South arrives at the borders of Wanli City: those who are blind. The spirits float through the void to the World of Abandoning the Worthy, and their eyes become clear.
**Third Recitation** – The Perfected Great of the West arrives at Fuku Shū: those who are mute. The spirits float through the void to the World of Powerful Conduct, and they regain speech.
**Fourth Recitation** – The Perfected Great of the North arrives at the wilds of Yudan: those with lameness, chronic illnesses, and accumulated suffering. The spirits float through the void to the World of Purity, and all can rise and walk.
**Fifth Recitation** – The Perfected Great of the Northeast arrives at the village of Fuji: those with long-standing, stubborn illnesses. The spirits float through the void to the World of Eternal Peace, and they all recover their forms at once.
**Sixth Recitation** – The Perfected Great of the Southeast arrives at the village of Wufu: those whose hair has turned white. The spirits float through the void to the World of Employing the Worthy, and their teeth fall out and regrow.
**Seventh Recitation** – The Perfected Great of the Southwest arrives at the village of Yanfu: those who have grown old and wish to return to youth. The spirits float through the void to the World of Benevolent Stillness, and the young all become strong.
**Eighth Recitation** – The Perfected Great of the Northwest arrives at the wilds of Fude: women and the young who are pregnant, and birds and beasts with child. The spirits float through the void to the World of Extending the Worthy, and all—whether already born or not yet born—are brought to completion.
**Ninth Recitation** – The Perfected Great of the Upper Realm arrives at the Various Heavens: the earthly treasures hidden in the world. The spirits float through the void to the Palace Gates, and gold and jade manifest in their forms.
**Tenth Recitation** – The Perfected Great of the Lower Realm arrives at the Nine Ramparts of the Cavernous Abyss, traveling through the Four Brahma Realms: dry bones. The spirits float through the void to the Thirty-Six Palaces of Sound and the Great Earthly Palaces, and all rise as complete persons.

**Verifying the Recitation of the Two Correct Scriptures**
In the first month, maintain a prolonged fast and recite this scripture to sever the earthly bonds and servitude of the departed souls of past generations, delivering them to the Upper Southern Palace.
In the seventh month, maintain a prolonged fast and recite this scripture to attain immortality and transcendence, have one’s name recorded by the Various Heavens, and have one’s death erased and life inscribed on the Yellow Register and White Tablet.
In the tenth month, maintain a prolonged fast and recite this scripture to pacify and stabilize the realm’s destiny for the king, emperor, lord, ministers, fathers, and sons, ensuring the eternal preservation of the state, the unbroken succession of generations as rulers, the pacification of their lands, and the people’s acclaim of great peace.
On the days of the eight solar terms, recite this scripture to become a Perfected of the Nine Palaces.
On one’s life-destiny day, recite this scripture to clarify and rectify the hun and shen, preserve the myriad qi eternally, avoid suffering and distress, radiate light from the body, receive the attendance of the Three Realms, be welcomed by the Five Thearchs, have the myriad spirits pay homage, have one’s name recorded in the heavens, fulfill one’s merits and complete one’s virtue, and ascend to the Upper Clarity.

Recite it ten times, and the heavens record one’s name.
Recite it a hundred times, and one’s name is registered in the Southern Palace.
Recite it a thousand times, and the Demon Kings provide escort.
Recite it ten thousand times, and the Dao is perfected, allowing ascent to the Great Void.

Should one encounter this celestial moment, recite it according to the method:
Above, it dissolves heavenly calamities and safeguards the emperor’s reign;
Below, it wards off poison and harm to deliver the multitudes;
In the middle, it liberates ancestors, while one’s own self attains the Dao—
This may truly be called sublime.

The Inner Sounds and Their Verifications:
The Great Brahmā Sound of the East—recite it for nine years, and the eight heavens each send eight Azure-Waisted Jade Maidens and eight Azure-Florescence Jade Lads to attend one’s form. They bestow the essence of the Nine Qi of Azure Sprouts, causing one’s body to radiate light, penetrating the Void of Non-Being. After ten thousand recitations, the Dao is accomplished, and one soars to the Upper Clarity, with seven generations of ancestors ascending together.

The Great Brahmā Sound of the South—recite it for three years, and the eight heavens each send eight Cinnabar-Rosy Jade Maidens and eight Great Yang Jade Lads to attend one’s form. They bestow the essence of the Three Qi of Vermilion Cinnabar, preserving one’s countenance through ten thousand kalpas without decline. Seven generations of ancestors transcend and ascend, entering the Hall of Blessings, returning to the immortal womb to be reborn anew.

The Great Brahmā Sound of the West—recite it for seven years, and the eight heavens each send eight Luminous Jade Lads to attend one’s form. They bestow the essence of the Seven Qi of Grand Simplicity, halting the years and preserving one’s visage, maintaining a youthful appearance through ten thousand kalpas. Blessings extend to seven generations of ancestors, who ascend and are delivered to the Southern Palace, returning to the womb to be reborn as immortals generation after generation.

The Great Brahmā Sound of the North—recite it for five years, and the eight heavens each send eight Grand Prime Jade Lads to attend one’s form. They bestow the Dark Nourishment, restoring the years and preserving one’s radiance, securing life in the Three Clarities. Blessings extend to the Nine Mysteries, with generation after generation ascending in flight.

For the Inner Sounds of the Four Directions, if one recites them according to the method, then nothing is not averted, nothing is not warded off, nothing is not delivered, and nothing is not accomplished. One soars to observe the world below, and the Supreme Emperor chants from afar. The myriad spirits pay homage, the Three Realms attend in chariots, subduing and pacifying all spirits, purifying the ten directions. When the Dao is perfected and merits are complete, one serves as a minister in the Three Realms.

*Scripture of the Numinous Treasure for the Limitless Salvation of Humanity, Great Rites, Scroll the Third* concludes.
*Scripture of the Numinous Treasure for the Limitless Salvation of Humanity, Great Rites, Scroll the Fourth* begins.

**Chapter on the Exegesis of Scripture’s Meaning**

The Primordial Beginning’s ancestral kalpas give rise to the various heavens. The ancestral kalpas are: *Longhan*, *Yankang*, *Chiming*, *Kaihuang*, and *Shanghuang*.

The Great Brahma Heaven is where the Void Sovereign resides, encompassing heaven and earth, boundless and unfathomable. As the Scripture states:
*"Above, there is no further ancestor—only the Dao is the body."*
Within the span of the five kalpas, heaven and earth are transformed and born.

From the Great Brahma’s single *qi*, the Three Heavens emerge. The realms of the Three Clarities are the Three Heavens descending their *qi*, thereby generating the nine tiers. The first is the *Yudan Wuliang* Heaven; the second, the *Shangshang Shanshan Wuliangshou* Heaven; the third, the *Dongxu Jishang Xuyan* Heaven; the fourth, the *Wuji Shangling Yuxu Yuan Dong Jiran* Heaven; the fifth, the *Dongji Wuya Bujiao Le* Heaven; the sixth, the *Shangji Yuanjing Dongwei Huayingsheng* Heaven; the seventh, the *Wuming Zhiji Fanbao* Heaven; the eighth, the *Taiji Wuya Dongyou Moye* Heaven; the ninth, the *Yuandong Boli Dahe* Heaven.

Each tier further generates three heavens, and the nine tiers together form the Thirty-Six Heavens—what this Scripture refers to as the heavens of *Shangqing*. The lofty and void are all called *Shangqing*, not merely designating a single realm.

Next, the seed-people are divided into the Three Realms and the Thirty-Two Heavens, governing the four directions, situated below the Nine Heavens and above the Three Luminaries. Palaces and chambers are apportioned with graded ranks. Descending to connect with the stellar lodges, primordial *qi* interlinks, transforming and giving birth to the myriad things, shaping and completing all categories.

Beyond this lie the Eight Poles and Eight Heavens, with the Outer Brahma Heaven below the Thirty-Two Heavens and beyond the Three Luminaries. Beyond the Eight Poles, from the *Qingwei* Heaven to the Outer Brahma Heaven, the total number is eighty. Natural *qi* congeals to form palaces and towers. Thereupon, the Void Sovereign appoints each with an Imperial Lord, assists them with Heavenly Ministers, establishes them with subordinate officials, divides them with peoples and creatures, and together with the Great Brahma’s single *qi*, they constitute the Eighty-One Heavens.

As the Dao’s *qi* descends, the Nine Earths are born. The first is *Runse*, the earth named *Yuande*, its *qi* above azure and within yellow, governed by the *Yuantu* Minister. The second is *Gangse*, the earth named *Huangde*, its *qi* pervading black, governed by the *Yuanting* Earth Aide. The third is *Shizhi Seze*, the earth named *Dide*, its *qi* pervading verdant, governed by the *Hukou* Earth Dragon. The fourth is *Runze*, the earth named *Wangde*, its *qi* pervading yellow, governed by the *Yuanxin* Earth Great General. The fifth is *Jinli Ze*, the earth named *Rende*, its *qi* pervading red, governed by the *Yuanfu* Earth Magistrate. The sixth is *Jingang Tieze*, the earth named *Shuide*, its *qi* pervading white, governed by the *Yuangu* Earth Elder. The seventh is *Shuizhi Ze*, the earth named *Lide*, its *qi* purple, governed by the *Jia* Earth Parents. The eighth is *Dafeng Ze*, the earth named *Fude*, its *qi* pervading azure, governed by the *Shixian* Earth Ancestral Rectifier. The ninth is *Dongyuan Wuse Gangwei*, the earth named *Changde*, its *qi* pervading green, governed by the *Xuan* Earth Subordinate of the Two Thousand *Shi*.

These are called the Nine Ramparts, each rampart consisting of one layer each of earth, water, fire, and wind, arranged in ascending and descending order. Each earth is presided over by the Void Sovereign. Additionally, the Four Earth Sovereign Lords jointly govern palaces and assist in equal measure, descending to emulate the heavens above. Altogether, the Thirty-Six Earth Sovereigns correspond above to the emperors of the Nine Tiers and Thirty-Six Heavens.

Beneath the Nine Ramparts lies the vast and desolate palace, enveloped by wind and marsh. The wind and marsh are the *qi* of the Primordial Beginning’s Brahma wind, as unyielding as true metal—also called the *Gang* wind. It upholds the Nine Ramparts, thereby bearing the various heavens, floating high and hollow, suspended yet not falling, connecting above to the Great Brahma—this is the *qi* of the Dao. Thus, the Scripture states: *"The wind marsh is hollow and void; the vajra rides the heavens."*

Now, the Three Caverns interflow, the Nine *Qi* intermingle and arise, floating upon the Great Primordial, surging through the Four Voids. In the vastness of its dharmic form, only the Dao can encompass it.

**The Outer Eight Poles Brahma Heavens’ Names**
**The Names of Immortal Realms within the Domain**

The *yue* (mountains) are that which "mirrors" (*zhen*). The *kun* (earth) is thick and bears all things without shifting. The Five Peaks, Three Isles, and Ten Continents are the abodes of immortals and sages.

**Divine Continent (*Shenzhou*)** is the Middle Kingdom, where the Son of Heaven dwells, serving as the greatest realm within the domain. Its people cultivate the true Dao and ascend to become perfected immortals. Above it lie the Ten Great Grotto-Heavens, Thirty-Six Lesser Grotto-Heavens, and Seventy-Two Blessed Lands, all governed by immortal officials. Within the Grotto-Heavens stand the Five Mountains, also called the Five Peaks, which serve as the Middle Kingdom’s *zhen* (mirrors). The remaining minor states are not enumerated here.

The Three Isles of *Shenzhou*, the Five Peaks, and the Ten Continents all lie beneath the Three Luminaries, upon the great earth, and amid the vast seas.

**The Nine Abyssal Grottoes’ Names**
**The Three Officials and Nine Bureaus**

The Three Officials and Nine Bureaus refer to the Three Origins and Nine Palaces.
- The **Upper Origin Palaces** reside above the Nine Heavens.
- The **Middle Origin Palaces** lie between the Nine Earths.
- The **Lower Origin Palaces** dwell within the marsh-grotto abysses.

The Three Origins encompass Nine Palaces, Twenty-Seven Prefectures, and One Hundred Twenty Offices. Innumerable spirits, immortals, perfected beings, and sages—along with all celestial and terrestrial deities—are subject to them. Of the greatest authority are the Three Origins and Three Officials.

*(The above follows Li Shaowei’s annotations, combined with the* Three Origins Precepts Sutra’s Universal Sacred Hierarchy Chart*, to establish this section’s structure.)*

---

**The Three Officials, Nine Bureaus, and Twelve River Sources**

**The Upper Origin’s Three Palaces** are where the Supreme Emperor resides, with the First-Rank Heavenly Palace governing their midst. They comprise Nine Prefectures and Thirty-Six Offices, presiding over the sages of the upper heavens and the transformation of all living things. These palaces are formed from the interweaving of the primordial *qi* of the Original Beginning—azure, yellow, and white—into their structures.

**The Middle Origin’s Three Palaces** are the Supreme Emperor’s detached palaces, governed by the Second-Rank Earthly Officials within. They comprise Nine Prefectures and Forty-Two Offices, overseeing all earthly immortal officials, spirits, and the transformation of living things. These palaces are formed from the congealing of the *qi* of the Primordial Grotto’s chaotic numen and the essence of ultimate yellow, solidifying into their structures.

**The Lower Origin’s Three Palaces** are also the Supreme Emperor’s detached palaces, governed by the Third-Rank Water Officials within. They comprise Nine Prefectures and Forty-Two Offices, presiding over the Dragon Kings of the Eight Seas and Four Rivers, the Water Immortals, and the transformations of yin and yang. These palaces and palatial towers are formed from the intertwining of the *qi* of wind and marsh and the essence of divine vastness.

**The Thirty-Two Heavens: A Comprehensive Summary of Hidden Mysteries**

From the **Grand Yellow Emperor’s Layer** to the **Upper Radiance Seven Luminaries’ Maheśvara Six Heavens** constitute the **Realm of Desire**; from the **Void-Transcending Heng** to the **Boundless *Tanxie* Eighteen Heavens** constitute the **Realm of Form**; from the **Luminous Court’s Cloud-Soaring** to the **Supreme Plain’s Joyous Prohibitions’ Four Upper Heavens** constitute the **Formless Realm**—these are the **Three Realms**.

From the **Supreme Void’s Unsurpassed Constant Fusion** to the **Grand Ultimate’s Level Nurturing *Jiayi* Four Heavens** belong to the **World of Seed-People**.

Upon examining the original scripture, this division is categorized into ten matters:
1. **Heavenly Names and Kalpas** – The names established at the initial division.
2. **Emperor’s Titles** – The titles bestowed by the Original Beginning.
3. **Emperor’s Taboo Names** – The names of the Heavenly Emperors.
4. **Heavenly Emperor’s Governance** – The offices presiding over the Dao.
5. **Constellation *Qi*** – The descending *qi* of the Twenty-Eight Constellations.
6. **Names of *Qi*** – The names of the primordial *qi* received.
7. **Colors of *Qi*** – The colors of the Nine *Qi*’s differentiated powers.
8. **Great Brahma’s Hidden Speech** – The inner sounds, compiled by the Dao Lord. The origins of these matters are detailed in the chapter on inner sounds.
9. **Division of Boundaries** – The ascents and descents of the upper and lower realms.
10. **Lifespans of Heavenly People** – The measures of their longevity.

This chart is the essence of the precious scripture. Those who recite and uphold it should study it in detail and practice accordingly.

*(The above follows Chen Jingyuan’s exegesis, combined with Cheng Xuanying’s commentary, Li Shaowei’s, Xue Youqi’s, and Yan Dong’s annotations on the* Primordial Chart’s Wings of the Cavernous Numinous Chapters’ Inner Sounds and Jade Characters Sutra*, to establish this section.)*

---

**The Governance of the Five Directions’ Five Emperors**

The scriptural meaning lies in the **Five Heavens**. The Five Heavens receive the *qi* of the Five Spirits and reside in the midst of the Great Void. Above, they array the Five Dipper Stars; below, they establish the Five Peaks, governed by the Five Emperors. These are the directional-colored heavens, not the heavens of formed images.

The names and taboo names of the **Five Elders, Five Emperors, Five Dipper Stars, and Five Great Demon Kings**, along with their governed offices, are matters those who recite the scriptures should certainly know.

*(The above follows Chen Jingyuan’s exegesis, combined with Cheng Xuanying’s commentary and Li Shaowei’s annotations on the* Shangshu’s Essentials of Governance: Chart of the Five Chapters’ True Writ Sutra*, to establish this section.)*

---

**Constellation *Qi***

The Twenty-Eight Heavens of the Four Directions each correspond to the *qi* of one constellation. The Four Cardinal Heavens each correspond to the *qi* between two constellations. Additionally, the heavens of the northeast, where *qi* descends and intermingles, further correspond to the constellations of the northwest. This is because the ascending *qi* of life spirals upward like a ram’s horn. Though the principle’s flow is the same, confusion arises regarding the directions and cardinal points. Thus, this chart is made to clarify it.

---

**The Thirty-Five Divisions: The Upper Origin’s Total *Qi***

The Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper and the Twenty-Eight Constellations of the Four Directions form the Thirty-Five Divisions, which gather the primordial *qi* in the upper heavens to govern creation.

The **Northern Dipper** is the Central Dipper. As the *Records of the Grand Historian: Treatise on the Celestial Offices* states: *"The Dipper is the Emperor’s chariot, revolving at the center, overseeing the four directions. It divides yin and yang, establishes the four seasons, balances the Five Phases, shifts the solar terms, and determines all records—all are tied to the Dipper."*

**Chapter on Splitting Characters into Talismans**
**Primordial Beginning Chapter**
The August Personage says: "Primordial Beginning" is the august title of the Heavenly Worthy. There are twelve titles—what do they signify? It is because Lord Lao manifested in ten transformations, the Dao Lord in eleven, and the Primordial Beginning in twelve. Thus, the twelve qi of the center correspond to the Primordial Beginning of the Mysterious Origin, who delivers beings.

These may be employed in accordance with the sutra’s phrases, with the life-saving and death-delivering formulas contained in the middle finger.

1. The Primordial Beginning delivers boundless beings of the highest grade.
2. The Heavenly Worthy of Primordial Beginning is about to expound this sutra.
3. The Heavenly Worthy of Primordial Beginning expounds the sutra once.
4. The Heavenly Worthy of Primordial Beginning sits suspended in empty space upon a five-colored lion.
5. The Primordial Beginning suspends a precious pearl.
6. The Primordial Beginning is within the precious pearl.
7. The words spoken by the Heavenly Worthy of Primordial Beginning in expounding the sutra.
8. The Primordial Beginning, the Most High Lord, before the throne.
9. The Primordial Beginning’s Cavernous Mystery, Numinous Treasure, Original Chapter.
10. The Primordial Beginning, in the ancestral kalpa, transforms and gives birth to all heavens.
11. The Primordial Beginning’s talismanic command.
12. The middle section of the Primordial Beginning’s Numinous Writ.

The two characters "Primordial Beginning" dispersed in form.

**Dao Speaks Chapter**
The August Personage says: "The Dao speaks" refers to the jade edict of the Heavenly Worthy of Primordial Beginning. There are twelve phrases, corresponding to the number of a year. These may cure all illnesses, summon a thousand spirits, and invoke harmonious qi into the field of the body, forming talismans with the seven qi.

1. The Dao speaks: Once in the Azure Heaven of Beginnings, amidst the azure void’s hymns, in the Great Floating Li Land. In the middle of the middle finger, face the divine Central Palace and inhale the central yellow qi. Draw it into the practitioner’s mouth, connect the qi of the Three Fields, irrigate the field of the body, and blow to seal the talisman.
2. The Dao speaks: At that time, the Heavenly Worthy of Primordial Beginning expounded the sutra once. The boundless and immeasurable perfected great spirits of the eastern realm of Ultimate Non-Being arrived floating in space. This may subdue violent demons and evil spirits, with formulas to summon by direction.
3. The Dao speaks: The words spoken by the Heavenly Worthy of Primordial Beginning in expounding the sutra are all the inner names of the Heavenly Emperors among the heavens, the hidden rhymes of sounds. They are also the inner taboos of demon kings, the secret names of the hundred spirits. Write the characters of the heavens’ names and taboos in seal script for use in esoteric incantations.
4. The Dao speaks: For every ten recitations of this sutra, all the heavens arrive. On the nail of the middle finger, summon the lofty perfected of the ten directions, the flying heavenly spirit-kings, and those receiving deliverance.
5. The Dao speaks: In the first month, maintain a prolonged fast and recite this sutra. In the middle of the middle finger, for every recitation of the sutra, first ingest the qi of the seasonal node.
6. The Dao speaks: On the day of performing the Dao. In the middle of the middle finger, ascend the altar to pay homage, cure illnesses, and subdue demons—first ingest or wear this.
7. The Dao speaks: These two chapters are the hidden and secret sounds of the Heavenly Emperors among the heavens and even the demon kings. On the fourth finger, for every writing of jade characters, first ingest this.
8. The Dao speaks: As for the revolutions of heaven and earth, to the universal deliverance of the primordial kalpa. In the middle of the thumb, employ as needed with the sutra’s phrases.
9. The Dao speaks: Those of shallow learning in the Dao, to swiftly attain immortality. Write on the nails of the five fingers; for every petition to redress transgressions, first ingest this.
10. The Dao speaks: As for the end of heaven and earth’s revolutions, to the boundless deliverance of beings. Write on the lower joint of the middle finger, employing as needed with the sutra’s phrases.
11. The Dao speaks: For all who possess this sutra. In the middle of the middle finger, one may summon the Great Unity demon of the Three Realms and recommend ascension as an immortal.
12. The Dao speaks: These esoteric utterances of the Great Brahma among the heavens are boundless sounds. At the hours of *yin*, *shen*, *si*, and *hai*, one may submit memorials and petitions; wearing this, one may cross the Dipper’s vastness and directly ascend to the heavenly gates.

**Chapter on the Forest of Manifestations and the Pure Radiance**
The August Personage says: The Forest of Manifestations is the light of the ten thousand images, paying homage to the imperial throne. The Pure Radiance is the Yellow Flower of the Eastern Well, the Dan Pool—where the perfected immortals of all heavens refine their forms. Thus, the sinful souls of the lower world, if refined in the spring of the Yellow Flower of Pure Radiance, may dispel their yin obscurations and ascend to the yang realm. Practitioners who refine their forms may attain the Way of corpse liberation, avoid hell, and roam the great void.

When writing, place the left hand’s middle finger in the grip, hold the brush in the right hand, face the Heavenly Gate, inhale qi twelve times, blow upon the brush, and recite the incantation to complete the talisman.

Thus the chant resounds—
those who cannot be reborn anew,
from whom ten thousand calamities recoil,
walk alone through Jade Capital’s halls.
Majestic, the Great Brahmā’s virtue
cannot be surpassed.

Rivers and seas grow still,
mountains and peaks conceal the clouds,
sun and moon suspend their radiance,
the turning heavens halt their course.
All demons bind their forms,
ghostly spirits lose their clarity.

The dead return to life,
white bones become human once more.
The Five Thearchs stand guard,
the body merges with the Dao of the Cavernous Truth.
The Three Realms bow in reverence,
penetrating the profound, fathoming the subtle.

Demon essences lose their sight,
ghostly apparitions vanish in obscurity.
Power unmatched governs heaven’s decree,
virtue subdues earth’s divinities.

When merit is complete and virtue perfected,
all attain the immortals’ way,
ascending to the Golden Gates,
roaming and feasting in Jade Capital’s halls.

Amidst the three-hued clouds of qi,
within and without, luminous clarity reigns.
Azure Dragon, White Tiger,
Vermilion Bird, Dark Warrior,
lions and white cranes,
sun and moon illuminate with brilliance.

Within the Cavernous Radiance Chamber,
a halo of light crowns the head.
The Three and Five Merit Officers,
attendant officials to left and right,
incense-bearing Golden Lads,
message-bearing Jade Maidens,
the Five Thearchs’ direct talismans,
the incense officials of the day—
today is auspicious,
a long fast in the pure hall.

The Primordial Beginning’s Cavernous Mystery,
the Numinous Treasure’s original scripture,
parting and uniting by nature,
the primordial chaos of crimson script.
From the Primordial Ancestor’s kalpa,
all heavens were transformed and born.
The Three Luminaries revealed—
this is the root of heaven.

Without script, no illumination,
without script, no clarity,
without script, no completion,
without script, no deliverance,
without script, no establishment,
without script, no life—
the Heaven within Heaven.

At Yu Luo’s Pine Terrace,
the Great Jade Clarity of the Great Dao—
dim and distant, the kalpa’s blade,
now gone, now present.
The Three Flowers part at will,
the wondrous court of Great Possession.
Golden towers, jade chambers,
the vast array in pure radiance.

The great flow of Brahman qi—
within it, the gods who deliver the dead to immortality,
within it, the Southern Culmen’s Lord of Longevity,
within it, the world-delivering Marshal of the Sima,
within it, the life-cherishing Elder Han,
within it, the Southern Supreme’s Officers of Fate and Record,
the august spirits who extend life and augment destiny,
who turn back the startled dead,
who deliver boundless beings.

The Five Elders open the way,
the host of immortals flank the chariot,
the chancellors of all heavens,
the Southern Prosperity’s Upper Palace,
the life-monitoring great gods,
Han’s Officers of Record—
holding talismans, grasping registers,
all assemble before the Thearch.
As each is to be delivered,
the heavens are strictly examined.

The Northern Capital’s Feng Du,
the Three Offices, the Nine Bureaus,
the Twelve River Sources—
above, the ancestors are absolved,
the karmic kin of a hundred kalpas.
Swiftly the ledgers of sin are erased,
the roots of evil extinguished.
No restraint, no detention,
no coercion by ghostly throngs.

By the Primordial Beginning’s talismanic decree,
moment by moment they ascend.
In the Northern Capital’s Frigid Pool,
the hun-souls are escorted and guarded,
the dead souls receive refinement,
transmuted into immortals.
The living bodies receive deliverance,
kalpa after kalpa abiding,
revolving with the kalpas,
their years equaling heaven’s.
Ever delivered from the Three Wretched Paths,
the Five Sufferings, the Eight Adversities.

The Supreme August Yellow Canopy Heaven,
the Clear Brightness of He and Tong Heaven.

The Mystic Womb’s Even-Nurturing Heaven,
the Grand Luminous Jade-Perfect Heaven,
the Primordial Luminous Literary-Florescence Heaven,
the Supreme Luminous Seven Luminaries’ Maheśvara Heaven,
the Void Transcending the Celestial Balance Heaven,
the Supreme Ultimate’s Veiling Mist Heaven,
the Vermilion Luminance’s Harmonious Yang Heaven,
the Mystic Luminance’s Reverent Florescence Heaven,
the Radiant Luminance’s Ancestral Whirlwind Heaven,
the Jambu’s Yellow Gourd Heaven,
the Void Luminance’s Hall of Radiance Heaven,
the Contemplative Luminance’s Upright Quiescence Heaven,
the Primordial Luminance’s Reverent Jubilation Heaven,
the Grand Resplendent Ultimate Jade Heaven,
the Primordial Vastness’ Aperture-Ascending Heaven,
the Grand Peace’s August Cliff Heaven,
the Manifest Quiescence’s Ultimate Wind Heaven,
the Origin-August’s Filial Awn Heaven,
the Supreme August’s Luxuriant Layered Floating-Canopy Heaven,
the Non-Thought’s River-Flowing Heaven,
the Supreme Leaf’s Joyous Heaven,
the Boundless’s Dharma-Oath Heaven,
the Luminous Court’s Cloud-Crossing Heaven,
the Abyssal Communion’s Primordial Cavern Heaven,
the Grand Literary Flourish’s Exalted Wondrous Completion Heaven,
the Grand Simplicity’s Elegant Joyous Forbidden Upper Heaven,
the Grand Void’s Supreme Eternal Fusion Heaven,
the Grand Release’s Jade Exaltation’s Soaring Victory Heaven,
the Dragon-Transformation’s Brahman-Crossing Heaven,
the Supreme Ultimate’s Even-Nurturing Jia-Yi Heaven.
Nine Harmonies, Ten Unions—
transforming into the Upper Clarity.
Entreat the eradication of the Three Evils,
severing the roots of earth.
Ba-Yuan the Ugly Earl,
bearing heaven, shouldering stone,
reversing the mountain’s six-eyed gaze.
Jian-Chou the Brightly Fragrant,
hoisting heaven with transverse strength—
the ancestral origin of the ten thousand spirits.

The Marshal-General commands the ghostly legions,
wielding banners, drums, and batons—
roaming the vast heavens, self-styled in resplendent might.
The Divine Lords receive their mandate,
sweeping away all misfortune.
Eight Fierce Ones spew venom,
mighty steeds spread in four directions.
Heavenly Soldiers lead the vanguard,
Great Generals brandish their pennants,
hurling fire for ten thousand leagues,
streaming bells in eightfold surges.
Should any dare to resist,
opposing the Perfected Ones above—
golden axes strike first,
the Great Queen of Heaven metes punishment,
slaughtering and severing ghostly shades.
Wind and fire cease not:
thousands upon thousands of heads severed,
myriads upon myriads of forms annihilated.
Demons dare not trespass,
ghosts dare not manifest as specters.
The Three Officials of Northern Feng
inspect the ghostly camps with clarity—
none may conceal themselves.
The Golden Horse’s courier route
proclaims boundless decrees.
All spirits heed:
wind and marsh penetrate the void,
Vajra ascends the heavens.
Within the Mysterious, the Grand Sovereign,
the Lofty Perfected of the Supreme,
the Purple Void’s luxuriant splendor—
assist and guard the myriad immortals.
A thousand harmonies, ten thousand unions—
naturally attaining perfection.
Within the Perfected dwells the divine,
eternal life and supreme goodness.
The Peerless Duke,
the White Prime Honored Spirit,
the Great One who Oversees Destiny,
the Peach and Health Decree’s Artisan—
descend to guard the human body,
the Crimson Palace of the Mud-Pill,
governing the fivefold qi within,
blending the hundred spirits as one.
Thus are the cavernous scriptures composed,
transforming and soaring through the void—
to test your being,
trialing resolve and retreat.

How few attain this Way—
those who grasp the talismans, hold the registers,
bind demonic spirits with the *Lingbao* divine spells—
utterances of the Great Brahma,
the celestial’s spontaneous numinous tones,
not the common speech of this world.
The ancient script stretched a full *zhang* in length.
Once transmitted by the Venerable One of Mount Qingcheng from the Most High Lord of the Dao,
whoever recites them subdues the hundred demons,
dissolves demonic ghosts in silence,
while the myriad spirits guard and protect.
Inscribe their talismanic script,
form it into a pellet and swallow—
one may ascend to the Mysterious Void of the Great Empyrean.
Recite the spell a hundred times,
and when the Dao is complete,
the Flying Heavenly Divine Kings descend to observe the body,
record its merits and toils,
and memorialize the Ten Heavens—
thus may one attain the spontaneous principle of the *Lingbao* and Primordial Beginning.
From this spell, one or two characters may be imparted to mortals,
their power responding to fortune and misfortune,
birth and death, good and ill—
unerring in effect.
If a perfected one receives it,
pledging heart and treasure in golden offering,
swearing an oath to heaven before transmission—
to leak or profane it lightly
brings calamity upon nine generations.
Wherever this scripture resides,
if spectral evil brings harm,
inscribe its talismans to suppress it—
all other spirits and demons transform into water,
their nature restored to spontaneity,
fulfilling the great principle of the Dao.

Here ends *Scroll Five of the Great Rites of the Numinous Treasure Scripture of Limitless Salvation*.
