**The Heavenly Dao Values Life**
**The Ghostly Dao Values Finality**

**The Dao of Immortals is Ever Auspicious**
**The Dao of Ghosts is Ever Inauspicious**
The loftiest, pure, and radiant spirits
Sing mournful songs that resound through the vast heavens.
I only wish the Dao of Immortals to flourish,
Not for the Dao of Humans to languish in destitution.
In the Northern Capital’s Yellow Springs and Crooked Mansion,
A myriad of ghosts gather in throngs.
They seek only to cut short human fate,
Severing the Gate of Human Life.
Ah! Sing the cavernous hymns,
To subdue the Northern Feng of Luo.
Bind and dispatch the demons and malevolent spirits,
Sever the blades of the Six Ghostly Legions.
The qi of all heavens surges boundlessly—
My Dao daily ascends in glory.
Lofty and resplendent, it soars high,
Illuminating qi in all four directions.
The pure conduct of the Brahma heavens,
Encircling the ten directions,
The boundless great deities—
All arise from this body of mine.
I possess the cavernous hymns,
A myriad recitations to attain immortality.
The Dao of Immortals values deliverance,
Yet the Dao of Ghosts clings fast.
Heaven and earth stretch vast and desolate,
Defiled qi swirls in profusion.
The Three Realms rejoice—
Pass beyond them, and abide eternally.
When this body crosses into my realm,
Its form merges with spontaneity.
At this moment, joy abounds—
Yet how fleeting, for it flows from my grace.
The Dragon Han era surges boundlessly—
How can one discern the true?
My realm is difficult to cross,
Thus I compose these cavernous texts.
Transforming and soaring through the void,
To test this body of mine.
Success or failure, slackening or retreat—
How few are those who attain deliverance?
I laugh at those who do not cross over,
Thus I sing this melody.
Above the Three Realms,
The boundless Great Luo stretches on.
No root of form exists there,
Cloud-layers towering, majestic and high.

Only the Primordial Beginning, the House of Vast Kalpas,
ordains and governs my realm,
receiving its mandate from the Mysterious Capital.
Those who transgress my realm
enter the Jade Void—
I reign as the Supreme King,
rectifying and subduing the hordes of demons.
Ten thousand transformations fill the void,
defiled qi blooms in profusion.
Few preserve their authenticity,
many fall into delusion.
The Dao of immortals is hard to stabilize,
the path of ghosts easily turns crooked.
The human path lies in the heart—
truly, it does not depend on others.
The Dao of immortals values substance,
the human path values splendor.
If you do not delight in the immortal Dao,
how can you pass beyond the Three Realms?
Should you desire to traverse the Five Paths,
what recourse shall I have?

The Demon Kings pay homage in form,
commanding and restraining the earthly deities,
forever parting from ghostly offices.
The soul crosses the Cinnabar Mound,
passing through the Three Realms,
undergoing refinement to birth the spirit—
this is called the Boundless.
Universally delivering the limitless,
inscribing talismans and reciting incantations:

"Celestial crystal, primordial and vast,
earth expansive, rivers flowing.
Thunder Duke dispels evil,
Thunder Mother responds to heaven.
Spirits of straw men,
serving for ten thousand years.
Wondrous trees,
dare to approach the altar.
Lu lu ling ling,
assist on all four sides.
Divine spirits below,
summon your souls.
Arrive instantly at my command,
foretelling a thousand years.
Attach and arrive at once,
responding in due time.
Se se li li,
spirits swiftly gather.
Xie xie Ji Di,
the sacred tortoise commands.
Hasten! As the Supreme Numinous Treasure decrees."

With the right method, trace the Mao script with the left hand while reciting,
using cinnabar on yellow paper, as per the preceding text.

The Great Rites of the Numinous Treasure *Scripture of Boundless Salvation*, Scroll Seven, concludes.
The Great Rites of the Numinous Treasure *Scripture of Boundless Salvation*, Scroll Eight begins.

**Chapter on the Radiant Stabilization of Divine Light**

For seven days and seven nights, the sun, moon, and stars of all heavens halt their wheels—Xuanji and Yuheng stand still. The divine wind falls silent; mountains and peaks conceal their clouds. The sky is free of drifting veils; the four *qi* shine in clarity. Throughout the land—its mountains, rivers, forests, and trees—all levels as one, no longer high or low. The earth transforms into green jade, uniform in hue.

The Perfected attend in assembly as the Most High Lord of the Dao sits suspended in empty space upon a five-colored lion. The Mystic Master says: This speaks of the primordial bequest of the Heavenly Worthy, whose wondrous application of divine transformation and responsive mechanism brings forth such manifestations. Though it is said that for seven days and seven nights the sun, moon, and stars halt their wheels, how then is the count of seven days and seven nights distinguished? Moreover, this is not solely the Floating Black Soil of the Jade Clarity Heaven—such numinous and wondrous transformations occur likewise. What the Dao Lord describes is the simultaneous response of all heavens; throughout the Three Realms and the myriad heavens of the ten directions, all are thus—this is the subtle and sacred resonance.

In the Heavenly Worthy’s external transformation, the sun and moon do not move, the stars do not revolve, Xuanji and Yuheng halt their wheels, and day and night are no longer manifest. Yet internally, the governing and sustaining functions never cease for even a moment. Thus, the Jade Palace employs the count of seven days and seven nights—not to be compared with the seven days and seven nights of the Jade Clarity or Jade Capital when expounding scriptures, nor with the seven days and seven nights of the human world. Here, "one land" encompasses all heavens and all earths. When it is said that the land levels as one, this signifies that transformation pervades all things without exception, hence "no longer high or low."

From the internal perspective: the sun and moon of the heavens do not blink; the stars do not circulate *qi*; Xuanji and Yuheng do not rest their pulses. The divine wind is silent, without exhalation or inhalation. Mountains and seas conceal their clouds, and yin and yang do not alternate. The sky is free of drifting veils—internally and externally, nothing obstructs. The four *qi* shine in clarity—internally and externally, above and below, all is one. "One land" is like one body; its mountains, rivers, forests, and trees are like the four limbs, the hundred vessels, hair, pores, the chambers of *ying* and *wei*, the spirit abodes, and the joints of the bones. When the earth transforms into green jade, one enters the realm of Daoist stabilization.

The Mystic Master says: From the internal perspective, this is the radiant stabilization of divine light, wherein the Jade Clarity realm is clearly perceived through seven days and seven nights of practice. For seven days and seven nights, the sun and moon halt their wheels, and the eyes do not blink—yet this is neither closing the eyes, nor inner vision, nor gazing directly. It is a prolonged gaze of seven days and seven nights, halting the blinking of the eyes to illuminate the Three Fields, internally and externally resplendent. The *qi* of one’s body circulates through the hundred joints and meridians; yin and yang, *ying* and *wei*, all connect to the breath-pulse of the Three Fields. This breath-pulse is the Xuanji and Yuheng of the human body. The four directions constitute Xuanji; the Three Fields correspond to Yuheng.

When Xuanji does not move, the sun and moon pause in their course, and the stars halt their wheels. When the four directions do not reach, the Three Fields do not rest, and the *qi* and blood of the body cease their circulation. First, one must achieve stillness in the divine wind, without the sound of exhalation or inhalation. Mountains and peaks conceal their clouds, free from the obscuring visions of deluded thoughts. In clarity and profound stillness, the sky’s drifting veils vanish, and the four *qi* naturally harmonize in warmth, coolness, cold, and heat—all things become one in hue. How much more so within the body, where internally and externally all is like green jade, without a speck of dust. Gradually, the hundred spirits guard the gates of death, and the myriad Perfected attend the form of one’s body—one may then ascend bodily into empty space. After a hundred days, the spirit merges with the subtlety of the Dao; after a thousand days, one soars in broad daylight to ascend on high.

The Heavenly Worthy’s suspension in empty space is the dwelling of one’s own primordial spirit in the Jade Clarity Palace—also called the Jade Emperor’s Palace. As it is said: "Within oneself there is a Heavenly Worthy; why gaze upward to heaven?" The eulogy states: Though the Heavenly Worthy is distant and wondrous, in nearness it is the Mud-Pill Palace, whose chambers are all of the seven treasures, with windows and doors naturally distinct.

When the five *qi* gather at the Crimson Palace, the wondrous transformations of numinous power coalesce into a lion. The Heavenly Worthy thereby mounts it and descends into the Cinnabar Field. Left is blue-green, right is white, front is red, back is black, and the center is yellow—hence the five colors. Sitting suspended in empty space, there is transformation in response to the insubstantial and the real, trust in resonance. For seven days and seven nights, the Jade Clarity Heavenly Worthy is clearly perceived—this is the radiant stabilization of divine light. Ascending to the most wondrous, with merit perfected and encounter complete, one may attain effortless ascent. Yet within stabilization, demonic trials—water, fire, blades, weapons, royal laws, and myriad forms—cling to the slightest reality, and none may attain the Dao. Beyond the seven days and seven nights, what is seen pertains to future events. Should one speak of it, all prior merit is forfeit, and the hope of immortality is lost. How can one not guard one’s words?

The method states: Align the ears with the shoulders, the nose with the navel; gather the six senses. Honor the spirit in the eyes—neither external nor internal—observe the divine light. After three days, within the secluded chamber, a speck of divine light appears; steadfastly stabilize the spirit. After four days, it gradually brightens and expands. By the seventh day, the divine light fills the chamber. Within stabilization, all things are as yet unrealized. When within stabilization one sees all true spirits and ghostly beings, one enters the penetrating vision, beholding the *Chart of Radiant Stabilization of Divine Light* and the *Chart of Xuanji and Yuheng*.

With each inhalation and exhalation, the four directions together measure six inches. One inhalation reaches two directions; one exhalation reaches two directions—each direction measures three inches. Each direction attains fifteen parts, weaving heaven and earth in fifteenfold warp and weft—thus did the Supreme Emperor bestow the *Yellow River Chart* upon the Yellow Emperor.

**Chapter on Penetrating Vision**
Begin with one’s original destiny and practice the stabilization method. After seven days, when stabilization is firm, one may proceed with penetrating vision. If stabilization is not yet achieved, do not practice this. Within empty space, visualize oneself as the Most High Lord of the Dao, the gaze fixed upon what lies ten thousand miles beyond, without regard for what is before one’s face. After another seven days, faint traces gradually appear. With a hundred days of practice, one may sit and observe the Three Worthies, penetratingly behold the Ten Heavens, and see all within the ten directions.

When calamities arise in the year, recite and chant the wondrous scriptures—thus does one become a Perfected of the Nine Palaces.

In practicing this great stabilization and penetrating vision, one must observe two sets of precepts and uphold the great stabilization for three years. Facing the Jade Purity, the Heavenly Worthy bestows a celestial writ, and one ascends in broad daylight to fill a vacancy among the Heavenly Perfected. If one practices the great stabilization without upholding virtue and precepts, wisdom will not arise, and entry into the wondrous subtleties of the Great Vehicle will be difficult. One cannot embody the utmost subtlety or ascend into the Jade Purity.

**Chapter on the Wondrous Precepts of Might and Spirit**
The first precept: maintain equanimity of mind; do not deceive oneself.
The second precept: serve one’s lord and teacher with loyalty; honor and revere heaven, earth, and parents.
The third precept: extend benevolence and compassion to all beings; live in frugality and temperance.
The fourth precept: maintain purity, uprightness, and integrity; do not form cliques.
The fifth precept: revere the supreme Dao and deeply trust in cultivation.
The sixth precept: honor spirits and deities; do not treat them with contempt.
The seventh precept: regard all clothing, food, and possessions as issuing from the primordial qi of the Originator; do not entertain extraneous thoughts.
The eighth precept: cleanse with ash-water and purify defilements; do not indulge in adornment.
The ninth precept: recite with the mouth and prostrate with the heart; do not allow weariness or toil.
The tenth precept: after seven days of great stabilization, the divine radiance becomes resplendent, and the realm of Jade Purity appears.

**Chapter on the Wondrous Virtues of Wisdom**
The first virtue: do not kill.

The second virtue: not to kill.
Where the mind conceives intent, the mouth utters falsehood, or the hand acts in deception—where one incites, aids, instructs, or lures others to slaughter all sentient beings—this is called killing.

The third virtue: not to harm.
Where schemes fester in secret, flattery and treachery are deployed outwardly, or pits, snares, nets, and cruel, unlawful methods are used to injure sentient beings—this is called harming.

The fourth virtue: not to envy.
Where resentment is harbored, malice is concealed, or one seizes an opportunity to slander—where one wishes misfortune upon another—this is called envy.

The fifth virtue: not to be jealous.
Where the heart is stirred in darkness, private desires are nurtured, or one covets another’s beauty—where one schemes to undermine or eradicate another’s abilities or lineage—this is called jealousy.

The sixth virtue: not to lust.
Where the mind strays beyond proper bounds, whether through desire for beauty or wealth, or where one engages in illicit relations with kin, violates familial bonds, or pursues improper unions—where private longings arise regardless of beauty or ugliness—this is called lust.

The seventh virtue: not to steal.
Where walls are breached, seals are broken, locks are forced, or documents are tampered with—where one conceals with private intent, borrows without repayment, or deceives to seize what is not one’s own—this is called stealing.

The eighth virtue: not to covet.
Where words and thoughts lack foundation, and one’s desires expand boundlessly—where, upon beholding the myriad things, one wishes to possess them all, never satisfied, ever seeking to fulfill insatiable cravings—this is called covetousness.

The ninth virtue: not to desire.
Where the mind, like a restless monkey, and the will, like a galloping steed, drive the six senses into motion, stirring the seven emotions—where longing arises from attachment, and desire takes root—this is called desire.

The tenth virtue: not to hate.
Where partiality and attachment lead one to distinguish between fragrance and stench, purity and filth—where one discriminates between high and low, noble and base, refusing to regard all as equal—this is called hatred.

The eleventh virtue: not to be deceitful.
Where suspicion and doubt cloud judgment, where one errs in excess or deficiency, where cunning and deceit arise, or where one obstructs or thwarts others—this is called deceit.

The twelfth virtue: speech without embellishment.
The thirteenth virtue: speech without malice.

The Way of Great Stabilization instructs you, the seeker: observe the mind within stillness, for the mind without mind is the true mind. Observe form without form, for this is the true form. When both mind and form are forgotten, one naturally enters the formless Dao—this is the method of ascending in broad daylight.

The *Hymn of Divine Radiance in Great Stabilization* by the Perfected One of the Grand Unity says:
In profound obscurity, the mind is absent;
In the great abyss, form is concealed.
Azure hues merge as one,
Preserving transformation and congealing spirit.
Light as a feather, unmoving,
Within and without, the true is contained.
The tortoise devours the crimson serpent,
Weaving the essence of true refinement.
Sun and moon grow dim,
The celestial pivot ceases its ascent.
White mist and azure haze
Intertwine in ceaseless exchange.
After seven days of divine penetration,
The Jade Purity realm appears of itself.

The Wondrous Rank of the Millet-Grain Man
When the ten recitations of the scripture were complete, the Perfected Great Spirits of the Ten Directions and the boundless Celestial Worthies arrived as one. The men and women of the land turned their hearts in reverence and devotion. They came like fine rain or dense mist, their numbers beyond measure—so vast that half the land sank beneath their weight, yet none could be turned away.

Then the Originator suspended a single treasure-pearl, no larger than a millet grain, in the void five *zhang* above the earth. The Originator ascended and led the Perfected Great Spirits, the Most High and Venerable Ones, and the Realized Ones of Wondrous Conduct—an innumerable host—into the pearl. From below, the celestial beings gazed upward and saw only a shimmering light entering the pearl’s mouth. Once inside, its destination was unknown. The people dispersed, and the land returned to levelness, the unevenness no more.

The Mystic Master said: When the ten recitations of the scripture were complete, the Great Spirits of the Ten Directions and the boundless Celestial Worthies arrived as one. The power of wisdom was summoned, weaving auspicious responses, and the entire land was protected and delivered, all attaining longevity. Thus, they turned their hearts in devotion, and the whole nation came to the place where the scripture was expounded. Like fine rain or dense mist, their numbers were beyond reckoning—hence the term "innumerable host." The myriad heavens speak of "one land," and when that land gathers in the Great Floating Li Realm, the earth cannot bear its weight. Yet by the profound power of the Heavenly Worthy’s scripture and the vastness of the innumerable host, the land was pressed down and half of it sank, though the multitude could not be restrained.

Thus, the Heavenly Worthy enacted a wondrous transformation: suspending a treasure-pearl no larger than a millet grain in the void, five *zhang* above the earth, beyond the realm of defilement. The Perfected Great Spirits, the Nine Ranks of the Upper Primordial Perfected, the Most High and Venerable Ones, the Nine Ranks of the Middle Primordial Sages, and the Realized Ones of Wondrous Conduct, along with the Nine Ranks of the Lower Primordial Immortals, followed the Heavenly Worthy’s ascent and entered the pearl as one. All other celestial beings, not being Perfected Great Spirits, Most High Sages, or Realized Ones, could not follow the transformative mechanism of non-action and thus could not enter the wondrous void of the millet-grain pearl. They could only gaze upward, seeing the shimmering light enter the pearl’s mouth. Once inside, its destination was unknown.

Even lesser immortals possess the wonder of holding Mount Sumeru in a mustard seed or the scenery of heaven and earth in a gourd—how much more so the Great Sage! The Heavenly Worthy, in expounding the great teaching, manifested divine transformations. Though the pearl was no larger than a millet grain—already wondrous in itself—being five *zhang* above the earth, only celestial beings could perceive it suspended in the void. How much rarer still to witness its mouth! Truly, the Heavenly Worthy led the Perfected and Sages into the wondrous realm of being and non-being. As they followed the Heavenly Worthy into the pearl, the celestial beings below saw its mouth. Once all had entered, the pearl’s interior—its profound and wondrous transformation—became invisible to them. Thus, the people dispersed, the land returned to levelness, and the unevenness vanished. Such was the scene of the scripture’s recitation and the wonder of the Heavenly Worthy’s pearl.

In the words of the Great Dao: the divine penetration of the Dao is vast, encompassing all without limit, entering all without exception. When gathered, it takes form; when transformed, it becomes an innumerable host, all reduced to the subtlety of a hair or mustard seed. Such is its power when concentrated.

When dispersed, it arises from non-being into being, pervading the myriad heavens and all lands, dividing its form into countless millions—nothing it does not reach, nothing it does not penetrate. Such is its state when scattered.

At five *zhang* above the earth, one transcends the five desires and five dusts, the five aggregates and five colors, the five fragrances and five sounds, the five turbidities—beyond the reckoning of the Five Agents, thus entering the wondrous subtlety of emptiness and mystery.

The grain of millet is the chief among the five cereals. A single land is likened to the body. The uneven sinking signifies the Dao’s inclination and pursuit, its unity not yet complete, thus unworthy of the profound transformation of the Double Mystery.

The *tianren* are the myriad spirits. The Perfected of the Upper Saints and the Heavenly Worthies, the Realized Ones of wondrous practice—these are the spirits of the Three Primes. The Heavenly Worthy is the master of the body entire.

Spoken in terms of the wondrous inner vision of the Dao, this is the esoteric formula of the Jade Clarity’s divine pearl and the alchemical embryo of the immortals. In the great method, it is the practice of grain avoidance to cure illness. In recitation and cultivation, it is the ritual of numinous power and mysterious penetration, the rank of dispelling calamity and summoning fortune.

The Mystic Master said: After nine revolutions and ten cycles, when the work is complete, one attains the proof of passing from being into non-being, the wondrous subtlety of emptiness and the grain of millet. First summon the yang essence, then the yin radiance—entering like fine rain or dense mist, suffusing the entire body. The primordial *qi* circulates ten times; the spirit transforms the original valley. When the primordial *qi* returns once more, the host of *qi* follows in unison, transmuting into the mysterious cinnabar of the millet grain, settling in the numinous palace of the Yellow Court. When the elixir is formed and pierces the sun, consuming it, one instantly mounts the clouds and ascends to Jade Clarity, attaining the rank of Perfected.

The *Tai Xuan* Perfected’s *Hymn on the Millet Grain Entering the Mystery* says:
The numinous gaze rivals heaven, in resonance with the Great Mystery.
Three days of yang unite; seven dawns complete the yin.
The thirteenth is the position of *kun*; the eighteenth links *qian*.
Full and new moons bear the talisman; eight forms the crescent.
On the twenty-third night, yin and yang merge in origin.
The evening sun is the constant Dao—this assembly unites the Three Fields.
If a single speck is tainted, the unbroken continuity is lost.

**The Five Spirits in Harmonious Union**
*Summoning Talisman for the Five Spirits in Harmonious Union*

*Incantation for the Talisman:*
A thousand harmonies, ten thousand unions—naturally perfected as the Real.
Within the Real dwells the spirit, the Great Lord of Longevity.
The Peerless Noble Youth, the White Prime Honored Spirit,
The Great One Who Oversees Destiny, Peach and Plum in Harmonious Longevity.
Grasp the talisman, hold the register—preserve life and root destiny.
Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the *Yuan Shi Wu Liang Du Ren* Ordinance!

*Incantation for Ingesting the Talisman:*
The Supreme Numinous Elixir, radiant in the Three Fields,
Slays and extinguishes the corpse-worms, repels the demonic mists.
The Five Spirits in harmonious union—all passages are opened and complete.
It can make winter hot, even cause summer to turn cold.
Reversing *kan* and *li*, the *qi* revolves in unbroken continuity.
My body vast and boundless, transformed in a thousand ways.
Entering my five viscera, the hundred spirits do not intrude.
The true *qi* descends within, stripping *kun* and invigorating *qian*.
Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the *Ling Bao* Ordinance for the Harmonious Union of the Five Spirits!

**Diagram of the Five Spirits in Harmonious Union**
The White Prime Honored Spirit.

Within the Mud-Pill Palace dwells the Great One;
At the Center presides the Director of Destinies;
At the Gate of Life, Peach Vitality and Unaging Lord;
The Lad of No-Flourish.

The Master of the Mysteries states: The talisman for the Harmonious Union of the Five Spirits—when adepts practice the *Ling Bao* Seven Classics and Eight Taboo-Names, along with all inner cultivation methods—should be inscribed in cinnabar upon yellow silk. Each morning, facing east, one swallows a single talisman. The *Shangqing* oral instructions prescribe the Five Directions’ *qi* to be blown onto the talisman. Thus, the Five Spirits guard and protect, the Three Ones abide perpetually, and all visualization practices and applications become efficacious without fail.

The *Ode of the Five Qi in the Central Principle* by the Wondrous-Practice Perfected:
One *qi* pays homage to the ancestral source, entering the Eight Darknesses.
The Gate of Heaven and Door of Earth—opening, closing, blocking, and flowing.
Life’s root lies in the Supreme Tenuity; the luminous beam is the ancestral *qi*.
Heaven enters to become yang; the Gate of Heaven is yin.
Earth’s release is true; receiving and expelling are the work of the perverse.
Water and fire arrive together; the hundred spirits turn eastward,
Returning to the Valley Chamber.

*Concluding the Eighth Scroll of the Great Method of the Supreme Ling Bao Wuliang Duren Shangjing*

**Ninth Scroll of the Great Method of the Supreme Ling Bao Wuliang Duren Shangjing**
**The Ten Revolutions of Returning Spirit**

The Ten Revolutions of Returning Spirit—ten thousand *qi* ascend as immortals together.

The Master of the Mysteries states: The Dao of the Ten Revolutions embodies the principle of the Five Phases’ generation and completion. The method of the Ten Revolutions was expounded by the Heavenly Worthy in ten recitations of the scripture, wherein the divine transformations manifest this principle.

The Host of Perfected Ones attended the assembly.
The Master of the Mysteries states: When the true beings of the body gather, this discourse may be discussed.
When the Primordial Heavenly Worthy recited the scripture once, all the great sages of the heavens simultaneously voiced their approval. At that moment, all the deaf and ailing in the land had their ears opened to hearing.
The Master of the Mysteries states: When the true beings gather in constant goodness, the water number generates the One. The entire world receives grace; water arises and ascends in audience, flowing through mountains and valleys, bathing the kidneys to augment wisdom. The deaf gain hearing, and the ailing ears become keen. In terms of the supreme Dao, those lost in sound do not perceive beyond sound; the truly afflicted ear does not hear the soundless—even the greatly wise are deaf. It is said: Obtaining the true flow of water’s One, wisdom ascends and intelligence unfolds, and the ailing ear becomes keen.

When the scripture was recited a second time, the blind regained their sight.
The Master of the Mysteries states: The eyes are the masters of the body’s radiance, the root of the sun and moon’s essence. They are the windows and doors for gathering the true, the numinous source for perceiving the Dao. In the *Shang Dao Prohibited Scripture*, the sun and moon are foremost. Radiance is fire; the pupil at the center is the root of Mars. The sun and moon divide their brilliance—fire’s generative number is two. The true water of Heaven’s One bathes the root of life’s origin. The supreme and mysterious true fire soars and flies within the heart. Thus, light returns and brightness is restored, connecting with the three luminaries’ splendor—this is how the blind regain their sight. Moreover, the root of generation and transformation lies in the splitting of the *jia* from the two kidneys, the origin of the *xu* and *hai*. The water of the kidneys pays homage to the origin; the two pupils congeal above, and fire is born in the heart. Gazing upon the three luminaries in union, the two pupils govern the eyes’ light—this is called *xuyuan*. The generation and nurturing of the supreme Dao are of this same kind.

When the scripture was recited a third time, the mute could speak.
The Master of the Mysteries states: This is the generative number of wood. In terms of the supreme Dao, one thing generates the Five Phases; one color contains five hues. Yin and yang interact, generating and completing, reversing and repeating, concealing their function. Regarding the mute in conventional terms: the lungs govern sound. In the Five Constants’ application, speech is governed by metal, and metal governs voice. Thus, when the Heavenly Worthy recited the scripture thrice, the generative number of wood, the divine transformation’s principle resided in the West—the proper ritual of metal. By summoning metal with wood, the divine transformations reverse and recur—this is how the mute could speak.

When the scripture was recited a fourth time, those afflicted with lameness, paralysis, chronic accumulations, and lingering ailments could all rise and walk.
The Master of the Mysteries states: This is the generative number of metal. Lameness and paralysis refer to the withering of flesh and blood, the contraction and curvature of the four limbs—obstructions, paralysis, lameness, and stiffness. The ailments of chronic accumulation are those passed down through generations, deeply settled and incurable. These conditions involve the relaxation and contraction of sinews and vessels, the obstruction of blood networks—governed by the wood phase, the master of the liver’s *qi* and the web of vessels. However, the fourth revolution pertains to the immortals’ number—precisely the method of the Five Phases’ reversal and completion. In terms of the supreme Dao, the ailments of the Dharma-body perish when metal and wood interact. This is the mutual necessity of water and fire, the mutual affection of metal and wood. Thus, the fourth recitation corresponds to metal’s generative number, accomplishing wood’s divine transformation—this is the meaning.

When the scripture was recited a fifth time, long-standing chronic illnesses were restored to wholeness in an instant.
The Master of the Mysteries states: Five is the generative number of earth’s Dao. Flesh, blood, and bodily form all belong to earth. Thus, the fifth recitation restores form, completing the Five Phases’ embodiment. Deafness, blindness, muteness, lameness, paralysis, chronic accumulations, lingering ailments, and long-standing chronic illnesses are all cured at once, restoring form and wholeness—this is the generative number of the Five Phases.

When the scripture was recited a sixth time, white hair turned black again, and fallen teeth regrew.
The Master of the Mysteries states: This is the generative number of water’s One. It enables the deaf and ailing to regain hearing, while water’s completion number is six. The true water completes its transformation—white hair turns black, and fallen teeth regrow.

When the scripture was recited a seventh time, the old regained their youth, and the young became even stronger.
The Master of the Mysteries states: The seventh recitation corresponds to fire’s completion number. The body’s inner radiance is born; the five viscera’s brilliance shines forth. Externally, the old regain their youth, and the young, upon receiving this, find their countenances and physiques strengthened—all through the work of water and fire.

When the scripture was recited an eighth time, pregnant women, birds, and beasts carrying young—whether born or unborn—all attained completion in birth.
The Master of the Mysteries states: Eight is the completion number of wood. The *qi* of generation nurtures all beings, enabling their completion. The sacred embryo congeals the numinous; the eight *qi* flourish and coalesce. Forms divide and embryos transform, free from all harm—all governed by wood’s generative *qi*.

When the scripture was recited a ninth time, the earth’s treasuries were revealed, and gold and jade manifested openly.
The Master of the Mysteries states: The ninth recitation corresponds to the sacred embryo’s nine revolutions—the completion number of metal. Forms can no longer be concealed; the radiance of gold and the splendor of jade illuminate ten thousand *li*. This is what is meant by a golden countenance and jade visage, a body of jade and limbs of nephrite, bathing and irrigating the entire body.

Exhaling and inhaling animate the myriad beings, transmuting them into gold and jade. Blowing *qi* forms gold; spitting upon the earth yields jade. A hundred blossoms and a thousand hues interlace the body—all through the functioning of the Five Phases, the effusion of gold and jade, and the division of the sacred embryo’s form.

When the scripture is recited a tenth time, withered bones revive, all rising as complete humans.
The Master of the Mysteries states: This is the completion number of earth. It is called the ten revolutions of returning numinosity, where the ten thousand *qi* ascend as immortals together, the decayed skeleton revives, the withered bones transform into immortals, and the dead rise again as complete humans. This tenth recitation’s Dao originates from the Five Phases’ generative numbers. At its culmination, it reaches the Five Phases’ completion numbers. To understand this Dao is to attain longevity; to cultivate it is to become a divine immortal, shedding the mortal coil and ascending in flight—this is its ultimate attainment. When merit is perfected and conduct fulfilled, one attains the rank of Highest Perfected.

Eighty-one days mark one revolution; eight hundred days, the Lesser Vehicle; three thousand days, the Greater Vehicle. Depart not from these words, and all divine immortals shall emerge from their cultivation. Though the myriad methods diverge in path, their affairs converge in principle. The true master’s oral instructions end here.

The Perfected of Dharma-Emptiness’s *Ode on the Ten Revolutions Returning Numinosity, Where the Ten Thousand Qi Ascend as Immortals Together* states:
From one to ten, the Five Phases are the foundation.
Yin and yang revolve in cycles, entering and exiting the sacred barrier.
The sun ascends Fusang; the moon sinks into Dark Yan.
The ten thousand spirits pay homage to the Perfected, attaining unity with the Great Chaos.

The Master of the Mysteries states: The Four Mysteries and Two Dao, the great stabilization of divine radiance. A grain of millet enters the wondrous, where the Five *Qi* reside at the center. The ten revolutions return numinosity. The Perfected expounds it; the ode and gatha reveal its profundities—then ascension has its limits, and enlightenment its origins. Those who grasp its essence become divine immortals.

**Methods of Embryonic Transformation and Dharma-Substance Grades**
The August Person’s Teachings state: The Primordial Beginning’s sacred embryo has the number of ten months for its formation, and the way of the seven heads and five roots.

**Superior Grade: Wondrous Head**
- At fifteen: the Head of No Conduct.
- At twenty-five: the Head of Extended Clarity.
- At thirty-five: the Anāpāna Head.
- At forty-five: the Curved Head.
- At fifty-five: the Head of Reverence in the Three Realms.
- At sixty-five: the Head of Demons Bound.
- At seventy-five: the Head of Spirits Bound.

The Master of the Mysteries states: The Superior Grade’s Wondrous Head requires not nine years of effort. The Head of No Conduct can achieve Perfection in seven years. The Anāpāna Head ascends in broad daylight after nine years. The Head of Extended Clarity fulfills its merit in one cycle and achieves Perfection. The Curved Head attains the Dao through liberation from the corpse after eighteen years. At sixty-five, one becomes an immortal of earth and water, with one’s name recorded in the Celestial Bureau—hence reverence in the Three Realms. At seventy-five, one attains longevity and transcends the world, free from demonic trials—hence the binding of all demons. Those below this extend their heavenly years, and all spirits are bound.

Above lies the colorless root—this is the Heavenly Root. Sever the Earthly Root, preserve the Life-Generating Root, and extinguish the Evil Root.
The Master of the Mysteries states: The colorless root above is where all dust and defilements are purified, entering the grade of thoughtlessness and non-action—this is called

When Heaven and Earth move, qi and blood circulate; when yin and yang revolve, *ying* and *wei* flow. At the conjunction of sun and moon, the inner qi converges; when inner qi converges, the supreme treasure is produced. The supreme treasure gathers to form the Great Elixir; when the Great Elixir is perfected, the sacred embryo is completed.

The path of leakage lies in the assault of the Eight Evils. The foundation of elixir-making lies in the union of the Ten Celestial Stems, matched to the Nine Cauldrons, harmonized with the Nine Colors, and accomplished through the Nine Revolutions.

*The Diagram of the Eight Vessels of the Heart-Pericardium within the Primordial Palace*
*Divine Communication through the Profound Grade*

The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign says: When yang is complete, one becomes an immortal; when yin is complete, one becomes a ghost. When yang is complete, the celestial truth may be beheld—hence the *Dongzhen*, *Dongxuan*, and *Dongshen* scriptures. When yin is complete, one joins the company of ghosts—hence the *Dongyin*, *Shuodan*, *Yujue Xuan Yin*, and *Han Ting Chang Ye*.

Humans receive the harmonious qi of the primordial, with yin and yang each half. Those who cannot behold their immortal truth do so because their yang is incomplete. Even a trace of yang prevents one from becoming a ghost; even a wisp of yin prevents one from becoming an immortal. Above the Nine Heavens, yin qi is entirely dissolved; below the Nine Earths, true yang is forever extinguished.

Thus, in practicing the numinous treasure of the Great Law, one must first ensure the body is free from杂务, the mind from stray thoughts, and both inner and outer realms are pure and empty, embracing the primordial and guarding the One. Next, one gathers and ingests the upright qi, refining qi into spirit, expelling pure yin from the body, and descending the yang spirit into the self. Only then may one clearly perceive the hundred spirits, summon and descend the thousand perfected, dispel demonic entities, and avert the five weapons.

The practitioner must recite and chant the sacred scriptures and hymns day and night without negligence to attain spiritual resonance. Should a single word be carelessly revealed, all true spirits will scatter, and success will be utterly unattainable. The practitioner must seal their lips and uphold the practice.

On the days of the Three Origins and Eight Nodal Points, one should bow in reverence and inscribe the talismans for the Ten Great Perfected, Ten Great Jade Lads, and Ten Great Jade Maidens to summon the true spirits. Within the method, the Five Thearchs’ Jade Lads and the attendant Jade Maidens of the Immortal Offices shall, along with the spirit officials, guardian deities of the Dao, and rectifying spirits, be stationed behind the sleeping couch.

Prepare a small chamber, arrange the sacred seats of the Immortal Offices, the registers of the method, and other scriptures, and offer incense, flowers, seasonal fruits, and other supplies for their oversight. They shall monitor, record, and report the practitioner’s merits, transgressions, movements, and stillness, as well as the responses of the guardians.

On an auspicious day, enter the oratory, conclude the morning audience with the perfected, and visualize the Three Treasures, each receiving a tablet of azure jade inscribed in gold characters. The true qi is nine inches long and five inches wide, inscribed as the *True Qi of Jade Clarity*, the *True Qi of Supreme Clarity*, and the *True Qi of Grand Clarity*. After receiving them, bow twice, withdraw, and recite the invocation to the Divine Communicator, the Jade Lads, and Jade Maidens, accumulating ten thousand repetitions. In cold places, warmth is obtained; in hot places, coolness; in weariness, vigor; in foulness, fragrance; in peril, safety—all shall be as desired.

For all matters within and beyond the method, burn incense and pray, and they shall come to inform the practitioner. Whether grand or small, luminous or shadowy, in speech or sound, light or image, color or scene, examine them carefully to discern fortune or misfortune. Memorials may be submitted from afar, and all shall evoke a response.

The Perfected of the Great Ultimate, the Perfected of the Great Mystery, the Perfected of the Great One, the Perfected of Fixed Radiance, the Perfected of Wondrous Radiance, the Perfected of Treasure Accumulation, the Perfected of Universal Attainment, the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, the Perfected of Orthodox Unity, the Perfected of the Mysterious One, the Golden Radiance Lad, the Supreme Lad, the Orthodox Lad, the Opening Radiance Lad, the Pure Radiance Lad, the Wisdom Radiance Lad, the Reverent Lad, the Perfect Radiance Lad, the Dao-Eye Lad, the Wisdom-Eye Lad, the Jade Maiden of the Great Mystery, the Jade Maiden of the Azure Waist, the Jade Maiden of the Great Simplicity, the Jade Maiden of the Mysterious Wondrous, the Jade Maidens of the Six Dings, the Jade Maidens of the Three Clarities, the Jade Maidens of the Eight Poles, the Jade Maidens of the Nine Palaces, the Jade Maiden of Numinous Flight, and the Jade Maiden of Transformations—

The Ten Perfected, Jade Lads, and Jade Maidens of this method: should they manifest extraordinary or peculiar forms, or should the practitioner harbor impure thoughts, they shall fall into hell. If one rages or cries out in great anger, or breaks faith and violates the covenant, the spirits will depart far away, and when the moment comes, they will not respond.

To practice the numinous treasure, choose the days of *wuchen*, *wuxu*, *jiwei*, or *jichou* as the starting point. After the *zi* hour on that day, conclude the morning audience with the perfected, face the sacred stars, and step the Dipper from its handle to its mouth. Turn and enter the Dipper’s mouth, then perform nine bows and three pinches of incense. Form the Mudra of the Five Peaks and Three Paths with both hands, hold it before the heart, gaze steadily at a bowl of water, and click the teeth nine times.

Recite the incantation:
*"Kui Gang* is numinous, *Kui Gang* is sacred.
Encountering evil qi, it must respond.
Charge and command, charge and command."*

Recite this nine times, inhale the northern qi toward the heavens, and exhale it into the water. Visualize the character *ling* within the water, and gaze steadily at it.

Recite the incantation:
*"Qian, origin; Kun, benefit; Zhen, upright.
Sun and moon accompany me.
I am neither hungry nor thirsty,
but rely on the purity of the divine water.
The qi of the Five Phases,
the essence of the Six Jias—
divine water enters the five viscera,
forever ensuring peace and tranquility.
Immortals together ascend in transformation,
flying to pay homage in the Supreme Clarity.
Swiftly, swiftly, as in the statutes and ordinances!"*

Recite this nine times, inhale the northern qi, and exhale it into the water.

Recite the incantation again:
*"Red apricot in *mao*, ink-black in *kan*,
grind true *you*, stocking *la* in the south.
Numinous Treasure.
Middle finger, center.
*Xing* arises in *qian*, *du* stands alone in *kun*, *ke* and *han* in *xun*.
Reverently invite the Perfected of the Great One of Heaven,
the Perfected of the Great Beginning of Heaven,
the True Immortals and True Perfected,
to ascend in response to the position of *Qian*,
the Six Dings as left spirits,
the Six Jias as right troops,
to receive for me the divine incantation of the Heavenly Heart and Great One.
The fire wheel of the south dispels evil and removes illness.
Charge and command with the *Geng* water.
The secret name of the Great One."*

Recite this incantation ten times, inhale the northern *qi*, and exhale it into the water.

While reciting, visualize the sun as a great wheel of fire within the water. Inhale *qi* and project it into the seal, then perform the Mudra of the Five Peaks and Three Paths with both hands. Recite again:

*"Though this disciple receives *qi* but thrice in a year,
heavenly *qi*, earthly *qi*,
solar *qi*, lunar *qi*,
the *qi* of the Five Stars,
the *qi* of the Southern Asterism and Northern Dipper,
the *qi* of the Six Dings and Six Jias,
the *qi* of the Nine Sovereigns of the Northern Dipper,
the *qi* of the Three Terraces and Canopy of Hua,
the *qi* of the Primordial Three Heavens above,
the wondrous *qi* that sustains the Five Peaks,
the *qi* of wind and clouds,
the *qi* of thunder and rain,
the *qi* of the Four Uprights.
Heaven cannot cover me,
earth cannot bear me.
Whoever opposes me shall perish,
whoever strikes me shall die.
Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!"*

Recite the incantation three times, inhale the northern *qi*, and blow it into the water. Then face north, recite the incantation once more, and draw the *qi* of the five directions into the mouth, rinsing and swallowing it into the abdomen. Take three sips of the water, pressing down the true *qi*, and flick the Mudra upon the body.

Then offer nine bows with incense and withdraw.

*The Great Method of the Numinous Treasure Scripture of Limitless Salvation, Scroll Nine*
*The Great Method of the Numinous Treasure Scripture of Limitless Salvation, Scroll Ten*
*Chapter on Penetrating Vision and Summoning*

The descent of Perfected Ones and the summoning of spirits in the *Numinous Treasure* tradition arise from the *qi* of the Three Caverns in flight and mystery, naturally coalescing into sacred talismans to invoke the hosts of the Three Origins, the myriad spirits, and the thousand Perfected. Should the adept hold office in the True Rank of the Azure Palace, among the transcendent ranks of the Numinous Void, and wish to summon the thousand Perfected and command the hundred spirits, take azure silk seven feet and two inches in length, sever it at the center, and inscribe upon it the Vermilion Talisman for the Descent of Perfected Ones and the Yellow Seal-Script Talisman for the Summoning of Spirits. Place them within the oratory. Use a mat of yellow brocade, or silk if brocade is unavailable.

Perform the *jiao* rites to offer sacrifice. Every nine days, invoke the inner taboo names of the Five Emperors, visualizing the talismans within the palm. After nine offerings, the true *qi* coalesces into radiance within the palm. After a hundred days, the envoys for the descent of Perfected Ones and the summoning of spirits—three Jade Maidens and three Golden Lads—will descend alongside the rites, directly guarding the numinous script and ensuring the swift arrival of the summoned Perfected Ones into the chamber. Thus may one behold the Heavenly Perfected with the eyes and hear the numinous sounds with the ears. After three offerings, their forms may be faintly perceived. Should the adept’s faith lack sincerity, the Five Peaks will test them. To lightly disclose these secrets will render the summoned spirits unresponsive. All the Perfected and Transcendents of the heavens heed the numinous talismans to appear before the adept. Without these sacred writs, any summoning is false. Though one may exhaust the mind in earnest devotion, no response will be granted. Should any entity descend, it is likely a demonic trial. The recipient must adhere to the statutes of the Mysterious Capital, presenting three plain silks measured by the year’s length to the scripture master, memorizing them in the void of the mind without committing them to writing, lest gods, spirits, birds, or beasts steal a glimpse and leak these profound mysteries.

**Vacuous Sovereign Talisman for the Descent of Perfected Ones**
**Vacuous Sovereign Talisman for the Summoning of Spirits**

The adept must submit a memorial to the Primordial August True King, swearing an oath to request the descent of these two talismans, for they are the pivotal essence of the *Numinous Treasure* tradition. When employing these grand methods to benefit the primordial and commune with the divine, purify the left hand, ensuring it is free from all defilement. Form the Mudra of the Five Peaks, draw the *qi* of the five directions, and blow it into the left hand, allowing pure boys, pure girls, good men, and good women to also blow *qi* into the hand. Perform three blows and three presses; if the left hand appears azure or verdant, one may enter the sacred realm. Other hues are unsuitable for entry.

The True Taboo Names and Incantation of the Five Peaks:
*"Hongxing, Mohei, Mozhen, Walà, Lingbao."*
Recite the incantation once, draw the *qi* of the five directions, and blow it onto the mudra, keeping the hand seal unbroken. With the right hand, use two fingers to inscribe the Summoning Talisman for Perfected Ones in the air. Inhale and blow into the left hand, recite the incantation five times, draw the *qi* of the five directions, and blow it toward the altar, instructing adults and children to fix their gaze and observe the adept’s right hand, then have them all blow *qi*. Recite the incantation again, draw the *qi* of the five directions, swallow it, and press it down. Then bid the observers open their eyes and look into their own palms; if a verdant hue like the azure heavens appears, the rite may proceed. If not, repeat the procedure among the assembly. Select those who perceive it clearly and in accordance with the method. Once the verdant hue is seen, recite the incantation:
*"Reverently invite the envoys of the Vacuous Sovereign’s Talismans for the Descent of Perfected Ones and the Summoning of Spirits to swiftly bear the talismans and manifest their forms. Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the *Numinous Treasure* statutes!"*
Draw the *qi* of the southeast and blow it into the left hand. Have the observers blow three times. Recite the incantation again, perform three blows and three presses, and bid the observers look again. They will then see two crimson segments on the palm. Invoke the talismans again and blow *qi*; the leftward script of the Descent Talisman and the rightward seal-script of the Summoning Talisman will become distinct. Only then summon the officials of the *Numinous Treasure* to behold the talismans. Once they are clearly seen, instruct the chosen person to fix their gaze upon the officials without blinking. The master should then withdraw the hand, dismissing the officials, who will move to and fro in the void of the Mystery, revealing their true forms. This is the secret method of the *Numinous Treasure* for benefiting the primordial and communing with the divine to enter the sacred realm. It is not recorded in writing but transmitted orally and memorized in the heart; guard it with utmost secrecy.

**Summoning and Descending Perfected Spirits into the Ritual Space**
First, burn incense and wash the hands. Once done, recite the inner taboo names of the Five Peaks and sit in repose. Next, with the right hand, inscribe this vertical flourish upon the altar. Then gather the flourish into the hand, form the Mudra of the Five Peaks in rotation, recite the taboo names of the Five Peaks, and blow the *qi* of the five directions into the hand three times. Again, inscribe the *Taiqing* flourish upon the altar, gather it into the left hand, rotate the Mudra of the Five Peaks, recite the inner taboo names of the Five Peaks, and blow *qi* into the hand. Repeat this three times. Then observe the hand for a verdant hue; if it is not yet verdant, recite the taboo names of the Five Peaks again, draw the *qi* of the five directions, and blow it until the hand appears as azure as the heavens, then cease. Next, invoke the envoys of the Descent and Summoning Talismans:
*"Reverently invite the envoys of the Primordial August’s Descent Talisman and the Jade Emperor’s Summoning Talisman to descend swiftly."*
Draw the *qi* of the northwest and blow it onto the verdant *qi* of the left hand; crimson light will appear on both sides. If not yet visible, invoke the envoys of the Descent and Summoning Talismans again until the crimson hue appears. Then observe the left and right edges of the palm for two talismanic scripts: one vertical seal-script, one horizontal seal-script. If they are not distinct, recite the invocation for the Descent and Summoning Talismans again until they become clear. Then recite the *Numinous Treasure* Incantation for the Gathering of Numinous Winds and Mists:
*"Jade tones gather *qi*, numinous winds assemble mists.
Purple voids luxuriate, aiding the myriad Transcendents.
A thousand harmonies, ten thousand unions, naturally perfected."*
Draw the *qi* of the southeast and blow it; the talismans will stir in unison. If they do not move, recite the incantation and blow again, then summon the youths of the five directions. Recite the incantation:
*"Reverently invite the Azure Numinous Primordial Elder and the Youth Who Initiates the Dao of the East to descend swiftly and manifest their forms. By imperial command, descend swiftly to me; swiftly blow the *qi* of the East!"*
*"Reverently invite the Cinnabar Numinous True Elder and the Youth Who Initiates the Dao of the South to descend swiftly and manifest their forms. By imperial command, descend swiftly to me; swiftly blow the *qi* of the South!"*
*"Reverently invite the Radiant Numinous Yellow Elder and the Youth Who Initiates the Dao of the West to descend swiftly and manifest their forms. By imperial command, descend swiftly to me; swiftly blow the *qi* of the West!"*
*"Reverently invite the Fivefold Numinous Mysterious Elder and the Youth Who Initiates the Dao of the North to descend swiftly and manifest their forms. By imperial command, descend swiftly to me; swiftly blow the *qi* of the North!"*
*"Reverently invite the Yellow Numinous Verdant Elder and the Youth Who Initiates the Dao of the Center to descend swiftly and manifest their forms. By imperial command, descend swiftly to me; swiftly blow the *qi* of the Above!"*
Once one direction’s envoy is seen, summon the next without overlap or simultaneous invocation. After blowing *qi*, if the shadow is distinct, recite the incantation and blow upon the clothing to clarify the vision.

Then examine their countenances closely, taking care not to mistake one for another, and proceed with meticulous attention. Once the Youth has manifested, summon the Six Ding Jade Maidens, reciting the *Tongguang Daming* Divine Incantation to invoke the Six Ding and Six Jia Jade Maidens to appear "in adult form." Fix your gaze single-mindedly upon the Jade Maidens’ forms.

The master withdraws his hands into his sleeves and recites the *Tongguang Daming* Divine Incantation:
*"Red apricot, Mao script; ink-black, Kan script; grinding true, Dui script; stocking-wax, Gao script; Numinous Treasure, central finger’s central script. Flourishing life turns to Yin script; solitary servant shifts to Mao script; Ke Han illuminates Chen script; merit complete in Si script; sharp corner corrects Wu atop, then moves to the central finger’s central script—insert firmly, gather souls and seize."*

With the right hand, form the mudra in sequence with the left, reciting the incantation as the mudra is made. Draw the *qi* of the Three Paths of Heaven, Earth, and Humanity, and blow it into the mirror. Recite the incantation again:
*"Merit gathers souls, summoning the swift messengers of the Eight Directions, celestial deities and earthly spirits, the myriad numina united as one by the Celestial Emperor’s decree. United Bright Celestial Emperor, Sun; United Bright Celestial Emperor, Sun. Swiftly reveal, swiftly reveal! □li □li, embed and fall, embed and fall! Embed and fall, swiftly come, swiftly come!"*

Draw the *qi* of the Eight Directions, blow it upon the mirror with the mudra, and summon the Six Ding and Six Jia Jade Maidens to swiftly manifest within the mirror. The incantation reads:
*"Reverently invite the Left-Flying Right-Numinous: Jiazi Jade Maiden, Jiaxu Jade Maiden, Jiashen Jade Maiden, Jiawu Jade Maiden, Jiachen Jade Maiden, Jiayin Jade Maiden; Dingchou Jade Maiden, Dinghai Jade Maiden, Dingyou Jade Maiden, Dingwei Jade Maiden, Dingsi Jade Maiden, Dingmao Jade Maiden."*

Draw the *qi* of the Five Directions and blow it forth; first the *qi* appears, then the form and shadow, the depth of clothing, and finally the face. If the vision remains indistinct, recite the summoning incantation again and draw *qi* to blow upon it. Only when all this is complete may other immortals and perfected beings be summoned. If the sequence is not followed, the invocation will fail, or if it succeeds, it will be with great difficulty. These Five Emperors, Six Ding, and Six Jia are the ancestors of the myriad *qi*, and thus they are summoned first.

**Summoning the Immortals of the Azure Mystery Palace into the Array**
Reverently invite the Most Compassionate One, the Heavenly Worthy of Salvation from Suffering, who responds to cries and hastens to aid, dwelling in the Hall of Eternal Joy within the Eastern Ultimate Palace. Implore the descent of true *qi* to assist the adept’s vision. Draw the *qi* of the East and blow it forth. Recite the incantation:
*"Reverently invite the Numinous Response Perfected Youth of the Azure Mystery, who ascends and descends with the primordial destiny. Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Heavenly Worthy of the Azure Mystery!"*

Only when the *qi* assumes the hue of the azure heavens may the immortals of the Azure Mystery Palace be summoned one by one, each first manifesting *qi*, then their shadow, followed by their clothing and countenance.

**Summoning the Immortals of the Palace of Great Yin into the Array**
Recite: *"The Celestial Emperor of Great Yin descends. Moon Sovereign Incantation."*

The moon’s essence glows faintly, its fragrance veiled in solitude. Its jade-like emptiness shimmers with numinous radiance, while lush blossoms weave into ornate adornments. □ The golden essence gleams, its luminous visage marking the celestial terrace.

Draw the *qi* of the West from the Palace of Great Yin and blow it forth. Once your hand glows with the brightness of the moon, you may summon the Jade Lads, Jade Maidens, *lingguan* officials, and *gongcao* messengers to observe.

**Summoning the Immortals of the Palace of Great Yang into the Array**
Recite: *"The Celestial Emperor of Great Yang descends. Sun Sovereign Incantation."*

The sun’s soul shines like a pearl, its radiance suffusing emerald hues. Crimson clouds swirl with a youthful glow, while dark flames surge like a whirlwind.

Draw the *qi* of the South and blow it forth. Upon completing the incantation, trace a circle, visualize the sun, recite the spell, and blow the *qi* into your hand. Wait until the light appears like the sun before ceasing. If no manifestation is seen, repeat the incantation until the light appears. Draw the *qi* of the South and blow it again; once the light brightens, summon the Jade Lads, Jade Maidens, and immortal hosts, who will manifest first as *qi*, then as shadows, followed by their clothing and countenance.

**Summoning the Immortals of the Seven Stars Palace into the Array**
Reverently invite □□□□□□□, the Numinous Lad of the Northern Dipper, whose single call elicits a hundred responses. *Mao* aligns with *Dui*, *Xu* with *Chen*, elevated in *Kun*.

Flick the Dipper upon the mirror, draw the *qi* of the North, and blow it forth. Cease only when the Seven Stars manifest. If they do not appear, recite the incantation and blow again until they are seen. Should even one star be absent, divine only one matter of fortune or misfortune. If the patient’s life-star is unseen, it portends great ill. Only when all seven stars are present may the celestial generals and officials of the Northern Dipper be summoned, who will first appear as *qi*, then as shadows, followed by their clothing and countenance.

**Summoning the Immortals of the Transmutative Quiescence Palace into the Array**
First recite the taboo names of the Five Emperors, summon the Jade Lads of the Four Directions, and the Six Dings and Six Jias. Then recite the Transmutative Quiescence Incantation:

*"Within the cavern’s profound void, the vast origin shines resplendent.
The mighty spirits of the eight directions render me naturally empowered.
By the talisman and mandate of the Numinous Treasure, I proclaim to the Nine Heavens.
Qianluo Danna, the Dipper’s might pervades the Great Mystery.
Slay demons, bind evil, annihilate ten thousand ghosts.
The Central Mountain’s divine incantation, the Jade Writ of the Primordial Beginning.
As I recite it once, demons retreat and years extend.
Marching through the Five Peaks, the Eight Seas heed my call.
The Demon Kings bow their heads, guarding my hall.
Banish defilement, let the Dao’s *qi* endure eternally.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the statutes and ordinances!"*

Draw the *qi* of the North and blow it forth. Immediately, towers, terraces, palaces, and halls will appear. First, *qi* manifests, then form and shadow, after which you may summon the Jade Lads, Jade Maidens, officials, and lords of the Divine Empyrean Jade Palace’s immortal hosts.

**Incantation for Summoning the Immortals of the Capital of Numinous Descent**
*"The celestial script spreads wide, gazing down upon the Grand Tenuity.
Mysterious transformations bring forth creation, as ninefold mists swirl.
Eight luminaries encircle six circuits, upheld by the Yellow Cycle’s sway.
I now make my great vow, unlocking heaven’s mechanism.
The Dragon Han era flows boundlessly, infinite and without end.
I proclaim to the Three Realms, borne swiftly by dragons and winds."*

For any summoning of the Jade Palace’s immortals, Jade Lads, Jade Maidens, generals, officials, or *gongcao* messengers, first offer incense thrice, recite the incantation three times, then proceed with the specific summoning incantation. From the Attendant of the Golden Portals to the True Lords of the Three Origins, to the Right Hall’s generals, summon them according to their respective offices and inquire of them.

Knock your teeth together three or four times, burn the talisman of the summoned immortal before the incense burner, and form the Jade Clarity mudra with both hands.

**Incantation for Summoning the Divine Empyrean Immortals**
*"Divine Empyrean, Jade Clarity, the True King who presides.
Civil and martial immortals of the Eastern and Western Flowery Terraces.
Robed in cloud-brocade and jade, adorned with jade pendants and golden bells.
Crimson slippers and jeweled crowns, bearing seals and insignia.
I now summon and invite you to swiftly descend upon the altar.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the statutes and ordinances of the Divine Empyrean Jade Clarity True King!"*

Recite this incantation once, draw the *qi* of the Divine Empyrean from the Southeast, and blow it into the purified altar or mirror, summoning as the occasion demands.

*"Reverently invite [Name] Immortal Official to descend swiftly.
By imperial decree, you may not tarry.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the statutes and ordinances of the Divine Empyrean True King!"*

If one faces calamity, summon the Lord of Calamity’s Resolution. For extending lifespan, summon the Lord of Longevity. To inquire of fate and fortune, summon the Lords of Life and Record. For ritual offerings, summon the Left and Right Lords of Lingering Splendor. Summon according to the matter at hand, focusing your gaze to the left and right, and burn the talisman of the summoned immortal in the incense burner.

**Incantation for Summoning the Jade Lads**

**Jade Clarity Regulations state:**
After a ninety-day retreat, summon and descend the immortal spirits to the Jade Clarity Bureau, using the southeastern qi.
When the numinous spirits descend, one may vaguely sense their presence.

If they are lost, they will not arrive; three losses result in permanent loss.
Those without golden bones and jade countenance must yearn for the Dao as a thirsty infant craves its mother’s milk, relinquish wealth as a hundred snakes shed their skin—
this must never be transmitted to those of superficial interest or the unlearned.

**The Supreme Chapter on the Primal Jade Tablets**

The Perfected Sovereign says: The nine grades of texts from the Three Caverns of Supreme Purity are divided into four auxiliary sections. Only the *Jade Stairs of the Numinous Treasure* retains the residual divine chapters, which prioritize the salvation of the dead and the deliverance of the living. Those in the Lower Realm who study the true Way often begin with diligence but end in laxity, for their dust-bound roots obscure their understanding. The six wisdoms remain unopened, and they are deluded by the six heavens’ demons. The four perverse influences arise wantonly, manifesting in all manner of transformations, yet they cannot achieve penetrating clarity. Thus, among the texts of the Three Caverns, the highest is called *Cavern of Perfection*. For the ordinary practitioner, the Cavern of Perfection unites form and spirit, allowing the eyes to behold the Perfected Ones, merging with the Dao in perfect accord. As for the middle and lower caverns—*Cavern of Mystery* and *Cavern of Divinity*—they are the origin of the ten thousand methods and the root of the six penetrations. Therefore, the Heavenly Worthy verifies the Dao with the *Eye of Wisdom* and the *Eye of Truth*, while the Perfected Ones stabilize the *Dharma Eye* and the *Eye of Compassion*. Radiating their gaze across the Three Realms, they perceive all as if held in the palm of their hand. The celestial Perfected command the methods, having first illuminated inner vision; externally, they cultivate cavernous vision to manifest the eye of Dao-wisdom. With cavernous sight, penetrating vision, and distant observation, they embody the compassionate gaze of the Dharma—this is called the Three Caverns. In studying the *Cavern of Perfection*, one must first perceive the Perfected Ones with cavernous sight before attaining perfection. As for the *Cavern of Divinity*, one must behold the divine Perfected with the eyes before achieving communion with the divine and becoming a spirit-immortal.

Among the ten thousand methods of the Three Caverns, none do not first require the Three Caverns to be self-illuminated before one may commune with the divine and invite the descent of numinous spirits. As for the *Cavern of Divinity*, *Cavern of Depth*, *Cavern of Numinosity*, *Great Cavern*, the eight scribes, the six ding-spirits, the six jia-spirits of *Numinous Flight*, and *Luminous Cavern Vision*—all establish the Way of penetrating sight. If male practitioners indulge in lust or female practitioners succumb to perversity, their six roots remain impure, depleting and losing their true primal qi. How then can they achieve cavernous sight of the true or the divine? Those of pure yang will not conceal the spirit-immortals, while those of pure yin will manifest ghosts and spirits.

This is the secret transmission of the *Jade Tablet* from the Primal Perfected Ancestor. When the ancestor of the Three Caverns cultivates it, after a hundred days, they attain communion with the divine and the numinous; after a thousand days, the true immortals manifest their traces. Seeing them, one may command their service and summon the celestial Perfected. When merit is complete and virtue aligns, one ascends in broad daylight. In summoning the Perfected and observing the divine through the Three Caverns, without this *Jade Tablet*, all efforts are in vain, and one will never achieve penetrating clarity. It was never transmitted to the lower world. Yet with the spread of the Numinous Treasure teachings, demonic and perverse influences emerged from the shadows, and by means of this cavernous vision, they could no longer conceal their forms or escape delusion.

The *Jade Tablet* of the Daoist contains the hidden names of the highest Perfected. When used according to the method, one attains perfection in a set number of days. The recipient must choose a day of the Three Primes, the eight nodes, or the ten auspicious days, presenting two jade tablets, nine taels of gold, a thousand feet of white silk, and a sincerity offering of one hundred twenty strings of cash to swear the oath before the Three Officials and receive it from the master. If one fails to uphold the oath and recklessly divulges the celestial treasure, the master will suffer the trial of the wind-blade. If the disciple cultivates it without success, their lifespan will be reduced by a hundred and twenty years.

Those who dwell in cold hermitages must discern the right person and not be swayed by greed. To leak this is contrary to the Dao, and the penalty is the same. The *Five Precepts of Cavernous Vision in the Numinous Treasure*:

The Three Caverns, four auxiliaries, hundreds of thousands of scrolls, scriptures of the Dao and the divine—countless millions of characters—all take cavernous vision as their foundation. In the highest, the *Cavern of Perfection* descends the true, and one becomes Perfected. In the middle, the *Cavern of Mystery* descends the mysterious, and one becomes an immortal. In the lowest, the *Cavern of Divinity* descends the divine, and one attains the Dao. In cultivating the Way of cavernous vision, one must first clarify the Five Precepts:

1. **Fasting and single-minded devotion**: When the spirit descends into the body, if one is not fasting and single-minded, one will incur divine retribution.
2. **Purity of body and mind**: With purity of body and mind, the spirit’s light achieves penetrating vision. Without purity, defiled qi will assail and cloud the spirit’s radiance.
3. **Consistency from beginning to end**: Maintaining consistency ensures the swift manifestation of spiritual efficacy. Without it, wondrous responses will be difficult to achieve.
4. **Serenity of spirit and harmony of qi**: When spirit is serene and qi harmonious, one summons the true and meets the numinous. Without serenity, anger drives the spirit far away.
5. **Secrecy in cultivation**: Never leak the hidden mechanisms. To do so invites divine censure.

In practicing this method, one must strictly adhere to the Five Precepts. Additionally, one should choose the days before or after the winter solstice—*wuchen*, *wuxu*, *jiazi*, or *jiawu*—to commence cavernous vision. Without following the proper form, cavernous vision will be difficult to achieve. One must be sincere, upright, and pure in body and mind, abstaining from meat, impurity, intoxication, and lust. Only then may one proceed, first swallowing the talismanic tablets. When true qi enters the body, it washes away the mundane defilements, refining yin into yang, and the true immortals will manifest without concealment.

**Heavenly Qi Talisman**

Incantation:
*"Qian, the Creative, is strong and steadfast; the sun and moon align with me.
I receive the celestial qi to govern my body and expel toxins, refining both within and without.
Internally, it dispels the hundred ailments; externally, it gathers and subdues the hundred spirits.

Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law!"*

For this method, on the first day of each month at the second watch of dawn, clench both fists, face east, and take three *ding*-trigram steps. Hold the breath, clench the hands, and recite the incantation. Then, gaze eastward, raise the head to the heavens, and draw in celestial qi nine times. Recite the incantation once more. Three times for the south, seven for the west, five for the north, and twelve for the center. After five days, one may use it freely.

*(Pronounced "Lei")*

Consume my talisman and attain enduring growth.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law!"*

For this method, on the days of *chen*, *xu*, *chou*, or *wei*, face the direction of the earth’s gate. Visualize earthly qi surging forth ten thousand leagues, then draw it into the spleen with the mouth. Recite the following prayer:

Your servant respectfully petitions."*
After the prayer, draw ten breaths of qi into the spleen.

**Six Jia Martial Qi Talismans**
Swallow six characters daily to summon the Martial Qi.

Recite the invocation:
*Jiazi: Wang Wenqing, attended by eighteen officials. Talisman clerks: Heavenly Seasonal Spirit-General bearing light, Jade Maiden Moonlight, Decade Clerk Yin’e Lord.*
*Jiaxu: Zhan Zijiang, attended by fourteen officials. Talisman clerks: Heavenly Yin Spirit-General Qionglong, Jade Maiden Denggu, Decade Clerk Zhang Bulin.*
*Jiashen: Hu Wenchang, attended by sixteen officials. Talisman clerks: Heavenly Walk Spirit-General Supervising Soldiers, Jade Maiden Kaiming, Decade Clerk Chen Zisi.*
*Jiawu: Wei Shangqing, attended by eighteen officials. Talisman clerks: Heavenly Recompense Spirit-General Lingguang, Jade Maiden Han, Decade Clerk Du Chujun.*
*Jiachen: Meng Feiqing, attended by fourteen officials. Talisman clerks: Heavenly Male Spirit-General Heavenly Bird, Jade Maiden Yingtai, Decade Clerk Gongsun Dajun.*
*Jiayin: Ming Wenzhang, attended by sixteen officials. Talisman clerks: Heavenly Gaze Spirit-General Mengzhang, Jade Maiden Dengzhi, Decade Clerk Xu Junwang.*

*I now activate the talisman—you, as the spirits of this day, shall serve as my messengers. Don your embroidered caps and enter the Gate of No Doors. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with statutes and ordinances!*

This method requires swallowing the Six Jia talismans at dawn, then proceeding to their respective directions—within sixty paces, beyond ten. Gather wood from the corresponding direction, whether trunk or branch. With the right hand, grasp the wood; with the left, break off half, leaving the other half on the ground. Clasp the fallen grass in the left hand’s middle knuckle. Avoid contact with women, entering chambers, or the western direction. Visualize the Jia spirit-general and jade maiden standing before you.

Recite the incantation:
*Six Jia, nine configurations,
Heaven round, earth square.
Four directions, five phases—
Azure, crimson, white, yellow.
Grand Unity as master,
Sun and moon as light.
Yu governs the Dao,
Chiyou repels weapons.
Green Dragon flanks the hub,
White Tiger guards the rear.
Mars leads the van,
Dispelling inauspicious omens.
Northern Dipper executes judgment,
Eradicating misfortune and calamity.
Five spirits guide me,
Roaming the eight directions.
Penetrating vision unobstructed,
Piercing sight in all quarters.
Those who oppose me perish,
Those who turn from me die.
Those who hate me
Shall suffer their own retribution.
Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with statutes and ordinances!*

For the right (western) direction, draw qi through the nose into the kidneys. By day, visualize it emerging to follow the *wei* (defensive qi); by night, visualize it entering the kidneys. Change once every ten-day cycle, following the six Jia as in spring.

Recite the incantation:
*In spring, the Jia resides in heaven,
Above corresponding to celestial mystery.
Light and pure, it attaches to qi,
Yellow Dao, golden origin.
In summer, the Jia resides in the Tiger,
Scattering to fill the Astral Tower.
Numinous chart, great edifice,
Power of the eight directions.
In autumn, the Jia resides on earth,
Below corresponding to the nine springs.
Qi of generation and completion,
Assisting my three fields.
In winter, the Jia resides in yang,
Qi filling the Dipper and Ox.
Circumpolar constellations,
Aiding my field and sprouts.*

For the six Jia days at dawn, face the Jia direction. First form the Five Peaks mudra, recite the *Kuigang*, *Zheyuan*, and *Tianzhen* incantations three times. Then, according to the Jia direction, inhale qi once, swish it in the mouth, and swallow thirty-six times, dividing it into three gulps to reach the cinnabar field. Next, click the teeth thirty-six times, sit facing the Jia direction, fully extend both legs and arms, then clasp the hands and place them on the head, straightening the arms. Perform the crane’s peck three times, sway the two passes eighteen times. Evenly distribute the "water" atop the head, as if drawing in waves, guiding it down to below the navel. Swallow qi once, then place the talisman on the tongue, recite the incantation as before, and swallow it with saliva. Cease thereafter.

After practicing:
- First Jia: metal essence solidifies.
- Second Jia: meridians flow freely.
- Third Jia: metal essence congeals like red jade.
- Fourth Jia: all spirits guard steadfastly.
- Fifth Jia: five spirits protect.
- Sixth Jia: cinnabar field crystallizes into treasure.
Only then may one rise from seclusion. If one violates desires and cravings, all prior efforts are instantly forfeited.

**Six Ding Gentle Qi Talismans**
On the right day, swallow the six characters to summon gentle qi.

Recite the prayer:
*Ding-mao Jade Maiden, Wenbo benevolent and noble.
Ding-chou Jade Maiden, Wengao benevolent and honored.
Ding-hai Jade Maiden, Wentong benevolent and reverent.
Ding-you Jade Maiden, Wenqing benevolent and respectful.
Ding-wei Jade Maiden, Wenzhi benevolent and harmonious.
Ding-si Jade Maiden, Juqing benevolent and accomplished.
Those who know the six Ding
Move in and out of darkness unseen.
Neither lacking nor startled,
Preserved for a thousand years,
Unshaken for ten thousand.
Heaven and earth share their repose,
Eon upon eon, everlasting life.
Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with statutes and ordinances!*

On the six Ding days at dawn, swallow the talisman, recite the incantation, draw qi from the corresponding direction, and blow it onto the body. Proceed in that direction, walking within sixty steps but beyond twelve. With the left hand, take a blade of grass; with the right, break it. Do not look back. Return to the chamber, place the grass in the corresponding direction, and visualize the Jade Maiden’s form. Offer incense.

Recite the prayer:
*Reverently, precious incense,
Ascends to the six Ding.
The former master made a pact,
Granting me this divine method.
I bow and offer fine incense,
Deer jerky, honeyed broth.
Giant jujubes, plump and sweet,
Heaven’s green ants, fragrant matured nectar.
Butter cakes, pure fruits,
Luminous lamps and candles.
With equal devotion, I kowtow,
Summoning the divine kings.
May my masters and friends
Command bodies like vajra,
Prolong life and increase destiny,
Everlasting joy without end.
May my entire household,
Attain great fortune and prosperity.
Though high, not imperiled;
Demon toxins perish.
Malevolent spirits and specters
Flee to distant lands.
Enemies and the jealous
Cower and hide.
What I seek, I obtain;
All affairs flourish.
