**Talisman for Piercing Vision and Washing the Eyes**
**Talisman for Piercing Hearing and Washing the Ears**
**Talisman for the Spirit of Hearing and Vision**
Write in cinnabar by lamplight, place in a basin of pure water, and wash the eyes—at night, all ghosts and spirits will be seen.
Wash the ears to hear the voices of ghosts and spirits.
Without washing the ears and eyes with this talisman, the efficacy of other talismans will be difficult to verify, and ghosts and spirits will not be seen.
This talisman’s wonders are beyond words.

*Incantation:*
Heaven is my father, Earth is my mother.
The sun is my elder brother, the moon is my elder sister.
The *Taiyi* is my friend, and all ghosts and spirits are those I command.
Now I pierce all vision, as I decree.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the statutes and ordinances.

**Piercing Vision Urgent Method**
The Azure Lad receives the mandate and descends the decree to me.
Swiftly, swiftly, grant me the power to communicate with spirits and pierce all vision.
For divining people and objects, respond to the numinous and summon.
Face east, visualize the Azure Lad holding the Yellow Decree descending into the water, recite the incantation nine times and blow nine times.

**Another Urgent Method**
Visualize within the left eye a figure resembling an emperor, clad in azure robes.
Within the right eye, a figure like an empress, also clad in azure.
Visualize them standing within the eyes.

*Incantation:*
Azure Thearch and Queen Mother, divine light pierces all vision.
Externally, the ten thousand spirits are seen; internally, the viscera are observed.
Upon concluding the prayer, visualize them entering the two breasts.

**Another Urgent Method**
Each day, ingest the Thirty-Two Heavenly Jade Characters, and morning and evening recite one scroll of the *Huangting Jing*.
Furthermore, in a pure chamber, with both hands knead the four corners of the eyes, causing the circular light to emanate nine times.

*Incantation:*
Circular light disperses, crimson, azure, and purple clouds.
The Three *Qi* linger, protecting your eye roots.
Piercing the vision of the hundred spirits, penetrating the sight of the ten thousand gods.
The lads within the eyes clearly see the worthy perfected.
If there is communion with the numinous, ascend together to *Shangqing*.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the statutes and ordinances.
Upon concluding the incantation, press the palms to the eyes.

**Ritual Concluding Mudra**
Enter the formation.

**On Stabilizing the Breath and Entering the Chamber**
"Stabilizing the breath" means to enter the chamber in quiescence. "Sitting" refers to one’s own seating before a desk. Place a mirror before the face. Upon the altar, suspend a mirror; before the face, set water. The yang spirit resides in the mirror, the yin spirit in the water. O Numinous Treasure Perfected, reverently summon such-and-such spirit—herein, swiftly manifest your form.

**Lineage Masters of the Numinous Treasure Great Method**
Numinous Treasure Inheritor of the Void Perfected Lord Tian Jun, Numinous Treasure Perfected Lord Lu Shangzhen, Supreme Clarity Wondrous Conduct Perfected.

**Summons-Realms Talisman Within the Formation Must Be Personally Inscribed**
**Numinous Treasure Penetrating Vision Formation Talisman**
Now invoke the celestial offices, divine officials, numinous palaces, golden lads and jade maidens, merit-generals, messengers, clerks, and soldiers—all true sovereigns within the registers of this method. Await the audience of this ministry’s perfected ones; having dismissed their ranks and duties, let them stand within this pure chamber, heeding the summons. May each manifest their form with perfect clarity, in strict accordance with the statutes of the true ministry.

Use a placard, inscribed on both sides: "Entering the formation today" and "Not entering the formation today." Upon concluding the penetrating vision, immediately strike the teeth nine times and restore the officials.

*Incantation:*
The officials and clerks just summoned,
Return now to your governance.
When next called, arrive at once,
As in former precedent.

Each day, at morning and evening, enter the chamber twice to practice and uphold the penetrating vision.

**Gathering the Spirits in Penetrating Vision**
Face east and sit evenly. With the left hand form the *xu* mudra, strike the teeth twenty-four times, and silently invoke:
Heart spirit Cui Xuan,
Mind spirit Yang Dexing.
Swiftly summon and gather the twenty-four spirits of the three regions and eight luminaries within the body, the five viscera and six bowels, the four limbs and nine orifices, the one thousand two hundred bodily forms, the ten thousand two hundred essences of radiance, the thirty-six thousand spirits of the hair-fine apertures, and all others.
Assemble them within the body, permitting no dispersal or disorder.

Then strike the teeth and silently intone:

The Nine Palaces of the Great Spirit,
the Great One guards the chamber.
The hundred spirits assume their stations,
soul and spirit harmonize their offices.
Long life and enduring vision,
sealing away evil and misfortune.
Swiftly, swiftly, as in the statutes of the Upper Clarity!

If, while practicing penetrating vision of spirits, fear arises, employ this method.

This rite, when observed with purification and ingested, will perfect realization on the appointed day. Cycling without end, one may command and employ the immortals, fulfilling all in purity.

The Dao of the Numinous Treasure comprises three ranks:
Above, the Way of the Imperial Unity’s Returning Wind, bestowed upon the Jade Clarity.
In the middle, the method of the Five Qi’s blending in central harmony, entrusted to the Five Emperors.
Below, the scripture of the Ten Revolutions of Returning Spirit, conferred upon the various perfected.

Beyond these three grades, those who take up the remnants do so to aid the living and deliver the dead as their merit, and to summon the perfected and invoke the numinous as their method.

Those who study the supreme Dao, aspiring to immortality, all begin here.

The Great Rites of the *Numinous Treasure Upper Scripture of Limitless Salvation*, Scroll Fourteen—concluded.
The Great Rites of the *Numinous Treasure Upper Scripture of Limitless Salvation*, Scroll Fifteen.

**The Numinous Treasure Method of Penetrating Vision**

**Internal Practice of Penetrating Vision**
Withdraw the spirit, then on the right, generate thirty-six breaths upward. Inhale, and on yang days, first generate twenty-four breaths on the left. For the numinous spirit, on yin days, reduce twenty-four breaths on the right. Manifest form, then on the left, generate thirty-six breaths downward.

On yang days, first thirty-six breaths form one line, becoming *Qian*. Then twenty-four breaths form one line, transforming into the *Kun* hexagram. On yin days, first twenty-four breaths form one line, becoming *Kun*. Then thirty-six breaths form one line, transforming into the *Qian* hexagram.

Each day, after swallowing the jade talisman, sit upright, regulate the breath, gather the spirit in the *qi*-sea, and draw breath into the cinnabar field. Visualize true *qi* within the kidneys, like red threads, inscribing the four characters of the middle chapter within the cinnabar field. Once complete, apply the fire-phase to nurture it: with the nose, draw the azure *qi* from the heavens into the navel’s depths, shaping it into one yang line, vermilion in hue, and arrange it within the *qi*-sea. Six times, draw azure *qi* to form six yang lines. Then with the nose, draw the yellow *qi* from the heavens into the *qi*-sea, shaping it into one yin line. Again, draw yellow *qi* six times to complete six yin lines, then cease. While drawing *qi* through the nose, silently count the breaths: nine on yang days, six on yin days. Do not be too forceful. Do not swallow the *qi* as it descends; instead, guide it into the six lines.

Once complete, on yang days turn left forty-nine times, on yin days turn right thirty-six times within the *qi*-sea to harmonize the *qi*. After turning, click the teeth nine times and stop. If turbid *qi* or flatulence arises, let it flow naturally; do not suppress it.

**Incantation for the Penetrating Vision Catalyst Method**
*Queen Mother’s immortal [talisman] gathers, Queen Mother’s immortal peach gathers. Queen Mother’s true qi descends; today I consume the immortal [talisman]. Let me reach the eastern household; today I consume the immortal peach. Let me reach the jasper and jade, to behold the Eastern King Father. The King Father commands the Azure Lad; the Azure Lad descends with my decree. The Queen Mother descends with true qi, letting me know fortune and misfortune, granting me penetrating vision to clearly see all ghosts and spirits, transforming without obstruction. King Father’s true qi gathers, Queen Mother’s true qi gathers.*

**Method of Focused Contemplation**
The Eastern King Father wears five-colored robes and a crimson crown; his name is *Wuwei* ("Non-Action"), his style *Jun Jie* ("Lord of Liberation"). To his left is Wang Qiao, to his right Red Pine Master. Dwelling in the sun’s midst, he is called *Jun A* ("Lord Alas"), named *Fuxi*, ancestor of the ten thousand spirits, forebear of the ten thousand *qi*. The Western Queen Mother wears a five-colored cloud-topped chignon; her name is *Ziran* ("Spontaneity"), her style *Jun Si* ("Lord of Reflection"). To her left is the Jade Maiden of the Round Light, to her right the Jade Maiden of Grand Yin, ancestress of the primordial *qi* of the Great Void, forebear of the ten thousand *qi*. This should be practiced constantly.

**Method for Invoking Officials to Open the Eyes**
Repeatedly invoke the Jade Maidens of Weak Water, one thousand four hundred in number, clad in white, to serve as ministers and convey divine visions, discerning fortune and misfortune across ten thousand miles. Next, visualize within stillness five-colored lads, a thousand chariots and ten thousand riders, joyfully entering the eyes. Then recite the incantation:

*The lad of the left eye is named Flying Spirit,
The lad of the right eye is named Morning Infant.
Resplendent as celestial might casting shooting stars,
Radiantly gazing without end, penetrating Jade Clarity.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

After visualizing the lads, click the teeth nine times, recite the incantation nine times, draw in azure *qi*, rinse the mouth with saliva three times, and send it into the liver. With both thumbs, press the *Rijun* ("Sun Lord") mudra against the eyes nine times, then stop.

**The Immortal’s Method of Penetrating Vision**
Three days prior, purify and bathe. At the third watch, when the moon is at its zenith, one must not fail to see the moon. Upon seeing the moon, offer incense and pray:

*On this day of the Three Primes, your servant [Name] respectfully invokes General Zhou, the Grand Yin Lord, the Right Crystal Water Mother, the True Ministers of the Three Heavens, the Envoys of Upper Clarity, the Radiant Illuminators of the Six Pitches, the Moon’s Rear Light-Spreaders, the Dark Cavern Lord, the Sun Illuminator, the Supreme Obscurity Lord, the Inner Perfected of the Three Sovereigns of Upper Clarity, the True August Ones Assisting the Mandate of the Three Heavens, the Primordial August Ones of the Five Luminaries. May the lords and ministers of the registers not dare to harm or injure wantonly. I pray for the opening of the right eye’s penetrating vision, to see the forms of ghosts and spirits, entering as the method directs, infusing great luminosity. From the eye to the brain, from the brain to the eye, coming and going without obstruction, may I fully attain the divine immortals. Today I receive the qi; may my wish be fulfilled.*

After reciting, step back, align with the *ding* trigram, advance three steps, hold the breath, and gaze fixedly at the moonlight. Draw the moon’s radiant *qi* through the nose and swallow it completely, then exhale the *qi* into the hands and rub the eyes. Recite again:

*Revolving winds merge; the dharma master descends with light. The lad gathers.*

After reciting, rub the eyes and chant the incantation six times, then stop. From the day of receiving this method onward, always collect dew in a vessel at dawn to wash the eyes. If no dew is available, ice, frost, or snow may be used.

**For the practice of penetrating vision:**
Press the mudra of your original master, turn once, then press and hold at the corresponding celestial stem of the day. Close the left eye and gaze with the right, fixing the vision without blinking. Avoid seeing corpses or impurities. If unable to avoid a corpse and it is seen, resolve it by writing a vermilion talisman, placing it in water, and washing the eyes.

**Incantation for the Penetrating Vision Gathering Method:**
*Where the sun and moon of heaven and earth shine, the ten thousand spirits manifest their forms.*

First write the two characters *Daoyan* ("Dao Speech"), then recite the above incantation. Next recite [the missing characters], turn left seven times, then draw in breath and blow it into the hands to rub the eyes—most efficacious. When summoning the souls of the deceased, blow onto paper curtains or banners.

**Another Incantation:**
*The pool of the left eye’s divine pearl,
The pool of the right eye’s jade pearl.
I pray for divine talismans and divine water to wash my two eyes,
Making them clear and bright, seeing ten thousand miles afar.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

**Incantation:**
*Heaven opens, earth is obscured;
Ask one, know ten; ask ten, know a hundred.*

**Talisman Incantation:**
*The divine talisman enters the abdomen—
the heart opens, the mind is enlightened,
ears and eyes grow keen and bright.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

Burn the talisman to ash and swallow it with pure water. Visualize the qi of the northeast. **Another Method: The Jade-Character Visualization for Penetrating Vision**

Enter stillness, knock the teeth nine times, and sit to regulate the breath for eighty-one cycles. When the breath is even, visualize the Primordial Celestial Venerable, the Supreme Dao Lord, and the Supreme Old Lord seated upon the divine tortoise at the center of the kidneys, with the Queen Mother and the Ding-Jia spirits in attendance. The cinnabar of the heart shines like the sun.

Then, in accordance with the scripture, visualize the body seated amidst clouds of blue, yellow, and white qi, dense and luxuriant within and without. The Upper Cinnabar Field is blue, the Middle Cinnabar Field is yellow, and the Lower Cinnabar Field is white—both inner and outer like fortified walls, merging with the chamber of the body.

Visualize the Azure Dragon emerging from the liver to stand on the left, the White Tiger from the lungs to stand on the right, the Vermilion Bird from the heart to stand in front, and the Dark Warrior from the kidneys to stand behind. Six lions emerge from the back of the heart, and six white cranes from the crown, arrayed on either side, their radiance like rainbows, illuminating the ten directions. The sun and moon shine brightly, suffusing the chamber with light.

Visualize the sun and moon emerging from the two eyes, their brilliance illuminating the room. A circular image arises from the crown, its light reflecting in all directions. The radiance of the sun and moon streams forth from the Great Power in two paths, merging above into a perfect sphere of luminous color.

Next, visualize the thirty-two celestial palaces of the four directions, with jade halls and golden towers suspended in five-colored clouds. Within the palaces, envision the Celestial Emperors in crimson robes and imperial crowns, seated in solemn dignity.

When this vision is clear, begin from the Heaven of Boundless August, knocking the teeth once and bowing with utmost reverence. Then recite the secret incantation:

*Supreme Mysterious Origin, Supreme Dao Lord—
Summon forth from within my body the Three and Five Merit Officers,
the Attendant Messengers of the Left and Right,
the Golden Lads who tend the incense,
the Jade Maidens who scatter flowers,
the Direct Talismans of the Five Emperors,
and the Incense Officials of the Day—
thirty-two each—
to come forth and transmit my words.
Today is an auspicious day,
a day of prolonged purity and reverence in the hall of cultivation,
as I practice this scripture to deliver boundless beings.
I, your servant, seek penetrating vision of the ten thousand spirits,
unobstructed sight of gods and ghosts,
that my entreaties may ascend directly
to the august presence of the Primordial Celestial Venerable,
Supreme Lord of the Thirty-Two Heavens.*

When finished, draw with the nose the qi of the Eight Heavens of the East into the liver, the Eight Heavens of the West into the lungs, the Eight Heavens of the South into the heart, and the Eight Heavens of the North into the kidneys. Then observe the day’s earthly branch, face the celestial position of the corresponding direction, and sit as though in conjunction with the day.

Recite the incantation:

*Silent, silent—unto the ultimate Source,
Vastly towering, aeons high in the Void.
Profound and open, the scripture of the Mysterious Cavern—
Who can fathom its hidden depths?
Once entered upon the Great Vehicle’s path,
Who reckons the kalpas’ span?
Neither born nor extinguished,
Yet born through the lotus’s cause.
Transcending the Three Realms’ bonds,
With compassionate heart, the world’s snares are undone.
The Perfected, of supreme virtue,
Generation upon generation, become immortals’ kin.*

Recite again:

*Cloud-script of the Great Void,
Realm of the boundless kalpa.
Now distant, now near,
Now sinking, now floating.
Wandering the Five Directions,
Beyond a zhang’s reach.
The Celestial Perfected, the August One,
Takes brush in hand to inscribe.
Expounding the Cavern’s chapters,
Next writing the numinous talismans.
The Primordial Descends,
The True Writ unfurls.
Luminous—it exists;
Obscure—it is not.
Stagnation dissolves of itself,
Worldly toil may be buoyed.
The hidden and manifest shall emerge,
Thereby ascending the Immortals’ capital.
Those who utter this vow,
Humbly seek penetrating vision of the ten thousand spirits,
Unobstructed sight of gods and ghosts,
Universal deliverance without end,
Salvation of the dark and unseen.*

Recite the Jade Tablet once, swallow the Hidden Taboo once more, then visualize the qi of the corresponding heaven’s color, billowing and swirling. Next, behold the Heavenly Emperor, whose mouth emits a beam of the same-colored light, merging with the qi in a single stream that descends to pour through the crown of the head. In succession, it fills the seven orifices and suffuses the entire body. After a long while, look up toward the celestial direction—there, the eight vermilion characters of the corresponding heaven appear, radiant in the void.

Then, with the nose, draw in the Jade Characters: inhale one into the heart, one into the spleen, one into the lungs, one into the liver; with the nose, draw one into the kidneys; with the mouth, inhale one into the Mud Pill Palace, one into the Central Cinnabar Field, and one into the Lower Cinnabar Field—all eight characters complete. Visualize them entering the five viscera and three cinnabar fields, glowing red as firelight. After a long time, suddenly the eyes perceive visions in dreams, and inner sight becomes clear—this is the auspicious sign of penetrating vision. For those of pure conduct, traversing the Eight Heavens daily, or within a single day and night, suffices. Within seven days, one may see the immortals and spirits.

Visualize the three fields and five viscera suffused with five-colored purple light, illuminating the five organs and seven orifices. After completing eight bows, rise and proceed with the method.

The Supreme Lord Lao’s Penetrating Vision Talisman—ingest on a *tiankai* day. Within a year, one may see ten thousand *li*.

**Supreme Lord’s Eight Scribes Penetrating Vision Talisman**
Inscribe in cinnabar on paper, expose to sunlight, and swallow with clear water. Also ingest the talisman by casting it into water, then wash the eyes—gazing afar, one may see a thousand *li*. To the right: ingest the radiance of the shooting star. This method: on a *mao* or *you* day at dawn, face the sun, recite seven times, draw in the sun’s qi, and blow it into water to wash the eyes—forty-nine times. Calm the spirit, close the eyes, sit in stillness, then open them after a short while. Repeat for seven days, and one may see ghosts and spirits. After forty-nine days, one may see celestial beings.

Begin on a *mao* or *you* day, reciting the charmed water seven times each morning. Blow the sun’s qi before the sacred, then have men and women wash fifty times. As before, close the eyes, sit in stillness for a short while, then suddenly open them—one may see celestial beings, ghosts, and spirits. Avoid *xin* days and inauspicious sights.

When finished, conclude the method with the incantation.

The statutes and commands of the Yellow Emperor and Laozi summon the wandering youths and venerable elders. Retrieve the original arrangement, lest the divine mechanism be revealed. Swiftly, swiftly, as the statutes and commands of the Yellow Emperor and Laozi decree.

With the sleeve, recite the incantation and blow upon the eyes; with the sleeve, brush the faces of men and women, then administer maltose soup. This method employs the Seven Stars divine incantation: each day, face the sun and recite forty-nine times, then charm the water to drink and wash the eyes. At night, face the Northern Dipper and recite forty-nine times, then charm the water to drink and wash the eyes. After one hundred days, the divine youths shall tread the Dipper’s steps. At the hours of *zi*, *wu*, *mao*, and *you*, recite seven times each to avert warfare, floods, droughts, comets, and baleful stars, prolong life and attain immortality, slay myriad ghosts, spread qi, and dispel the hundred diseases.

**The Supreme Luminous Divine Talisman**
For all talisman-writing: form the Dipper mudra with the left hand, grasp the brush with the right, and recite the brush incantation:
*"This brush is most efficacious, bestowed upon me by the Heavenly Emperor.
True immortals guard my form, dispelling anomalies and illness.
Grant me long life, as I write talismans and charm water.
Preserve harmony and prosperity. Swiftly, swiftly, as statutes and commands decree."*
Upon completion, draw in the Dipper’s qi through the nose and blow upon the brush, flicking the mudra.
*"By command, by command—single force, pure and direct.
Heaven oversees the head, Earth oversees the feet.
Humans oversee the hands, Bian Que oversees the eyes.
Wherever the divine talisman arrives, the hundred diseases vanish.
Swiftly, swiftly, as statutes and commands decree."*

This talisman specializes in treating all eye ailments in men and women, greatly enhancing vision and clarity. On the four *li* days, or the four beginnings of *yin*, *shen*, *si*, and *hai*, the first day of the lunar month, *jiazi* days, *gengshen* days, or one’s own life-destiny day, burn incense facing the kingly direction (east in spring, north in winter). Write in vermilion as per the previous method, without limit—more is better. Each day before use, place one talisman into a bowl of pure water, soak, and wash both eyes. Recite the talisman-immersion incantation:
*"The left eye is the Pool of Divine Pearls; the right eye is the Pool of Jade Pearls.
Now, with this divine talisman immersed in water, I wash my eyes.
May they become clear and bright, seeing ten thousand miles afar.
Swiftly, swiftly, as statutes and commands decree."*
Upon completion, stir with a stick. Before washing the eyes, recite:
*"The sun rises in the east, lush and golden.
The divine talisman transforms the water, washing eye pains and sores.
As the pernicious qi of the people scatters, turbid qi vanishes.
By the divine talisman’s dharma-water, the eyes gain radiance.
Swiftly, swiftly, as statutes and commands decree."*

**The Method for Sacrificing to Wells to Dispel Malevolent Qi (Proven Efficacy)**
On the Three Assemblies, *jiazi* or *gengshen* days, the Three Origins, or the Eight Festivals, prepare ten cups each of cypress broth, tea, and wine, along with seasonal fruits, rare flowers, incense, and lamps, arranging them on a mat. Offer incense, tread the Dipper, transform the spirit, face the well, and recite the incantation while absorbing the qi of the daily direction and blowing it into the well:
*"I, the minor adept [name], humbly offer sacrifice to the great deities within the well, the well’s youths, the well’s divine generals, the well’s numinous qi, the well’s straight guardians, and all spirits of the well.
I rely on the well’s divine qi of the earth’s springs to ingest, wash, and cleanse my viscera, purging filth and turbidity, washing away the accumulated dust and grime from my ears and eyes.
Water embodies divine efficacy; upon success, we shall share the reward. I dare not betray this vow."*
Knock the teeth three times, recite the well-seizing incantation one hundred times, and form the *xu* and *hai* mudras. The incantation:
*"The frigid waters of the vast pool flow clear and deep.
Qi spreads boundlessly, birthing myriad paths of light.
The springs of the five directions circulate without cease.
By the Emperor’s decree, all realms submit.
Whoever dares defile this shall be punished by fire and bell.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Azure Mystery’s command decrees."*

**Treading the Dipper to Encircle the Well and Suppress Evil**
Align as the Celestial Pivot: *zi* corresponds to the well’s *wu*, *wu* to the well’s *zi*, and so forth. Transform the spirit, tread the Dipper, and leap the Seven Stars into the well, visualizing the trodden stars flowing into it. Tread the Dipper as usual. Afterward, inscribe the *zi*, *wu*, *mao*, and *you* talismans on peachwood boards and nail them at the well’s four sides to establish boundaries, preventing ghostly qi from clashing with the well’s qi. Thus, the water becomes easily clear, pure, and luminous—scholars should study this deeply.

**The True Well-Suppressing Talismans**
- **Northern Earth Talisman**: Blow northern qi, form the *zi* mudra.
- **Southern Earth Talisman**: Blow southern qi, form the *wu* mudra.
- **Eastern Earth Talisman**: Blow eastern qi, form the *mao* mudra.
- **Western Earth Talisman**: Blow western qi, form the *you* mudra.

**The Method for Crafting and Sacrificing to Mirrors**
To craft a mirror: cut a round mirror from paper. Then, obtain two ancient mirrors—one yin, one yang—and place them in a case on either side, ensuring no filth remains. Offer incense, flowers, wine, and fruit in sacrifice. Recite the mirror-seizing incantation and pray:
*"I, the minor adept [name], humbly offer sacrifice to the numinous deities within this mirror, the mirror’s numinous qi, the mirror’s straight guardians, and all spirits of the mirror.
I have received the Supreme Mystery’s Primordial Treasure Mirror, penetrating yin and yang, darkness and light, revealing gods, spirits, ghosts, and demons, seeking divine communion.
Today, I sacrifice to you, divine spirits. May you grant me eyes that see clearly and ears that hear keenly, with vision and hearing penetrating all, perceiving the unfathomable mechanisms of yin and yang.
Upon success, we shall share the reward. I shall never betray this vow. Divine spirits, heed my plea."*
Knock the teeth three times and recite the mirror-seizing incantation one hundred times. Form the Jade Emperor mudra and recite:
*"The Supreme Mystery’s Sovereign refines qi to clarity.
The Yellow Emperor and Laozi forged it, empowered by the Supreme.
It reveals ghosts and gods, penetrating the hidden and obscure.
Spirits cannot conceal their qi; ghosts cannot escape their forms.
Where the thousand harmonies align, the hundred demons converge.
Whoever dares remain unseen shall be obliterated without trace.
Those who should appear must do so swiftly, disobeying none.
Spirits within the mirror, numinous guardians of the mirror,
On the day of shared success, ascend together to the Upper Clarity.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Upper Clarity’s statutes and commands decree."*

The adept selects an auspicious day for artisans to carve the **Numinous Treasure Grand Dharma Bureau Seal**, the **Three Heavens Supreme Seal**, the **Three Heavens Petition-Unifying Seal**, the **Nine Numinous Petition Seal**, and other **Lingbao seals**. **The Unobstructed Perception of the Profound**

Those who study the Way of summoning the true must cultivate distant thought and far-reaching contemplation, inwardly gazing in stillness. Seated in observation without limit, they penetrate the vision of the hidden void.

After three years of dwelling in the hidden void, the center becomes precisely aligned. The true spirits unfold in radiance, foreknowing what has yet to come. They scrutinize the utmost bounds of heaven, illuminating all that is hidden, governing all that is above, and surveying all that is below.

Thus they receive the titles of the Supreme Thearch, bestowed through accumulated resonance—how could one assume such rank at birth?

At dawn, when the light of heaven has yet to divide and the first blue radiance begins to emerge, the adept rubs their hands together until warm, then wipes both eyes—each thirty-seven times. They knock the teeth twenty-four times, then lick and swirl the tongue around the mouth’s interior, above and below, until saliva overflows. They swallow *qi* nine times.

When finished, they cover their entire body with a blanket or robe, settle the body, and lie down in stillness, aligning the center with precision. They ensure inner and outer silence, hearing no sound. Hands cover the ears, eyes close, and inwardly they visualize themselves perceiving events nine myriad *li* to the east—mountains, rivers, earth, colors, grasses, trees, birds, beasts, and the peoples of the Hu—all as if present before them, vivid and distinct.

If the alignment is unsteady, they visualize again. With time, the vision will naturally appear. Once distinct, they hear within their ears the clear ringing of bells and drums. After a long while, they further perceive the immortal officials of the Eastern Marchmount, riding azure dragons and emerald clouds, bearing the Five Sacred Fungi. Twelve jade maidens in flying azure feathered skirts accompany them, carrying blue-essence jade nectar in golden platters, offering it to their body.

Upon seeing the immortal officials, they bow and receive it, then consume it, tasting its sweetness. They wipe their eyes again, swallow *qi* nine times, and continue thus for three years. Their eyes will see events ten thousand *li* away, their ears hear sounds ten thousand *li* distant—all made luminously clear. They will foreknow the fortunes and misfortunes, blessings and calamities, and the span of years yet to come.

The adept’s body will then emanate a wondrous light, penetrating within and without. The method of the true Way is most sublime. It is transmitted mouth to mouth, not committed to writing. The adept must silently uphold and practice it.

The adept then turns their contemplation, as in the method above, to visualize events nine myriad *li* to the south—mountains, rivers, earth, colors, grasses, trees, birds, beasts, and the peoples of the Yue—all as if present before them, vivid and distinct. If the alignment is unsteady, they visualize again. With time, the vision will naturally appear.

Once distinct, they hear within their ears the clamor of a hundred sounds. After a long while, they perceive the immortal officials of the Southern Marchmount, riding cinnabar clouds beneath a vermilion canopy. Twelve jade maidens in flying crimson brocade skirts accompany them, bearing dark-net scarlet fruits in golden platters, offering them to their body.

Upon seeing the immortal officials, they bow and receive it, then consume it, tasting its sourness. They wipe their eyes again, swallow *qi* nine times, and continue thus for three years. Naturally, they will penetrate the vision of the hidden void, their eyes seeing ten thousand *li* beyond, their ears hearing sounds ten thousand *li* distant. With prolonged practice, all becomes luminously clear, and they foreknow the fortunes and misfortunes yet to come. Their body will be suffused with jade-like luster, their face radiant with jade light.

The Way of summoning the true is most sublime. The Thearch transmits it mouth to mouth; it must not be committed to writing.

The adept then turns their contemplation, as in the method above, to visualize events nine myriad *li* to the west—mountains, rivers, earth, colors, grasses, trees, birds, beasts, and the peoples of the Xuan—all as if present before them, vivid and distinct. If the alignment is unsteady, they visualize again. With time, the vision will naturally appear.

Once distinct, they hear within their ears the resonant clamor of gongs and drums. After a long while, they perceive the immortal officials of the Western Marchmount, riding a flying chariot of plain clouds. Twelve jade maidens in flying purple brocade skirts accompany them, bearing golden liquid and cinnabar essence in golden platters.

Upon seeing the immortal officials, they bow and receive it, then consume it, tasting its sweetness. They wipe their eyes, swallow *qi* nine times, and cease. After three years of this, their vision will penetrate all. They will perceive events ten thousand *li* beyond, foreknowing fortunes and misfortunes with luminous clarity. Their face will take on a golden countenance.

The Way of summoning the true must not be committed to writing; it is transmitted mouth to mouth.

The adept then turns their contemplation, as in the method above, to visualize events nine myriad *li* to the north—mountains, rivers, earth, colors, grasses, trees, birds, beasts, and the peoples of the Qiang—all as if present before them, vivid and distinct. If the alignment is unsteady, they visualize again. With time, the vision will naturally appear.

Once distinct, they hear within their ears the clear ringing of bronze bells. After a long while, they perceive the immortal officials of the Northern Marchmount, riding a flying chariot of dark clouds, bearing the Five Sacred Fungi. Twelve jade maidens in flying black brocade skirts accompany them, carrying jade-like nectar and languid sustenance in golden platters, offering it to their body.

Upon seeing the immortal officials, they bow and receive it, then consume it, tasting its bitterness. They wipe their eyes, swallow *qi* nine times, and cease. After three years of this, they will perceive the eight directions with penetrating vision, scrutinizing the hidden and probing the void. Seated, they will see without limit, their body light and luminous, dwelling in the mysterious emptiness.

The Way of summoning the true is most profound and difficult to declare. It is transmitted mouth to mouth; it must not be committed to writing.

Still maintaining the above method of visualization, inwardly perceive your body so clearly that you behold the palaces of the Nine Heavens, the mountains and rivers, forests and trees, flying dragons and running beasts, and the boundless edges of the cloudy horizon. There you meet with the host of perfected beings, conversing with the assembled immortals in perfect clarity. If the vision is not clear, continue the practice until it becomes distinct.

Then you will hear within your ears the sounds of the five tones and chiming jade, as if they could truly be heard. After a long while, you will see the immortal officials of the Central Marchmount, riding a flying chariot drawn by rosy clouds and dragons, accompanied by twelve jade maidens in flying yellow brocade skirts, bearing five-colored floral banners. They carry the Five Sacred Fungi and cinnabar essence in golden platters, offering them to your body.

Upon seeing the immortal officials, bow and receive them, then consume them, tasting their sweetness. Wipe your eyes, swallow *qi* twelve times, and cease. The Way of summoning the perfected to its utmost is a sublime method beyond words. After three years of practice, you will penetrate the hidden and void, clearly perceiving the mysterious darkness, calculating lifespan and fortune. All omens of good and ill will be thoroughly understood within your body, and your face will radiate jade-like light.

It is transmitted mouth to mouth; it must not be committed to writing. Once the visualization of the five directions is complete, rise and sit facing east, knocking the teeth nine times. Recite the prayer:

*"The myriad transformations arise in chaos,
The dark net governs the void.
The turning wheel makes no sound,
Yet revolves through the four directions.
Its radiance flows for ten thousand miles,
Penetrating the empty and boundless.
The Three Clarities’ precious brilliance,
Flying rosy clouds fill the chambers.
The morning essence infuses the dark,
The nine apertures open and flow.
Four convergences, eight reaches,
Abide in emptiness to summon the formless.
Grant me divine wisdom,
To clearly discern good and ill.
I mount the dark chariot,
Green canopy soaring through the dark.
Ascending to the Great Dawn,
I advance to worship the Jade Emperor."*

When the inner visualization of summoning the perfected and penetrating vision is complete, and the celestial rites are observed, the wondrous efficacy of this practice will be immediately evident, surpassing all other methods. Focus your mind solely on the Central Marchmount; after a hundred days of secluded practice, faint signs will begin to appear. After three years, the divine and true will be thoroughly illuminated, nothing obscured, nothing forgotten. This is the rarity of summoning the true from the formless, causing the true to descend.

This Way is subtle and profound, beyond worldly discourse, and thus transmitted only mouth to mouth, never committed to writing. Men value rank and position; I value this Way. Throughout the four seas, I have never heard of anyone exchanging this method for another. This is the root of undying life. Through it, you will foresee the unseen, penetrate the hidden and void, gaze upward into the boundless, and hear clearly for ten thousand miles. Its sublime wonders pervade all marvels under heaven—what could surpass it?

Those who attain it will mount the green canopy, soaring with a dark parasol of rosy clouds, ascending to the imperial abode of the Emperor. Guard this treasure in secrecy. Beware of reckless disclosure, for violating the covenant will bring retribution upon yourself and your nine generations of ancestors, consigning them to endless servitude. Your body will sink into the dark springs, enduring the trials of the Three Officials. Heed this warning well.

Receive the Purple Scripture of the Blazing Light, cultivate the practice of abiding in the true, and master the Way of summoning the perfected and penetrating vision. Always practice in a secluded chamber, free from worldly affairs. In stillness, visualize the lands beyond ten thousand miles in all four directions—the mountains and rivers, forests and trees, marshes and grasses, birds and beasts, peoples of all tribes, the aged and the foreign, all coming to bow before you.

Further visualize the fiery light streaming from your eyes like shooting stars, blazing and radiant, its brilliance filling the ten thousand miles beyond. The mountains and marshes, the Huai and Ji rivers, forests and trees—all dissolve in its light, leaving the heavens pure and bright, free from dust and filth. Your gaze will reach the boundless realm, penetrating all without obstruction, every detail clear and distinct.

Then knock the teeth nine times and recite the prayer while looking upward:

*"The dark light shines within,
Penetrating the boundless.
Subtle vision, far hearing,
The nine portals open wide.
Essence flows in surging streams,
Ten thousand miles made clear.
Seated, I perceive the natural,
Discerning good and ill in reverse.
I mount the flying rosy clouds,
Ascending to the great void."*

Conclude by drawing in *qi* and swallowing saliva seven times. If you cultivate this Way, faint signs will appear within a hundred days. After three years, your eyes will perceive the empty and boundless, seated you will see beyond ten thousand miles, and your ears will hear to the farthest reaches. This is the most sublime Way, not to be transmitted in writing but only mouth to mouth. Those who steal it will be struck by the wind-knife, their souls perishing without rebirth, and their nine generations of ancestors bound to serve as ghostly officials. Beware, beware.

---
*The Supreme Scripture of the Limitless Salvation, Great Method, Scroll Fifteen* concludes.

*The Supreme Scripture of the Limitless Salvation, Great Method, Scroll Sixteen*
**Chapter on Suppressing Demonic Trials**

The Mysterious Master said: When scholars practice penetrating vision, they often encounter disturbances from demonic hosts, leading to the collapse of their efforts. If you see a beautiful immortal consort, do not gaze too long, for they may be officials of the Three Bureaus or the Five Emperors, jade lads and maidens sent to examine your merit. There are also pure and cunning demonic legions that transform to delude you. They may appear as ghosts or monsters, manifesting a hundred kinds of demonic trials to prevent the completion of your great work. Even the obstruction of family and relatives stems from demonic influence, seeking to halt your progress midway.

Constantly recite the *Middle Chapter of the Scripture of the Primordial Beginning* and the *Great Mantra of the Five Heavenly Demon Kings*—from the Demon King of the Azure Heavens to the *Shangqing* litanies of the ranked immortals, as well as the *Hymns of the Three Realms’ Demon Kings*—to suppress demonic trials and prevent wavering resolve. After a hundred days of accumulating a hundred thousand recitations, enter seclusion to practice penetrating vision. First recite the *Divine Mantra of the Golden Portal and the Mysterious Origin Lord*, which destroys ninety kinds of heterodox paths and one hundred eighty kinds of great demonic wisdom. Then summon the Jade Maiden Who Discerns Demons to distinguish truth from falsehood.

Inscribe the *Five Directions’ Demon-Dispelling Talismans* on banners and hold them in the five directions. Only then may you penetrate the hundred spirits and clearly perceive the ten directions. When your merit is complete and your practice fulfilled, your name will be recorded in the Jade Clarity, granting you long life and enduring vision. The heavenly demons will bow in submission, and the myriad spirits will pay homage. The Three Officials will select you for promotion, elevating you to the rank of Perfected.

If you harbor lust, jealousy, or malice, or engage in slander and collusion, if you begin with diligence but end in laziness, gradually abandoning your former efforts, you will be consigned to serve as a ghostly official, bringing calamity upon your nine generations of ancestors. Beware, beware.

The Demon-Dispelling Wisdom Mantra states:

Heaven and Earth’s mixed qi gives rise to all demons and perverse spirits.
Always with the upright Dao, dispel the baleful influences.
First contemplate: no self, no master.
All dharmas are empty, without mutual transformation.
The One True Realm—flying demons and ghosts.
Know their dwelling places, truly know the expedient means.
Through provisional emptiness and existence, the nature of dharma and principle.
Limpid and ever-abiding, without going or coming.
First, know the real; second, know the demonic;
third, eliminate appearances; fourth, discern emptiness.
*Qian,亨,li,zhen*—the perverse cannot encroach upon the upright.
"Those who face battle array themselves before the ranks."
Hasten, hasten, as the Emperor’s law commands!

For this method, first strike the teeth twelve times, then recite silently without regard to repetitions. All demons will instantly generate good thoughts and bow their heads at your seat. If you wish to eradicate them, recite extensively through many repetitions; the demons will flee in disarray, dissolving in accordance with the mantra.

**Purification and Cleansing**
When establishing an oratory for *dongshi* practice, first observe a period of fasting and abstinence. On the appointed day, invite the master to open the oratory and prepare twelve portions of incense, tea, wine, and fruit to offer to the celestial officials of the registers. Only then may you begin the practice. Thereafter, avoid attending funerals, entering birthing chambers, pigsties, battlefields, or execution grounds, and witnessing the slaughter of animals or the mating of livestock. If relatives encounter auspicious or inauspicious events, follow the *Upper Clarity Golden Root Precious Scripture* to refine and deliver their souls, enabling transcendence. Then bathe to purify yourself before re-entering the oratory to continue the practice. If unavoidable circumstances arise and you inadvertently violate the celestial prohibitions or encounter defilement, you must perform penance by suspending practice for twenty-four days. Afterward, bathe and re-enter the oratory to resume the practice. If, during the practice, chickens, dogs, monks, nuns, pregnant women, or defiled persons violate the altar’s sanctity, all prior merit will be forfeited, and the defiler will face annihilation. Should this occur, immediately burn incense, approach the altar, remove your headscarf, kowtow, and slap your cheeks twenty-four times. Then prostrate and recite:

The Ten Directions’ Great Compassionate Savior of Suffering Heavenly Worthy,
The Great One Savior of Suffering Heavenly Worthy,
The Three Sovereigns’ Inner Secret Names—hundreds of repetitions,
and the Purifying Water Mantra to dissolve defilement.

Recite the *Heaven and Earth Purification Mantra*, sprinkle the purifying water, and avert harm to people and things. After three days, you may resume the practice. Each day at dawn, take a bowl of water, recite the mantra, face north to absorb qi, and blow it into the water. Swallow the talisman with the water, then use it to cleanse your body. The mantra states:

The Celestial River pours into the Eastern Well,
The essence of stone and water-mother’s spirit.
The qi of the Five Directions flourishes and waxes,
Congealing into the form of a flowery canopy.
It restrains the hun-soul and governs the seven po,
With a single washing, the Five Turbidities become pure.

**True Talisman for Dissolving Defilement**
Mantra states:
The immortals bathe in fragrant qi,
Washing away all foulness to make it vanish.
The sun serves as general, the moon as marshal,
Commanding my eyes to see all without obstruction.
Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances.

Write the talisman in cinnabar: first inscribe three "sun" characters, then the name of the Dipper, and recite the mantra seven times. Upon completion, swallow one talisman. Next, pour half the water onto the ground and step over it. The mantra states:
Treading this water of the Three Clarities,
Washing away the mud of the Five Turbidities.
The body soars into the realm of formlessness,
Irrigating the celestial pools above.

Once the dissolution of defilement is complete, you may enter the oratory to perform the practice of penetrating vision and the great methods of the Dao.

**Daily Observances for Cultivation**
Each night after the hour of *zi*, rise from bed, face south, drape your robe, and sit. With both hands, form the Five Emperors’ mudra of the red apricot, and click your teeth thirty-two times. Visualize your heart as General Tang, your left kidney as General Ge, and your right kidney as General Zhou. The Four Numinous Generals stand at your left, right, front, and back. The Azure Dragon emerges from the liver and stands to your left, the White Tiger from the lungs and stands to your right, the Vermilion Bird from the heart and stands before you, and the Dark Warrior from the kidneys and stands behind you. General Tang emerges from the numinous crimson palace of the heart, General Ge from the left mysterious palace of the left kidney, and General Zhou from the mysterious origin palace of the right kidney, each leading eighty thousand troops and cavalry, arrayed to your left and right.

Bow in your heart thirty-two times, and click your teeth thirty-two times, visualizing the thirty-two Heavenly Sovereign Lords. The secret mantra states:
Supreme Mysterious Origin, Most High Dao Lord,
Summon forth the Three and Five Merit Officers within my body,
The attendants of the left and right, the incense-bearing golden youths,
The jade maidens who transmit words, the direct talismans of the Five Emperors,
The incense officials of the day—thirty-six each—emerge and follow my command.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Primordial Celestial Venerable decrees.

Next, visualize three Fire Star officials of the south in crimson robes, returning to the heart in red light. Nine Wood Virtue Star officials of the east in azure robes return to the liver in green light. Seven Metal Star officials of the west in white robes return to the lungs in white light. Five Water Star officials of the north in black robes return to the kidneys in black light. Twelve Earth Star officials of the center in yellow robes return to the spleen in yellow light. The three hun-souls and seven po-souls, along with the thirty-six thousand spirits, all reside within the body. The mantra states:
The hun-souls become clear and upright,
The ten thousand qi eternally endure.
Unburdened by suffering and affliction,
The body radiates light.
The Three Realms provide escort,
The Five Emperors oversee reception.
The myriad spirits pay homage,
My name is inscribed in the Upper Clarity.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Primordial Celestial Venerable decrees.

Next, visualize the sun on your left and the moon on your right, with the stars arrayed above. Gradually, ascend through the Heavenly Gate into the Mysterious Terrace Palace and the Crimson Tower Palace, penetrating within and without, illuminating the entire chamber. Upon completion, visualize the Yellow Elder Lord in purple robes seated in the Central Yellow Palace below the navel. The Unsurpassed Noble Scion in purple Daoist robes resides on the left, and the White Prime Honored Spirit in white robes resides on the right. Guard this vision, allowing the qi to flow continuously. Inhale through the nose, keeping the mouth closed to prevent leakage, and circulate it gently to ascend to the Upper Clarity.

Next, visualize the green qi of the left kidney as a streak of green light traveling along the left spine to the back of the brain, entering the left eye and passing through to the right eye. Then visualize the black qi of the right kidney transforming into purple light, traveling along the right spine to the back of the brain and entering the left eye. The mantra states:
The two eyes, talismans of water and ink,
True qi enters the eyes, penetrating the formless.
Gazing through the Three Realms,
True immortals share the path.

Circulate the right and left eyes nine times each to perform penetrating vision.

**Daily Practices for Penetrating Vision**
Upon waking at night, immediately close your eyes. Click your teeth nine times and swallow saliva nine times. Then, press the left and right sides of the nose ten times with your hands. The mantra states:
The Four Luminaries of the Most High,
The essence of the Nine Gates’ method.
Ears and eyes profoundly clear,
Communing with the true and reaching the numinous.
The Mysterious Terrace in the heavens,
Flowing qi harmonized and balanced.
The Cloudy Maiden’s graceful bearing,
The pupils of the eyes bright and keen.
Radiant clarity and brilliance,
A hundred visions distant and clear.
Preserving harmony in the Upper Origin,
Wandering the Nine Citadels.
The five viscera rooted,
Ears and eyes naturally arise.
The Heavenly Terrace’s lush purity,
Pillars and beams unshaken.
The seven po refined and tempered,
The three hun at peace.
The Red Child carries the light,
Ever at my side.
Should any dare obstruct my ears and eyes,
The Most High shall smite them with the flowing bell.
All myriad evils vanish,
Every wish is fulfilled.
The sun and moon guard the gates,
The heart harbors the Five Stars.
As the True Sovereign invokes,
Let all listen with reverence.

Upon completion, swallow green saliva into the liver nine times. Rub your face until it becomes slightly warm. Make this a regular practice. Perform this ritual upon waking, never omitting a single night. It sharpens hearing and vision, strengthens memory and clarity, balances the nose, prevents spittle and nasal mucus, restores a youthful complexion, governs the hun and records the po, and repels all demons.

**Another Method**
First, press the two hollows at the inner corners of the eyebrows twenty-seven times. Use both hands to press gently, then firmly with the middle fingers. The incantation states:

"Unlock the Heavenly Court,
Granting me eternal life.
Pierce through vision for ten thousand miles,
Let hun and po return to infancy.
Banish ghosts and repel demons,
Summon a thousand spirits.
Ascend to the Supreme,
Merge with the sun as one.
Attain the rank of Perfected,
Inscribed in the Register of the Mysterious.

**Another Method**
After ingesting the Jade Script, first press and then rub. With fingers and palms, wipe the eyes. Bring both hands together atop the crown, repeating twenty-seven times. Visualize azure, violet, and crimson qi emerging before your eyes.

Recite again:
'Triple Clouds of the Eye Youth,
True Lords of the Two Eyes.
Radiant brilliance infuses essence,
Unlocking and purifying the spirit.
Supreme Cloud Visage,
Spiritual maidens dance lightly.
Guard the twin gates,
Open and penetrate the nine portals.
All joints respond in harmony,
Morning fluid ascends to the Mud Pill Palace.
The body ascends to the Jade Palace,
Ennobled as an Upper Perfected.
Should any obscure my ears and eyes,
The Supreme shall shatter them with flowing bells.
Pierce through vision for ten thousand miles,
Clearly perceive ghosts and spirits.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the statute decrees.'

Perform this at the zi and wu hours, or practice it regularly. It sharpens the ears and brightens the eyes.

Grasp the upper joint of the middle finger with both hands. For each incantation recited thrice, inhale northern qi and blow onto the palms (the area below the thumb is the palm). Press the palms to the eyes, then to the back of the head. Repeat this, reciting the incantation thrice. As before, inhale northern qi, exhale onto the palms, press them to the eyes, then recite the incantation nine times. Blow into water, and with the middle finger, drip the water into the eyes—once daily.

**Penetrating Vision for Document Review**
For reviewing, reporting, or examining documents, first write on paper:
'The sky is free of floating haze,
The Four Qi are bright and clear.
Dark wisdom illuminates purity,
Luminous qi soars in four directions with four talismans.'

While writing, visualize the Jade Capital Mountain in the southeast, towering millions of zhang, with the sun and moon shining brightly and the stars gleaming. Form the Jade Purity mudra, inhale qi, and blow onto the brush. Recite one character as you write one, layering them into a talisman. Cast it into water and wash the eyes. If unable to write the talisman, take pure earth from the ground, recite the incantation fifteen times, and mix the earth into water. Stir until clear, then wash the eyes.

Place the document to be reviewed under the open sky, burn incense, and invoke the attending spirit officials and jade maidens. Form the mudra again, recite the Jade Tone Qi-Gathering Incantation, blow onto the document, recite the names of the Five Emperors, and inhale eastern qi to blow upon it. You must be able to perceive the text. If the paper appears veiled in azure, the true qi has descended. If not, recite the incantation again until it turns azure.

Then recite the incantation nine times:
'Formless yet luminous,
True qi arises spontaneously.
Red-script Jade Characters,
Eight Mighty Dragon Scripts.
Preserve and govern the kalpa,
Ensuring heaven’s eternal endurance.
Brahma qi pervades the cosmos,
Ten thousand Brahma realms open.
Inhale the qi of the Heavenly Gate and blow onto the paper. Observe whether the text is distinct.

Jade Tone gathers qi,
Spiritual winds amass mist.
Purple emptiness flourishes,
Aiding the myriad immortals.
A thousand harmonies, ten thousand unions,
Naturally attaining perfection.
Chaotic Crimson Script,
Peerless Upper Perfected.
From the Primordial Ancestral Kalpa,
All heavens are transformed.
The Three Luminaries unfold,
Becoming the root of heaven.
Above, there is no further ancestor,
Only the Dao as body.
Five Scripts expand,
Universally planting divine spirits.
Without script, no illumination;
Without script, no clarity.
Without script, no establishment;
Without script, no completion.
Without script, no deliverance;
Without script, no generation.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Primordial Sovereign of Heaven decrees.'

Inhale the qi of the Heavenly Gate and blow onto the paper. Observe:

For beginners with one or two-tenths of vision, the text may appear as if through an insect’s burrow—obscured or faintly rising. With three-tenths of vision, the characters resemble raised plaques, each stroke elevated on both sides with a channel-like depression in the center, containing faint ink traces. With four-tenths of vision, the traces appear as pale ink. With five-tenths, the traces turn azure, pale pink, pale yellow, or faint ink. Spiritual qi swirls above the paper. Beyond five-tenths, red hues gradually appear. At full vision, yellow predominates.

If the strokes remain indistinct, recite the incantation and blow again until the text matches the described clarity, avoiding disorder. Only then is it acceptable. Then recite the 'Without script, no illumination' incantation. If the text appears black, recite the 'Without script, no clarity' incantation and inhale qi until the strokes are half-visible and half-hidden, discernible enough to trace. If still unclear, recite the incantation, blow, and wash the eyes while invoking the spirit officials, jade maidens, and divine tigers.

Initially, strive to discern the strokes, stopping after ten or twenty characters to avoid greed. Gradually increase by ten or so characters daily, ensuring vision does not regress. Deterioration often stems from tracing too many characters when fatigued, leading to misrecognition, errors in writing, and chaotic true qi. The text may resemble insect burrows, plaque channels, or bird tracks, becoming unstable and harming vision. Heavenly script is formed by true qi—exercise utmost caution.

After one hundred to two hundred ke without vision decline, stabilize it before progressing. First recite the Five Directions Incantation, write the Five Talismans (the Five Meritorious Talismans of the Numinous Treasure), and swallow them. On yin and yang days, ingest the Jade Tablet to enhance vision further.

**Entering the Chamber to Assume Duties**
Before entering the chamber each day, recite the Entry Incantation:
'Luminous Scribes of the Four Brightnesses,
Messengers of the True Transmission.
Jade Maidens of Serene Attendance,
Jade Lads of Proclamation.
Convey my words,
To the deities of the Dao chamber.
Upper Prime Qi,
Enter my body.
Let all I declare
Be heard above.'
Silently.'

Upon completion, strike the teeth twelve times and enter the chamber with the right foot first. Before the sacred presence, strike the teeth nine times, perform nine bows, and with the left hand thrice offer incense. Recite:

"Jade radiance scatters light,
Nine qi abide in smoke.
Fragrant clouds densely woven,
Ascend to the Nine Heavens.
Incense-attending Golden Lad,
Message-bearing Jade Maiden.
Heard above before the Emperor,
Let all I declare
Be granted as spoken."

Thereafter, offer prayers as the heart desires. Step into the Dipper’s mouth, perform nine bows while kneeling, and present the secret memorial. From the beginning, invoke and pray to the immortal officials of the registers and methods concerned. Proclaim universally:

"Once you await my audience with the perfected complete,
As I enter the chamber to attend to affairs,
You must manifest clearly,
Reporting and responding without fail."

Upon concluding the prayer, visualize the immortal officials all present at your sides. Only then form the mudra and proceed in proper sequence. According to yin and yang days, swallow the Jade Tablet and wash the eyes. Then sit upright, lean upon the desk, and ingest the *Tongmu Dongshi* (Penetrating Eye and Pervading Vision) talisman, as well as the *Shezhao* (Summoning) talisman.

Place a sheet of paper before you, fold it into three pieces, and divide them over three days. For instance, if today is the seventh day of the seventh month and you enter the chamber, it is fitting that texts descend from Heaven, while deities of the middle and lower realms present official matters. If immortal officials submit reports or request rulings, the presiding *Jing* immortal officer, spirit officials, and jade maidens in charge will annotate them. After a while, clearly visualize each detail above the incense. Shortly after, recite the incantation of the *Dongshi* method, inhale the azure-colored and white-bodied textual dew, enunciate the incantation distinctly, and transcribe each character to examine the matters at hand.

Await the evening audience to deliberate and conclude affairs in the *Jing* chamber. Recite the Exit Incantation:

"Emerging from yin into yang,
Myriad spirits open wide.
Matters concluded, gates sealed,
The Yellow Chamber now closed.
Jade Maidens of Serene Attendance,
Brightly prepare the divine carriage."

Upon finishing the incantation, exit the chamber, stepping first with the left foot, and do not look back. To look back invites perverse qi, and what was presented will not reach its destination. First perform nine bows, holding the breath while bowing. Upon rising, exit without looking back, for to do so offends the true qi. Do not tread upon the threshold, do not let the stove’s fire extinguish, and never blow upon the incense with the mouth—these are Heaven’s great prohibitions, and violations incur corporal punishment.

Discuss the annotated matters with masters and peers for thorough deliberation. If unresolved, further annotations must be sought while awaiting responses, to be concluded in the evening audience.

*The Great Rites of the Supreme Scripture of Limitless Salvation, Volume Sixteen* concludes.
*The Great Rites of the Supreme Scripture of Limitless Salvation, Volume Seventeen* begins.

**The Supreme Chapter on the Wearing of the Inner Sounds**

At that time, during the Primordial Radiance of the Red Clarity Era, the Most High commanded the Heavenly Perfected Sovereign to transmit the true methods of the Inner Sounds of the Heavens, thereby pacifying and securing the myriad heavens, establishing the firmament and the earth, regulating the stars and constellations, and founding the sun and moon. The myriad heavens and all the myriad sages, together with the ten thousand kinds and ten thousand things, all receive their completion from the numinous treasures of the Most High, and only by receiving the true *qi* of the Celestial Worthy of Original Beginning do they attain generation and transformation. Each follows its inherent nature to receive its name.

This method can deliver the myriad spirits of heaven and earth, as well as all the holy assemblies who have attained the Dao. All are endowed with the true method of the Inner Sounds and the *qi* of the great prohibitions, thereby accomplishing the great Dao. Should one encounter this orthodox method of the great Dao of the Inner Sounds, one will invariably ascend on high. It is said that all the great sages attain sagehood through the true method of the Inner Sounds.

The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign said: Above in the heavens and below on earth, this sound pervades all, dispels all, delivers all, and accomplishes all. This is the spontaneous sound of the Heavenly Perfected, known as the true method of the Inner Sounds of the Heavens, which naturally establishes the heavens and the earth. When encountering this method, one must align above with heaven, below with earth, and in the center with humanity. Furthermore, one must act with perfect propriety, speak without harming others, and practice the way of self-sacrifice to save all beings. Only through such cultivation may one practice the true method of the Inner Sounds of the Heavens and thereby attain the way of ascending on high.

It is said that the luminaries of the myriad heavens, the emperors, kings, and sages all ascend to the ranks of the immortals through the true method of the Inner Sounds of the Heavens. This method is wondrous and weighty, and its merits are equal to those of heaven. It is the treasure of the heavens for delivering humanity and is not transmitted to the lower world—such is the method of the Inner Sounds. Thus, it is known that the Celestial Worthy of Original Beginning transmits it to the lower world once every forty thousand kalpas.

This clarifies that the eight meritorious upper sounds are all the ancestral models of the heavens. It elucidates that this sound is the method for ascending to heaven. Thus, it is the root of entering sagehood and the gate of long life, the path to the heavens above. Moreover, should one encounter this method in ten thousand kalpas, one’s entire being will attain the Dao and ascend to heaven, and one will further deliver the nine ancestral lineages and the seven generations of ancestors, all of whom will attain the way of divine transcendence.

It is said that this method, in heaven above and among humanity below, enables all the sages, worthies, and true spirits to attain the way of the lofty perfected. This sound delivers an immeasurable number of beings, serving as the ancestral origin of the myriad ways. Those who attain the Dao and become perfected are as numerous as raindrops in a mist, and their merits and calculations are beyond reckoning.

It is further likened thus: Just as the Son of Heaven in the human realm confers ranks upon the myriad officials, and without the Son of Heaven, none may attain office, so too do the true sages of the myriad heavens, without the Celestial Worthy of Original Beginning, have no means to attain the Dao. It is said that this method will reside in the world for four million years before descending again to the human realm. Should one encounter this method, one will traverse the Three Realms alone, ascend through the Golden Gate, and share the same lifespan as heaven. All the true methods of the jade formulas of the Inner Sounds of the Numinous Treasure Heavens are listed as follows.

Furthermore, on the day of your life destiny, inscribe in cinnabar the remaining four characters, wear them facing the Grand Year Star, and the Three Officials will erase your transgressions from the earthly records, the Purple Tenuity will inscribe your name in the roster of Immortals, and you will be within the Purple Tenuity Palace of the Dark Capital.

The Seventeenth Scroll of the Great Method of the Numinous Treasure Sutra of Infinite Salvation Concludes
The Eighteenth Scroll of the Great Method of the Numinous Treasure Sutra of Infinite Salvation
The Lesser Chapter on Wearing the Inner Sounds

**Following the Solar Terms to Wear the Inner Sound Formulae**
The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign said: For those who cultivate the Dao of flying immortals and the method of liberation, the corpse dissolves and transforms, the wheel of life and death turns, and one roams freely with the cycles, unbound by the Great Yin. One should inscribe the jade characters of the various heavens and the infinite inner sounds in cinnabar, wear white silk upon the body, ingest them according to the text, keep the heart free from defilement, harmonize the five viscera’s emotions, tranquilize the six palaces, and abide in emptiness and non-action. After eight years, one penetrates all heavens, sits and sees the ten directions, divine perfected beings descend and commune, the body radiates jade light, one rides the dragon chariot, ascends at dawn, the jade lads praise the Dao, and for forty thousand kalpas, one’s practice remains unbroken.

The method of practice should follow the aforementioned cinnabar inscriptions. In the first, second, and third months of spring, inscribe the text in cinnabar, face the king, and knock the teeth nine times. The incantation reads:

Great Brahmā of Flying Heavens, Vairambha of the Eight Directions,
Nine Qi of the Pure Heavens, all gathered as Divine Kings.
Five Unions and Eight Assemblies, flowing and radiant through the Great Void,
Above connecting to the Dragon Han, the ancestral lineage of divine immortals.
Below delivering from the long night, the chambers of the Nine Dark Realms.
Rescuing suffering souls, decayed bones emit light,
The body transforms into feathers, clad in five-colored garments.
Azure dragons and jade chariots, soaring through the empty sky.
Today I make this supplication to the Blue Heaven of Primordial Yang.
May the myriad beings harmonize, merging with qi as one.
Ascending into the formless, eternally preserved without end.

After reciting, ingest the text, face upward, and swallow the eight qi. Cease.

In the fourth, fifth, and sixth months of summer, inscribe the text in cinnabar, face the king, and knock the teeth eight times. The incantation reads:

Celestial scriptures spread across the net, Brahmā’s practice in the Crimson Clarity,
Above opening the Eight Passages, the Five Unions connecting to the numinous.
The great cycle begins its term, refining essence in the Cavernous Yang.
Jade texts radiant and bright, the Three Luminaries self-illuminating.
Below delivering from life and death, all who receive form.
Today is most auspicious, the Great Sage descends to the court.
The Nine Nights open their windows, the dark chambers bright and clear.
The Three Evils cease, my Dao naturally fulfills.
The Five Emperors safeguard and deliver, ascending to the Flourishing Capital.
Within the Seven Jeweled Grove, eternally enjoying kalpas of longevity.

After reciting, ingest the text, face upward, and swallow the eight qi. Cease.

In the seventh, eighth, and ninth months of autumn, inscribe the text in cinnabar, face the king, and knock the teeth seven times. The incantation reads:

The Flying Mystery of the Eight Convergences gathers qi to perfect the true.
Sixty-four characters encompass the root of numinous heaven.
Opening the passage through life and death, decayed bones return to humanity.
Wandering souls disperse, receiving qi to ascend to the Mysterious.
Today’s time is most felicitous, ten thousand vows unfold.
Hosts of perfected beings converge—my wish, my immortality.
Radiance merges with the Dao—my wish, my spirit.
Attaining the white clouds, ascending to the imperial throne.
Amidst the Seven Jeweled Joy, befriending the perfected.
Cease.
Ingest the text, face upward, and swallow the eight qi. Stop.

In the tenth, eleventh, and twelfth months of winter, inscribe the text in cinnabar, face the king, and knock the teeth five times. The incantation reads:
Jade script opens the dark, flowing brilliance ascends the gate.
Eight qi perfect the true, Brahmanic conduct in radiant clouds.
Divine kings awaken light, the Three Images cleave asunder.
Five hues linger, illuminating my numinous soul.
Today’s convergence is most auspicious, gazing upward to the Imperial Lord.
Unsealing the pardon to reveal the script, bestowing upon me the true text.
Jade moisture intermingles, the Five Palaces engender the true.
Feathers and plumage transform, mounting radiance to ride the imperial throne.
Emerging from darkness into the formless, immortal deliverance is natural.
Seven ancestors return together, rejoicing in the Upper Prime.
Cease.
Ingest the text, face upward, and swallow the eight qi. Stop.

The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign declares: These incantations and recitations are the qi of the Four Convergences, the harmonies of the Eight Accords, the spontaneous compositions.
Those who practice them find the heavens afar chanting in response, the Three Realms arraying rites, myriad spirits girding their sashes to attend and guard the numinous text, following the seasons in service and recitation. After a hundred days, the heavens record their deeds, and the earthly officials erase their names from the ledgers.
After eight years, divine perfected beings descend of their own accord, the body born with jadelike radiance, penetrating the dark and empty. Seated, one beholds the spontaneous, the gate of death revives, the womb returns to humanity, the wheel ceases not, and in life and death one attains immortality.
The Dao is august, the Dharma wondrous—one practice endures for forty thousand kalpas.
To lightly divulge or neglect it is to bear the wind-blade of the River Source, never attaining immortality even after ten thousand kalpas.
The ancient statutes of the enlightened are clear: this must be kept secret.

The Great Method of the *Supreme Scripture of Limitless Salvation*, Scroll Eighteen, concludes.
The Great Method of the *Supreme Scripture of Limitless Salvation*, Scroll Nineteen.

**The Chapter of the Five Cloud Sprouts**

The Five Chapters of the Vermilion Writ of the Primordial Beginning arose within the Great Void. Before heaven and earth shone with light, before the dawn of creation, the hidden root of the original took form. The Three Radiances were established, the Five Qi were born, and the Five Colors divided their splendor, illuminating the Five Directions. The Five Thearchs were set in place, yin and yang guided their course, the pivot of the Nine Heavens turned, and the brilliance of the Five Stars revolved. The Five Marchmounts were planted to secure and pacify, and the Five Palaces nurtured the spirits.

Thus, the perfected of the utmost truth constantly rely upon the first light of yang’s dawn, drawing down the upright qi of the Primordial Beginning, channeling the Jade Spring to flow with fragrance, and summoning the original essence to the Supreme Ultimate. They beckon the Five Thearchs to the numinous youths. Those who cultivate and irrigate do not decline; those who preserve and guard know no end. They turn back ten thousand kalpas to renew the beginning, safeguarding the Five Sprouts within their countenance. Truly, this is the wondrous secret of the Numinous Treasure, the joyous veneration of the myriad sages.

**The Jade Instructions of the Primordial Beginning’s Vermilion Writ: Ingesting the Azure Sprout and Guiding the Nine Qi of the Azure Heaven**

The method for cultivating the Azure Sprout and guiding the Nine Qi of the Azure Heaven of the East:

Always, on the day of the Beginning of Spring at cock’s crow, enter the chamber, face east, and bow nine times. Sit upright, click the teeth nine times, and visualize the Azure Numinous Beginning Elder Lord of the Eastern Peaceful Treasure Flower Grove, surnamed Yan, named Kai Ming, styled Ling Wei Yang. His form is nine inches tall, his head crowned with an azure essence-jade coronet, his body clad in a flying robe of the Nine Qi’s azure feathers. He rides a chariot drawn by a blue-green dragon, bearing a banner of plumes, attended by ninety myriad Lords of the Jia-Yi Hu-Lao, descending from the Nine Qi Azure Heaven into the chamber.

Presently, azure qi transforms and arises, dense as the mist of distant clouds, enveloping one’s form. It enters through the mouth and descends directly into the liver palace. Then, visualize Jupiter blazing brightly in the east, its light illuminating one’s body, all made distinct.

Upon completion, open the eyes and raise the gaze, praying:

*"Nine Qi Azure Heaven, primordial essence on high.
August Elder, divine lord, clad in azure feathers.
Commanding the celestial palace, Jupiter shines resplendent.
Scattering radiance, flowing fragrance, cleansing my form.
Feasting on dawn’s aurora, ingesting and guiding wood’s essence.
Firmly nurturing the Azure Sprout, securing against decay.
The liver palace overflows, jade mushrooms sprout of themselves.
Turning back years by the myriad kalpas, countenance returns to youth.
Five Qi merge as one, heaven and earth endure together."*

When finished, guide the azure qi and swallow it nine times, then cease. Proceed to ingest the twelve Vermilion Writ jade characters of the east.

These twelve characters are the names of the Nine Qi Azure Heaven, guiding the Nine Qi of the Azure Thearch and ingesting the Azure Sprout. All are written in vermilion on white paper, visualized and then swallowed whole. Thus, the Nine Qi descend unbidden, the Azure Thearch responds in voice and manifests form, the Five Sprouts are fortified upon the Eastern Marchmount, the liver palace’s jade mushrooms sprout of themselves, and the numinous youths align the true writ beside one’s resting place. Azure lads come to assist and command, and after nine years of accumulated resonance and transformation, one instantly becomes a divine immortal, transcending the world for ten thousand kalpas without end.

Always, at cock’s crow when the yang light first divides, face east, click the teeth nine times, rub the hands until warm, and with the palms wipe the face and eyes nine times. Raise the gaze and pray:

*"Eastern Azure Sprout, ingesting the Azure Sprout,
drinking the dawn’s blossoms."*

When finished, with the tongue lick the inside of the upper teeth and the sweet lips three times, filling the mouth with Jade Spring, and swallow it three times. Then guide the azure qi and swallow it nine times, causing it to settle within the liver. This completes the method.

**The Jade Instructions of the Primordial Beginning’s Vermilion Writ: Ingesting the Vermilion Sprout and Guiding the Three Qi of the Cinnabar Heaven**

The method for cultivating the Vermilion Sprout and guiding the Three Qi of the Cinnabar Heaven of the South:

Always, on the day of the Beginning of Summer at cock’s crow, enter the chamber, face south, and bow three times. Sit upright, click the teeth three times, and visualize the Southern Flourishing Treasure Prosperous Cinnabar Numinous True Elder Lord, surnamed Dong Fu, named Ji Yan, styled Chi Biao Nu. His form is three inches tall, his head crowned with a vermilion kerchief and jade coronet, his body clad in a flying robe of the Three Qi’s cinnabar feathers. He rides a chariot drawn by a cinnabar dragon, bearing a vermilion banner, attended by thirty myriad officials of the Bing-Ding Yue-Lao, descending from the Three-Five Cinnabar Heaven into the chamber.

Presently, vermilion qi transforms and arises, blazing like the brilliance of fire, enveloping one’s form. It enters through the mouth and descends directly into the heart palace. Then, visualize Mars blazing brightly in the south, its light illuminating one’s body, all made distinct.

Upon completion, open the eyes and raise the gaze, praying:

*"Three Qi Cinnabar Heaven, vermilion palace’s numinous youth.
Primordial Beginning’s august elder, thrice riding the red dragon.
Cinnabar feathers in flight, brocade mantle’s radiance.
Driving and steering the celestial palace, revolving the Dao of yin and yang.
Three Qi exhale brilliance, irrigating my crimson palace.
The Red Child is preserved and secured, golden sprouts adorn the countenance.
