Jade youths guarding the true.
Grasping inscribed tablets,
Crimson ledgers and jade texts.
Reviewing the ranks of immortals,
Weighing and reporting above.
Today is most auspicious,
The numinous peaks open to immortals.
Turn above the exalted spirits,
Descend through my three gates.
Transform into an infant,
Settling the heart and pacifying the soul.
The two *qi* intermingle,
Entwining my life’s root.
Ever with Zhu Rong,
Riding the luminous clouds.
Wandering the Southern River,
Heaven and earth enduring forever."*

Conclude by drawing in red *qi* and swallowing three times, then cease. Practicing this Way will dissolve all karmic bonds of the Southern Peak, releasing punishments and dispersing judgments, ascending to the Heavenly Palace. This method is wondrous and weighty, opening the passage between life and death.

Regularly perform this on the days of *wuchen*, *wuxu*, *jichou*, or *jiwei* after the Spring Equinox, Summer Solstice, Autumn Equinox, or Winter Solstice. Bathe and purify, then enter the chamber as the sun’s rays enter. Face the king and bow twelve times, sit upright, and knock the teeth twelve times to awaken the body’s spirits. Conclude, close your eyes, and visualize the Yellow Thearch of Mount Song in the Center, whose surname is Dan and personal name is [omitted]. His form is one *chi* and two *cun* in height, crowned with a yellow jade *tongtian* coronet, clad in a feathered flying robe of yellow, and riding a yellow dragon. He is attended by twelve jade maidens of the yellow silk, descending into your chamber from the Central Peak.

After a while, the Yellow Thearch transforms into a newly born infant within a cloud of yellow *qi*, entering your mouth with the breath and proceeding directly to the spleen’s palace. Visualize a white *qi* arising from the lungs, encircling and suffusing the spleen’s palace. The yellow and white *qi* intermingle in primordial chaos, like yellow clouds swirling in the heavens. When you feel warmth suffusing the spleen, swallow twelve times.

Pray:
*"The Yellow Origin of the Center,
Governing the Four Numinous Ones."*

The Central Mountains of Wu and Ji, primordial essence of the supreme origin.
The Great Divine Yellow Thearch, riding a three-harnessed flying chariot,
Twelve yellow dragons ascending to feast in the Three Clarities.
Jade maidens attend as guards, divine youths serve as messengers.
Opening the mountain to reveal the chart, submitting to immortals to fix the name.
Roaming the Central Peak, the Four Kings unfold their numinous power.
Turning to descend in a winding path, streaming to irrigate my form.
Merging and transforming, the aged Thearch becomes an infant.
Pacifying and settling the Yellow Palace, the palace repository flourishes in splendor.
The body grows wondrous hair, luminous within and without.
The perfected ones commune, penetrating the Nine Clarities.
Attaining to ride the yellow chariot, ascending to fly in the Jade Court.

Conclude by drawing in yellow *qi* and swallowing twelve times, then cease.

Practicing this Dao, the numinous officials of the Central Peak descend to your chamber, sending twelve jade maidens of the yellow silk to open and communicate your passages, reporting above to the Nine Heavens. Parents of life and death, records of crimes and punishments bound to the Central Peak—all are dissolved and erased. Your name ascends to the immortal register, you depart the Earthly Prison, rise into the Hall of Blessings, and life and death unfold in harmony, delivering countless beings.

Always on the *gengshen* or *xinyou* days following the Beginning of Autumn, at dusk, bathe and purify in fasting. Enter your chamber, face west, and bow seven times. Sit evenly, knock the teeth seven times, and awaken the spirits within your body.

Conclude, then close your eyes and visualize the White Thearch of Mount Huayin in the Western Peak, surnamed Chong, whose personal name is [omitted]. His form is seven *cun* and seven *fen* in height, crowned with a plain jade *tongtian* coronet, clad in a feathered flying robe of white, and riding a white dragon. He is attended by twelve jade maidens of the white silk, descending into your chamber from the Western Prison.

After a while, the White Thearch transforms into a newly born infant within a cloud of white *qi*, entering your mouth with the breath and proceeding directly to the lung’s palace. Visualize a black *qi* arising from the kidneys, encircling and suffusing the lung’s palace. The white and black *qi* intermingle in primordial chaos, like auspicious clouds layering the heavens. When you feel warmth suffusing the lungs, swallow seven times. Look up and pray:

*"The Seven Qi’s Heaven,
The Hall of White and Yellow Gold.
Great Divine White Thearch,
Pacifying and settling the four directions.
The numinous mountain of Huayin,
Called the Divine King.
White feathered flying skirt,
Raising banners and driving dragons.
Ascending to roam the Dark Clarity,
Entering and exiting the Flowery Palace.
Governing the immortal registers,
Arranging the tablets to address the directions.
On this auspicious day,
The myriad sages feast on the peak.
Roaming the Nine Radiant Clouds,
Streaming and scattering their brilliance.
Golden essence gleaming,
White stone vast and overflowing.
Opening the mountain to observe the numinous,
The divine unfolds in the four quarters.
Wishing for the Dao, wishing for immortality,
Wishing for life, wishing for longevity.
When the highest wishes converge,
There is nothing that is not auspiciously prosperous.
At dusk, gather the perfected and communicate,
Transforming my form.
Changing and forming of itself,
Soaring together with the *qi*.
The body flies lightly aloft,
Ascending to the Purple Chamber."*

Conclude by drawing in white *qi* and swallowing seven times, then cease.

Practicing this Dao, the numinous officials of the Western Peak and the White Thearch descend in truth. Seven jade maidens of the white silk open and communicate your numinous passages, and all your prayers ascend to the Nine Heavens. Parents of life and death, records of crimes and punishments bound to the Western Peak—all are dissolved, the names of offenses erased. Your name ascends to the immortal register, you depart the Five Paths, seek to rise into the Hall of Blessings, and life and death unfold in deliverance. Blessings come naturally.

Always on the *renz*i or *guihai* days following the Beginning of Winter, at midnight, bathe and purify in fasting. Enter your chamber, face north, and bow five times. Sit evenly, knock the teeth five times, and awaken the spirits within your body.

Conclude, then close your eyes and visualize the Black Thearch of Mount Heng in the Northern Peak, surnamed Chen, whose personal name is [omitted]. His form is five *cun* and five *fen* in height, crowned with a dark jade *tongtian* coronet, clad in a feathered flying robe of black, and riding a black dragon. He is attended by twelve jade maidens of the Great Mystery, descending into your chamber from the Northern Peak.

After a while, the Black Thearch transforms into a newly born infant within a cloud of black *qi*, entering your mouth with the breath and proceeding directly to the kidney’s palace. Visualize a green *qi* arising from the liver, encircling and suffusing the kidney’s palace. The green and black *qi* intermingle in primordial chaos, like azure clouds layering the mist. When you feel warmth suffusing the kidneys, swallow five times. Look up and pray:

*"The Five Qi’s Dark Heaven,
Supreme origin flowing in essence..."*

Gather *qi* and condense the numinous—this is called the Immortal Hut.
Securely stationed at Northern Heng, it is the Black Thearch’s domain of roaming.
Reveling in the northern wastes, you ascend with dragons afloat.
Today is an auspicious day: the myriad spirits open the celestial charts.
The Five *Qi* linger and circle; felicitous clouds spread in all four directions.
Immortal youths hold jade tablets; the Great Mystery transmits the talisman.
Inscribe my name in the immortal register, inscribed in golden script on high.
Returning to the true and curving descent, merge with the infant form.
The two *qi* intermingle and descend; I behold my body with penetrating vision.
The Dark and Mysterious One leads me by the hand, and immortals become my companions.
Forever partaking of Heaven and Earth, through ten thousand kalpas without end.

Conclude by drawing in the black *qi* and swallowing five times. Cease.

By practicing this Way, the numinous officials of Northern Heng and the Black Thearch descend in truth. Five jade maidens of the Great Mystery are assigned to serve you, conveying petitions and supplications upward to the Nine Heavens. Your parents in life and death, the records of your offenses and punishments—all bound to Northern Heng—are thereby absolved. You attain deliverance from the Three Evil Paths and ascend to the celestial halls. This is the supreme and wondrous method, universally delivering boundless beings.

When practicing this Way, maintain a serene mind and focused intention; the numinous and the true readily respond. Mastering its forms and procedures, within a year you will witness spirits coming and going in all directions. Officials will welcome you; demonic forces will disperse and submit, no longer daring to approach. Your mind will grow keen and your thoughts wise; you will discern fortune and misfortune for yourself. The Five Peaks and Five Thearchs will become your constant companions and guests. Communing with the divine, you will effortlessly attain immortality.

---

The High Ascent of the Sun and Moon Way

The Supreme Prime of the Southern Culmen said: You have received the essentials of the Highest Ascent and the practice of the Three Ways—the Way of Yellow *Qi* and Yang Essence. By ingesting the numinous radiance, sipping the imperial blossoms, and gazing upward to consume the flying roots, you store the Seven Luminaries within the Purple Splendor and traverse the Three Ways at the Golden Gate, penetrating the Abyssal Radiance. You behold the round and square of the sun and moon, perceive the vermilion steps in the Cavern Yang, and enter to refine Yang within the Vast Cold. You ascend the Seven Treasures at the Dark Garden, climb the flying ladder at the Cloud Observatory, absorb Yang essence from the Floating Black, and gather yellow *qi* from the Lush Unitary. Beside the Golden Wings on the Lofty Tree, you turn the stone’s radiance to illumine your countenance. Cultivating and mastering the Numinous Chart, you thereby summon the divine and true.

Thus the Three Radiant Ones descend in splendor; the Seven Essences flank your chariot. The Five Numinous Ones intertwine as sashes; the Four Directors compile the scriptures. The Western Tortoise determines the records; your name is inscribed in the Highest Dawn. Therefore, you ascend to the Southern Culmen.

This Way is lofty and wondrous, not to be discussed by mediocre men of narrow learning. You should study it carefully and practice accordingly.

---

For the High Ascent of the Sun and Moon Way, observe a pure fast for fifty days, severing all worldly affairs. Seek seclusion and stillness, dwelling only where the first light of dawn appears. If the sky is overcast and the sun and moon are not visible, or if you are in a secluded place, simply purify your mind and visualize within the chamber where you lie. The key lies in rectifying the mind and concentrating your thoughts—where the mind reaches, nothing remains obstructed.

When closing your eyes to visualize, do so to the point of vivid semblance. "Closing the eyes" means neither fully shut nor fully open, allowing you to perceive the light and form of the sun and moon. Practice in secrecy; do not let others see or know. If observed, the numinous radiance will not descend.

When cultivating the High Way, first sever all worldly ties. After beginning the fast, maintain utmost purity. It is especially fitting to prepare a separate chamber, its door opening to the east. Alternatively, have a window facing east, and the bed should also face east. The sleeping area must be free of filth and disorder, and no other garments should be strewn about—such is not a place where the Supreme Perfected may descend.

The sun and moon are the mutual reflections of all methods of Yin and Yang; visualize them both. The essence lies in pure and unwavering concentration, without distraction.

The Perfected of the Primordial Simplicity said: When you store the essence of the sun, the Five Thearchs hold in their mouths the *Yu Yi* Text of the Supreme. Only when this Way is accomplished will you behold the Lord within the sun. Without it, your efforts are in vain, and you will only vex yourself.

The Perfected of the Primordial Simplicity said: When you store the essence of the moon, the Five Ladies hold in their mouths the *Jie Lin* Chapter of the Supreme. Only when this Way is accomplished will you behold the Lady within the moon. Without it, your efforts are in vain, and you will only grieve yourself.

The above two passages were transmitted by the Perfected of the Primordial Simplicity, who received them from the Supreme Thearch. The *Hidden Writings of the Supreme* states: When visualizing, hold the text; the Thearch says to contain it in the mouth.

The Perfected of the Primordial Simplicity taught Lord Pei: When visualizing, hold one text in the mouth and grasp another in the hand, practicing both simultaneously, each transcribed within the scripture. The two ascent methods and their taboo names are not to be intermingled with other words.

For the sun method, write in vermilion on blue-green paper, about two *cun* in width, and store it in a crimson pouch. When visualizing, hold it in the right hand. For the moon method, write with orpiment on blue-green paper, and store it in a yellow silk pouch, holding it in the right hand. Additionally, transcribe each in vermilion and yellow on fine blue-green silk, about one *cun* in width, with the characters as small as possible. Roll tightly and seal with wax. When visualizing, hold one in the mouth. After completing the practice, wipe it with wine and place it in a fragrant box.

The true taboo name of the Lord of *Yu Yi*:
The Supreme Thearch of the Red *Qi* within the Sun, taboo name Jiang Che Liang, style Gao Qian Shuang.

When visualizing, know this, but do not casually invoke this title. The sacred scriptures contain no methods for visualization or cultivation regarding this.

The Green Thearch within the sun, named Yuan Chang Wu, style Zhao Long Tao, appears as an infant, clad in a green jade brocade cloak, an azure floral flying feather skirt, and a morning coronet of emerald hibiscus.

The Red Thearch, taboo name Dan Ling Zhi, style Lü Hong Ying, appears as an infant, clad in a crimson jade brocade cloak, a vermilion floral flying feather skirt, and a vermilion talismanic luminous coronet.

The White Thearch, taboo name Hao Yu Jiang, style Hui Jin Xia, wears a white jade brocade cloak, a white feathered flying floral skirt, and a luminous white hibiscus coronet.

The Black Thearch, taboo name Cheng Zeng Chun, style Xuan Lü Yan, appears as an infant, clad in a black jade brocade cloak, a black feathered flying floral skirt, and a black mountain hibiscus coronet.

The Yellow Thearch, taboo name Shou Yi Fu, style Biao Hui Xiang, appears as an infant, clad in a yellow jade brocade cloak, a yellow feathered flying floral skirt, and a purple coronet of supporting numinosity.

At dawn, don your cap and robes, burn incense, face the sun, and bow twice. Perform ablutions.

When finished, hold the scripture text in your mouth with the first character facing inward, sit upright, and align with the sun’s circular radiance. Offer incense, then silently invoke the taboo name and style of the Supreme August True Lord and bow in your heart. After bowing, close your eyes. Once closed, do not open them again. Hold your breath for ten cycles, then sit squarely facing the sun, hands resting on your knees, palms upturned. Hold the scripture text in your left hand, curling your thumb into a fist, and do the same with your right hand. Next, swallow the sunlight ten times. Visualize the sunlight entering your mouth and being consumed. Envision the sun’s core as crimson *qi* with nine purple rays. Silently intone: *"Nine luminous spirits of the radiant essence."* The nine rays descend upon your face; slightly part your lips, gently inhale, and swallow them ten times. When done, hold your breath and imagine the radiance within your abdomen ascending to connect with the *Niwan* palace and descending to permeate the viscera, illuminating your form and penetrating both within and without. Sustain this vision of light until the practice concludes, ensuring it does not dissipate.

Next, softly call the name and style of the Thearch, just loud enough for your own ears to hear. Then visualize the lunar soul as nine circular orbs of yellow, slightly smaller than the sun, floating within the solar *qi* like a shimmering reflection—do not perceive it as solid. Though its form is unspoken, sense its presence as if a spirit responds. Silently recite the incantation:
*"Lunar soul, spirit of the soul,
Warm and towering, the Terrace of Xiao.
Grant me access to the Heaven of the Solar Cavern.
On the eastern mound of Dongmeng’s long ridge,
I receive the divine radiance’s scripture,
Bear the talisman of the Nine Realms,
Feast on the azure essence of solar nectar,
Drink the cloud-green’s richness,
Recline in the city of the Eight Poles,
Ascend the Terrace of Luminous Perfection,
Sit in the Hall of Verdant Forests,
Chant the Jade Dawn’s verses."*

Mentally recite this without uttering a sound. Then silently pray: *"May I ascend with the Five Thearchs and the solar soul’s spirit, riding the luminous clouds to the Solar Palace."*

Next, close your eyes and visualize the Azure Thearch emerging from the sun upon rays of light, standing to your left, and silently invoke his taboo name and style. Then visualize the Crimson Thearch emerging from the sun upon rays of light, standing to your right, and silently invoke his taboo name and style. Next, visualize the White Thearch emerging from the sun upon rays of light, standing behind you, and silently invoke his taboo name and style. Then visualize the Black Thearch emerging from the sun upon rays of light, standing above your left hand, and silently invoke his taboo name and style. Finally, visualize the Yellow Thearch emerging from the sun upon rays of light, standing above your right hand, and silently invoke his taboo name and style. Since your hands hold the scripture, they cannot open; the Thearchs stand upon them, facing you. Visualize their robes and colors vividly. Once all five are present, envision the Five Thearchs in their five positions, their forms and attire appearing simultaneously. Knock your teeth five times and swallow saliva nine times.

Softly recite, just loud enough for your own ears to hear:
*"Crimson furnace, cinnabar landscape,
Ninefold radiance of circular splendor.
Great luminance dawns,
Glorious and resplendent with vermilion essence.
The Five Thearchs initiate the dawn,
Illuminating the myriad beings of the cavernous void.
Behold the descent of the perfected,
Vast and boundless, without measure.
Circulate the *qi*, refine the hues,
Flowing through the five forms.
May my spirit transform,
And my six viscera flourish.
Attend the descending clouds,
The nine chariots of the solar mirror.
Ascend to the Solar Palace,
And unite with the Thearch’s spirit."*

When finished, visualize the solar soul riding the sunlight toward your face, stopping nine inches away. Envision a spirit within it, then knock your teeth three times and swallow saliva three times. Softly recite again: *"Lunar soul, spirit of the soul,"* as before.

Next, visualize the chariot of the solar mirror, drawn by nine crimson dragons, emerging from the sunlight and arriving before you—its form like a carriage’s yoke. Forget your own body. Then imagine the Black and Yellow Thearchs descending from your hands to stand on either side, and forget them as well. The Five Thearchs take your hands, and you rise together, ascending into the chariot. Envision the lunar soul also within it, amid the radiance. Ride the rays of light, swiftly soaring until you reach the sun’s core. Still your mind, cease visualization, and enter a state of profound absorption, as if dwelling within the sun for a long while. Finally, swallow saliva fourteen times.

When finished, open your eyes. Do not look directly at the sun again. All these procedures must be thoroughly practiced beforehand. From the beginning to the end of a session, one must not harbor doubts or consult the text. After one year of practice, semblances appear; after two years, forms manifest; after three years, they descend; after four years, clarity and penetration arise, and one’s face shines with jade-like radiance. After five years, one attains perfection. After eleven years, one may ride the cloud chariot with its feathered canopy, drawn by a host of dragons under command, ascending to the solar palace to receive the scripture and be named an Upper Clarity Perfected. One is then granted twenty-six jade lads and twenty-four jade maidens.

The Perfected’s true name of the Lady of Radiant Essence is *"Moon’s Yellow Qi, Supreme August Divine Mother,"* with the personal name *Yaodao Zhi* and the style *Yuhui Tiao*. Hold this in mind, but do not casually invoke these titles, for the scripture’s profound secrecy contains no method for their visualization.

The Lady of the Azure Thearch in the Moon has the personal name *Yine Zhu* and the style *Fenyan Ying*. Her form is like that of an infant, clad in a robe of azure-flowered jade brocade with a shawl of kingfisher-feather phoenix patterns and a flying-feather skirt. Her hair is gathered into a three-cornered cloud-toppled chignon, with the rest hanging down to her waist.

The Lady of the Vermilion Thearch has the personal name *Yiyi Liao* and the style *Wanyan Xu*. Her form is like that of an infant, clad in a robe of cinnabar-budded jade brocade with a shawl of vermilion-flowered phoenix patterns and a flying-feather skirt. Her hair is gathered into a three-cornered cloud-toppled chignon.

The Lady of the White Thearch has the personal name *Lingsu Lan* and the style *Yulian Hua*. She wears a robe of white jade brocade with four-dragon motifs and a flying-flower skirt of white-feathered simurgh patterns. Her hair is gathered into a three-cornered cloud-toppled chignon.

The Lady of the Black Thearch has the personal name *Jielian Qiao* and the style *Chunli Jin*. She wears a robe of dark jade brocade with nine-layered cloud patterns and a flying-flower skirt of black-feathered dragon motifs. Her hair is gathered into a three-cornered cloud-toppled chignon.

The Lady of the Yellow Thearch has the personal name *Qingying Jin* and the style *Jiongding Rong*. Her form is like that of an infant, clad in a robe of yellow-cloud mountain-patterned brocade with a shawl of green-feathered phoenix embroidery and a skirt of the same. Her hair is gathered into a three-cornered cloud-toppled chignon, with the rest hanging down to her waist.

On a quiet night, don your cap and robes, burn incense, and bow twice toward the moon. Whether at moonrise or dawn, adjust your position to face it as appropriate.

When the moon first appears two or three days after the new moon, as soon as the sun sets and the moon becomes visible, you may begin. As the moon rises higher, wait until the sunlight has completely faded and the moonlight grows bright before proceeding. During the dark of the moon, when the lunar form has vanished, there is naturally no practice to be performed. If the moon is not visible within the chamber, go outside to the courtyard or beneath the eaves. Should clouds or rain obscure the moon while indoors, hold the scripture in your mouth with the first character facing inward, kneel long toward the moon, and visualize the personal name and style of the Supreme Thearch’s Divine Mother. Rise, press your hands to your heart, and bow. If the moon is eclipsed on the night of the full moon, do not proceed until the eclipse has passed.

After bowing, close your eyes. From this point, keep them closed until the practice is complete, without opening them midway. Hold your breath for nine cycles, sit upright facing the moon, place your hands palms-up on your knees, hold the scripture in your right hand, and clench your left hand into a fist. Lift your face toward the moon and hold for nine breaths, as long as forty-five pulse beats. Swallow the moonlight nine times, imagining it entering your mouth. Visualize the moon containing a radiant yellow *qi* and the white light of eight luminous rays. Silently intone: *"Moon essence, night essence, eight rays."* Let the eight rays pour onto your face, then slightly part your lips to inhale and swallow them nine times. Conclude by holding your breath, imagining the radiance within your abdomen ascending to the *niwan* and descending to the viscera, illuminating your form and penetrating both within and without. Maintain this luminous brilliance until the practice ends, ensuring it does not dissipate. Let your breath be so soft that only your ears perceive it.

Next, visualize the solar soul as a vermilion expanse of protective light, the size of the moon, floating within the lunar *qi*—ethereal and shimmering, without solid form. Though the soul’s spirit has no fixed shape, sense its presence as if responding to a divine resonance. Silently recite: *"Solar soul, spirit essence, pearl radiance, crimson youth. Guide me westward to the Gate of the Six Ridges, into the Jade Palace of Harmonious Dawn, the Eight-Stringed White Mound, the Upper Chamber of Eight Sceneries. Grant me the talisman of Ten Brightnesses, the insignia of the Flowing Star’s nocturnal glow. Let me sit in the Hall of Supreme Harmony, ascend the Terrace of Seven Spirits, receive the moon’s cloud-ointment, partake of the purple nectar of Jasper Perfection, chant the verses of the Exalted, and recite the words of the Jade Dawn."* Keep these thoughts within your heart without uttering them aloud.

Next, silently recite: *"May I, together with the Five Thearchs’ Ladies and the solar soul’s spirit essence, ascend the moon palace upon flying clouds."* Close your eyes again and visualize the Lady of the Blue Thearch arriving upon the moon’s rays to your left, silently invoking her personal name and style. Then visualize the Lady of the Red Thearch arriving upon the moon’s rays to your right, facing left, silently invoking her personal name and style. Next, visualize the Lady of the White Thearch emerging from the moonlight behind you, silently invoking her personal name and style. Then visualize the Lady of the Black Thearch arriving from the moonlight to your left hand, standing upon it with a firm grip, facing you, silently invoking her personal name and style. Finally, visualize the Lady of the Yellow Thearch arriving from the moonlight to your right hand, holding the scripture upon it, standing and facing you, silently invoking her personal name and style. All Five Thearchs’ Ladies appear simultaneously in their forms and attire.

Then click your teeth nine times and swallow saliva nine times. Softly recite: *"Yellow essence unfurls its splendor, primordial Yin’s inner insignia. Reflecting upon the Great Mystery, it stirs the ten thousand directions. Scattering the misty chill winds, the Seven Dawns suspend their jade. The Three Convergences of Yin revolve, heaven and earth exhale their light. Purple brilliance descends, floating blossoms fill the nine skies. Round luminosity bestows its hues, the Six Qi transform and commune. The Five Thearchs’ Ladies tread clouds and embrace the wind. Clouds drape the dense silk, jade pendants and pearl ornaments adorn. Feathered skirts brush the heavens, soaring through the void to fan the east. The soaring tree unfolds its dawn, the canopy’s branches flourish like the sacred fern. Clouds refine and polish, aiding and nurturing the Lord of the Wood. Gazing through ten thousand miles, their shade shelters the Five Bodies. Soul harmonizes with spirit, the Six Mysteries fill the clouds. Returning from age to infancy, jade’s radiance restores youth. Timely riding the flowing bell, ten dragons soar through the clouds. Ascending to the moon palace, I am established as the Guardian Thearch."*

Visualize the solar soul arriving upon the moon’s rays before you, nine inches from your face, sensing the presence of a spirit within. Click your teeth nine times and swallow saliva nine times. Softly recite again: *"Solar soul, spirit essence."* As before. Calm your heart and focus your intent to see within the moon a chariot of flowing bells, its form resembling a carriage’s shaft, with flying clouds preceding it. Ten dragons draw it in unison, connected to the clouds, gently emerging from the radiance. When it arrives before you, turn the dragon-chariot’s pole. The Ladies of the Black and Yellow Thearchs descend to stand on either side, each holding your hands outward. Then visualize all Five Ladies assisting you as you rise, ascending together into the chariot and sitting within. The solar soul is also upon the chariot, and within the radiance, you ride swiftly toward the moon. Still your heart and cease visualization, entering a state of reverie where you forget your form, as if dwelling within the moon for a long while. Swallow saliva thirty times, then open your eyes, but do not gaze at the moon again.

All these procedures must be thoroughly practiced beforehand. Remain seated until the practice is complete, without doubt or consulting the text.

With one year of practice, semblances appear; with two years, forms manifest; with three years, descent occurs; with four years, penetrating vision arises, and the body emits flowing radiance. At five years, one attains perfection; at eleven years, one gains the reins of the dark dragon-chariot, ascending to the Lunar Palace to become an Upper Clarity Perfected, granted twenty-six Jade Lads and twenty-four Jade Maidens.

The *Scripture of the Primordial Perfected* transmits the two affairs of the Pure Numinous Perfected, Master Pei, and the Chapter of the Supreme Thearch’s *Yuyi* and *Jielin*, which summon the spirits of the sun and moon, ascending to the sun and moon, and the Dao of soaring through the celestial light of the Great Void. All ride cloud-chariots with feathered canopies, driving a host of dragons to ascend to the Purple Court of August Heaven.

The *Inner Vision of the Central Realm* states: "If you wish to walk the void, visualize the King of the Sun and Moon. If you wish to ascend to the Pure and Numinous, visualize the Five Stars." This is the meaning of secluded chambers and hidden practice, never leaving the courtyard.

The *Plain Memorial of the Vermilion Talisman* says: "Great is *Yuyi*! Wondrous is *Jielin*! They are unseen by any but the Highest Perfected, unheard of by any but the Highest Immortals. By the spirits of the sun, moon, and Five Essences, one rides dragons to walk the void, treading luminous clouds, and thus ascends with the Five Thearchs to enter the Gate of Heaven. If one hears of this, take care not to speak of it idly."

Here ends the twenty-second scroll of the *Great Rites of the Numinous Treasure Scripture of Limitless Salvation*.
Beginning of the twenty-third scroll of the *Great Rites of the Numinous Treasure Scripture of Limitless Salvation*.

The *Feast of Primordial Harmony*

Formerly, the Mystic Master, the Lord of the Azure Lad, received this from the Celestial Thearch of the Grand Tenuity. It is also called *The Scripture of Cinnabar and Golden Essence, the Water Mother of Stone Radiance*.

At sunrise, face east toward the sun, knock the teeth nine times, and silently intone the names of the sun’s soul and the five thearchs:

*"Sun-soul, Pearl Radiance,
Verdant sheen illumined.
Crimson Lad of returning mist,
Mystic flame in whirlwind form."*

Having recited these sixteen characters, close the eyes, clench the fists, and visualize the five-colored streaming mists within the sun descending to envelop the entire body, down to the feet. Then visualize the five brilliances ascending to the crown, where the five-colored streaming mists of sunlight all enter the mouth. Again, within the sun’s radiant mist, perceive a purple *qi*, large as the pupil of the eye, layered in tens, resplendent amid the five lights—this is called *Flying Root Water Mother*. Together with the five *qi*, it enters the mouth. Facing the sun, swallow the mist forty-five times. After swallowing the *qi*, swallow the saliva nine times and knock the teeth nine times.

Softly recite the incantation:

*"Crimson crucible, cinnabar *qi*,
Mystic heaven nurtures essence.
Firm receives the yielding,
Fiery water’s yin flower.
Sun’s primordial radiance,
Named Great Illumination.
Nine yangs transform as one,
Dual mists arise together.
Congeal the soul, harmonize the spirit,
Essence of the five *qi*.
Within, the five thearchs are born,
Riding light to govern form.
Gather the flying in emptiness,
Pluck the root to attain fullness.
Head draped in dragon-flower,
Clad in vermilion, girded in azure.
Reins of crow, flowing mystery,
Mist illumining the Upper Clarity.
Bestowed jade tablets,
Golden portals, jade names.
Feast on morning blossoms,
Merge with the perfected in numinosity.
Ascend as a flying immortal to the Grand Tenuity,
Rising to the Purple Court."*

After the incantation, bow twice toward the sun.

This supreme Dao is the fellowship of true immortals. Among ten thousand, not one knows the name of the sun’s soul. This Dao is mystically accomplished—those who consume blood and foul flesh cannot hear of it.

On overcast days without sun, perform this in a clean place within your chamber, visualizing as before. Pure and refined Daoists, those who profoundly connect with the upper realms, need not wait for the sun’s appearance to practice.

If a Daoist abstains from grains, maintains perpetual fasts on the Five Peaks, severs worldly ties, and deeply aspires to purity and truth, daily consuming the sun-root’s mist and swallowing the essence of the Great Yang, they will immediately feel their body suffused with jade-like luster and their face aglow with streaming light.

For those entangled in worldly affairs, unable to still the body, or whose hearts are bound by the nets of glory, practice on the first, third, fifth, ninth, thirteenth, fifteenth, seventeenth, nineteenth, and twenty-fifth days of the lunar month—ten times in a month. These are the days when the sun’s soul descends to connect with the *Flying Root*. Practicing for eighteen years, the Upper Clarity will record you with golden perfection, polish you with jade radiance, and appoint you as a Perfected, soaring through the great void, riding the three flowery essences to illumine the world below.

*The Grand Tenuity’s Talisman for Ingesting Solar Qi to Open Luminous Numinosity*
*(Inscribed in vermilion on azure silk)*

The incantation states:
*"Great Tenuity’s Cinnabar Script, named ‘Opening Luminosity.’*
*Summon the sun’s upper soul to transform this form.*
*At dawn, attire yourself with reverence, beginning in the round courtyard.*
*Flying Flower and Water Mother, sun-root and golden essence—*
*purple radiance streaming as light, styled the Five Spirits."*

First, announce to the sun’s soul and inscribe the talisman. When ingesting it, hold the breath, grasp the talisman in the left hand, and silently recite the incantation. Upon completion, swallow the talisman.

The method for gathering and ingesting the yin-flower and moon’s essence:
The first is the yellow *qi*, the yang essence concealing the sky and the moon’s hidden essence. At the moment the moon first appears, face west toward it, click the teeth ten times, and silently invoke the names of the moon’s soul and the Five Ladies:

*"Alas, the soul’s dim glow, fragrant and lustrous in the void.*
*Gently wafting, spirit’s gate, luxuriant blossoms intertwined.*
*Pure golden essence gleaming, radiant countenance atop the terrace."*

Repeat thrice, reciting the twenty-four characters in full. Then close the eyes, clench the fists, and visualize the moon’s five-colored streaming essence descending to envelop the body, reaching down to the feet. Next, envision the five *qi* ascending to the crown. As the moon’s light and five-colored essence flow into the mouth, perceive within the moon’s luminous essence a yellow *qi*, large as the pupil of an eye, dozens in number, trailing amid the five-colored radiance of the moon’s essence—these are the *Flying Yellow* and the moon’s flowery essence. Together with the five *qi*, they enter the mouth. Face the moon and swallow the essence fifty times. Upon completion, swallow the saliva ten times and click the teeth ten more.

The minor incantation:
*"Yellow essence, mysterious splendor, primordial yin’s upper *qi*.*
*Scattering and flourishing upon the cloud terrace, the numinous gathers in the stomach.*
*Vacuous waves, the gate’s brilliance, upright and irrigating the vessel.*
*Moon’s essence, night’s scene, the Mysterious Palace’s exalted adornment.*
*Five Lords and Ladies, each safeguarding their maternal station.*
*The Red Child flies in, the Infant follows in succession.*
*Revolving yin’s triple union, light and mystery pervade the ten thousand directions.*
*Harmonizing the hun and restraining the po, the five wombs flow freely.*
*Riding the rosy clouds, flying essence, soaring in the void to the east.*
*At the crown, bind the numinous cloud; the luminous flower summons the wind.*
*On the left, bear the Dragon Talisman; on the right, gird the Tiger Seal.*
*Phoenix plumes and crimson sashes, jade pendants and golden earrings.*
*The soaring tree’s branches entwine, styled the Wood King.*
*The divine turtle controls the root, waxing and waning in turn.*
*Bright essence inwardly illumines; mysterious water spouts forth a bridge.*
*Bestowed the jade tablet’s script, inscribed in the Cloud Chamber.*
*Ingesting the moon’s flower, merging with the Perfected as one.*
*Flying immortal of the Purple Tenuity, ascending to pay court to the Supreme August."*

Upon finishing the incantation, bow twice toward the moon. Visualize the sun and moon seated or standing as they please within the immortal palace, where none but the Perfected of that time know the moon’s soul’s name. On overcast nights without moonlight, perform this indoors. The essential method, like the practice of ingesting moonlight, should be done nightly, and one will swiftly perceive the body emanating light, the eyes brimming with flying essence.

The essential method’s lunar days: the second, fourth, sixth, eighth, tenth, fourteenth, sixteenth, eighteenth, twentieth, twenty-second, and twenty-fourth—eleven times in a month—will likewise lead to transcendence. These are the days when yin essence flies and converges, the three *qi* overflow, the moon’s water crystallizes into flower, and the Yellow Spirit descends to connect. Practicing for eighteen years, the Upper Clarity will refine the hun and transmute the po, illumining them with jade light, riding the dark reins of radiance to soar through the great void.

*The Great Tenuity’s Talisman for Ingesting Moon Essence and the Mysterious Yin’s Birth*
*(Inscribed in yellow on azure silk)*

This talisman is ingested at midnight on the night of the moon’s waning, facing east. First, announce to the moon’s soul. At the time of ingestion, first take the *Opening Luminosity* talisman, then the moon talisman. Hold the breath, grasp the talisman in the left hand, and silently intone:

*"Purple Tenuity’s Yellow Script, named ‘Great Mystery.’*
*Summon the moon’s flowery water to nourish the po and harmonize the hun.*
*In the square’s midst, attend with reverence, issuing from the Mysterious Opening.*
*Concealing the sky and veiling the moon, the Five Spirit Ladies—*
*nine beams of flying light illumine the Muddy Pellet."*

Upon finishing the incantation, ingest the talisman.

The Dark Master, the Perfected Lord of the Azure Lad, prostrated himself and advanced on his knees before the Golden Gate’s August Lord, persistently entreating the Supreme Dao. At that moment, the Sage Lord pushed aside his desk, reclined, and suddenly sighed, saying: "Your earnest words hasten the mysterious; your sincerity has come to enlightenment. You have applied your heart to the utmost." Thereupon, he pointed to the earth’s bounds, moved by compassion. Then, taking up the cloud-hook zither, he strummed it. Its pure resonance gathered in emptiness, cascading into a hundred tones, jade vibrations echoing through the nine voids, piercing and illuminating the Great Empyrean. He sang the *Great Cavern’s Divine Continent* hymn, the *Congealing Hun* melody, the *Mysterious Eulogy’s* numinous verses—celestial rhythms of the subtle and inaudible, drinking in the luminous and impalpable *qi*, its harmonious sound pure and ethereal. The lyrics:

*"Mysterious emptiness, the Upper Clarity’s *qi*,*
*the Three Essences soaring with flowery radiance.*
*Profound resonance opens the spirit’s gate,*
*the Seven Portals’ feathered script takes flight.*
*Vast and open, gazing upon the Cinnabar Empyrean,*
*the limpid and desolate reveal the workings of the dark.*
*Those who awaken to the mysterious assembly*
*soar westward toward the Great Yang.*
*The empty terrace, the Great Cavern’s wilds,*
*the secluded and transcendent, the orchid’s brilliance.*
*Shedding the obscuring cloud-wheel,*
*the abandoned dwelling naturally connects to the dark.*
*In the lofty assembly at the Mysterious Dawn’s gate,*
*prostrate, pay court to the Jade August.*
*The spirit’s radiance responds to the numinous decree,*
*the empty drum resounds with the jade bell.*
*Nine reins loosen the cloud chariot,*
*carefree upon the Purple Rosy Peak.*
*The Cinnabar Mound opens the Azure Chamber,*
*the Green Court unfolds the Five Rooms.*
*The Golden Gate gleams with towering splendor,*
*the misty grove, the Upper Clarity’s palace.*
*Savor this sun and moon’s flower,*
*attain that formless method.*
*The mysterious reaches the Three Spirits’ awakening,*
*desolate amid the kalpa’s blade.*
*Why sit in the path’s midst,*
*the Five Difficulties riding your breast?*
*Why not mount the Red Infant,*
*ride my Muddy Pellet Lord?*
*Neither dying nor living,*
*neither beginning nor ending."*

When the Sage Lord finished singing, he invited the Azure Lad to be seated, offering the nectar of flowing rosy clouds, the fruit of linked steel, the white seeds of the *wei* tree, and the crimson wood’s azure fruit. Then he commanded the Five Elders, the Upper Perfected of the Immortal Capital’s Left Duke, to open the cloud-brocade pouch of purple pistil and jade slips, and present this sacred scripture, the *Purple Text’s Upper Canon*, to the Azure Lad.

Only those who bear the jade name of the Mystic Palace and ever serve as Perfected Ones may receive this transmission.

**Sun Lord’s Incantation**
At sunrise, form the Jade Emperor’s mudra with both hands, press palms together toward the sun, and recite the incantation:
*"Spirit of Yu Yi, true essence of radiance,
irrigate and imbibe the nine rays—Qian’s primal efficacy and steadfast virtue."*
After reciting, inhale qi through mouth and nose, swallow nine times, and guide it with intent to the cinnabar field. Repeat twice nine, thrice nine, up to nine times nine.
Then recite the incantation:
*"Oṃ Yu □□ Yù Yè Yuán Huī Vā □ Luó Jūn Nú Lí Pó Sà Hā."*
After reciting, draw qi and swallow as before.

Perform this at noon or before noon; do not practice after noon.

**Purple Radiance True Talisman of the Sun’s Soul in the Jade Purity Heaven**
Face northeast, recite the Three Lights’ single-character incantation once, inhale qi three times, and channel it to the tip of the brush. Then, following the dispersed form, recite the incantation and inscribe the three talismans:
*"Yu Lí Zhēn."*

**Moon Lord’s Incantation**
At moonrise, form the Jade Emperor’s mudra with both hands, press palms together toward the moon, and recite the incantation:
*"Lady Jie Lín, true essence of Kan’s position,
round and luminous with eight rays—auspicious primal flourishing."*
After reciting, draw qi and swallow as before, eight times, guiding it with intent to the cinnabar field, for approximately eight times eight, sixty-four repetitions.
Then recite the incantation:
*"Oṃ Jié Xīn □□ Hēng Zhào Làn Fú Yuè Luó □ Luó Pó Pó Sà Hā."*

**Ninefold Numinous Jade Talisman of the Moon’s Spirit in the Jade Purity Heaven**
Face northeast. Recite the incantation three times, inhale qi three times, and channel it to the tip of the brush. Then, following the dispersed form, recite the incantation and inscribe the talisman:
*"Jié Lín Kǎn."*

**Big Dipper Incantation**
When the stars appear, form the Jade Emperor’s mudra with both hands, press palms together toward the Big Dipper’s direction, and recite the incantation:
*"Oṃ, divine spirit of command, true essence of the Dipper’s pole,
flowing radiance of seven rays—Hūṃ! Chà! Congeal and solidify."*
After reciting, inhale qi through mouth and nose, swallow seven times, and guide it with intent to the cinnabar field, for approximately seven times seven repetitions.
Then recite the incantation:
*"Oṃ Oṃ Hūṃ Hūṃ, Mí Lí Náo Nà.
Pó Luó Xiū Lì, Oṃ Chà Lī □."*
After reciting, draw qi and swallow as before.

Perform this during the hours of *xū* and *hài*; do not practice at other times.

**Mysterious Essence Secret Talisman of the Big Dipper’s Upright Qi in the Jade Purity Heaven**
Face its direction, recite the incantation three times, inhale qi three times, and channel it to the tip of the brush. Then, following the dispersed form, recite the incantation and inscribe the talisman:
*"Oṃ Hūṃ Chà."*

The above methods are called *"Refining Form with the Three Lights."* Do not practice on yin days or during windy or cloudy weather.

After absorbing the qi of the Three Lights and completing the practice, click the teeth nine times and withdraw.

Every twenty-one days, the ritual officer forms the Dipper mudra with both hands, faces the Celestial Gate, steps the Big Dipper’s *gang*, turns to face south, ingests the Three Lights’ talisman, and recites the Emperor’s three-character secret name:
*"Dòng Qián Xuán, Tiān Mìng Cháng, Rén Héng Níng."*
Then bow twice and swallow the talisman with fresh water. Bow again and recite the general incantation:
*"Attending the Dao’s mysterious truth, blazing and majestic true spirits,
Yu Yi refines the body, Mars commands the form.
Red brightness harmonizes yang, governing prohibitions and numinous might.
Luminous and soaring, the Emperor’s doubled radiance,
the essence of *wù* and *jǐ*, the Central Star’s guardian.
Dispel and scatter evil qi, shatter and extinguish licentious essence.
Boil the seas they encounter, burn the wood they meet,
extinguish the fire they face, melt the metal they touch.
The Lord of Eternal Separation governs and commands all flight.
Mí Lí Nú Nà, Oṃ Oṃ Hūṃ Hūṃ.
Mí Lí Nú Nà, Oṃ Oṃ Hūṃ Hūṃ.
Encompassing the spread net, the Azure Lad of the Eastern Sea,
Mí Ní Nú Nà, Oṃ Oṃ Hūṃ Hūṃ.
Mí Ní Nú Nà, Oṃ Oṃ Hūṃ Hūṃ.
Mí Ní Nú Nà, Oṃ Oṃ Hūṃ Hūṃ.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Emperor’s statutes and commands decree!"*

**Numinous Scripture of Jade Sound Absorbing Heavenly Qi**
*"The ancestral Dao’s mysterious truth—*
as before."

The Mystic Master said: At sunrise, face the sun, first visualize the five viscera clearly, then silently recite the numinous chapter’s *Jade Sound Absorbing Qi Incantation* once while facing the sun. With mouth toward the sun, draw and swallow nine breaths. Recite the incantation again, close the eyes, and with a long nasal inhalation, silently count and swallow nine times. In each, visualize swallowing the sun’s nine-rayed purple radiance, descending into the cinnabar field in the form of the sun. The more repetitions before noon, the greater the merit; do not practice after noon.

Until the third night of the lunar month, at moonrise, follow the method for absorbing solar qi, swallowing ten times while visualizing ten rays of white light. After the twenty-third day, cease absorption.

Lunar qi is equal to solar qi, totaling ten thousand repetitions. Also visualize the moon’s form in the cinnabar field, merging with the sun to half its size.

In spring, first absorb the virtue of wood; in summer, fire; in autumn, metal; in winter, water; during the four seasons, when earth flourishes, absorb each in its proper color, totaling ten thousand repetitions.

Once every five days in a month, follow the *Cavern Scripture* method to absorb the purple qi from the Dipper ten thousand times, called the *"Outer Attendant Eightfold Jade Elixir."* After one thousand repetitions, divine light will appear and vanish at night. After two thousand repetitions, the entire body will radiate light.

After three thousand repetitions, the entire chamber will be filled with light. After four thousand repetitions, old illnesses, new ailments, scars, and blemishes will all vanish, and one’s complexion will revert to that of an infant. After five thousand repetitions, the Earth Bureau will erase one’s name from the register of the dead, and the Jade Clarity will inscribe one’s name in the ledger of the living, with a hundred spirits attending as guards. After six thousand repetitions, the entire body will radiate light, illuminating a hundred paces; at night, fine script may be read, ghosts and spirits will have no place to hide, and one will foreknow the yet-unmanifest. After seven thousand repetitions, one may blow life into all things and revive the dead. After eight thousand repetitions, by exhaling and reciting incantations over the five metals, they will transform into supreme treasures, their light forming perfect spheres. After nine thousand repetitions, the elixir will form like the sun, one’s face will take on a golden countenance, the bones will become refined and emit five fragrances, and the Three Heavens will record one as an immortal. After ten thousand repetitions, the Dao will be perfected, and one will attain the rank of Perfected.

*The Supreme Scripture of the Limitless Salvation of Humankind, Great Rites of the Numinous Treasure, Scroll Twenty-Three (conclusion)*
*The Supreme Scripture of the Limitless Salvation of Humankind, Great Rites of the Numinous Treasure, Scroll Twenty-Four*

**Chapter on Exhaling and Absorbing the True Qi**

The Scripture states: Draw qi thirty-two times.
It further states: The Jade Tone gathers qi, the numinous wind collects mist; the Purple Void flourishes in splendor, aiding the ten thousand immortals.

The Perfected Master says: The true qi of the Numinous Treasure is the true Dao-qi of the thirty-two heavens. Without absorbing this qi, internal cultivation will lack the foundation for success, and external practice will yield no responsive signs. To wander the higher Dao as an empty corpse or recite sacred scriptures as a lower ghost is to labor in vain.

The Black Qi of the Limitless Vow Oath Heaven.

The Perfected Master says: By pacing the *Well, Ghost, Willow, Star, Spread, Wing, Axle* constellations’ *gang* and absorbing the qi according to its color, the Heavenly Lords of the eight heavens will dispatch true immortals to attend and guard. One will be able to perceive all matters of the eight heavens with clarity and move without obstruction.

The Perfected Master says: First, knock the teeth nine times, then guide the qi from the Heavenly Gate into the Upper Primordial Net, flowing and extending to the corresponding lodging. Visualize each heaven as a palace of gold and jade, where the Heavenly Emperor sits enthroned, clad in robes matching the heaven’s color, exhaling the native qi like a dense, curling mist into the practitioner’s mouth. Follow the prescribed number for each, and for any petition, silently present it within the qi of the Emperor’s Mysterious Governance; the response will be immediate.

The *gang* of the Four Directions’ Brahman Heavens and the Central Dipper should be paced according to the day’s lodging, and practiced concurrently with the four heavens. (Diagram of the lodging configurations follows. Diagram omitted.)

The Scripture states: Within the true resides the spirit, the Great Lord of Longevity, the Peerless Duke, the Venerable White Prime, the Great One Controller of Destiny, and the Peach and Plum Union of Longevity.

The Perfected Master says: These two chapters contain the great Dao of the Supreme Cavern, the forbidden scriptures of the higher Dao, and the *Central Scripture of the Nine Perfected*. The Great Lord of Longevity presides over the transformations of the ten thousand spirits. When a person is born, the Great Tenuity descends with qi to generate life, and the form first emerges from the womb. After birth, thirty-six thousand spirits are complete, and when one’s lifespan reaches thirty-six thousand days, the spirits return to the Great Tenuity—this is called a ghost. "Ghost" means "return." If one incurs transgressions in life, depleting qi and scattering spirits, thus bringing about one’s own death and decay, one will not fulfill the heavenly years but die prematurely in infancy, for the spirits are incomplete. When spirits are incomplete, the form is not whole. Moreover, even a minor transgression deducts one *suan*, and the Northern Dipper seizes three days’ worth of spirits. A grave evil shortens life by a year, and three hundred sixty spirits and their qi are detained. A minor good deed adds one *suan*, extending life by three days and augmenting the spirits. A great merit adds a year to one’s lifespan, extending life by three hundred sixty days and bestowing blessings. Thus, the increase and decrease occur. These seven spirits are the yin spirits of the Northern Dipper, also called the Mysterious Elixir Great One, and are part of the higher Dao’s forbidden canon. To know this Dao is to augment the spirits and extend life, enduring for ten thousand kalpas.

**Eulogy of the Venerable Prime of Longevity:**
In the Central Heaven stands the Dipper, master of souls and spirits,
The Mysterious Elixir Great One, the seven yin spirits.
Holding the numinous banner, they command the hundred spirits,
Bestowing or seizing, judging good and evil, shaping increase and decrease.
One *suan* removes three days from life,
One year, three hundred sixty stops.
Those who know how to move the seven numina
Ascend into the Mysterious Heaven and open the seven gates.

The three hun souls dance and unite as one form,
A hundred spirits rejoice and return in full array.
How to attain this Dao? From the Primordial Valley fire rises, and the seven spirits take flight.
Straight they enter the Dipper to open the Mysterious Pass,
Bow twice and knock upon the space between heaven and earth.
Return to the origin, expel evil and rebellion, erase the name of death,
Summon spirits to augment one’s allotted years and preserve life’s completion.
One may divide the body into billions,
Or reverse the bones to attain celestial immortality.
Silent within and without, all things forgotten,
The ape and horse die as yin returns to yang.
This Dao is secret and not rashly transmitted;
Guard it for a hundred kalpas and abide forever.
Inscribe your name in gold and present it to the Three Heavens—
Careless disclosure seals you forever in the river’s source.
Simply guard the heart to make stone firm;
In a hundred days, the spirits are whole and the root of life revives.

**The Flying Mysterious Purple Qi Chapter**
The Mysterious Master said: The root of the thirty-two heavens lies in the Primordial Record of the Western Tortoise Mountain. Within it is the *Cinnabar Yellow Flying Mysterious Purple Text*, the *Empty Cavern Numinous Scripture*. The Color Realm Demon King said: "I possess the Cavern Scripture—this is precisely that text."

The Flying Mysterious Purple Qi congeals the root of spirit,
Weaving the net of jade numina to govern the ten thousand spirits.
In the void it surges and coalesces naturally,
Above lie the towering twelve transmissions.
Jade towers soar, radiant with luminous clouds,
Flowing essence and purple palaces girded with golden chariots.
Jasper halls gleam, encircling the eight transcendent realms,
Within dwell the Nine Azure Gold Immortals.
The Cinnabar August Mother governs essence and extension,
Flying azure feathers and morning infants crowned.
Holding jade tablets and grasping numinous banners,
Five-colored life-demons face the imperial honored ones.
Grasping talismanic registers at the Gate of Life,
They chew the sun and moon, sip from the nectar springs.
The Net of Separation emits radiance to refine the five hun souls,
Internally replete and externally overflowing, the Crimson Palace rejoices.
Golden light shines brilliantly, the form perfectly round,
From the new moon it enters gold, its hue pure and unblemished.
Only the Enlightened One understands these words—
Five days and ten months, essence matches the origin.
Then one beholds the Flowery Canopy leading the immortal lords,
Purple qi swirls leftward, linked with the Dipper.
Passing through twenty-eight degrees, it enters the Golden Gate—
This is where the Cinnabar August One reviews the ten thousand immortals.
Those who clearly grasp this formula and add diligence,
Refining the form and contemplating the secret, must keep it distinct.
When wondrous visions respond and the essential text is obtained,
Guard it for three years to ensure long preservation.
After nine years, ascend the void in feathered skirts,
Phoenix robes lightly soaring to Mount Dragon.
Bowing and rising, the Nine Numinous Ones pay homage to the Jade Emperor.

**Method of Practice:**
In cultivating this Dao, calculate one year by twelve months. Each month, on the third, fifth, ninth, fifteenth, and twenty-fifth days—five times monthly—
Observe purity rites and chant the Mysterious Text once.
After midnight, gaze upward toward the Golden Gate in the west, as if in the human realm.
If the sky is overcast and lightless, perform this within your chamber,
Silently reciting and inwardly contemplating as prescribed.
Visualize purple clouds arising from the left side of the Golden Gate,
Passing through the Winnowing Basket and Dipper, circling the Northern Dipper,
Then returning to the Golden Gate above—each detail must be vivid.
Upon completing the visualization, bow to the purple clouds four times and click the teeth thrice.
Raise your head and pray:
*"Heavenly qi is bright and clear, the hidden void reveals the true.
Flowing qi lingers, golden blossoms in four transcendent realms.
The Cinnabar August One spreads radiance, numinous flight on cloud chariots.
This night unfolds the array, the Azure Gold receives immortality.
Fulfill my supreme vow, the body responds to nature.
Bind life to the moon’s essence, preserve life at the sun’s root.
Three numina merge with the luminous, the luminous halts at Dragon Mountain.
In the secret night, pure and unveiled, I request as these words."*
After the prayer, draw purple qi through the nose and swallow it twenty-eight times, then cease.

Practice this for three years, and omens of divine immortals will descend to your chamber.
Your body will be enveloped in purple clouds and rosy mist, your name inscribed in the Nine Heavens.
After nine years, you will surely attain immortality.

The Mysterious Master said: Heaven possesses the qi of purple clouds, intersecting with the sun, moon, and five luminaries, and the divisions of the Northern Dipper. In every region and kingdom where this alignment occurs, there are those who attain the Dao and become immortal lords. Once understood, await the sign’s appearance—when you behold the purple clouds, perform the rites and prayers as described, not merely on ordinary days. With diligent intent, you will succeed in summoning the clouds, and ascension will follow.

Moreover, when purple clouds and yellow qi linger in mountain valleys like carpets or canopies—whether red, white, yellow, azure, purple, crimson, or golden, or five-colored clouds radiating brilliance with rosy mist on all sides—these are the Celestial Honored One and Supreme Emperor on their processions. Where they appear in mountain valleys, there dwell those who have attained the Dao. You should go there to cultivate and refine. If you glimpse the Celestial Honored One or Perfected Persons, swiftly burn incense, bow twice, and state your heart’s vow. With diligent practice, you will surely behold the imperial countenance and immediately achieve ascension. Seal this within your heart; do not lightly reveal it to others. If the Dao is divulged, its numen scatters, and immortality cannot be attained. Follow the example of Master Yin of Wen Shi, who served the Sage Lord of the Golden Portal as his standard. You should be cautious and strive to practice.

**The Three Ones’ Mysterious Subtleties Chapter**
The Lord of the Nine Empyreans said: The Three Ones are the pivot of creation and transformation. They are not exclusive to the supreme elixir but are also inherently present and complete within the human body. If one can cultivate the Three Ones within the body, then mother and child will not separate, spirit and qi will naturally guard each other, harmonious and warm, radiant and luminous.

Have you not seen the full moon at midday? When the wind is still, no clouds stir, not even the finest gauze moves, and the azure sky is limpid and clear—how could there be any obstruction? The same is true for humans. If one can harmonize the Three Ones, then myriad thoughts will not arise, merging with the qi of the azure sky. Internally and externally luminous, one becomes one with the void and may ascend.

Some in the world may have furtively heard of this Dao, mistaking it for qi ingestion—puffing the cheeks to forcefully swallow through the nose and mouth. This can lead to sudden death, much like mistakenly taking poison in medicine, an irredeemable error. The Three Ones within the body are no different from the supreme elixir; the secret formula must not be lightly transmitted.

The Mysterious Master said: The Supreme One, the Emperor Lord of the Nine Heavens, is named *Xuantian* and styled *Sanyuan*.

One is styled *Bowushang*, another *Boshihua*, wielding the Tiger Talisman of the Divine, sealed within a blue jade casket. To the right stands the Imperial Minister, named *Zhao Qinjing*, styled *Zhong Xuansheng*. One is called *Qifei*, another *Changfu*. Within the *Great Cavern Sutra*’s purple jade casket, he commands twelve thousand celestial immortals and their steeds. Their foremost leader stands nine inches and nine fen tall, clad in a purple brocade robe embroidered with gold, crowned with a dark-jeweled coronet, seated upon a seven-jeweled throne. At times, he rides a nine-dragon chariot, roaming the Three Realms, bearing the Heavenly Treasure Brazier in hand to govern and transform the Jade Clarity. The Supreme *Xuan* Venerable has two great ministers, together forming a triad. The left minister is titled *Xuan Yi Dao Lord*, his head clad in azure, his robes azure. The right minister is titled *Taihe Old Master*, his head clad in white, his robes white. These two spirits are the hun and po of the Dao.

The Supreme One Emperor Lord resides in the *Niwan* Palace of the brain. There is a solar emblem, round and nine inches across, its crimson light and purple rays surging ten thousand *zhang* into the sky. Above it hangs the Dipper, its handle pointing forward, resembling an infant clad in red brocade. The incantation reads:

*Interflowing divine qi, spirit nourishing marrow.*
*Absorb my radiant essence, divine qi fills and fulfills,*
*Body glowing with luminous freshness.*

**Upper Prime Perfected One Talisman**

The Mysterious Master said: The Middle Prime Emperor One True Youth is named *Shenyunzhu*, styled *Zinan Dan*. One is called *Shengshang Bo*, another *Shiyunju*. He holds the Fire Star Talisman, sealed within a jade casket. To his right stands the Assistant Minister, named *Zhong Guangjian*, styled *Sihua Ling*. One is called *Youche Bo*, another *Chong Shihua*. He bears the Bright Moon Pearl, commanding ten thousand divine immortals and their steeds. Their foremost leader stands six inches and six fen tall, clad in a cinnabar brocade robe, crowned with a nine-phoenix coronet, seated upon a seven-jeweled throne. At times, he rides a nine-unicorn chariot, roaming the Ten Directions, bearing a golden brazier in hand to govern and transform. The Supreme Clarity Middle One Prime Venerable has two great ministers. The left is titled *Perfected One*, the right *Guangjian*, entering the *Jiowei* three inches within the body. The heart is like a lotus, within which lies a solar emblem, its crimson flames surging into the sky. The Emperor Lord is clad in a cinnabar brocade robe, seated within the solar emblem. The prayer reads:

*Scatter radiance, Red Child,*
*Return the hun, restore the po,*
*Revert the old to infant youth,*
*Cross life’s threshold, turn back years,*
*Preserve life without end.*

**Middle Prime Perfected One Talisman**

The Mysterious Master said: The Lower Prime Emperor One Primordial King is named *Shiming Jing*, styled *Guxia Xuan*. One is called *Infant Womb*, another *Bo Shiyuan*. He holds the *Golden Star Great Possession Sutra*, sealed within a yellow jade casket. To his right stands the Assistant Minister Perfected One, named *Guishang Ming*, styled *Guxia Xuan*. One is called *Fengshen Bo*, another *Chengguang Sheng*. He bears the Bright Moon Pearl, commanding eleven thousand earthly immortals and their steeds. Their foremost leader stands five inches and five fen tall, clad in a yellow brocade robe, crowned with a nine-dragon *Yuanyou* coronet, seated upon a seven-jeweled throne. At times, he rides a five-colored lion chariot, patrolling the Five Peaks, bearing a fragrant treasure brazier in hand to govern and transform. The Grand Clarity Lower One Prime King has two great ministers: to the left, *You Jing*; to the right, the Imperial Minister. They enter the three inches below the navel, the Lower Cinnabar Field. There is a lunar emblem, golden in hue, filling the Cinnabar Field. The Primordial King is clad in a yellow brocade robe, resembling an infant, seated within the lunar emblem. From his mouth issues the chant:

*Jade stem, white pearl fluid,*
*Congeals to form the White Spirit.*
*Nurture the form with the Five Elders’ talisman,*
*Extract the register from the Emperor One’s chariot.*
*The Gate of Life must not tilt,*
*The golden fluid must not err.*
*Return the essence, fill the White to repletion,*
*Let not the Jade Spring leak.*
*Life and death both arise therefrom—*
*Seal it, and become a divine immortal.*

The prayer reads:

*Purge the filth and turbidity, cast out the old, absorb the new.*
*Engender my Five Elders, the Emperor Perfected transforms the form.*
*Transform the bones and marrow, the intestines become sinews.*
*Golden bones, jade marrow, accord with the Dao, accord with the Perfected.*
*Spontaneous transformation, longevity without end.*
*Forever with the Three Treasures, together preserve the root of life.*

**Lower Prime Perfected One Talisman**

From midnight to the *si* hour, visualize the Upper Prime Perfected One. From noon to the *you* hour, visualize the Middle Prime. From dusk to midnight, visualize the Lower Prime. With prolonged visualization, the Perfected Ones will manifest in form, converse with you, traverse stars and cross moons, review memorials and petitions, and teach you the arts of penetrating the mysterious. As for the Three Ones’ supreme Dao: one must not harbor anger or indulge in lust. Anger causes the Three Ones to depart and vanish; lust prevents the work from succeeding. One must not hold newborn infants, for their residual impure qi has not yet dissipated, and contact would offend the Dao of the Three Ones. Whether moving, staying, sitting, or reclining, one should constantly visualize them.

**The Three Ones’ Mysterious and Subtle Essentials**

The Mysterious Master said: To attain the wonders of the mysterious and subtle, one must practice in stillness. On the spring equinox, at midnight during the *zi* hour, rise and face east, close the eyes, and visualize the Three Ones’ ministers within your body, along with the seven who accompany you—yourself at the center—all riding the purple cloud’s mist to ascend the *Yangming* of the Northern Dipper, the eastern spirit of the Dipper. Then visualize entering the star’s center and sitting there, swallowing purple qi thirty times. With prolonged practice, you will naturally perceive the *Yangming Dongyuan Taishang* Palace, wherein resides the *Qingxuan* Youth, who bestows upon you the true qi. First, visualize the purple qi beneath the Northern Dipper, as thick as a bowstring, descending straight before you from the star. Then visualize the Three Ones’ *Zhoujun* oral instructions, the seven persons among the Dipper’s seven stars, together ascending the *Yangming*’s grand procession. The central star of the Dipper covers your head with the *Kui* and points the handle forward. Swallow the purple qi thirty times, visualizing yourself ingesting it. Also imagine the Three Ones’ ministers swallowing it simultaneously. After swallowing, further visualize the seven persons following the purple qi’s descent from the palace back to your own palace. After a long while, recite the prayer:

*Three Venerables, Supreme Perfected,*
*Great Mysterious Lofty Spirits.*

The *Yangming* governs spring, and the ten thousand youths begin their procession. The *Danyuan* governs summer, where vermilion and purple merge in mist. The *Yinjing* governs autumn, and the Celestial Might arrays six formations. The *Beiji* governs winter, where the ten thousand evils and treacheries are blocked. The Five Lands hold the *ren*, *wu*, and *ji* as the Celestial Gates. All that they strike is destroyed; none dare oppose their advance. They refine my seven *po*, harmonize my three *hun*, generate my five viscera, and cause my Yang Perfected to flourish. Ascending to fly in the *Shangqing*, I drift upon the radiance of the Seven Origins. Abiding in eternal life, I command the thousand spirits with a whistle. You too may rest, visualizing this across the four seasons, reciting this single incantation.

*The Supreme Treasure Chapter of the Great Ultimate*
The *Supreme Treasure Chapter* was transmitted by the Most High to the Supreme Thearch, the Supreme Thearch to the Celestial Thearch, the Celestial Thearch to the Thearch of the *Taiwei* Heaven, the Thearch of the *Taiwei* Heaven to the Thearch of the Golden Portals, and the Thearch of the Golden Portals to the Azure Lad of the Eastern Sea, who sealed it to govern the famous mountains and summon and command the Five Peaks. Inscribe it in vermilion upon white silk and wear it upon the left elbow; do not treat it with carelessness or defilement. After wearing it for eight years, the Three Ones will all appear.

On the first day of the first lunar month, inscribe a talisman in blue-green ink, face north, bow twice, and swallow it. After the Three Ones appear together, use gold as the material, nine inches in length, four inches in width, and six *fen* in thickness; carve and inscribe it to seal the malevolent spirits of mountains and rivers and to command the true essences of the Five Peaks.

When the Three Primordial Lords of the Three Origins arrive, you must comprehend the proper application and moderation—this is the Dao of the divine and the true. To ingest the talisman, face north, click the teeth thirty-six times, then raise your head and recite the incantation:

*"Three Perfected guard the chamber,
Primordial Elders secure the essence.
Heaven and Earth merge as one,
Three qi intermingle.
The August Lord wields his authority,
His command seals the spirits.
Summon the mountains, call forth the seas,
Crush and annihilate the myriad spirits.
Hasten to invoke the Northern Emperor,
Array the names of demons.
Bind and govern all without exception,
Swiftly return to the ghostly camp."*

Recite again:
*"Supreme Ultimate August Lord,
Three Primordial True Ones.
Azure Lad of the Eastern Sea,
Deliver and reveal to the beholder.
Wear, ingest, and swallow,
Penetratingly perceive ghosts and spirits.
Mountains, rivers, and the Five Peaks,
All submit to my command.
Wear it forever,
The Cavernous Chapter soars through the Dipper."*

*The True Talisman of the Three Ones of the Supreme Treasure Chapter*
With the left hand’s middle finger pressed into the palm and the thumb pressing the *zi* mark, wear the talisman on the right to seal mountains and summon seas, to govern the myriad spirits, to command birds and beasts, to subjugate celestial soldiers, and to traverse the Five Peaks. At such times, first click the teeth thirty-six times, visualize the Seven Stars covering your head, and exhale red *qi* to crown a city, surrounding it on all sides, burning within and without until nothing remains. See yourself standing at the center of the fire, and in an instant, the divine officials of the Five Peaks and the beasts of the mountains and wilds will come to pay homage. Then recite the incantation:

*"The Primordial Beginning issues the decree,
Proclaiming to the myriad spirits.
The Heavenly Perfected August Lord
Is born with the qi.
From below, all are governed,
All return to the Supreme Clarity.
Should any fail to comply,
Their true forms shall be seized.
Seal the mountains, summon the seas,
Respond to the command and collapse.
Hasten to submit,
Linger not in delay.
Swift as the true law,
Do not transgress the dark realms."*

Afterward, swallow the *qi* thirty-six times and await the decree.

*Edict of the Three Ones and the Primordial Spirit*
Three bodies as one are my transformations; the Three Ones are the gods of the original unity, each born of my own primordial spirit. If one body is not true, the other two are false. If the True One is not truly visualized, my two other spirits are also false and unreal. The Three Ones and the Primordial King need not be visualized, for they are natural transformations inherent in every person. If the visualization is not true, it becomes the "horse of thought." With a single thought, transformations occur in an instant. As the scripture says: "Each time you visualize, a spirit departs; unknowingly, each day diminishes." This is the meaning.

For those cultivating the Dao of Celestial Immortality and practicing the Orthodox Rites of the Jade Clarity, on the days of the Six *Jia* and Six *Ding*, calm the mind, stabilize the spirit, enter seclusion at the four hours of *zi*, *wu*, *mao*, and *you*, burn incense, and inscribe the talisman of the day in vermilion. Visualize the divine generals and jade maidens of the day, face north, and swallow it. Settle the thoughts, sit upright, close the eyes, clench the fists, and envision the five true *qi* of the Five Directions—radiant and yang—descending from the Great Void, directly entering your body through the *Niwan* Palace, swirling nine times, then entering the Crimson Palace to merge with the Imperial Abode. Next, descend into the Kunlun (the navel), where your Three Ones and the three *qi*—blue-green, yellow, and white—of the true spirits blend into one. In an instant, they naturally ascend and descend. After a year of practice, the three *qi* and the myriad spirits will appear, and your body will respond to transformations, reaching everywhere.

Then step the *Gang* of the Twenty-Eight Constellations, invite the *qi* of the Thirty-Two Heavens into the Cinnabar Field, and coalesce the Thirty-Two Jade Characters, ascending to the *Niwan* Palace and the various heavens to transform into the myriad spirits. You may then use the *Chapter for Governing and Summoning the Myriad Spirits* to issue decrees to the Three Realms, and with the *Chapter of the Three Mysterious Qi in Flight*, submit memorials to the Heavenly Ministries. Through the ritual of memorials and prostrations, divine transformations will swiftly manifest, and nothing will be denied.

For those cultivating the Dao of Celestial Immortality and practicing the Orthodox Rites of the Jade Clarity, on the birthday corresponding to your life’s fate, sit upright, regulate the breath evenly, close the mouth, exhale, and with the heart-spirit guide the *qi* to the root, reaching the life’s origin. Inhale to the stem, ascend along the spine to the *Niwan* Palace, and maintain continuity. If the visualization is not diligent, wait until the breath is even and settled, allowing it to move naturally. After three days, the light will whiten the eyebrows. After seven days, the spirit will congeal, and you will become serene. After ten days, the spirit will attain flight, suddenly appearing before you, and you will hear the sounds of immortals—wind and rain—in your ears. Knock on the Mysterious Pass to open the Three Palaces; over time, the Three Fields will gestate treasures, and you may refine the divine elixir.

For those cultivating the Dao of Celestial Immortality and practicing the Orthodox Rites of the Jade Clarity, on the day of the Primordial Spirit, at the four hours of *zi*, *wu*, *mao*, and *you*, gaze at yourself in a large mirror, close your mouth, and visualize without error. On the *jiazi* day at the *zi* hour, face south, click the teeth, and beat the Heavenly Drum, each thirty-six times. Fold your hands, sit upright, regulate the breath evenly, and as before, visualize your body entering the Lower Cinnabar Field within the white *qi*, about one *cun* and two *fen*, like an infant. Gradually ascend to the spleen, pass through the Florid Canopy, cross the Double Towers, traverse the two Golden Chambers, enter the *Niwan* Palace, and stand atop the crown. Visualize purple *qi* and yellow mist swirling and covering you. Then slowly step forward to stand before your face, envisioning yourself as a one- or two-year-old child, as if your own child—do not glance at other matters, lest your focus be seized by external phenomena. Then visualize yourself soaring upward, entering through the *Niwan* Palace and the crown, descending through the two chambers, crossing the Double Towers, and returning to the Cinnabar Field—this completes one cycle. In daily practice, whether moving or still, guide the *qi* with the spirit, visualize the Three Ones and the True Lords, and after a month, practice at the *zi* and *wu* hours. After a month, gradually visualize the spirit growing to match your body’s size, coming and going, walking, and conversing with others.

Begin by holding the breath as if dwelling within the womb, which will hasten the attainment of efficacy. After one hundred days, visualize yourself ascending in feathered robes to pay homage to the Primordial. For those who cultivate the Dao of celestial immortality, the form and *qi* become inwardly complete, moving in and out without obstruction. In a single thought, one may ascend to the Great Void or wander among the Five Peaks, all without hindrance. In all such ascents and petitions to the Three Clarities, the Nine Heavens, and the celestial realms of the myriad heavens, summon the true immortal officials, the *ding*-*jia* generals, jade maidens, golden youths, and functionary messengers recorded in the received registers of the method—along with the three *qi* and the true spirits within the body.
