In profound stillness, they merge with the Void, ascending to the Nine Heavens, where spirit unites with the Dao and *qi* transforms into the True.

On days of practice, inscribe the vermilion talisman and swallow it. Then invoke and visualize the spirits, calming the mind and stilling thoughts until form and *qi* fully harmonize. The host of spirits and the three officials of the body’s true spirits merge in wondrous transformation. The heart unites with the Great Void, and the myriad spirits fill the body. In a single thought, all becomes luminously clear, and one ascends to pay homage. The Three Realms respond at will, and all petitions are answered without fail.

First swallow the talisman, then summon the spirits in accordance with its decree. Visualize the Supreme Ministers, the Grand Chancellors, the Supreme Assistants, the Supreme Protectors, the True Lords, the Immortal Lords, the Marquises, and the Ministers—all wearing *longjin* hats, sable caps, crimson robes, and jade pendants. Next, visualize the true officials and immortal officials bowing and rising, wearing caps, azure robes, jade tablets, and shoes. Then summon the six *jia* and six *ding* great generals, clad in golden armor and helmets, bearing brocade banners. Next, summon the six *ding* and six *jia* jade maidens, adorned in phoenix crowns and feathered robes, holding mirrors. Then summon the six *jia* and six *ding* golden youths, dressed in blue-green garments with double topknots, bearing texts. Next, summon the divine messengers of the *yunshen huidao* functionaries, wearing dark caps and crimson robes, holding texts. Finally, summon the divine messengers of the *yunshen feixuan* functionaries, donning black headscarves with sashes and forehead bands in blue-green, yellow, and red, dressed in brocade robes and carrying fish-tail blades. Each of the above comprises twelve persons.

Then calm the mind, still all thoughts, harmonize the breath, and extinguish distractions until profound stillness is achieved. Thereafter, summon the myriad spirits to enter from the lower Cinnabar Field, merging with one’s own spirit; proceed to the middle Cinnabar Field to merge with the Cinnabar True; and ascend to the upper Cinnabar Field to merge with the Emperor Lord—all in accordance with the method within the three *qi*. The Supreme Ministers and immortal officials emerge from the Upper Prime, standing in attendance in the upper region. From the left and right, the generals of the blue-green *qi*, the jade maidens, and the golden youths emerge from the Middle Prime, standing in the middle region, while the functionary messengers of the yellow *qi* emerge from the Lower Prime, standing in the lower region. From the left and right of the white *qi*, one’s own spirit emerges from the Purple Gate, forgetting form and merging with the Great Void. Then, with a single thought, ascend to pay homage to the Three Realms at will, or wander among the Five Peaks, making prayers and declarations without obstruction. All petitions are answered, spirits are set in motion, and the Dao is joined—submitting secret memorials with the *Nine Numinous Flying Steps*.

*The Great Method of the Supreme Scripture of Limitless Salvation, Scroll Twenty-Four, Concluded*
*The Great Method of the Supreme Scripture of Limitless Salvation, Scroll Twenty-Five*
*Chapter on the Inner Homage to the Three Luminaries*

The Mysterious Master said: Those who cultivate the great method but have not yet fully comprehended the majestic transformations of the celestial perfected may be assailed by demonic trials, causing the spirits and deities to show no reverence, and their summons to go unanswered. They should practice the method of inner homage to the Three Luminaries and the Dao of flying immortals with divided forms.

During the *chen*, *xu*, *chou*, and *wei* hours, pay homage to the Central Prime Controller of Destiny within the heart, whose name is *Xuanjian*, the Great Lord of the Central Ultimate. Below, he resides in the spleen, which is the Jade Hall Palace—also called the Jade Chamber—where the Lord of the Great One reposes, governing the nourishment of the body’s form and substance. During these four hours, knock the teeth five times, and visualize the spleen filled with yellow *qi*, within which a true person appears, like a newborn infant, clad in yellow robes and cap. Call out: *"Central Ultimate Xuanjian, Great Lord of the Great One, I seek the Dao of the True Person, the immortals, and the Yellow Court."* Repeat this five times, then lie down, close the eyes, and meditate for fifty breaths.

This Central Controller of Destiny is the Venerable Lord who transforms into the Emperor Lord of the Great One, the father of the gods born in the Nine Heavens, who governs the Palace of the Great Ultimate. Those who know him will not enter hell; jade youths and maidens attend him, and the myriad spirits serve at his command.

During the *yin*, *mao*, *wu*, and *shen* hours, pay homage to the Upper Prime Spirit Lord of the Great One, known as the Old Man of the Southern Ultimate, who resides in the Palace of the Great One, governing the body’s ethereal and corporeal souls, the womb spirits, the life *qi*, and the father of the fetal palace. During these four hours, knock the teeth nine times, and visualize a space one *cun* directly above the head, called the Palace of the Great Ultimate—also known as the Palace of the Great One—filled with red and yellow *qi*. Within the *qi* appears a true person, like a child, dressed in crimson robes. Call out: *"Southern Ultimate Yuanlao, Spirit Lord of the Great One, I seek the Dao of the divine elixir, long life, and immortality."* Repeat this nine times, then lie down, close the eyes, and meditate for ninety breaths. Those who cultivate this will prolong their years without dying, attain the transformations of immortals, dispel demonic trials, and summon true immortals.

During the *zi*, *you*, *si*, and *hai* hours, pay homage to the Lower Prime Mysterious Dao Mother, who resides in the Double Union Palace—the kidneys, which correspond to the Southern Ultimate above, hence called the Northern Ultimate. She governs the body’s essence and *qi*, and is the mother of the registers of life and death. During these four hours, knock the teeth four times, and visualize white *qi* between the kidneys, within which a divine tortoise appears, bearing a mysterious woman in blue-white robes, like a newborn girl. To her left stands the Controller of Records, a celestial official in white robes; to her right, the Controller of Destiny, a celestial official in blue-green robes. Call out: *"Lower Prime Yuan Shen, Northern Ultimate Mysterious Dao Mother, named Xuanmiao, I seek the golden liquor and jade nectar for sustenance. I beseech you to command the Controllers of Records and Destiny to erase my name from the register of death and inscribe it in the register of long life, and to dispatch the six *ding* jade maidens to prepare the traveling kitchen."* Repeat this four times, then lie down, close the eyes, and meditate for forty breaths.

Daily practice must not be neglected, for over months and years, its responsive efficacy knows no bounds. After nine years, one may ascend as a Grand Supreme Immortal Minister; even within a single year, faint traces of attainment appear, and spirits and gods are summoned at will, with every desire answered without fail. Maintain a steadfast heart, guard against recklessness, and be especially mindful of speech—thus may one attain immortality in due time. This is the practice of the Three Sovereign Lords of the Cavernous Mystery, the esoteric mechanism of the *Lingbao* tradition, to be performed only after pledging before heaven and informing one’s master.

**Lingbao Silent Audience: Refining the Crown Chapter**
At the three hours of *yin*, *wu*, and *xu* each day, enter the oratory, form the Jade Clarity mudra with both hands, and visualize oneself as a transcendent crane in the method of the White Crane Immortal. Envision the Gate of Heaven opening, from which a white crane descends. Next, visualize riding the white crane, soaring effortlessly to the summit of the Three Heavens, where the Primordial Beginning’s crown emits nine-colored golden light, pouring into one’s own crown. Imagine one’s body, with its myriad apertures, radiating light that illuminates the ten directions of the cosmos. Upon completion, remount the white crane and return to one’s original abode. Thus does one receive the Lingbao’s most arcane and profound oral instructions from the Primordial Beginning. For petitions or supplications, prostrate upon the jade steps and present the memorial in the same manner as above.

Before visualization, first refine the crown with the mudra to open the Gate of Heaven, then perform the divine transformation incantation:
*"Jin zha! Jin zha! Great Power’s Crown-Refining Mudra—left hand."*
This is the oral instruction personally transmitted by the Primordial Beginning to the Wondrous Practitioner of Realized Conduct and the Heavenly Perfected Sovereign for their ascension. It must not be lightly disclosed.

The Sovereign said: The *Lingbao* Dao is most luminous and easily understood, most essential and perfectly fitting. When transmitted to the right person for reception and upholding, how could one not command the reverence of the myriad spirits and expect imminent ascension?

**Receiving and Wielding the Staff Chapter**
The Sovereign said: The *Lingbao* Dao possesses a divine staff of spiritual potency, by which the gods of the Six Heavens are awed and the myriad spirits of the Three Realms are commanded. At a propitious day, within the oratory of a sacred mountain’s grotto-heaven, blessed site, or numinous altar, gather a single stalk of sweet bamboo, six feet in length, with twelve nodes. On the third node from the top, carve a bend on each side; in the hollow of the curve above, inscribe the sun and moon, and below, the Dipper’s form. Bore a cavity at the crown and insert the Central Guardian’s talisman. Below the second node, bore four cavities and insert the Four Directions’ Guardian talismans. Seal with wax and mark the four directions.

Below the third node, carve the *Ten Directions Lingbao Eternal Transformation Heavenly Worthy*. Beginning on the first day, follow the ten cyclical days, recite the incantation, and draw the *qi* of the five directions. Face each direction in turn, recite the incantation, and blow the *qi* upon the staff. Each night, engage in visualization; after a full year, when the *qi* is sufficient, the staff may be employed.

**Method of Use:**
Knock the teeth thirty-six times, and visualize the Five Emperors’ Direct Attendants, one for each direction, each accompanied by five-colored light flowing and shimmering upon the staff. Envision the Five Emperors’ Jade Maidens, one for each, standing in attendance to the staff’s left and right. Recite the incantation:
*"Mountain of the Great Yang, primordial essence of the Primordial Beginning.
Opening heaven and unfurling earth, sweet bamboo channels the numinous.
Direct Attendants and Guardian Clerks, marshaling divine soldiers.
Five colors flow and shimmer, crimson robes and golden tassels.
Assisting the Perfected Ascended, emerging from darkness and entering the unseen.
Summoning the heavens, the heavens bow; subduing the earth, the earth welcomes.
Pointing at ghosts, ghosts perish; demons and malevolent spirits are bound in form.
Divine talisman and numinous staff, awe and command the hundred directions.
With me they are perfected, with me they are born.
After ten thousand kalpas, they replace my form.
Governed by the Five Liberations, the spirit ascends to the Upper Clarity.
By the talisman’s decree and command, none dare disobey."*

Upon completing the incantation, draw the *qi* of the five directions and swallow thirty-six times. Point the staff toward heaven, and the celestial gods will render homage. Point it toward earth, and the terrestrial gods will receive and welcome. Point it toward the northeast, and the myriad ghosts will be bound in form. Point it to shatter hell, and the deceased souls will return to life. Point it at calamities and misfortunes, and they will collapse at the gesture. The Way of the Five Liberations consists of the true *qi* of the Five Phases, seizing the balance of the Northern Dipper, escaping the fetters of death, achieving liberation through the corpse, and ascending as a spirit to the Upper Clarity.

**Eastern Guardian’s Talisman**
Nine figures for the East, inscribed in blue with black above.

**Southern Guardian’s Talisman**
Three figures for the South, inscribed in cinnabar with blue above.

**Western Guardian’s Talisman**
Seven figures for the West, inscribed in white with yellow above.

**Northern Guardian’s Talisman**
Five figures for the North, inscribed in black with white above.

**Central Guardian’s Talisman**
Twelve figures for the Center, inscribed in yellow with red above.

**Chapter on Concealing Traces and the Five Liberations**
The Mysterious Master said: At Moonwave Stream on Mount Green City, at Dragon Gate, one encounters the Venerable One and together pays homage to the Perfected. The Master secretly transmits the Five Methods of Liberation, which must not be lightly disclosed nor recklessly imparted to those who are impious or unprincipled. If the spirit conceals and vanishes, shedding the mortal to transcend the mundane, none shall perceive its form—this is called the method of concealment.

The Five Liberations correspond to Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, and Earth. They are the means to receive the *qi* of Heaven and Earth’s yin and yang, to grasp the mechanism of Heaven and Earth’s transformations, and to steal the rhythm of yin and yang’s *qi*, practicing them frequently in daily use. For those who seek the Great Dao yet remain bound by life and death, when encountering the calamities of one’s destined epoch, when baleful stars descend, or when demonic tribulations assail the true and unwitting, to escape the appointed hour of death and rebirth, one must skillfully employ this method—its numinous efficacy defies description.

**Metal Liberation**
On a *gengzi* day, take an ancient ingot or halberd weighing twelve taels and forge it into a ruler one *chi* in length. In a purified chamber, purify the body. At the first watch of the night, place the ruler on the ground one *zhang* and two *chi* before the bed. Wait until the *zi* hour, first cleansing oneself, then drink a cup of frankincense and borneol water. Strike the teeth twenty-four times, visualize the ruler as one’s own form, and ensure no sound reaches one’s ears. Silently recite the sacred incantation seven times. Once done, place the ruler beneath a felt mat, allowing no one to see it. Perform this visualization for forty-nine days. Upon completion, when ready to use it, tie a white silk thread to the ruler and swiftly cast it down before fleeing without looking back. While reciting the incantation, also spray borneol and frankincense water onto the ruler. Recite the incantation and draw seven mouthfuls of *qi* from the auspicious direction onto the ruler. The subsequent four methods follow this pattern.

The incantation states:

The Three Terraces give birth to me and transmit the Dharma,
The Three Terraces protect me and ascend as immortals.
Communicating past karma, the ruler severs responses,
Restoring my original form to its fundamental essence.
Swiftly, swiftly, as □□□□□□□ decrees.

**Wood Release**
On a *jiazi* day, take a branch from a fallen red pear tree, as long as oneself. On the day of use, cleanse the body and proceed as in the method above. Complete forty-nine days. At the time of use, place it on the ground without looking back, gaze upward at the sun and depart, never glancing at the form.

The incantation states:
Branch-wave-draw, crow-fish-wave-draw, *ka*□-wave-draw,
Three Terraces birth-body-draw.
On this day, the birth-body crosses the Dao,
Forty-nine merits ascend.
A thousand transformations, ten thousand changes, the body conceals,
The Upper Clarity staff transforms my form.
Swiftly, swiftly, as □□□□□□□ star decrees.

**Water Release**
On a *renzi* day, take a large tortoise shell weighing one *jin*. Perform the method for forty-nine days. On the day of use, if encountering great water, or upon a bridge or boat, release the tortoise into the water without looking back.

The incantation states:
Spirit-shell disperses *qi*, enters my staff.
I possess the great Dao, unlike the vulgar.
Emerging with the sun, entering with the moon,
Driving tigers, pursuing dragons.
Depart and transform in my stead,
Spring veins interconnect.
Swiftly, swiftly, as □□□□□□□ star decrees.

**Fire Release**

**Fire Release**
On a *bingzi* night, take one male sparrow and place it in a small cage. The method is the same as before. Feed it only at your side, and when ready, sprinkle water upon it, draw in *qi*, and blow *qi* as in the previous method for a full forty-nine days. Hold the sparrow in your hand when ready to use it. Tie a crimson thread around its head, and when the sparrow dies, place it in your bosom. Upon encountering a great fire, cast the sparrow into the flames and depart without looking back.

The incantation states:
Crimson Sparrow stands before me,
I grasp the power of creation.
The Three Terraces guard my life,
The Five Emperors preserve my birth.
The *Zhibo* bird’s divine fire transforms immortals,
Commanding my nature and spirit to be whole.
Swiftly, swiftly, as □□□□□□□ decrees.

**Earth Release**
On a *wuzi* day, take one of your own shoes and perform the method as before for a full forty-nine days. When ready to use it, tie a yellow thread to the shoe and cast it to the ground without looking back.

The incantation states:
Primordial Yellow Dragon,
Flourishing in the four seasons.
Central Palace holds true position,
Wielding authority at the source.
Judging the Earth Bureau,
I heed the Emperor’s decree.
You now stand in my stead,
Assuming my borrowed power.
Eighteen counts mark the *wu* and *ji* cycle.
Swiftly, swiftly, as □□□□□□□ decrees.

**The Divine Gaze: Ranks of the Many Heavens**
The Mystic Master said: If you wish to behold the Thirty-Two Heavens, first cultivate all practices, then make a great vow and employ all your heart. Next, enter stillness through visualization, and only then may you attain the vision.

First, begin with a scattered mind, then make your vow: Today I observe the Heavenly Emperors. May the Three Realms and the Ten Directions, all sentient beings bound in dullness, the four births and six paths, and those whose names are inscribed in the heavens—may their souls ascend with mine to the Emperor’s abode. May the suffering souls of Fengdu, those long sunk in kalpas of darkness, and my countless ancestors all transcend obscurity, escape the wheel of suffering, and ascend with my soul to the sacred fruit. May they be far from the Five Turbidities, roam the Dao’s realm, and may all living beings across the ten thousand lands dissolve their evil karma, lift their manifold sins, and depart from all suffering and affliction. May they attain the Dharma-body, complete with the ten marks, and ever wander the heavens, expounding the Dharma to awaken the deluded, continuing the sacred lineage, and mastering the ten holy paths.

Though my fleshly body bears form and trace,
My spirit ascends the Three Heavens,
To attend the Primordial Lord of the Ancestral Masters,
Receive the Great Law of the Numinous Treasure,
And wander the many heavens for ten thousand kalpas.
In this life and the next, may I ever dwell in blessed realms,
With the seven treasures complete,
Gardens, mansions, palaces,
Wives, servants, children,
And all friends—may they join me in contemplation.
May I bestow upon the Ten Directions and Three Realms
Elephants, horses, rare treasures,
Chariots, garments, food, bedding,
Ever giving without stint.
May I dam rivers to build bridges,
Sink wells by the roadside,
Aid all travelers,
Rescue the hungry and thirsty,
Bury the carcasses of the six livestock and flying birds,
Ensuring none are exposed to the Three Luminaries.
Make vows, cultivate good deeds.

Once settled in visualization without slackening,
Enter stillness, then burn fine incense.
First behold the azure clouds’ path,
Spiraling upward in twisting ascent,
Rising layer upon layer to the celestial realm.
Next, observe the Heavenly Emperor’s abode.
Visualize the heavens’ vast and majestic splendor,
Ever fragrant with *qi*, free of impurity.
The Heavenly Emperor rides an eightfold jade carriage,
Triple-pure flying clouds,
Jade wheels and feathered canopies,
Five-colored floral radiance,
Dragons, unicorns, tigers, leopards,
Lions, white cranes,
Their songs and calls harmonious.
The ground is paved with gold,
The four-sided stairways of white jade,
Adorned with the seven treasures and luminous pearls,
Glowing with resplendent light.
The Emperor wears a *liluo* robe,
A crown of a hundred treasures,
Attended on all sides by flying immortals,
Their bodies radiant, outshining sun and moon.
Their music—drums, strings, songs, and flutes—
All resound in unison.
The people thrive, none die young,
No cries of lament are heard.
In those heavenly palaces,
Even the sword trees stand unmoving.
Behold the countless heavenly hosts,
With natural food and drink,
Abundant in kind and flavor,
Their essence flowing down to the lower realms.
The heavens possess treasure trees and golden pools,
Five-colored radiance,
Purple groves where gentle winds
Brush the branches, producing wondrous sounds.
Those heavenly palaces,
Forged from myriad treasures,
House the Emperor in solemn majesty.
Their light illumines the Nine Darks,
As the Emperor, with the most excellent Dharma,
Universally delivers the heavenly beings.
Hearing the Dharma, they praise its virtue.
Upon the Emperor’s jade table,
Red-script jade characters summon the assembled immortals.
Yellow talismanic writs bring joy to the dark realms.

Each day, visualize your form
Clad in ritual robes and feathered garments,
Riding clouds of nine hues,
Approaching the center of a heaven,
Following the celestial palaces within,
Joining the ranks to pay homage before withdrawing.
On the Three Primes and Eight Festivals,
Ascend with the ranks to the many heavens,
Partake in the Dharma assemblies,
Seated upon the Jeweled Blade Terrace.
The terrace is round like an altar,
Layer upon countless layer.
Gaze upward as the Lord of Heaven expounds the Dharma.

With long and devoted practice,
In deep concentration, the eyes attain vision,
And in dreams, when form is forgotten,
The spirit soars to the Dao’s realm.
The eyes behold the Heavenly Emperor expounding the Dharma,
The ears hear the Emperor’s sacred words,
And the music of celestial flutes and reed pipes.
At this time, the yang spirit is formed,
Able to ascend the many heavens.
Only then may you behold the Three Heavens.

When practicing the divine gaze of the heavens,
First purify yourself with fasting and ablutions.
Chant the Heavenly Cavern’s natural numinous hymns,
First three hundred times,
Then seven hundred,
Completing one thousand,
Only then may you proceed.
A single thought sends the spirit flying ten thousand *li*,
A single intention invokes mysterious responses in the Ten Directions.
After a year,
The yang spirit no longer wanders the mortal world,
But ever dwells in the heavens.

After seven years at minimum, nine at most, one is certain to transcend the mortal world and ascend to the heavens above. In the heavens of the Desire Realm, beings are still born of qi-transformation, while in the Formless Realm, they take shape within nine-petaled lotuses, their forms fragrant. In dreams, one may glimpse green, azure, and white lotuses—signs of gradual attainment in the Dao. As progress is made, the lotus unfurls its bud; if the Dao is abandoned, the bud remains closed; if sins accumulate, the lotus withers.

*The Precious Scroll of the Limitless Salvation Sutra, Great Method of the Supreme Dao, Volume Twenty-Five Concludes*
*The Precious Scroll of the Limitless Salvation Sutra, Great Method of the Supreme Dao, Volume Twenty-Six: The Transmission of the Great Method*

The Mystic Master said: When you wish to invoke the Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Directions, focus your mind with wisdom. First, ensure your cinnabar chamber is pure and bright, free from the turmoil of the seven emotions and six desires. Concentrate your heart with utmost sincerity, never lapsing into negligence. Cultivate few desires, guard your thoughts, be content with the present, practice kindness and compliance, embrace frugality and patience, restrain anger, eat sparingly, reduce sleep, quiet your thoughts, moderate what you see and hear, speak little, regulate movement and stillness, and keep your mind fixed on this practice. At all times, whether in motion or repose, do not stray from this path.

Then, choose the ten auspicious days and eight solar terms—these are the most propitious times. Bathe both inwardly and outwardly, burn the finest incense, and reverently face the sacred image of the Jade Pure Highest Lord, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy. Sit with your feet planted firmly, knock your teeth to gather the spirit, swallow saliva to harmonize the hun-soul, stabilize your mind, purify your thoughts, and regulate your breath evenly. Bow three times with your heart, settle your intention into oneness, and gaze intently upon the sacred countenance.

Begin with the ever-changing Jade Pure treasure crown, then observe the perfectly luminous celestial visage, its color like golden truth, round and radiant as a nine-hued rainbow. Next, behold the nine-hued Li Luo mantle, and the two hands displaying the celestial seal. Then, gaze downward to see the feet resting upon a golden and azure lotus throne, supported by a jade table and a sapphire jade desk.

Again, from the celestial visage and crown, observe each detail with utmost clarity. Close your eyes and hold the image in your heart. If it grows unclear, open your eyes to see it again, ensuring every detail is distinct, not missing even the finest hair. Close your eyes once more to visualize it. Whether walking, standing, sitting, or lying down, perfect this visualization.

Thereafter, in a quiet and secluded place, burn incense and sit in silence. Visualize the northwest heaven of Jade Purity, the vast expanse of the Mystic Void, where a sudden blaze of light, bright as the sun and moon, fills the Dharma realm, leaving no mountains, rivers, grasses, or trees. Once this samadhi is achieved, you will see only the Heavenly Worthy in the emptiness, seated upon a golden and azure lotus throne in the same majestic posture as before. As he raises his hand to expound the Dharma, seventy-two auspicious signs and eighty-one excellent marks radiate from him. Observe each with a focused mind, ensuring your attention does not scatter.

Once this vision is clear, you will see the Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Directions, their luminous marks and virtues, as they raise their hands to proclaim the Great Method of the Limitless Salvation Sutra. Having beheld the Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Directions, you will further perceive the Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Directions who respond and transform across kalpas, even unto boundless Heavenly Worthies. At first, they appear near, then gradually farther, growing ever larger as their lights connect. After seeing them, return your gaze to the northwest, where the vision remains as before, not missing even the finest detail.

Once this visualization is perfected, the Ten Directions above and below will likewise become clear and distinct. At times, you may simultaneously behold the heavens of the Ten Directions, hundreds of thousands of myriads of realms, all appearing in a single thought. All the Heavenly Worthies share one wisdom, awakening to the source of the Dao, illuminating all dharmas, and entering the unconditioned.

With the passage of time and the maturation of samadhi, you will naturally see the Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Directions expounding the Great Method of the Limitless Salvation Sutra. All doubts will dissolve, and you will attain the original true Dao. If, due to heavy karmic obstructions from past lives, you cannot yet see the Heavenly Worthy, perform repentance six times a day and night, enter samadhi with focused contemplation, repent for all past evil deeds, and diligently advance in the Dao. Follow all virtuous joys, and though your mind may cling to habit, you will gradually succeed. Even if the Heavenly Worthy does not preach the Dharma, your mind will have already entered the blissful and wondrous fruit, your body and mind at peace. In time, you will also behold the Great Unconditioned Dao.

Next, after seven days and nights, you will clearly see the sacred realm of Jade Purity. The great samadhi and focused contemplation will have reached fruition. In quiet solitude, even while sleeping, concentrate on the Three Sages. Visualize the upper palace of the Niwan Palace, vast and radiant, emitting the Great Compassionate Light that pervades the Dharma realm. With every thought, invoke the Three Sages; with every intention, radiate light. Over time, the power of visualization and samadhi will mature. After seven days and nights without wavering, you will surely see the Primordial Heavenly Worthy expounding the Dharma, his divine powers manifesting before you, instructing your heart and leading you into the source of the Dao. This is what is meant by "thought after thought without ceasing."

Bowing to the celestial visage, recite this verse:
*One mind, Three Sages; Three Sages, one light.*
*Light begets mind; brilliance arises from light.*
*One Sage’s mind connects; myriad transformations shine.*
*Perfect penetration, universal awakening—no delusion, no distraction.*

And again:
*With sincere focus, not a moment is wasted.*
*From emptiness, seek the real; even emptiness is not empty.*
*First empty, then respond; first attain, then penetrate.*
*Mind arises, mind ceases—without beginning, without end.*

*The Audience with the Jade Pure Emperor*

Within the secret chamber, burn incense, sit upright, and knock the teeth twenty-four times. Visualize entering three inches directly from the space between your brows—this is the Mud-Pill Palace, the abode of the Primordial Heavenly Worthy. Recite the Hidden Secret of the Three Heavens (霐), summoning the Three Qi to descend from the Mud-Pill Palace into the Central Palace, then into the Lower Palace, and finally return to the Upper Palace. Visualize your primordial spirit paying homage to the Primordial Heavenly Worthy. Recite the Hidden Secret without counting repetitions, envisioning the Three Qi filling the Nine Palaces with radiant light, illuminating all. The Primordial Heavenly Worthy sits within the Palace of Light upon a thousand-petaled lotus, his brilliance like the sun. He wears the Ever-Changing Jeweled Crown of Jade Pure, a nine-colored robe of morning essence and cinnabar-feathered treasure, with a halo of golden light. His form is golden, his countenance jade, and his two hands form the Mudra of Jade Pure. With each bow and rise, hold the vision clearly, imagining yourself beneath the Golden Portal. Kneel in ninefold reverence and secretly petition:

*"This humble dust-born servant, a male student of the Dao, [your name], prostrates in awe and trepidation, bowing deeply to petition the Supreme Three Heavens’ Jade Pure Sacred Realm, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy, the Most High Lord of the Void and Spontaneous Dao. By ancestral grace, I was born in an age of prosperity, fortunate to meet a master and receive the Great Dharma, entrusted with the Heavenly Seal and the governance of the Mysteries. Yet my transgressions accumulate daily, and I have not yet offered due gratitude. I humbly beseech Your celestial mercy to bestow a sacred decree, commanding the Northern Mansion of Fengdu, the Three Officials of Mount Tai, the River Sources and Spring Bends, and all divine overseers to absolve my thousand sins and ten thousand offenses, dispel calamities and misfortunes, dissolve karmic entanglements, inscribe my name in the Three Heavens, advance my cultivation of the Dao and refinement of truth, spare me from demonic trials, unblock stagnant energies in my womb-source, open knotted channels, and ensure the Three Realms bow in reverence and the myriad realms submit in homage. May I soon encounter a profound master to instruct me in the Great Dao of Golden Elixir and Lead-Mercury, teaching me to enter deep samadhi, awaken to the Profound Mystery, activate talismanic waters, and achieve efficacious summoning. May my merits and vows be fulfilled, allowing me to join the ranks of the Perfected Immortals. I am forever indebted to the boundless grace of the Great Dao. With utmost sincerity, I pray to Heaven and beseech the Sage—my heart trembles with urgency and awe. I await Your sacred decree."*

Upon finishing, perform six silent bows, kneel before the Emperor, and recite the Hidden Secret of the Three Heavens while awaiting the decree. Visualize the Three Qi’s purple light encircling your body, then bow three times in reverence before withdrawing, descending into the Crimson Palace, and finally returning to the Lower Field.

---

**Audience with the Supreme Pure**

Within the secret chamber, burn incense, sit upright, and knock the teeth twenty-four times. Visualize entering four inches directly from the space between your brows—this is the Flowing Pearl Palace, the abode of the Supreme Lord of the Dao. Recite the Hidden Secret of the Three Heavens (霐), summoning the Three Qi from the Mud-Pill’s Upper Palace into the Central Palace, then into the Lower Palace, and finally returning to the Upper Palace. Visualize your primordial spirit ascending with the Three Qi to pay homage. The Supreme Lord of the Dao sits within the Treasure Palace upon a thousand-petaled lotus, clad in a nine-colored robe of morning essence and purple-clouded treasure, a feathered garment of frost-like silk, and a crown of instantaneous transformations. Hold the vision clearly, imagining yourself beneath the Jade Steps. Kneel in ninefold reverence and secretly petition:

*"This humble dust-born servant, a male student of the Dao, [your name], prostrates in awe and trepidation, bowing deeply to petition the Boundless Great Dao, the Supreme Lord of the Dao, the Most High Emperor of Supreme Pure. Though of base and impure form, I have been fortunate to meet a master and receive sacred scriptures, fulfilling my duties in tranquil governance. Yet I fear my past and present lives are marred by transgressions—my three karmas and six senses burdened with a thousand faults and ten thousand errors, leaving no path for repentance. My heart is heavy with daily dread. I humbly beseech Your celestial mercy to grant absolution, for I am ever mindful of the weight of life and death, the relentless passage of seasons, the fleeting dew at dawn, the rare longevity of the sacred tree. Now, I uphold the secret classics of the Supreme Dao, ingesting true qi and divine talismans, preserving the Three Ones, refining my form, dissolving internal knots and womb-root obstructions, purging external impurities of the two months, dispelling illness, and severing the roots of misfortune. I earnestly pray to erase my name from the Black Register and strike it from the Book of Death, then penetrate the subtle mysteries, embodying the eternal virtue of the Dao. May my form and spirit unite in perfection, merging with the Dao’s truth, and may all sentient beings attain the fruition of the Dao. Daring to address Your celestial majesty, my heart overflows with urgency and awe. I await Your sacred decree."*

Upon finishing, perform six silent bows, kneel before the Emperor, and recite the Hidden Secret without counting repetitions while awaiting the decree. Visualize the Three Qi’s purple light encircling your body, then bow three times in reverence before withdrawing, descending into the Crimson Palace, and finally returning to the Lower Cinnabar Field.

---

**Audience with the Grand Pure**

Within the secret chamber, burn incense, sit upright, and knock the teeth twenty-four times. Visualize entering two inches directly from the space between your brows—this is the Grotto Chamber Palace, the dwelling of the Central Yellow Elder, the Supreme Lord. Recite the Hidden Secret of the Three Heavens (霐), summoning the Three Qi to descend from the Mud-Pill Palace into the Central Palace, then into the Lower Palace, and finally return to the Upper Palace. Visualize your primordial spirit paying homage to the Supreme Lord, reciting the Hidden Secret without counting repetitions. Envision the Three Qi’s light filling the Nine Palaces, illuminating all. The Supreme Lord Lao sits within the Golden Portal and Jade Hall upon a thousand-petaled lotus, his form golden, his countenance jade, wearing a seven-jewel crown and a nine-colored robe of morning essence and white-feathered frost-like silk. He leans upon a table of azure jasper, holding a whisk of feathers. Hold the vision clearly, imagining yourself beneath the Golden Portal. Kneel in ninefold reverence and secretly petition:

*"This humble dust-born servant, a male student of the Dao, [your name], prostrates in awe and trepidation, bowing deeply to petition the August Emperor of Primordial Virtue, the Supreme Lord Lao, the Most High Emperor of Grand Pure. By a thousand lifetimes’ fortune, I have met a master, received the Dharma Register, and been entrusted with guiding the people. Yet my transgressions accumulate daily, and I have not yet offered due gratitude. I humbly beseech Your celestial mercy to bestow a sacred decree."*

Petition the True Offices below to grant special pardon and forgiveness. May I, from this day forth, attain clarity of mind and awakening of intent, sharpness of hearing and brightness of sight. May the assembly of the ten thousand immortals confer upon me the Golden Elixir, dispel calamities and avert misfortunes, so that I may attain the state of divine transcendence. As a patriarch of the teaching, may I propagate the Great Dao, deliver the hidden and the manifest, and benefit all living beings, becoming a seed-people for future sages and securing a place to abide with Heaven and Earth.

With reverence, I pray for the clarity of the firmament and the purity of the earth, the radiance of the sun and the moon, the orderly movement of the stars and constellations, and the responsiveness of mountains and peaks. May wind and rain come in due season, water and fire remain latent, the myriad heavens enjoy peace, and kalpic disasters not arise. May all creatures that fly and crawl alike attain liberation and ascension.

I have presumptuously offended celestial majesty; my humble sentiments are overwhelmed with urgency and trepidation. I prostrate myself in wait for the sacred decree.

Upon concluding the petition, bow six times in the heart, kneel before the Emperor, and silently recite the hidden and esoteric invocations without regard to number, awaiting the imperial response. Envision the threefold qi of purple light encircling your body, then perform three profound bows and withdraw. Descend into the Crimson Palace, then return to the Lower Cinnabar Field.

The Mysterious Elixir Palace lies five inches directly inward from the midpoint between the brows, where the Most High Jade Emperor of the Vast Heaven resides. The Hall of Light Palace lies one inch directly inward from the midpoint between the brows, where the Great Emperor of Longevity and the Jade Sovereign of the Divine Empyrean reside. To the left of the Hall of Light Palace is the dwelling of Lord Han the Elder. The Nine Mornings of the Northern Dipper reside above the Mud Pill Palace in the brain, with the Pointer Stars before them and the Two Stars of the Northern Culmen’s August Emperor within the Dipper.

When the adept wishes to perform rituals, observe which palace governs the matter at hand. For the Great Yellow Register Fast, notify all palaces and report to the Nine Dark Realms. For refinement and deliverance, report to the Jade Purity and Lord Han the Elder. For thunder and rain rites, report to the Divine Empyrean. The prayer texts need not be repeated in full. When paying homage to the Emperor and Master to receive qi...

Within the quiet chamber, the adept kindles incense, strikes the teeth together, and in accordance with the former *Chaoyuan* method, visualizes the self kneeling beneath the Golden Portal. Prostrating in reverence, the adept secretly petitions:

*"This humble dust-born adept, a male student of the Dao named [so-and-so], humbly reflects: by fortune spanning a thousand ages, I have been granted the grace to receive the transformative teachings. I revere the numinous treasure of the Great Rites, the true net of the Three Caverns. Above, it dispels the calamities and mutations of Heaven and Earth; below, it rectifies the transgressions of yin and yang’s appointed times. In the hidden, it can deliver the Three Paths; in cultivation, it can liberate from the cycle of birth and death. Vast, it encompasses all; minute, it leaves nothing wanting. Its boundless mysteries run too deep to fathom.*

*Today, on this auspicious day, I reverently follow the Jade Statutes to receive the various numinous qi. I implore the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Vacuous Non-Being, the Jade Purity Great Emperor, to broadly extend compassion and specially bestow deliverance.*

*Having now ingested the various numinous qi, I refine the Five Viscera, purging defilement and turbid vapors. I humbly beseech the celestial mercy to deign to send down the luminous, correct, and true Dao-qi of each station’s *Yaoguang*, entering my body. Within, it purges the filth of the heart; without, it tempers the essence of the eyes. Whatever the task, its numinous efficacy shall be manifest.*

*Now, reverently before Your presence, I request to receive the true qi. With awe and trepidation, I bow my head, prostrate myself, and again bow in reverence."*

Next, the adept forms the Jade Purity mudra with the left and right hands and recites the *qi*-invoking incantation:

*"The adept receives qi thrice yearly: the qi of Heaven above, gazing to Qian; the qi of Earth below, bowing to the Diurnal Sun; the qi of the first month and the *zi* month; the qi of the Five Stars in the first month’s *yin* hour; the correct qi of the Five Directions and Three Sovereigns; the qi of the Six Offices of the Southern Dipper in the *zi*, *shen*, and *yin* hours; the qi of the Seven Primes of the Northern Dipper in the due south; the qi of the Three Terraces Perfected in the due north; the concealed inner names of the Three Heavens at the Dipper’s head; the divine qi by which the Three Masters of the northwest deliver my spirit; the wondrous qi of the Five Directions and Five Marchmounts that sustains the body; the qi of the Five Directions and Three Paths’ general overseers; the gentle, harmonious qi of the Six *Ding* at the *Qian* position of *zi* and *wu*; the martial, unyielding qi of the Six *Jia* in the *ding* direction; the qi of the Divine Immortals and Grand Unity in the *jia* direction; the Seven Primes’ true qi of the Divine Tiger in the direction of the day; the qi governed by the Four Straight of the Northern Dipper’s yin; the correct, true, life-generating qi of the Highest Emperor for the year, month, establishment, day, hour, and direction; the true qi of the Nine Heavens’ Mysterious Woman at the Heavenly Gate; the inner-refining qi of the Three Perfected in the southwest; the qi of the Cloud, Thunder, and Rain Departments at the Heavenly Gate.*

*In the *xun* direction: Heaven cannot cover me, Earth cannot bear me. Whoever opposes me shall die; whoever collides with me shall perish."*

Hasten, hasten in accordance with the statutes and decrees.

Next, perform the Mudra of the Five Emperors and Three Paths:
Red Apricot, Thunder Black Ink, *Chou* Grinds True, *Dui* Stocking Wax, *Wu* Numinous Treasure.
The middle finger turns to revive *Zhongxing*; alone, it shifts to *Duli*; it may clarify *Hanming*; it gathers as *Gongdu*; it corrects the angles and aligns; it assembles and seizes the hun-souls.

*Gongdu* assembles the hun-souls, summoning the swift messengers of the eight directions, celestial spirits and earthly deities, the myriad numina all converging—united under the decree of Heaven and Earth.

Conjoin the radiance of the Heavenly Emperor’s sun; conjoin the radiance of the Heavenly Emperor’s sun.

Upon reciting the incantation, bow twice. With both hands in the Jade Emperor Mudra, visualize the *qi* of the Three Heavens returning to the body. Then visualize the preceding *qi*, following the Three *Qi* into the body, entering the Lower Cinnabar Field. Thus concludes.

On the first day of the month at the *zi* hour, ingest *qi* and recite the Hidden Taboo of the Three Heavens ten thousand times. Thereby, one may communicate with the perfected and reach the numinous, command the clouds, thunder, rain, and lightning, and summon the deities of Heaven and Earth. Do not raise the voice; let not the ears hear. Maintain a fast for one day, abstaining from meat.

The Great Method of the *Supreme Scripture of Limitless Salvation*, Scroll Twenty-Six—Concluded.
The Great Method of the *Supreme Scripture of Limitless Salvation*, Scroll Twenty-Seven.

**Chapter on Atoning for Past Transgressions**

The essence of cultivating the Dao lies foremost in minimizing faults. If one does not repent of their transgressions, they drift ever farther from the Way. Even if one practices talismanic methods, they will not ascend to the highest stages of the Dao. Should their conduct remain unchecked, how can they subdue ghosts and spirits, let alone submit memorials or deliver the living and the dead? The bureaus of merit and transgression record even the slightest misdeed without error.

In the Jin dynasty, Xu Yuanyou retreated into the mountains and forests, diligently cultivating the Dao and gradually attaining the rank of the perfected. Yet the Three Officials dispatched Zhou Fang and others to present him with a vermilion tablet of his transgressions, rebuking him thus: "Those who aspire to study the Dao and long for immortality, who seek to be enrolled among the perfected, who nest their profound minds in the distant, and who revere the numinous with utmost sincerity—must first accumulate worldly merits, avoid calamities and evils, plant the roots of hidden virtue, and extend benevolence upward. Only then may they ascend to the ranks of the perfected and inscribe their names in the Azure Palace."

From this, it is clear that those who have not yet reached Xu Yuanyou’s level must surely strive to minimize faults and cultivate themselves. For those who uphold the precepts, practice the methods, seek immortality, and study the Dao, it is essential to repent of past transgressions and accumulate future merits through diligent effort.

Thus *The Treatise on the Mysterious Principle* states: "Faults are to be corrected and never repeated; merits are to be established without wearying midway." This is called daily renewing one’s virtue, whereby Heaven itself grants its protection. If one merely performs the rituals of prayer and repentance with the mouth while the heart lacks any thought of self-examination, if one’s past transgressions precede and future misdeeds follow, if one adorns the exterior while corrupting the interior—then even if one exhausts the body and wearies the form, gazes at the stars and worships the moon, observes fasts and upholds precepts, burns incense and recites scriptures, all such efforts will be in vain.

There are those who boast grand words to deceive the world, claiming that since their sins are not accumulated and their evils not committed, there is no need for repentance or renunciation of the teachings. Such extreme posturing is excessive. The proper way lies in balanced moderation, neither exceeding nor falling short. One should repent sincerely in the heart, reflect upon faults when recognized, follow the scriptures and uphold the teachings, and practice the rituals according to the established forms. Thus may the records of sins be erased from the courts of the Three Officials and the Five Emperors, and one’s name inscribed in the realms of the Ten Poles and Nine Heavens. By establishing merit without slackening, the body may ascend and take flight as an immortal. The state shares in this, and one should not hinder oneself—those with resolve often accomplish their aims.

For repentance, aside from the day of the Autumn Equinox each year, one should choose the Three Primes, the Eight Festivals, one’s own birthday, the days of *jiazi* and *gengshen*, and other auspicious occasions to enter a quiet chamber, or a temple, mountain, or secluded place. There, one should burn incense, focus the mind, and reflect upon faults and transgressions. First, sit in solemn silence beside the altar, deeply contemplating all actions and deeds from birth to the present—none without transgression, and unwholesome deeds innumerable. Trembling with remorse, one should regret not having torn open the heart and poured out the gall, swearing never to repeat such acts. Overcome with shame, one feels unworthy to occupy this place. Then, rising and adjusting one’s robes, one composes body and spirit, ascends the altar, and begins the invocation. Where no altar is present, set up an incense table and arrange the ritual space accordingly. Perform the entrance incantation, offer incense, and follow the prescribed rites of prayer and repentance. In the morning, begin facing east; at night, begin facing north. Conduct repentance in the five directions, adhering to the established ritual forms. After kindling the incense burner and following the proper sequence, offer incense thrice before proceeding with the rites, which should resemble the natural court audience. However, such matters are best conducted in secrecy, and solitary practice is preferable to excessive complexity. Thus, only the texts for repentance in the four directions are compiled here, to be adapted as circumstances require.

**First, the Incense Prayer:**
Dao incense, virtue incense, non-action incense,
Non-action, pure, and natural incense,
Wondrous cavernous true incense,
Numinous treasure wisdom incense,
Incense transcending the Three Realms,
Incense of the royal realm.
Filling the jade towers of the Jade Capital,
Pervading the Dharma realms of the cosmos.
With this incense now burned,
We offer it to the Heavenly Worthies of the Three Realms of the Great Dao of Emptiness,
The August Heavenly Emperor,
The Great Emperor of the Purple Tenuity and the Northern Pole,
The Heavenly Emperor of the Purple Tenuity,
The August Earthly Deity of the Rear,
The Lords of the Thirty-Two Heavens,
The Ten Thousand Heavenly Emperors,
The Eleven Luminaries of the Upper Clarity,
The Seven Primes of the Northern Dipper of the Central Heaven,
The Lords of the Three Officials of Heaven, Earth, and Water,
The Four Saintly Marshals of the Northern Pole,
The Five Masters of the Numinous Treasure,
The Twenty-Eight Constellations of the Four Directions,
The Five Great Demon Kings of the Three Realms,
The Flying Heavenly Kings of the Ten Directions,
The Great Emperor of the Northern Darkness of Fengdu,
The Great Emperor of the Eastern Radiance of Fusang,
The Sacred Emperors of the Five Peaks and Five Heavens,
The Grotto-Heavens and Blessed Lands,
The Famous Mountains and Pure Retreats,
The Lords and Perfected of the Registers,
The Divine Officers and Generals of the Three Caverns and Four Supplements,
The Officials and Attendants of the Three Realms,
All majestic spirits.
By this fragrant cloud, we universally extend our offerings.
Jade blossoms scatter their radiance,
Nine *qi* congeal into mist,
Fragrant clouds and dense fogs
Pierce straight through the heavens.
The Golden Lad attendant of incense
And the Jade Maiden transmitter of words
Ascend to the presence of the Emperors.
Let my petition be heard,
And all be as spoken.
The ritual officer, [Name], on this auspicious day,
Purifies the heart and washes clean,
Praying to the Perfected and invoking the Dao.
First, we extend our wishes for the imperial court and the altars of soil and grain,

Your servant, with utmost trepidation and reverence,
Is overwhelmed with awe and urgency,
