**Invoking the Directions:**
Your servant [Name], with sincere devotion, takes refuge in the Heavenly Worthies of the Numinous Treasure in the ten directions—east, south, west, north, the four corners, above, and below—the Thirty-Two Heavenly Emperors, the Twenty-Eight Constellations of the cosmos, the Perfected and Sacred Ones of Heaven, the True Lords of the Five Peaks, the mountains, rivers, seas, grotto-heavens, blessed lands, and all divine immortals and spirit officials.

**Next, facing north, bow thrice and kneel.**
(In the daytime, begin with the east; at night, begin with the north.)

The ritual officer, [Name], with sincere devotion, body and spirit, takes refuge in the Heavenly Worthy of the Limitless Numinous Treasure of the North and Northeast, the Eight Heavenly Emperors of the North, the High Perfected and Sacred Ones of the North, the Seven Constellations of the Dipper, Ox, Girl, Void, Danger, House, and Wall, the True Lord of the Black Emperor of the Northern Peak Hengshan, the grotto-heavens and blessed lands of the North, the mountains, rivers, and seas, and all true spirits and divine immortals and spirit officials of the northern realm.

I have heard that the Great Dao, in its compassion, opens the path of repentance for transgressions. The High Perfected, in their transformation, establish the rituals for seeking forgiveness. Without beseeching their grace, how could one be absolved of faults and escape punishment? Reflecting upon myself, I am foolish, base, and of humble station, dull and of common endowment. Yet, by the grace of the true wind, I have encountered the turning of the Dao’s fortune, long held the registers of the Dharma, and presumptuously worn the cap and robes of the clergy. Unable to exert myself to establish merit, I have instead persisted in committing sins. I have known no restraint, nor carefully cultivated my conduct. I fear for the countless ancestors and forebears of past generations, and for myself across thousands of lives and kalpas, as well as for the causes of former existences. Extending to the present life, in all my deliberations and actions, and among all my household and kin, I have committed grave evils and accumulated deep transgressions—boundless and immeasurable, difficult to name or describe. These are bound within the courts of Heaven and Earth, recorded in the palaces of the sun, moon, and stars, never to be pardoned for eternal kalpas, forever without release. Fearing their retribution, I dread the onset of calamity.

With this first confession of my return to the Way, I humbly beseech full purification and absolution. May Heaven bestow its grace and pardon, may the Dao awaken its compassion and mercy, may the myriad sages pour forth blessings, and may the host of perfected beings confer felicity. May all my sins—those of nine generations of ancestors and seven lineages of forebears, as well as those of this present self across ten thousand kalpas and a thousand lives, down to the towering transgressions of this day and the profound iniquities of this world—be eradicated at their root, my name stricken from the ledgers of guilt. Thus may I swiftly attain the true Dao, encounter a genuine master, and know peace and prosperity in body and life, while my disciples, household, kin, and dependents enjoy tranquility and well-being.

Moreover, I pray that the divine consciousness of my ancestors, the souls of my masters and friends, my departed kin, and all my deceased family may dwell forever in bliss and eternal freedom. May the six paths and three realms of suffering, the four births and ten thousand kinds of beings, all be delivered and transformed.

Overwhelmed by shame and remorse, I offer this fervent and earnest prayer with utmost reverence.

Next, facing the East:
The humble servant [Name], with sincere devotion, body and spirit returned in homage, prostrates before the Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the East and Southeast, the Eight Heavenly Sovereigns of the East, the Perfected and Sagely Ones of the East, the Stellar Lords of the Horn, Neck, Root, Heart, Tail, and Winnowing Basket constellations, the Azure Emperor Perfected Lord of Mount Tai in the East, the grotto-heavens and blessed lands of the East, its mountains and rivers, seas and all numinous spirits, and the divine officials of the Eastern Realm.
The servant’s plea remains as before.

Next, facing the South:
The humble servant [Name], with sincere devotion, body and spirit returned in homage, prostrates before the Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the South and Southwest, the Eight Heavenly Sovereigns of the South, the Perfected and Sagely Ones of the South, the Stellar Lords of the Well, Ghost, Willow, Star, Spread, Wing, and Axletree constellations, the Vermilion Emperor Perfected Lord of Mount Heng in the South, the grotto-heavens and blessed lands of the South, its mountains and rivers, seas and all numinous spirits, and the divine immortals and officials of the Southern Realm.
The servant’s plea remains as before.

Next, facing the West:
The humble servant [Name], with sincere devotion, body and spirit returned in homage, prostrates before the Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the West and Northwest, the Eight Heavenly Sovereigns of the West, the Perfected and Sagely Ones of the West, the Stellar Lords of the Straddler, Harvester, Stomach, Hairy Head, Net, Turtle Beak, and Three Stars constellations, the White Emperor Perfected Lord of Mount Hua in the West, the grotto-heavens and blessed lands of the West, its mountains and rivers, seas and all numinous spirits, and the divine immortals and officials of the Western Realm.
The servant’s plea remains as before.

Next, facing the Center:
The humble servant [Name], with sincere devotion, body and spirit returned in homage, prostrates before the Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Upper and Lower Realms, the Thirty-Six Heavenly Sovereigns of the Three Luminaries, Nine Empyreans, Great Canopy, and Boundless Heavens, the Five Elder Thearchs, the Rulers of the Heavenly Courts, the countless Perfected Ones, the true spirits of the Ten Lands of Mount Fengdu’s Dark Realm, the Thirty-Six Earthly Sovereigns, the Yellow Emperor Perfected Lord of Mount Song in the Center, the grotto-heavens and blessed lands of the Center, its mountains and rivers, seas and all numinous spirits, and the divine immortals and officials of the Upper and Lower Realms.
The servant’s plea remains as before.

Finally, returning to my place before the altar.

With sincere devotion, I bow my head in reverence to the Most High Boundless Dao.
With sincere devotion, I bow my head in reverence to the Thirty-Six Venerable Scriptures.
With sincere devotion, I bow my head in reverence to the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center.

Next, I humbly address:
Servant [Name], with utmost sincerity, respectfully invokes the Boundless Dao, the Supreme Thearch, the High Perfected Ones, the mighty numina of the Three Realms, and the host of sages of the Ten Directions.
On this day, as I repent my transgressions and seek forgiveness, entering the oratory to cultivate the true, I have been permitted to present my plea, humbly beseeching great pardon.
May it be wished that the Dark Realm erase my sins, the Immortal Courts inscribe my name, that I encounter perfected beings on the Way, and study without demonic trials.
How dare I not redouble my virtuous thoughts, deeply reflect upon past wrongs, and aspire to unite with the true Dao, forever abiding in its tranquil shade? May the Ten Directions rejoice together, and may my nine generations of ancestors receive blessings.
For this supreme cause, I recite the *Lingbao Tianzun* of the Ten Directions, whose boundless, inconceivable merits are beyond reckoning.

Next, exit the chamber as per the usual protocol.

The *Natural Audience of Lingbao* begins by invoking the sacred, then paying homage to the Ten Directions, followed by the threefold repentance, then the dedication of merits, and now the fivefold thanksgiving for transgressions—this being the extended intent of the *Natural Audience of Lingbao*. It concludes here, for the five directions are valued for their simplicity and ease of practice.
The Jade Sounds and Brahman chants are not performed, for their power lies in silent resonance and profound sincerity.
All who uphold the Dao and cultivate the true—regardless of the rank of their registers—may practice accordingly. With prolonged observance and deep introspection, sins diminish, blessings arise, and one attains perfection and the Dao.

**Rite for the Three Primes and Eight Nodal Days: Audience with the Perfected and Thanksgiving for Transgressions**

First, form the Mudra of the Supreme Thearch, recite the Entering-Chamber Spell, stand at the Earthly Portal, face the Heavenly Gate, and close the qi while silently reciting the spell.

**Entering the Chamber**
The Dharma Master faces the Earthly Portal, lightly strikes the teeth three times, and recites the secret spell. Laozi’s visualization diagram states: Envision the Four Luminous Merit Officers, one Transmitting Perfected Messenger, two Jade Lads for Conveying Words, and two Jade Maidens attending the oratory.
The spell reads:
Four Luminous Merit Officers, Transmitting Perfected Messenger,
Jade Lads for Conveying Words, Jade Maidens attending the oratory.
For this servant, communicate with the true spirits of the Dao chamber.
May the qi of the Upper Prime descend and enter my body.
Upon completing the spell, enter the chamber, stepping first with the left foot.

**Entering the Chamber at Night**
The procedure for entering the chamber is the same as above.

**Laozi’s Visualization Diagram** states: Envision the Four Upper Merit Officers, two Dragon-Tiger Messengers, one Attending Pure Maiden, one Luminous Youth, and one Upper Mystery Maiden.

The spell reads:
Four Upper Merit Officers, Dragon-Tiger Messengers,
True Unity generates qi, Attending Pure Maiden.
At night when petitions are made, may the Luminous One be granted.
Youth and Upper Mystery Maiden,
enter the Yellow Chamber with this servant,
conveying all petitions to be heard above.

**Three Bows, Holding the Censer, Invoking the Sages, and Proclaiming the Rites**
This servant has heard that the One Qi unfolds the mechanism, grasping the transformative pivot in the boundless. The Three Heavens establish the model, extending the mysterious pattern through primordial chaos. Five thousand four hundred scriptures and precepts are spread below in the dusty world. The thirty-two heavens’ Brahman qi governs the supreme principles above. Contemplating that fortune and misfortune have no fixed gate, observing that fullness and emptiness follow their destined numbers, the transmitted Dharma registers open salvation for heaven and humanity. The Dao emerged at Crane Cry Mountain, where Orthodox Unity propagated the teachings of cultivating truth. Its merit shone in the Dragon Han era, as the Primordial One bestowed the scriptures for the world. The Great Dao is hard to name, yet pure sincerity can reach it. On this auspicious day, I purify the hall to pay homage to the Perfected and repent transgressions.

May the Golden Lads prepare the mats, the Jade Maidens tend the incense, ascending to the court of wondrous existence, directly entering the realm of emptiness. The phoenix flutes play softly, as dragon spirits unfold the azure heavens’ hymns. The ethereal simurgh carriages, feathered riders arrayed with crimson banners, stand guard. Seven chariots and eight reins float upon the vast qi through the void. The Three Realms and Ten Directions illuminate with divine radiance, sweeping away defilement.

This servant, a humble adept at the Mysterious Pass, has but newly received the red writ, his form born of foolishness, his nature endowed with ignorance. He has violated the precepts and teachings, accumulating transgressions and faults. Now, in accordance with the immortal statutes, he reverently presents the secret rites.

May the Lord of Jade Capital, the Venerable Master of the Golden Portal, universally bestow boundless grace, distantly showering abundant blessings. Open the path of renewal, place him within the pardonable statutes, and sweep away his deep-seated transgressions. Clear his entanglements, descending the Great Prime’s qi to refine his spirit into a numinous vessel. Temper his bones and renew his sinews, preserving his form to abide in the world. May grace return to his ancestors, enabling them to ascend. Extend kindness to both foes and kin, that all may attain harmony and release. A thousand faults and ten thousand errors dissolve in a single thought. The eight difficulties and seven harms scatter in the four seasons. Cultivation progresses gradually, and the Dao is advanced without demonic obstruction. One qi aids and sustains, a hundred spirits protect and assist. May he fulfill the covenant of ascending to Perfection, ever accompanying the company of immortals. May he unite with the Dao, his form and spirit both wondrous.

**Next, Kneeling to Repent**
This servant wholeheartedly takes refuge in body, takes refuge in spirit, and takes refuge in life to the Transformative Lords of the Three Purities, the Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Directions, and the sacred assembly within the *Sutra of Limitless Salvation*.

From past kalpas to this present life, through the three karmas and six senses, the five emotions and seven desires, past misfortunes and former deeds, the records of the mysterious statutes, yang transgressions and yin faults—all are inscribed in the Black Book. Through this repentance, may they all be dissolved and eradicated.

May the vast numen illumine and perceive, may the cinnabar portal bestow compassion, bestowing life upon the walking corpse, flowing grace upon the decayed bones. May the knots of the womb and origin be untied, the seven ancestors ascend, the mind’s realm be without dust, demonic obstructions disperse. Taking refuge in the Great Dao, washing away deep-seated transgressions, may calamities be extinguished without bound, and merit universally extend to all. After attaining the Dao, ascending into formlessness, may he unite with the Dao.

**Next, Uttering the Ten Great Vows**
The spell reads:
Three Pure Jade Emperors, Three Primordial Ladies of the Plain,
Supreme High Numinous Ones, Great Spirits of the Immortal Capital.
On this auspicious day, the wishes are declared:
First vow: to soar through the skies, becoming an immortal of long life.
Second vow: that heaven and earth merge with the radiant flying clouds.
Third vow: that the Five Peaks endure with this body forever.
Fourth vow: that the seven ancestors be freed from grievances and transgressions.
Fifth vow: that the Imperial Lords sever the bonds of the womb and origin.
Sixth vow: that in life after life, wisdom be awakened and luminous.
Seventh vow: that demonic spirits be vanquished, the Six Heavens’ forces be cut down.
Eighth vow: that all be opened and penetrated, communicating with the hidden and numinous.
Ninth vow: that in this assembly, none fail to fulfill their words.
Tenth vow: to ascend as a flying immortal, paying homage at the Three Primes.

**Next, Dedication**
Bowing to the Master of the Mysterious Cavern of Numinous Treasure, the true teacher of the *Sutra of Limitless Salvation*.
The Dao embraces heaven and earth, yet cannot be named;
the Dharma pervades yin and yang, beyond thought or discussion.
Responding to conditions, it transforms to save all beings,
transcending the Three Realms and Ten Directions.
Majestic and peerless, a mountain of merit and virtue,
the mind turns toward it, thought after thought, without ceasing.
The secret Dharma received today
dissolves above the heavenly calamities and kalpic destinies,
delivers below the multitudes of people.
Revives the dead to complete their forms,
heals the sick, eliminates misfortune, and aids the upright.
When merit is complete and conduct fulfilled,
swiftly consume the golden liquid elixir.
When the mind comprehends the numinous,
advance to receive the Jade Emperor’s decree.
For the highest good, recite the Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Directions.

**Exiting the Chamber**
After completing the exit through the Earthly Portal, turn to face the altar, strike the teeth three times, and envision one Jade Maiden.

The spell reads:
Emerging from yin into yang, the myriad spirits open and communicate.
The matters concluded, petition the closure of the Yellow Chamber.
Attending Pure Maidens, clearly prepare the spirit palace.

After the spell, exit the chamber, stepping first with the right foot.

**Exiting the Chamber at Night**
After completing the exit through the Earthly Portal, turn to face the altar, strike the teeth three times, and envision one Maiden.

The spell reads:
The Supreme Yin of the Mysterious Above, the eight windows open and luminous.
For petitions made, the Maiden communicates the numinous.
When matters are concluded, return to position; the myriad spirits withdraw in tranquility.

**Daily Rites for Entering the Oratory, Burning Incense, and Paying Homage**
First, form the Jade Clarity mudra with both hands, clench firmly, visualize the spirit, strike the teeth, stand facing the Heavenly Master, and recite the spell:
Heavenly scriptures spread in array, descending from the Grand Tenuity.
Primal transformation generates spirits, the numinous smoke coils ninefold.
Eight effulgences and six circuits, upheld by the imperial destiny.
To the left, the Azure Lord attends; to the right, the Imperial Consort is invoked.
The Venerable One of Southern Prosperity refines and repels defilement.
The dancing carriage of Crimson Brilliance unfolds the true mechanism.
Today is a great celebration, the myriad Dao return in unison.
Unite the upright qi, preserving heaven from decline.

**Universal Proclamation to the Three Realms, Swift as Dragons on the Wind**

The incense-prayer invokes the sacred:
With earnest mind, I reflect—early did I enter the Mystic Pass, long have I relied upon the Yellow and the Old, receiving the sheltering grace of the Great Dao, dwelling in the abode of truth to rest and abide. Ashamed am I for lacking the causes of the Ten Goodnesses, yet striving to praise the blessings of the Six Paths.

Since donning the dark robe, years have passed like seasons, yet I have failed to stir the numinous to gratitude, and in movement, lightly transgressed the precepts. Zealous at first, slackening later—begun but not completed. In upholding the law, sometimes straying; in practicing benevolence, not upright. Burning incense, losing proper measure; in recollection and invocation, violating the statutes.

I fear the Three Peng will secretly record my transgressions, and the Six Treasuries inscribe my offenses in bright script. Thus, I pour forth my sincere devotion, gazing upward to knock upon the Void. I pray that sins and evils be absolved, that transgressions and faults be dissolved.

May my name be perfected in supreme goodness, my life aligned with long endurance. May mystic merit accumulate through the Three Thousands, and the elixir of nine refinements be early attained. May the Yellow Register and White Tablet erase the names of the dead and inscribe those of the living. May the Golden Gates and Jade Capital grant ascent without descent.

May the Immortal Bureaus record my goodness, and the Ghostly Registers remove my misfortunes. May the Eight Effulgences of the Golden Script grant the art of refining qi and cultivating truth. May the Five Writings of the Jade Seal bestow the power of long life and enduring vision.

May the Dharma abide in peace, the oratory shine in radiance. May the perils of Metal, Wood, Water, and Fire never cause alarm or harm. May the calamities of green, yellow, white, and black all be swept away.

Further, I pray that right and wrong be dispelled in equal measure, that clothing and sustenance arise naturally, that demonic obstructions not arise, and that anxieties and misfortunes not arrive. Above, may I repay the kindness of sovereign, teacher, and parents; below, may I relieve the suffering of those lost in the dark and stagnant paths.

May I drive out the perverse and aid the upright, revive the teachings and establish merit. May the hundred spirits return in homage, the myriad deities tremble in submission. May form and spirit both attain subtlety, uniting with the Dao in truth.

*The Great Rites of the Supreme Scripture of Limitless Salvation, Scroll Twenty-Seven, Complete*
*The Great Rites of the Supreme Scripture of Limitless Salvation, Scroll Twenty-Eight*

**The Mysterious Register of Immortal Ranks, Superior Grade**

The Mysterious Master says: Great merit and transgression, blessing and misfortune—whether vast or slight—augment or diminish one’s years and lifespan. There are three ranks and nine grades, all governed by the Celestial Prohibitions of the Supreme Mysterious Capital; all beings ought to observe and uphold them.

**Superior Rank:**
- **Superior Grade, Highest:** Augments by three *ji* (thirty-six years).
- **Superior Grade, Middle:** Augments by two *ji* (twenty-four years).
- **Superior Grade, Lowest:** Augments by one *ji* (twelve years).

**Middle Rank:**
- **Middle Grade, Highest:** Augments by ten years.
- **Middle Grade, Middle:** Augments by nine years.
- **Middle Grade, Lowest:** Augments by seven years.

**Inferior Rank:**
- **Inferior Grade, Highest:** Augments by half a *ji* (six years).
- **Inferior Grade, Middle:** Augments by five years.
- **Inferior Grade, Lowest:** Augments by three years.

**Superior Rank:**
- **Superior Grade, Highest:** Diminishes or augments by 240 *suan* (lifespan increments).
- **Superior Grade, Middle:** Diminishes or augments by 120 *suan*.
- **Superior Grade, Lowest:** Diminishes or augments by 100 *suan*.

**Middle Rank:**
- **Middle Grade, Highest:** Diminishes or augments by 90 *suan*.
- **Middle Grade, Middle:** Diminishes or augments by 50 *suan*.
- **Middle Grade, Lowest:** Diminishes or augments by 40 *suan*.

**Inferior Rank:**
- **Inferior Grade, Highest:** Diminishes or augments by 30 *suan*.
- **Inferior Grade, Middle:** Diminishes or augments by 20 *suan*.
- **Inferior Grade, Lowest:** Diminishes or augments by 10 *suan*.

The Mysterious Master says: For minor good and minor evil, there are further diminutions or augmentations of ten *suan* or fewer, down to a single *suan*.

The Perfected of the Supreme Ultimate Mysterious Potency says: One who accomplishes merit of the Superior Rank’s highest grade must not presume upon transgressions of the same rank. Minor good deeds must be recorded daily, and minor evils must be expunged daily. Accumulate minor good to form great merit; dispel minor evil to achieve great virtue. Though one may accomplish merit of the highest rank, transgressions of the superior grade are not pardoned. Scholars who recite these teachings shall enjoy blessings as vast as mountains; those who treat them with contempt shall incur calamities lasting ten thousand kalpas.

---

**Middle Rank**

The Mysterious Master says: Male immortals of the highest order are called *Heavenly Worthies*; female immortals of the highest order are called *Primal Ladies*. Those whose form and spirit have not yet both attained subtlety still possess a corporeal frame and mortal remains; they are not permitted honorific titles.

For merit accrued in the mundane world:
- Great merit: three years per promotion.
- Middle merit: seven years per promotion.
- Lesser merit: nine years per promotion.

Those without merit ascend once every seven hundred days.

On the first day, one’s post is examined in the Courts of the Yin Realm. Next, one enters the offices of the Water Bureau and the lords of mountains and rivers. Then, the Earth Bureau and the lords of serene abodes and blessed lands. Next, the lords of grotto-heavens. Then, the immortal officials of the Ten Continents and Three Islands, gradually advancing into the Celestial Bureaus.

For those who perform merit in the world and establish the ten virtues of great meritorious conduct, whose inner and outer merit is complete, the place where the spirit is examined and the post assigned is the Great Yin’s refining of the corpse. When the allotted years are fulfilled, form and immortal unite and ascend.

If merit and virtue are incomplete in inner and outer cultivation, the spirit is divided to administer affairs, establishing a residence in the yin courts of Heaven, Earth, and Water.

To enter this Mysterious Stage of the Pure Rank, one must partake in the Dipper’s conferral of scriptures, sever the name of death, and ascend to the Southern Court. Merit and virtue manifest in reform; one ascends the immortal ranks, with years and deeds compared and examined, and may be promoted within the immortal grades. Presumptuous transgressions are impeached by the Three Officials. One must guard against this diligently. Violations result in demotion, subtraction of years, and punishment by forfeiture of merit or degradation of office.

**Initial Entry into Immortal Offices:**
- The Envoys of the Three Heavens, who wield brushes, subdue demons, and uphold the Dharma, first receive the Dharma and enter the immortal ranks.
- The Disciples of the Supreme Upholders of the Dharma: Immortal Scholars, Perfected Scholars, Immortal Officials, Perfected Officials. After eight instances of reform...

**Supreme Jade Steps:**
- Upholders of the Dharma, Immortal Scholars of the Supreme Jade Steps.
- Upholders of the Dharma, Perfected Scholars of the Supreme Jade Steps.
- Upholders of the Dharma, Immortal Officials of the Supreme Jade Steps.
- Upholders of the Dharma, Perfected Officials of the Supreme Jade Steps.
- Upholders of the Dharma, Immortal Officials of the Supreme Jade Altar.
- Upholders of the Dharma, Perfected Officials of the Supreme Jade Altar. After ten instances of reform...

**Southern Palace:**
- Upholders of the Dharma, Perfected Officials of the Lesser Mystery of the Southern Palace.
- Upholders of the Dharma, Perfected Officials of the Supreme Mystery of the Southern Palace.
- Upholders of the Dharma, Perfected Officials of the Primal Mystery of the Southern Palace.
- Upholders of the Dharma, Perfected Officials of the Wondrous Mystery of the Southern Palace.
- Upholders of the Dharma, Perfected Officials of the Numinous Mystery of the Southern Palace. After fifteen instances of reform...

**Grotto Realms:**
- Grotto Mystery, Grotto Abyss, Grotto Subtlety, Grotto Spirit, Grotto Numinosity, Supreme Ultimate, Supreme Clarity, Purple Tenuity, Great Possession.
- Celestial Bureau Upholders of the Dharma, Immortal Overseers. There are seven ranks of Immortal Overseers in the Celestial Bureau.
- Celestial Bureau Upholders of the Dharma, Immortal Ministers. After twenty instances of reform...

**Supreme Ultimate and Beyond:**
- Upholders of the Dharma, Immortal Ministers of the Supreme Ultimate.
- Upholders of the Dharma, Perfected Ministers of the Supreme Ultimate.
- Upholders of the Dharma, Immortal Ministers of the Grotto Spirit.
- Upholders of the Dharma, Perfected Ministers of the Grotto Spirit.
- Upholders of the Dharma, Immortal Ministers of the Supreme Clarity.
- Upholders of the Dharma, Perfected Ministers of the Supreme Clarity.
- Upholders of the Dharma, Immortal Ministers of the Highest Clarity.
- Upholders of the Dharma, Perfected Ministers of the Highest Clarity.
- Upholders of the Dharma, Immortal Ministers of the Jade Clarity.
- Upholders of the Dharma, Perfected Ministers of the Jade Clarity. After thirty instances of reform...

**True Stewards:**
- True Stewards Upholders of the Dharma of the Supreme Ultimate.
- True Stewards Upholders of the Dharma of the Primal Beginning.
- True Stewards Upholders of the Dharma of the Primal Origin.
- True Stewards Upholders of the Dharma of the Vermilion Brilliance.
- True Stewards Upholders of the Dharma of the Primal Brilliance.
- True Stewards Upholders of the Dharma of the Supreme Void.
- True Stewards Upholders of the Dharma of the Radiant Brilliance.
- True Stewards Upholders of the Dharma of the Bamboo Grove.
- True Stewards Upholders of the Dharma of the Void Brilliance.
- True Stewards Upholders of the Dharma of the Contemplative Brilliance.

The Mysterious Master says: These ten ranks are comparable to the ranks of the celestial chancellors; all require fifty instances of reform. One promotion requires forty instances of reform to enter the ten ranks of Immortal Stewards.

From this point downward, one enters the Form Realm:
- Upholders of the Dharma, Immortal Stewards of the Supreme Resplendence, Primal Endowment, Supreme Peace, Manifest Stability, Primordial August, Filial Radiance, Venerable Gravity, Non-Thought, Joyous Obscurity, Boundless, Luminous Court, and Primal Grotto.
- Upholders of the Dharma, Superior Immortals.
- Upholders of the Dharma, True Stewards.

All require sixty instances of reform to enter the ranks of Immortal Stewards. Seventy instances of reform to enter the ranks of Superior Immortals. Eighty instances of reform to enter the ranks of True Stewards.

From here upward, one enters the Formless Realm:
- Upholders of the Dharma, Immortal Stewards of the Supreme Literature, Supreme Simplicity, Primal Superiority, Supreme Release, Brahmanic Ascent, Equitable Nurturance.
- Upholders of the Dharma, Superior Immortals.
- Upholders of the Dharma, True Stewards.
- Upholders of the Dharma, True Stewards of the Supreme Clarity.
- Upholders of the Dharma, True Stewards of the Highest Clarity.
- Upholders of the Dharma, True Stewards of the Jade Clarity.

The Mysterious Master says: These ranks all require ninety instances of reform to enter the ranks of Immortal Stewards. One hundred instances of reform to enter the ranks of Superior Immortals. One hundred and twenty instances of reform to enter the ranks of True Stewards.

Gradually ascending to the ranks of Perfected Ones, all are specially enfeoffed by the Supreme Emperor, concurrently holding immortal offices across the heavens, earths, and waters—these too are special enfeoffments. Next, one enters the service of the Heavenly Mechanism’s Inner Ministry, the Heavenly Mechanism’s General Ministry, or the Great Mystery’s General Ministry. With each instance of reform, a memorial is submitted to the Heavenly Ministries, where it is compared and verified against demonic records. Only when the Demon Bureau confirms the absence of demonic interference, and true merit restrains the Demon Bureau, may one be recommended for merit by the Demon Bureau. Upon endorsement by the Three Officials and Five Emperors, and testimony from the myriad heavens, one’s rank is elevated—demotion follows the same process. Without penetrating insight into the hundred spirits and divine communion with the Heavenly Bureau, none can fathom these mysteries. Separate celestial immortal statutes are recorded daily in the Divine Court’s Golden Gates.

For those granted robes and established residences, who pay homage to the Primordial, observe the Dipper, and inspect the caverns, the great stabilization of the Seven Classics must be mastered. Only when merit is complete may one fully grasp the supreme mysteries of the Dark Mystery.

**Lower Grade of the Dark Statutes’ Immortal Statutes:**
*Upper Rank, Upper Grade*—Rebellion, treachery, and defiance.
*The Statutes of the Dark Capital* state: Those who murder father or lord, poison and harm masters and elders, disrupt the Five Constants of Heaven and Earth and the moral principles of the Dao, assault or defy lord, master, or parents, abandon righteousness for heresy, submit to demonic sorcerers, commit incest with kin, collude with the six relations, or plot murder—all are struck from the immortal registers and sentenced to atone through penal labor. They incur guilt upon nine generations of ancestors, seven generations of descendants, and their own person, enduring the trials of the Wind Blade for eternity without reprieve. Reborn as beasts, they receive non-human retribution, forever barred from immortal hope, with their lifespan reduced by one cycle.

**Upper Rank, Middle Grade**—Careless leaks, defilement, and usurpation.
*The Statutes of the Dark Capital* state: Those who slight lord, master, or parents; the Three Treasures, sacred images, or divine texts; who recklessly disclose the Three Treasures, the Three Caverns’ forbidden scriptures, secret classics, ritual codes, talismans, or diagrams; who leak the prognostics, taboos, or hidden mechanisms of Heaven, Earth, and the Five Phases; who fail to revere lord, master, or parents; who damage or destroy sacred images of the Three Treasures, or the permanent possessions of lord, master, or parents; who assault, curse, plot against, or kill those of moral virtue or the six relations; who undermine the teachings or foster disbelief; who feign devotion while slandering in secret; who alter their resolve; who seize, cheat, or deceive; who plunder the scriptures of the Three Treasures or the seven-virtued followers of lord, master, or parents—all are struck from the immortal statutes and sentenced to atone through penal labor. They burden nine generations of ancestors, seven generations of descendants, and their own person, condemned to the Long Night and the bitter retributions of the Three Paths for a thousand kalpas without reprieve. Reborn as loathsome creatures, they assume non-human, misshapen forms, with their lifespan reduced by two cycles.

**Upper Rank, Lower Grade**—Killing, lewdness, and theft.
*The Statutes of the Dark Capital* state: Those who kill or harm any living being, who entrap or harm any sentient life, who indulge in lust without restraint, who engage in conjugal relations without propriety, or who steal any property—all are demoted from immortal ranks and sentenced to atone through penal labor. They incur debt upon ancestors, descendants, and their own person, sinking into hell upon death, unredeemed by the Three Pardons. In this life, they bear the marks of deafness, blindness, muteness, or incurable madness, with their lifespan reduced by one cycle.

**Middle Rank, Upper Grade**—Breaking fasts, violating precepts, greed, jealousy, and malice.
*The Statutes of the Dark Capital* state: Those who consume the five pungent vegetables or the three forbidden meats, overindulge in alcohol, crave the flesh of the six livestock, fowl, or insects, break fasts for private gain, consume impure foods, harbor anger during fasts, mete out rewards and punishments immoderately, practice deceit and avarice, indulge insatiable desires, spread discord, envy their superiors, resent their inferiors, harbor malice toward the virtuous, contemplate evil, nurse grudges, or act with ill intent when outmatched—all are demoted three ranks in immortal status, sentenced to nine years of penal labor, with their lifespan reduced by six years. They must retreat from fasts for one year to make amends, and perform one hundred twenty acts of merit to atone.

**Middle Rank, Middle Grade**—Cunning, flattery, deceit, foul language, and curses.
*The Statutes of the Dark Capital* state: Those with crooked hearts, prone to suspicion, who act recklessly for success or failure, flatter superiors while neglecting inferiors, ingratiate themselves temporarily with deceit, speak and act falsely, roar in anger, exalt themselves, turn from righteousness to heresy, obscure truth and falsehood, favor the crooked and despise the upright, scrutinize minutiae for novelty, debate all matters, judge truth and falsehood, and in all postures—walking, standing, sitting, or reclining—pursue ostentation, unable to return to simplicity, defile purity, indulge in the five pungent vegetables, engage in lewd speech, curse at dawn, swear enmity against Heaven, Earth, wind, rain, the Five Phases, or spirits, or practice malevolent incantations—all are demoted two ranks in immortal status, sentenced to five years of penal labor, with their lifespan reduced by two hundred forty years. They must retreat from fasts for three hundred days to make amends, and perform ninety acts of merit to atone.

**Middle Rank, Lower Grade**—Theft, fraud, deceit, and evil intentions.
*The Statutes of the Dark Capital* state: Those who steal in secret, default on debts, borrow without repayment, appropriate what is not theirs, use cunning to claim lost items, divert public goods for private use, forge documents, claim falsehoods as truth, pass off the counterfeit as genuine, deceive with illusions, boast before gods and humans, deceive in heart and spirit, act wantonly in secret, deceive the Three Luminaries, Heaven, Earth, and the virtuous, or contemplate evil in thought—all are demoted one rank in immortal status, sentenced to three years of penal labor, with their lifespan reduced by one hundred twenty years. They must retreat from fasts for one hundred days to make amends, and perform fifty acts of merit to atone.

**Lower Rank, Upper Grade**
*The Statutes of the Dark Capital* state: Those who despise and waste the five grains, abandon kindness and benevolence, betray oaths and vows, cut or defile silk and cloth, act without faith or righteousness, without benevolence or compassion, lack a spirit of deference or rescue, make no firm commitments, or harbor no harmonious sentiments.

All are demoted three ranks in immortal status, sentenced to one year of penal labor, must retreat from fasts for seventy days to make amends, and perform thirty acts of merit to atone.

**Lower Rank, Middle Grade**
*The Statutes of the Dark Capital* state: Those who disdain and slight the orphaned, impoverished, elderly, or young; fail to aid Daoist recluses dwelling in cold mountain forests; neglect repairs to dilapidated structures; leave meritorious deeds incomplete; refuse to assist the virtuous in distress or illness, lacking food and clothing; destroy or desecrate mountain forests, tombs, or graves for personal comfort; coerce others through power; fail to rescue those in peril; fell or harm thriving plants and trees; claim the nonexistent as existent; deceive others with deceitful intent; divine omens from Heaven, Earth, stars, or celestial anomalies; encroach upon the authority of kings and nobles; ensnare living beings through cunning; show disrespect in serving superiors or neglect in governing subordinates; use incense and flowers for personal indulgence; or lack devotion in reverence.

All are demoted two ranks in immortal status, sentenced to half a year of penal labor, must retreat from fasts for fifty days to make amends, and perform twenty acts of merit to atone.

**Lower Rank, Lower Grade**
*The Statutes of the Dark Capital* state: Those who falsely speak the words of celestial officials or true spirits; feign their own virtue and conduct to seek blessings and fortune; intimidate the common folk; reveal teachings or practices meant to be secret; seek recognition from others; alter or forge seals, talismans, or written charms; pry into others’ private affairs; break seals or locks; record minor transgressions; trample upon documents or altars; harm small living beings; scold or berate the lowly; shout drunkenly; force labor upon the cold and hungry; make vows without fulfilling them; poison or destroy the things of the Five Phases; stir up groundless disputes; insist on refined food and drink; whip or beat the six livestock; cage or restrain birds and insects; use impure incense or fire; perform rites carelessly; fail to maintain purity during offerings and sacrifices; handle memorials or decrees without care; show disrespect to the honored; or violate ritual propriety in statutes and regulations.

All are demoted one rank in immortal status, sentenced to ninety days of penal labor, must retreat from fasts for one month to make amends, and perform ten acts of merit to atone.

**The Realms Governed by the Supreme Mystery**

The Jade Clarity Realm of the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning resides above the Thirty-Fifth Heaven, within the Realm of the Nine Sages. The Great Jade Clarity Palace belongs to the Heaven of Pure Tenuity. The Supreme Clarity Realm of the Most High Lord of the Dao resides above the Thirty-Fourth Heaven, within the Realm of the Nine Perfected. The Supreme Clarity Purple Tenuity Palace belongs to the Heaven of Cosmic Resonance. The Grand Clarity Realm of the Most High Lord Lao resides above the Thirty-Third Heaven, within the Realm of the Nine Immortals. The Grand Clarity Supreme Ultimate Palace belongs to the Great Scarlet Heaven. The August Jade Emperor of the Vast Heaven resides above the Thirty-Second Heaven, within the Supreme Realm above the Three Realms. The Grand Tenuity Jade Clarity Palace belongs to the Heaven Beyond All Heavens.

Scholars know only that above the Thirty-Second Heaven lies the Great Veil of the Three Heavens. Who knows that beyond the Great Veil there are yet Thirty-Six Heavens? These are the formless, shadowless, nameless, and shapeless Heavens of Emptiness and Spontaneity. The Twelve Heavens of Jade Clarity, the Twelve Heavens of Supreme Clarity, and the Twelve Heavens of Grand Clarity together make Thirty-Six Heavens. Below them dwell the Four Kinds of People, called the Brahmā Heavens. Next are the Four Heavens of the Formless Realm, the Eighteen Heavens of the Form Realm, and the Six Heavens of the Desire Realm, totaling Twenty-Eight Heavens. Their qi is bound to the Twenty-Eight Constellations, called the Stellar Realm. The Heavenly Emperor of the Purple Tenuity governs all stars, directing the revolutions of the constellations. The various heavens lie within the Palace of the Curved Array, which is also the transformative manifestation of the Grand Clarity Celestial Worthy. The Great Emperor of the Purple Tenuity of the North Pole governs all the great spirits of the heavens, residing within the Great Dipper’s Northern Ladle.

The great spirits of the heavens are innumerable. Above, they restrain the hordes of demons; below, they pacify the Northern Feng. The Thirty-Two Heavenly Palaces and Courts:

- **August Forebear Heaven:** Purple Ultimate Palace, also called the Lower Yi Palace of Wandering Years and the Purple Mansion.
- **Jade Perfection Heaven:** Purple Chamber Palace, also called the Soaring Heaven Palace and the Exhausted Yang Mansion.

The Heavenly Emperors who govern them and the heavenly kingdoms’ positions and merits also differ. All are detailed in the *Rites of Gratitude to the Great Existence* of the *Cavernous Spirit Scripture*.

**Palaces and Precincts of the Various Heavens**

- **Beginning Azure Heaven:** The Nine Qi Beginning August Azure Heaven of the East.
- **Great Floating Black Earth:** The Great Land of Floating Black.
- **Jade Capital:** The Jade Capital Mountain of the Great Veil Heaven.
- **Vermilion Palace:** The Southern Upper Vermilion Palace, where the Red Emperor refines and liberates the hun and po souls.
- **Southern Palace:** The Southern Prosperity, the Palace of the Fire of Renewed Hun Souls.
- **Realm of the Great Void:** Within the Grand Clarity, below the Supreme Ultimate. Spirits ascend to the Great Void without passing through the Southern Palace.
- **Nine Palaces:** Excluding the central honored position, the eight surrounding palaces correspond to the eight solar terms. Those whose recitation merits are abundant are enfeoffed as Perfected of the Nine Palaces—not the palaces of the Nine Heavens, but the empty palaces upon the mountains.
- **Heaven within Heaven:** The Mystery within Mystery, the Dao within Dao—this is the realm above the Great Veil, the Supreme Great Brahmā’s domain, the Heaven of the Primordial Beginning.
- **Lush Canopy and Clear Terrace:** The Jade Capital Mountain of the Great Veil Heaven. Upon the mountain stands the Seven Treasures Dark Terrace, clear and towering in nine layers. The mountain forests are lush and verdant, their radiance resplendent.
- **Three Florid Palaces:** The Three Primordial Palaces of Jade Clarity: the Upper Primordial Jade Florid Palace, the Middle Primordial Gold Florid Palace, and the Lower Primordial Nine Florid Palace.
- **Separation Convenience Palace, Great Existence Palace, Wondrous Court Palace:** North of the Mystery Capital Jade Capital, the palaces where the Celestial Worthy rests and feasts.
- **Palace of the Feminine One in the Human Body:** North of the Muddy Pellet Palace.
- **Golden Watchtower and Jade Chamber:** The realm of Jade Clarity, where the city walls are of yellow gold and the palaces of white jade. Above the Purple Tenuity, the Emperor’s Golden Watchtower and White Jade Dark Chamber.

The Golden Watchtower and Jade Chamber stand in majestic array, their purity vast and boundless.

The Four Palaces lie south of the Jade Capital, where the Primordial Elder of Grand Simplicity, the August Lord of Flourishing Yang, the Flowing Pearl Perfected Spirit, and the Primordial Lord of the Red Child reside. In the human body, south of the Muddy Pellet Palace, lies the realm of purity and vastness—furthermore, the Two Jade Clarity Pools, which correspond to the two eyes in the human head.

- **Eastern Heavens:** An Tai Hall Township, the Great Thousandfold World of Gathering Worthies.
- **Southern Heavens:** Wan Li Heavenly Realm, the Great Thousandfold World of Abandoning Worthies.
- **Western Heavens:** Fu Tang Continent, the Great Thousandfold World of Majestic Action.
- **Northern Heavens:** Yu Yi Wilds, the Great Thousandfold World of Purity and Stillness.

- **Northwestern Heavens:** Fu De Wilds, the Great Thousandfold World of Extending Worthies.

- **Lower Realm:** The Infinite Abyssal Cavern, within the Pure Numinosity, the Boundless World.

**The Realms Governed by the Perfected:**
The Three Realms—Heavenly Realm, Earthly Realm, and Water Realm.
Also called the Realm of Desire, the Realm of Form, and the Formless Realm.
The Infinite Spirit Township, the Ten Directions’ Infinite Worlds, the inexhaustible Spirit Townships.

**The Northern Capital Fengdu:**
The Fengdu Luoshan of the North, comprising ten inner and outer palaces, known as the Six Heavens.
Three Palaces and Nine Bureaus—each of the Heavenly, Earthly, and Water Bureaus has one palace, and each palace contains three bureaus, totaling nine bureaus.
- **Upper Primordial Heavenly Bureau:** Three Bureaus—Left, Right, and Center.
- **Middle Primordial Earthly Bureau:** Three Bureaus—Left, Right, and Center.
- **Lower Primordial Water Bureau:** Three Bureaus—Left, Right, and Center.
Also called the Three Bureaus of Northern Fengdu, each with nine bureaus.
All are fully depicted in the illustrated compendium.

**The Northern Capital’s Frigid Pool:**
The Dark Night of Fengdu, where lies the Frigid Pool of Qiuhan, the Night Repository of Ice.
**The Three Punishments:**
1. The Eternal Night,
2. The Frigid Pool,
3. The Stone-Carrying Labor.
Also said: The Heavenly Bureau’s punishment is to drive thunder and wield lightning; the Earthly Bureau’s punishment is to bear sand and carry stones; the Water Bureau’s punishment is to ceaselessly draw from the dark waves.

**The Three Evils:**
Sensual desire, craving desire, and greedy desire.
The Three Evils form one path—the Five Gates and Five Paths.
Also called the Gates of Decline, Sickness, Death, the Grave, and Extinction; or the Five Gates of Encumbrance.
The Heavenly Gate, the gate of the Three Realms’ various heavens.
The Great Lord’s horn is called the Heavenly Gate.
Also said: The reckoning severs the earthly root, with the Wuji Heavenly Gate rotating daily.
The four cardinal directions each have their Dipper constellations:
- **Eastern Dipper:** Horn, Neck, Root, Chamber, Heart, Tail, Winnowing Basket.
- **Northern Dipper:** Dipper, Ox, Girl, Emptiness, Danger, House, Wall.
- **Western Dipper:** Straddler, Bond, Stomach, Pleiades, Net, Beak, Orion.
- **Southern Dipper:** Well, Ghost, Willow, Star, Spread, Wings, Axle.
The Four Dipper Perfected govern reckoning, record names, and determine death and rebirth.

**The Central Dipper:**
The Jade Armillary and Jade Balance of the Seven Luminaries revolve in the central heavens, universally overseeing all directions to harmonize the Seven Governances. What the world calls the Northern Dipper is in fact the Central Dipper.
It is called the Great Chief, overseeing all spirits.
The Ghost Encampments—of the Twenty-Eight Constellations.
The Six Heavens of Fengdu all have Ghost Encampments.

**The Cavern of Wind and Marsh, the Void:**
The Nine Ramparts of the Abyssal Cavern, the palace of the Thirty-Six Earthly Sovereigns.
**The Five Constants:**
Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, Earth—the Five Constant Virtue Stars.
The Thirty-Five Divisions—thirty-two heavens, with the Three Supreme Heavens above, forming the Thirty-Five Divisions, all belonging to the Great Luo’s Upper Primordial.
The merit of the Primordial Beginning operates the mysterious mechanism of transformation, presiding over the Eight Gates—the arena where the Dharma Wheel dispenses karmic retribution and blessings.
- **The Eight Gates:**
  1. The Gate of Sin,
  2. The Gate of Blessing,
  3. The Gate of Prohibitions,
  4. The Gate of Past Lives,
  5. The Gate of Causes and Conditions,
  6. The Gate of the Dead Soul’s Rebirth,
  7. The Gate of Receiving Rebirth,
  8. The Gate of Manifesting the Three Perfected’s Dharma Wheel.

**The Six Ghost Peaks within the Scripture:**
The Six Peaks of Fengdu Mountain’s Six Heavens, each peak housing a palace spanning a thousand *li* in circumference.
1. The Palace of Zhou’s Absolute Yin,
2. The Palace of Tai’s Slaughter and Solemn Affairs,
3. The Palace of Mingchen’s Endurance of Transgressions,
4. The Palace of Tianzhao’s Sinful Qi,
5. The Palace of Zongling’s Seven Wrongs,
6. The Palace of Lianwan’s Repeated Offenses.
Additionally, the Six Outer Palaces atop the mountain govern ghosts and spirits, recording them in the Vermilion Numinosity—the Southern Prosperity’s Upper Palace, the Vermilion Fire Bureau.

**The Terrace-Cities of the Various Heavens:**
Beneath the Jade Capital Mountain lies the Long Tower, also called the Tower Capital, where the drums of the Tower Capital resound.
Within the Heaven of August Splendor, the August Lord’s Wandering Terrace is named the Thin Terrace. There are also the gates of the sun and moon, called the Gates of Sorrow.
Within the heavens, five-colored flying mystery qi encircle the gates of the sun and moon.
At the northwest gate of the Heaven of Jade Perfection stands the Gate of Extended Prayers.
Within the Heaven of Harmonious Youth, the Seven Jeweled Grove of Trees is named the Ayi Trees, covering all four directions.
The Heaven of Nurturing Growth contains the Hua Du Grand Ultimate Palace, the Azure Florescence Gate, the Immortal Bodhisattva Tower, and auspicious jade-colored clouds.
The Heaven of Literary Eminence holds the Answering Fall Jade Watchtower, the Convenient Gate of the Three Realms, within which lies the Purple Mansion of Auspicious Clouds.
The Heaven of Moli contains the Gate of Initial Birth—entering this gate brings blessings to the nine clans.
The Heaven of Crossing the Balance holds the Mountain of Empty Peaks.
The Heaven of Concealing Mist contains the Nine New Mountains and the Ridge of A-Qiu.
The Heaven of Harmonious Yang holds the Courtyard of Flowing Fire, called the Southern Yan Courtyard. The August Lord’s name is Dongfu, who refines souls; the flowing fire’s essence is called Jade Pupil.
The Heaven of Reverent Florescence contains the Four Dipper’s Flower-Viewing Terrace.
The Heaven of Ancestral Drifting holds the Marsh Mountain, atop which lies the Peace of the Multitude of Dragons. Within the heavens are golden chambers and jade halls, the Jasper Terrace, where the Perfected Dawn Dao Lord resides.
The Heaven of August Clarion holds the Golden Florescence Mountain, atop which lies the Five August Lords’ Palace. Those who attain the Dao proceed here to receive the Taiyi’s token, to subdue demonic trials.
The Heaven of Hall Radiance contains the Nine Capitals’ Mysterious Terrace and the Five-Colored Soaring Grove.
The Heaven of Upright Stillness holds the Empty Wheel Heavenly Pass, which summons the Celestial Perfected.

The Heaven of Reverent Celebration holds the Dragon Abyss’s misty depths, where heavenly beings channel the Eastern Well to irrigate. Within the Heaven of Celestial Perfection lies the Three Realms’ Heavenly Gate, and within it the Ford of Supreme Harmony, where life is born as spirit.

The Heaven of Ascending Perfection is also called the Land of Meditative Dawn; above it stands the Cavern Yang Palace and the Hall of Blessed Virtue. The Heaven of August Precipice contains the Palace of Vast Distant, where the Cloudscape Chariot welcomes root-nurturing immortals, ascending into the Hall of Transformative Birth.

The Heaven of Ultimate Wind holds the Purple Empyrean’s roaming banquet rites, rooted in the essence of the ultimate wind. The Heaven of Filial Radiance contains the Court of Profound Stillness. The Heaven of Aged Weight bears a nine-tiered terrace before the Jade Tower, along with the Court of Ghost-Restraining and the Chamber of Demon-Subduing, where the host of demons is quelled.

The Heaven of River Origins holds the Dragon Mountain’s ridge, where the Heavenly King of Aligned Hills rides the Threefold Simplicity’s carriage to ascend Dragon Mountain. The Heaven of Joyous Music contains the Blessed Hall of the Mysterious Center, where the records of the Dark Night are examined.

The Heaven of Solemn Vows holds the Eastern Florescence Palace, where the throng of soaring trees stands—verdant peaks of azure mist, where jade fowl perch and sing among the branches, and the wind stirs the grasses of reverse fragrance. The Heaven of Empyrean Crossing contains the Ninefold Mystery’s Gates and the Wheel-Symbol Chariot.

The Heaven of Primordial Cavern holds the Phoenix Chariot, which welcomes those who study immortality. The Heaven of Wondrous Completion contains the Cloud-Rimmed Ridge and the Cloud Palace of Feathered Forest. The Heaven of Forbidden Heights holds the Flying Mystery’s darkness, which above the empty empyrean coalesces into the Scripture of the Hollow Cavern.

The Heaven of Eternal Fusion contains the Palace of Sandalwood Orchids, gathering the immortal springs of the land’s hills, where merits are tallied and ascension is granted to the Jade Clarity’s Purple Tenuity Lodge. The Heaven of Jade Eminence holds the azure radiance of qi, within which stands the Seven Treasures’ Palace; inside lies the spontaneous Cavern Scripture, named *Empty Song*.

The Heaven of Brahmanic Crossing contains the Palace of Great Void, the Hall of Wondrous Transformation, the Heavenly King’s Talisman, and the Register of Nine Immortals. The Heaven of Exalted Harmony is the Formless Brahman Heaven, lofty and clear, suffused with the Cavern’s floating essence, where the Utmost Perfected Heavenly Beings reside.

**Three Heavenly Numinous Offices**
The Scripture states: Attending the Five August Lords are jade lads and jade maidens, twenty-four each.

The *Divine Writs of Guarding and Defense* protect the body of the scripture’s recipient. In the east, the Azure Numinous Dao-Opening Lads, twenty-four in number; in the south, the Cinnabar Numinous Dao-Opening Lads, twenty-four in number; in the west, the Radiant Numinous Dao-Opening Lads, twenty-four in number; in the north, the Mysterious Numinous Dao-Opening Lads, twenty-four in number; and in the center, the Yellow Numinous Dao-Opening Lads, twenty-four in number—altogether one hundred and twenty lads, all transcendent.

In the east, the Nine-*Qi* Azure Numinous Jade Maidens, twenty-four in number; in the south, the Three-*Qi* Cinnabar Numinous Jade Maidens, twenty-four in number; in the west, the Seven-*Qi* Radiant Numinous Jade Maidens, twenty-four in number; in the north, the Five-*Qi* Mysterious Numinous Jade Maidens, twenty-four in number; and in the center, the One-*Qi* Yellow Numinous Jade Maidens, twenty-four in number—altogether one hundred and twenty maidens, all transcendent.

The Scripture states: Summon forth from within the adept’s body the Three-and-Five Merit Officials, the Left and Right Attendant Envoys, the Incense-Bearing Golden Lads, the Message-Transmitting Jade Maidens, the Five August Lords’ Direct Talismans, and the Day-Directing Incense Officials—thirty-two of each.

The Thirty-Two Natural Renewal Merit Officials of the Three Heavens, the Thirty-Two Natural Memorial-Submitting Merit Officials of the Three Heavens, the Thirty-Two Natural Message-Transmitting Merit Officials of the Three Heavens, the Thirty-Two Natural Mysterious-Wondrous Merit Officials of the Three Heavens, and the Thirty-Two Natural Incense-Flying Merit Officials of the Three Heavens.

The Thirty-Two Natural Renewal Merit Officials of the Five August Lords, the Thirty-Two Natural Memorial-Submitting Merit Officials of the Five August Lords, the Thirty-Two Natural Message-Transmitting Merit Officials of the Five August Lords, the Thirty-Two Natural Mysterious-Wondrous Merit Officials of the Five August Lords, and the Thirty-Two Natural Incense-Flying Merit Officials of the Five August Lords.

The Mysterious Master states: The Three-and-Five Merit Officials possess twofold numinous transformations, each governing a spiritual bureau. There are the Three Origins and Five Virtues Merit Officials, who are subordinate to the Great Clarity’s Cavern Spirits. These are the Three Heavens and Five August Lords’ Merit Officials, not born of womb-transformation or possessing form, but all spontaneously transformed from the true *qi* of the Three-and-Five. By the celestial true Dao-*qi*, they summon and register the correct *qi* of the Three Fields and Five Viscera within the body, fashioning them into numinous spirits. The Merit Officials are so named because they hold specific bureaus and duties.

The Left Attendant Envoys, thirty-two in number; the Right Attendant Envoys, thirty-two in number; the Incense-Bearing Golden Lads, thirty-two in number; and the Message-Transmitting Jade Maidens, thirty-two in number.

The Mysterious Master states: The Left and Right Attendant Envoys are the spirits of yin-yang communication, the first to act upon the Five Officials’ intentions. The Incense-Bearing Golden Lads embody the yang’s initial purity and clarity. The Message-Transmitting Jade Maidens embody the yin’s fundamental purity and reverence. The transmission of messages and flying incense conveys sincerity and reaches the truth—all are primordial perfected beings of the fourth rank.

The Azure August Lord’s Direct Talismans, thirty-two in number; the Vermilion August Lord’s Direct Talismans, thirty-two in number; the White August Lord’s Direct Talismans, thirty-two in number; the Black August Lord’s Direct Talismans, thirty-two in number; and the Yellow August Lord’s Direct Talismans, thirty-two in number.

The Mysterious Master states: These are also the true *qi* talismans of the Five Viscera, transformed by the *qi* harmonized with the Dao and virtue.

The Day-Directing Incense Officials, thirty-two in number.

The Mysterious Master states: The Day-Directing Incense Officials are assigned to the sixty days of the *jiazi* cycle, descendants of the Three Sovereigns. *Jiayin* and *Tianhuang* govern *jiachen*, the souls of the Six Fields, the parents of *jia*. Each day has thirty-two officials who direct the fragrant *qi*, dispersing filth and summoning the true—this is their efficacious duty. Their male and female forms are transformed from the *qi* of the Six *Jia*. Though the myriad spirits are not limited to thirty-two, only thirty-two are summoned for memorials, corresponding to the celestial numbers of the four directions.

Each heaven has two Three-and-Five Merit Officials, two Left and Right Attendant Envoys, one Incense-Bearing Golden Lad, one Message-Transmitting Jade Maiden, one Direct Talisman for each of the Five August Lords, and one Day-Directing Incense Official—twelve in total per heaven. The thirty-two heavens thus comprise three hundred and sixty in total. Each of these officials—two Merit Officials per one—refers to one for the Three Heavens and one for the Five August Lords, corresponding above to the twelve hundred Official Lords and below to the thirty-six thousand spirit-*qi*.

The Mysterious Master states: Within the Jade Clarity’s Numinous Void Palace and the Inner Court of the Heavenly Immortals of the Numinous Treasure, there are celestial bureaus that descend to serve the palace’s immortals, all summoned from above to descend.

**Demon-Discerning Division**
The Demon-Discerning Jade Maidens, two in number, with four assigned from the Immortal Homeland.
The Eight Might Demon-Subduing Commanders, five in number, with ten assigned from the Immortal Homeland.
The Spirit-Wisdom Ghost-Slaying Captains, five in number, with ten assigned from the Immortal Homeland.

**Treasure Scripture Division**
The Perfected of the Celestial Talisman Treasures, one in number; the Heavenly Text Recorders of the Treasure Registers, two in number; the Perfected Translators of the Talisman Scripts and Treasure Registers, two in number; and the Jade Maidens Holding the Heavenly Texts of the Treasure Registers, two in number.

**Reception Division**
The Jade Maidens of the Ten Heavens’ Reception, one each; the Jade Maidens of the Three Heavens’ Reception, one each; the Jade Maidens of the Five August Lords’ Reception, one each; the Numinous Officials of the Three Clarities’ Memorial Submission, three each; and the Jade Maidens of the Thirty-Two Heavens’ Reception, one each.

**Duty Division**
The Numinous Officials of the Numinous Void Seal-Holding, the Numinous Void Dharma-Holding, the Numinous Void Verification, the Numinous Void Dispatch, and the Numinous Void Prison Supervision—eleven each.

**Celestial Physicians Division**
The Immortal Officials of the Celestial Physicians’ Supreme Medicines, who discern pulse forms and signs; the Numinous Officials of the Celestial Physicians’ Supreme Medicines, who administer medicines according to illness; the Divine Clerks of the Celestial Physicians’ Supreme Medicines, who prepare and refine medicines; the Supreme Clarity’s Form-Generating Doctors of the Celestial Physicians’ Supreme Medicines, who regenerate forms and restore flesh; the Three-and-Five Illness-Treating Merit Officials of the Celestial Physicians’ Supreme Medicines, who diagnose pulses and discuss illnesses; and the Minor Clerks of the Celestial Physicians’ Supreme Medicines, who request medicines, treat illnesses, and apply stone needles, moxibustion, and cauterization.

Below these are the Medicine-Apportioning Numinous Officials and the Toxin-Collecting General Envoys, two each.

**Protocol and Guard Division**
The Way-Guarding Divine Kings, two in number; the Jade Maidens of the Elegant Splendor, thirty-two in number; the Immortal Officials of the Elegant Splendor, thirty-two in number; and the Jade Clarity’s Merit-Executing Merit Officials, twelve in number.

The Grand Generals of Jade Clarity

The Mysterious Master said: Within Jade Clarity there are the Radiant Celestial Generals, mighty deities who assist the Dao, dispel demons, and descend upon command. The Numinous Officials of all heavens and passes, from the *xu* (11th earthly branch) to the *chen* (5th earthly branch), execute the斗诀 (Dipper Formula) to annihilate malevolent spirits of the ghostly and evil destinies; from *chen* to *xu*, they annihilate the Numinous Officials of hellish and evil destinies; from *kun* (southwest) to *gen* (northeast), they annihilate the Numinous Officials of the beastly and evil destinies; from *gen* to *kun*, they sever the Numinous Officials of the womb-root, the placenta-root, the knotted-root, the nodal-root, the desire-root, the six roots, and the earth-root. The Numinous Officials of the *chen* (5th branch) fly to transcend the household of color-karma; those of the *shen* (9th branch) fly to transcend the household of desire-karma; those of the *you* (10th branch) fly to transcend the household of love-karma; those of the *yin* (3rd branch) fly to transcend the household of emotion-karma; those of the *si* (6th branch) fly to transcend the household of greed-karma; and those of the *hai* (12th branch) are named the Numinous Officials of Supreme Mystery.

Commanding Ghost Soldiers of the Three Heavens, the Nine Heavens’ Supreme Patriarch, the Divine Kings of the Left Leading the Banner, the Mighty Deities of the Right Commanding the Standard, the Valiant Warriors of the Rear Drumming Battalion, the Heavenly Guards of the Front Wielding the Staff.

The Jade Clarity Divine Duke, Supreme Minister of the Supreme Mystery, of the sixth rank, together with the Jade Clarity Formula and the Purple Tenuity Seal, summons them. The Great Divine Azure Dragon of *zhen* (east), the Great Divine White Tiger of *dui* (west), the Great Divine Vermilion Bird of *li* (south), the Great Divine Dark Warrior of *kan* (north), the Great Divine Exorcising Deity of *kan* (north), the Great Divine Lion of *dui* (west), the Great Divine *Qiongqi* of *kun* (southwest), the Great Divine *Hailin* of *gen* (northeast), the Great Divine Heavenly Horse of *xun* (southeast), the Great Divine Vanguard of the *wu* (7th branch) Mighty Heavenly Guards, the Jade Clarity’s Folded-Hands Commanding Demon-Whip Banner Marshals, the Great Divine Generals of the *chen* (5th branch) Literary Star Pointing Jade Clarity’s Fire-Hurling, the Great Divine Generals of the *yin-li-wu-zhen* (3rd-9th-7th-3rd branches) Hand-Lifting Jade Clarity’s Flowing Bells, the *shen-kun-li* (9th-2nd-9th branches) Seven-Hurling Middle-Finger *chou-yin-mao* (2nd-3rd-4th branches).

The Great Divine Generals of the Front Beheading with Metal and Iron, the Jade Clarity Formula, the second finger directly pointing the Great Divine General of the Vast Queen Mother’s Punishment, the Jade Clarity’s Slaughtering Envoys with four fingers rooted and five fingers clenched, the Jade Clarity’s Wind-Fire Campaign Great Generals with the right hand in the Golden Lifting Formula, the left hand’s Four Mountains reaching *xun* (southeast) to lift high the beginning. The Great Deities Severing Ghostly Filth, the middle finger rooted at *gen* (northeast) lifting to inspect the ghostly camps, the *kun-li-xun-zhen* (southwest-9th-southeast-3rd branches) threading, the middle finger’s central *wen-chou* (civil-2nd branch) lifting. The Great Deities of the Golden Horse Post Route, from *wu* (7th branch) through the twelve earthly branches, returning from *li* (9th branch) to *wu* (7th branch) lifting.

The Record-Keepers of Jade Clarity list their names. The Three Clarities’ Formula of the middle finger, reaching the Five Directions, returns to the Jade Clarity Formula.

The Mysterious Master said: These Grand Generals and Mighty Deities of Jade Clarity all belong to the command of the Jade Clarity Divine Duke, Supreme Minister of the Supreme Mystery. Together with the Great Marshals of all heavens, their merit is equal to the loftiest numina, and they style themselves the Radiant Bureau of Jade Clarity’s Numinous Treasure, assisting Jade Clarity in kalpa transitions, demon-destruction, and disaster-sweeping, ascending and delivering the disciples of immortal study. They examine the Three Realms, drive out evil and malevolence, strictly govern the Northern Feng, control and command ghostly apparitions, search out ghostly encampments, and purify the Dao-qi, preparing for the seed-people of later generations to behold the Sagely Lord of Great Peace. They are all ministers of support and sweeping eradication.

Jade Clarity possesses the Heaven-Ascending Certificates, bestowed upon those who attain the Dao and ascend as immortals. When the Heavenly Worthy grants certificates to deliver suffering souls, they are sent to the Southern Palace. Without a certificate, the Heavenly Gate officials rebuke and bar their advance. Those who seek and obtain the certificate encounter no fettering obstructions at the Heavenly Gate.

Those who request the heavens to eradicate the Three Evils: internally, these are summoned by the Three Karmas; externally, they arise from the transgressions of the Three Poisons, leading to falls into the Three Evil Destinies of ghosts, beasts, and hells. Having today received deliverance from Jade Clarity, they follow their birthly *jia-yi* (1st-2nd celestial stems) to ascend and belong to the Thirty-Two Heavens. Through the master-disciple transmission across the passes, they request the eradication of the Three Evils. Internally, they eliminate the Three Karmas of body, speech, and mind; externally, they sever the Three Poisons of greed, anger, and delusion. Thus, hells have no means for their fall, ghosts have no means for their entry, and beasts have no means for their transformation.

Though delivered to eradicate the Three Evils internally and externally, if the karmic poisons of the Three Evils are not eliminated, they still cannot escape falling. In human birth, above are the twelve nodes, the roots of dead-qi transmitted by parents; in the middle are the twelve knots, the roots of dead-qi received by the body; below are the twelve placenta-knots, the roots of dead-qi transmitted to descendants—all are the earth-root. Therefore, on the day of deliverance, these must also be severed. Internally, the Thirty-Six Roots are eliminated; externally, the Six Roots’ evil destinies are restrained. The earth-root severed, debts are sealed, and forms are enclosed. Only then can one fly to transcend the Five Karmic Households of suffering, have one’s name listed in the Supreme Mystery, be supervised by the Demon Kings, and ascend through the Heavenly Gate. On this day of ascending Jade Clarity with flesh and bone together, the purpose of deliverance is fulfilled.

The Divine Dukes below receive the command of sweeping eradication. The Divine Duke is a minister of the Earthly Sovereign, heir of the Great Emperor of Horse Ancestors, and father of the Great Deity of the Dragon Horn *chen* (5th branch) constellation. His position is the Jade Clarity Divine Duke, Supreme Minister of the Supreme Mystery, styled the Horse-Dragon Clan, with the personal name Kuo Yi.

The *Scripture of the Infinite Salvation of Humanity, Supreme Method of the Numinous Treasure*, Scroll Twenty-Nine, concludes.
The *Scripture of the Infinite Salvation of Humanity, Supreme Method of the Numinous Treasure*, Scroll Thirty: **Rituals of Exorcism and Salvation**

The Master says: When the cycles of Heaven and Earth are in disorder, one must inscribe the texts of the Dragon Script and Phoenix *Qi* upon plain silk, place them upon purple net, and install them in renowned mountains, reciting this scripture to exorcise the affliction.

If the stellar lodges fall into disarray and the sun and moon lose their proper course, inscribe in cinnabar upon yellow silk the Red Script of the Five Elders and the Jade Characters of the True Writ, install them in renowned mountains, and recite to exorcise.

If the four seasons fall into disorder and yin and yang fail to harmonize, inscribe in cinnabar upon green silk the chapters of the Great Brahma’s Correct Sounds, place them in village shrines, temples, or renowned mountains, and recite to exorcise.

If the sovereign of the state encounters calamity and warfare arises on all sides, inscribe in cinnabar upon yellow silk the secret names of the Thirty-Two Heavens, wear them upon the body, and recite to exorcise.

If pestilence spreads and the people suffer death and injury, inscribe in cinnabar upon green silk the Correct Sounds of the Thirty-Two Heavens, wear them upon the body, and recite to exorcise.

If the lives of masters or companions come to an end, inscribe in cinnabar upon yellow silk the Great Brahma’s Hidden Speech and the Infinite Sounds, and burn them to deliver the deceased.

In all ritual applications, visualize oneself as the Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, press the middle joint of the middle finger, draw in the three *qi* of the Heavenly Gate, and inscribe while facing south.

If one follows the ritual protocols, fasts, recites with utmost sincerity, inscribes talismans, and chants, then the names shall be recorded by the myriad heavens, the ten thousand spirits shall attend as guards, and one shall become a minister of the Golden Towers, with the Demon Kings as guarantors.

The *Scripture of the Infinite Salvation of Humanity, Supreme Method of the Numinous Treasure*, Scroll Thirty-One: **Rituals of Exorcism and Salvation – The Red Script and Jade Characters**

The Primordial Red Script, Five Scrolls of True Writ,

The Profound Mystery of the Nine Heavens’ Genesis,
