To leak or profane it is to violate the statutes, and the crime is unforgivable. In the unseen, it implicates one’s distant ancestors; in the manifest, it brings disaster to one’s descendants, with calamities following one after another. How can one not be cautious?

For those who practice this method, if they are determined to deliver the departed, they must first refine their own primordial yang, molding and casting the myriad patterns. Without seeking the true, they become true of themselves; without seeking the divine, they become divine of themselves. In harmony with the Great Mystery, the suffering souls find refuge.

Those who covet empty fame, betray the Dao, and deceive others are but walking corpses and wandering ghosts, mocked in the unseen realms, with no recourse for prayer. Beware, beware! Exert yourself in refining body and spirit, and both the hidden and manifest will be blessed.

**The Monthly Jade Refining Method**

The essence of the sun takes a round form, its radiance a square, its color crimson. On the third, ninth, seventeenth, fifteenth, and twenty-second days of each month—five occasions in total—perform the refining above the Gate of Metal. With the *Golden Essence Stone Radiance Water Mother Mushroom*, refine the sun’s soul. On these days, the sun’s splendor scatters, the golden essence overflows, and all under Heaven receives its moisture.

If on these days one gathers the sun’s root, the numinous descends to the Jade Portal, and by practicing this method, one ascends to the Gate of Metal. The Gate of Metal lies above the Western Pass of Heaven, the portal through which the sun and moon communicate their numinosity.

To gather the sun’s root, first draw a bottle of well-flower water and expose it in the central courtyard. On green paper, write in cinnabar the *Jade Talisman of Stone Radiance Water Mother*, place it in the water, and face the water while clicking the teeth sixteen times.

Recite the incantation:

*"Radiant Yang’s luminous essence,
glows resplendent in the Purple Court.
Eight rays shine brightly,
soul’s brilliance overflows in full.
Five revolutions, three returns—
qi circulates through the Great Numinosity.
Fragrant streams curve and pour,
shading and moistening all living beings.
Adorned at the Gate of Metal,
the root of splendor gleams fresh.
Consume the Stone Radiance,
Water Mother pours forth essence.
Follow the turning of Heaven’s darkness,
revolve with the sun’s glory.
Nine apertures receive the true,
liberating the original form.
Hasten, hasten, as the statutes command!"*

Then face the sun’s zenith, click the teeth twenty-four times, and ingest the talisman while reciting:

*"The Yang essence now flows,
flying splendor renewed.
Imperial rays overflow,
shading and infusing the inner coils.
Gaze upward to feast on the mysterious moisture,
fragrant radiance arrives in full.
Palace and dwelling open wide,
washing away the dust of clamor.
The body reflects jade’s light,
the face emits golden truth.
Spirit soars with Yu’s steps,
ascending to the Gate of the Sun.
Hasten, hasten, as the statutes command!"*

Then tilt the head back, draw in the sun’s qi forty-five times, and use the remaining water to wash the face and bathe. Return to the chamber.

Next, face west, click the teeth twenty-four times, close the eyes, and visualize five-colored streaming clouds descending from the sun to encircle the body, along with a purple cloud, large as the pupil of the eye, layered tenfold within the radiant five colors. Draw the qi into the mouth forty-five times, and chew the saliva nine times.

Recite the incantation:

*"The sun’s soul scatters light,
five colors pour in abundance.
Refining the form at the Gate of Metal,
the circular radiance towers majestically.
Numinous brilliance shines forth,
receiving illumination from the Celestial River.
Jade mushrooms overflow,
orchid moisture exudes fragrance.
Drink of my Yellow Spring,
nourish me with flying splendor.
Sip the root, swallow the essence—
longevity equals the numinous tree.
Form clings to the Great Radiance,
the body ascends with flying clouds.
For a thousand ages, ten thousand kalpas,
grant me this boon.
Hasten, hasten, as the statutes command!"*

Then bow three times with the heart.

*Stone Radiance Ninefold-Refined Water Mother Jade Talisman*
The *Moon Splendor* is square in form, its circular radiance suffused with yellow qi. On the fifth, fifteenth, and twenty-fifth days of each month—once or twice—it passes above the Eastern Well. The Eastern Well is the Gate of Mysterious Radiance.

To gather the moon’s splendor: when the moon approaches the Eastern Well, draw well-flower water at dawn and expose it in the central courtyard. At midnight, write in cinnabar the *Yang Essence Jade Womb Refined Immortal True Talisman* on white paper, place the talisman in the water, and face the water while reciting:

*"Yellow qi and Yang essence,
threefold conjoined to condense light.
Mysterious radiance returns to true,
adorned with eight rays.
Refined and transmuted at the Eastern Well,
receiving illumination from the flying star.
Golden splendor scatters numinosity,
the Five Lords diffuse fragrance.
The Lady descends with sweet dew,
sprinkling the ten directions.
Vast fragrance pours downward,
filling the six viscera to overflowing.
Golden essence undergoes nine transformations,
altering the radiance to restore the countenance.
Hasten, hasten, as the statutes command!"*

Next, face the moon and strike the teeth thirty-six times in succession. Ingest the talisman while reciting the incantation:

*"Riding the void, drifting like mist,
roaming and feasting in the great emptiness.
Ascending to the moon’s courtyard,
paired with the perfected as a twin.
Transforming through the eight paths,
emerging from being and entering non-being.
Dual luminances shine as one,
eternally preserved without diminution.
Hasten, hasten, as the statutes command!"*

Then, tilt the head back and draw in the moon’s *qi* fifty times, swallowing it. Use the remaining water to bathe and wash the face, then return indoors. Next, face east and strike the teeth thirty-six times in succession. Close the eyes and visualize the five-colored streaming light of the moon descending to envelop the body, along with a yellow *qi* as large as the pupil of the eye, square and round, layered dozens of times inside and out, gleaming within the five colors and entering the *Dongfang* together with the *qi*. Then draw in the *qi* fifty times and swallow the saliva fifteen times to conclude.

Recite the incantation:

*"Concealing heaven and embracing light,
yellow *qi* dense and luxuriant.
Congealing essence and containing condensation,
eight rays radiant and resplendent.
Adorning the yellow splendor,
jade radiance pouring and irrigating.
Jade mushrooms overflowing,
moistening the light of the celestial vastness.
All under heaven receives the moisture,
ascending at dawn’s first light.
Riding the radiance to ascend the void,
attaining the ascent to the imperial palace.
The Eternal Yang descends to the world,
transcending the eight adversities.
Shining with the sun’s brilliance,
equal in stem with the moon.
Hasten, hasten, as the statutes command!"*

Next, bow three times with the heart.

**Yang Essence Jade Womb Refined Immortal True Talisman**
**Nine Palaces Insight Method**

The Mysterious Master said: Those without steadfast power who encounter all manner of wayless ghosts and spirits may rely on the Nine Palaces method. For men, begin at the *Li* palace at age one and proceed in sequence; for women, begin at the *Kan* palace at age one and proceed in reverse. Each year shifts to the next palace. Determine the palace of the year, then proceed to the month, the day, and the hour. From the hour, trace back to identify the affliction or transgression when the ghost or spirit manifests. Note the year’s branch, month’s branch, day’s branch, and directional location to discern the ghost or spirit’s form and condition.

**Qian**: The *Qian* image governs heavy-headedness, difficulty in lifting the body’s weight. Both feet grow cold and painful—haunted by a Yang person. A grave illness clings to the body until death; the northwest is the place of sinking. Burning incense may reveal vows, black-clad spirits, or malevolent souls.

**Kan**: The *Kan* palace brings bodily confusion, reluctance to speak, and rumbling intestines. Water toxins or bloating, drowning, or speechlessness may occur. Wandering in the due north, strange dreams and mournful wailing of the feet. A ghost of yin or yang haunts—inquire closely to uncover the cause.

**Gen**: The *Gen* direction brings heart and gut vexation, throat blockage and injury. Mad speech and strange behavior, sorrowful laughter beyond measure. A group of eight ghosts must be present; they roam temples and shrines without concealment. Further, wood and metal anomalies—examine the northeast for their forms and lights.

**Zhen**: The *Zhen* palace brings pestilence, alternating chills and fever spreading to the four limbs. Aversion to food, cursing, and blasphemy—offending the celestial envoys. Death by punishment, plague, or fright, with cyan and green dead spirits following. Red and yellow female ghosts appear; within three days, peril looms.

**Xun**: The *Xun* palace harbors mad ghosts, blindness, and loss of sight. Ancestral spirits speak in yin voices; external afflictions are women. Souls and spirits fall into the hands of ghosts, causing day and night groaning. Only through purifying fasts and seeking the great Dao can health and peace be preserved.

**Li**: The *Li* palace in the due south brings abscesses, boils, burns, and scalds. Excessive heat and jaundice, blood ghosts and deaths from childbirth. Crimson and purple victims of violent death, their spirits clinging to kin—yang souls. Face the fire’s position to confront the malevolent ghosts and discern their movements.

**Kun**: The *Kun* region brings spleen and stomach ailments, dysentery, and bodily emaciation. Prolonged illness resists cure; the southwest harbors hidden corpses. Disturbing the earth injures the year’s breaker, revealing spectral lights at that time. Drawn by ancestral mothers, lingering dead spirits, and dragon *po*.

**Dui**: The *Dui* palace brings consumptive corpse *zhu*, wheezing, coughing, and stagnation. Burial misfortune and inauspicious seating, punishment and injury with lingering connections. Premature death seeks merit and virtue; ancient artifacts lie near the dwelling. Three ghostly companions together incur grievances and transgressions.

The Mysterious Master said: For all practices of recitation, salvation, disaster mitigation, subjugation, healing, incantations over objects, vanquishing malevolent spirits, averting inauspicious omens, repelling spectral lights, summoning dragons to bring rain, praying for clear skies and luminosity, halting floods and extinguishing fires, dispelling plagues and removing harm, activating talismans and consecrated water, restraining venomous beasts, seeking immortality and cultivating the true, the seven classics and eight wefts, descending the perfected and summoning spirits—all require the secret recitation of the *Ling Shu* ten thousand times. Thereafter, whatever is desired will swiftly manifest as divine efficacy. Gradually reaching one hundred thousand recitations, one attains natural mastery, and transformation knows no bounds. For major matters, write in hidden script, burn and scatter the ashes, or place them on high mountains, rocky valleys, or stone surfaces. Alternatively, bury them in the earth or sink them in water. For deeply harvesting immortal medicines to cure illness, use this hidden script, reciting strictly according to the oral instructions.

**Numinous Treasure Divine Mirror Method**

The Dao’s utmost emptiness responds and moves all things to life. Heaven’s utmost purity mirrors and oversees all directions without concealment. Earth’s utmost stillness nurtures and bears all things in peace. Water’s utmost clarity moistens and transforms all beings to completion. The sun and moon’s utmost brightness illuminates and warms all paths with radiance. If there exists a thing that can embody the sun and moon, and water’s clarity that can symbolize heaven and earth, then the Dao’s purity and stillness, empty yet responding to things endlessly, never retaining anything—externally, this is the nine-inch round mirror; internally, it is the square-inch *Jianggong*.

Thus, the great method of the Numinous Treasure Dao takes the mysterious dwelling as its foundation. To communicate with spirits and penetrate the wondrous, the bright mirror serves as the beginning. Therefore, the *Daluo* Heaven’s phase first expounds the eighteen wondrous methods of the Numinous Treasure Divine Mirror, encompassing the great numbers of the nine heavens and nine earths. It illuminates the obscure and dim, discerning the secret mechanisms of ghosts and spirits. Penetrating the mysterious and perceiving the subtle, it knows the hidden and manifest of sages and mortals. Illuminating the five palaces and reflecting the ten directions, it is like the moon viewing the palm. The method employs a nine-inch round mirror, clear, lustrous, and undisturbed by polishing. Follow the prescribed form, recite the incantation, and infuse the mirror’s surface with *qi*. After eighty-one days, the Yang number’s method is complete, and the divine light will manifest true traces in all directions.

To perceive the Three Realms with penetrating vision and see clearly through the ten directions—nothing, not even the finest detail, can escape, let alone the forms and traces of ghosts and spirits. Yet if the mind is not pure and upright, thoughts not empty and still, or the will not immaculate and sincere, demonic spirits may transform and manifest false apparitions. Practitioners, can you afford not to be vigilant?

**Lingbao Five Peaks and Three Paths Treasure Illumination Incantation**
Red apricot, ink-black, grind true, wrap the sole, Lingbao.

With the left hand, form the cyclic mudra of *Zhen*, *Kan*, *Dui*, and *Li*, recite the incantation, and press the *Lingbao* mudra at the middle joint of the middle finger. Draw the *qi* of the five directions and blow it onto the mirror. Once done, recite the incantation:

*"Gongdu gathers the souls, summoning the swift messengers of the eight directions.
Heavenly spirits, earthly deities—
ten thousand spirits unite, joining the celestial and terrestrial mandates to bind and command."*

After reciting the incantation, draw the *qi* of the central heaven and blow it toward the *Gen* direction, then inhale the *qi* of *Gen* and blow it onto the mirror. Once done, trace the eight trigrams with the thumb and recite:

*"Reverently invoke the great spirits of the eight trigrams—*Qian*, *Kan*, *Gen*, *Zhen*, *Xun*, *Li*, *Kun*, *Dui*—to hasten the heavenly spirits and earthly deities of the eight directions, that their forms may appear within my mirror."*

With the left hand, trace the *Lingbao* mudra of the eight trigrams; with the right hand’s *Lingbao* mudra, use the middle finger to mark eight points on the mirror’s surface, beginning at *Qian* and proceeding to *Dui*. Then trace back to the *Lingbao* mudra, press firmly, inhale the harmonized *qi* of the eight directions, and blow it onto the mirror. Place the mudra upon the mirror and recite the **Lingbao Celestial Entry Chamber Bright Mirror Incantation**:

*"Wind gathers in the east,
Xun’s clouds rise to the heavens.
Qian’s *qi* collects the Dipper,
Qian’s rain scatters the five directions."*

Blow the *qi* of the two corners onto the mirror, then form the cyclic mudra of the Five Peaks. Recite the incantation:

*"Lin."*

The red apricot enters heaven and forms, shattering the images to rectify the eight directions.
In the east, *Mao*, ink-black takes shape.
Rain descends, rain confronts; the Four Waterways’ dragons align with *Qian*, the primordial spirit gathers the trigrams.
In the north, *Kan* grinds true thoughts to reveal gold; wielding the armor of a thousand men, *Kun* stirs the *qi* of the five directions.
In the west, *Dui*’s *waluo* illumines the Southern Dipper; my great overflow rests in hand, earth’s primordial responds to heaven’s primordial.
Within *Li*, the numinous treasure guards the heart.
The middle finger arranges the *waluo* in knotted patterns; the image should shatter the palace to seize it.

With the right hand, trace the mudra of the Five Peaks, recite the incantation, and draw the *qi* of the five directions to blow upon the mirror. Recite once more, then retreat from the central pattern to *Dui*, press firmly upon the mudra, inhale the *qi* of the west, and blow. This is the *Lingbao* Five Gates Mirror Method for entering the Dao.
Thereafter, summon the celestial spirits into the mirror and sharply observe them within. The incantation reads:

*"By the Emperor’s decree, the numinous treasure shines forth."*

With the right hand, draw the *qi* of the south, *Li*’s pattern, and blow upon the mirror. Recite again:

*"From whence do I derive this power? Sharply observe the celestial spirits within the mirror.
Gather the ancestral *qi* of the Three Origins; the great celestial dharma proceeds.
Above, collect the eight directions; *Qian*’s primordial aids the Great Yang.
Illusory yin descends from the night; I array myself toward the five directions."*

With the right hand, recite the incantation once, inhale the *qi* of the gates of heaven, earth, and humanity, and blow. Recite the incantation again, inhale the *qi* of the eight directions, and blow. Recite once more, draw the *qi* of the Great Yang, and blow upon the mirror. Next, recite the incantation again, inhale the *qi* from the north, then the *qi* of the five directions—west, south, east, and center—and blow upon the mirror.
Thus may one observe the celestial spirits manifest in form. If the vision remains dim and unseen, recite the *Moving Dimness Incantation*:

**Moving Dimness Treasure Illumination Incantation**
*"Dimness shifts, flashes shatter; clarity arises at the wings’ corners.
Open the luminous *qi* of Lord Gong; sever, gather, and expel.
Lift, press, move—spirits clear and stir, spirits clear and stir.
Gather, gather."*

With the right hand, form the *Lingbao* mudra, inhale the bright light of the sun and moon, and blow upon the mirror. If the distinctions among directions remain unclear, recite the *Celestial Capital Incantation*:

**Celestial Capital Concealed Treasure Illumination Incantation**
*"Moving *qi* drills the five notes; the celestial gate closes to admit the true.
Perverse *qi* violates the five phases; earth’s *qi* seizes the three yin.
The dharma’s numen hastens the destruction of the false; the three yang disperse with the sun.
Encountering yin, seize the yang; by decree, resonance is severed and gathered.
Decree and seize."*

With the right hand, recite the incantation once, press the *Lingbao* mudra, inhale the *qi* of the celestial gate, and blow upon the mirror. Recite the incantation again, draw the *qi* of the Great Yang, and blow upon the mirror. When complete, invoke and unite the names and ranks of the celestial spirits to be illuminated, and blow into the mirror.
Next, recite the *Five Peaks Incantation* to hasten the union and illumination of the celestial spirits for clear vision:

**Lingbao Five Peaks Spirit Illumination Incantation**
*"The red haze moves through wood; sever the mustache to present the feet.
*Mao*’s ink-black water shatters; yin’s mustache swiftly hastens.
*Kan* grinds true gold sharply; horns align with west and east.
*Dui*’s *waluo* traverses the fire scripture; refine the mustache to perfect me.
*Li*’s numinous treasure, earth’s spirit; the treasure returns to life’s cause.
The center must swiftly hasten, swiftly, swiftly."*

With the left hand, trace the mudra of the Five Peaks from east to north, west, south, and the celestial center, inhale the *qi*, and blow into the mirror to distinguish the ranks of immortals, true beings, ghosts, and creatures, and the myriad differences between the perverse and the upright. Then employ the *Three Paths Incantation* to gather the spirits and perfect the true:

**Three Paths Gathering Light Treasure Illumination Incantation**
*"Rising life turns; *Qian* alone shifts and moves. *Kun* may illuminate Han; *Xun*’s Lord Du achieves completion. Sharply align the corners.
*Gen* confronts the soul’s *qi* to gather and seize.
Gather, gather, gather."*

Recite the incantation, inhale the *qi* of the Three Paths, and blow upon the mirror. Examine closely to perceive the true image, or summon the spirits of the eight directions to move the scene and clearly see the affairs of the eight directions.
Next, recite the *Exchanging Qi Incantation* to achieve perfect clarity:

**Exchanging Qi and Uniting Trigrams Treasure Illumination Incantation**
*"Exchanging *qi* shifts to form firmness; the celestial gate stands to renew knowledge.
The earth’s door seeks the complete pattern of *qi*.
The center."*

With the right hand, press the *Qian-Kun Lingbao* mudra three times, recite the incantation, and blow the *qi* of the three directions upon the mirror to observe the affairs of the eight directions.
If dispatching and then recalling, recite the *Reappearing Incantation*, exchanging *qi* through the Seven Awakenings to restore vision:

**Reappearing Treasure Illumination Incantation**
*"Yin’s spirits thoroughly awaken to extinguish the will to defile; the celestial *Qi*’s spirits gather in response."*

With the right hand, press the *Lingbao* mudra, recite the incantation, inhale the *qi* of the northwest, and blow upon the mirror to immediately manifest the summoned spirit within.

**Five Phases Upright Qi Treasure Illumination Incantation**
*"Red haze, ink-black, true grinding, *waluo*, numinous treasure.
Rising life turns; alone shifts and moves.
May illuminate Han; achievement completes Lord Du.
Sharply align the corners; gather the soul and seize.
Lord Du gathers the soul, summoning the swift messengers of the eight directions, celestial spirits, earthly numina, and the myriad spirits to unite as one.
Unite the decrees of heaven and earth; unite the bright decree of the Celestial Emperor and the sun. Decree and seize."*

First, with the left hand, trace the mudra of the Five Peaks and Three Paths, draw the *qi* of the five directions, and blow upon the mirror. Release the mudra, then trace the mudra of the eight trigrams, and with the right hand, mark eight points upon the mirror’s eight directions. Recite the incantation:

*"Reverently, the great spirits of the eight trigrams—*Qian*, *Kan*, *Gen*, *Zhen*, *Xun*, *Li*, *Kun*, *Dui*—hasten the celestial spirits and earthly numina of the eight directions to manifest their forms within my mirror."*

With the right hand, recite the incantation, then blow the *qi* of the eight directions upon the mirror to illuminate ghosts and spirits.
Then alter the incantation to read:

*"Gather and seize the wayless ghosts of the eight directions to manifest their forms within my mirror."*

**Breaking the Green Register Incantation**
*"Unite to form the pool, heed the beneficial green. White frost’s silk shatters the green; the body stirs at dawn and dusk’s green.
Shatter the corners to distinguish the green; rely upon the western brightness’ green to depart and see the utmost green.
Gather and control, gather and control."*

With the right hand form the *Dongyue* mudra, recite the incantation, and blow the *qi* of the eastern direction upon the mirror to discern the garments of the heroic spirits and the implements of ghosts and souls, which appear visible within the mirror. Should they conceal their deceit or hide their origins, employ the following method.

**Breaking Concealment to Establish the Measure Incantation**
*"Bind intent to shatter the corners and force the measure; echo the name to establish the primordial name-measure.
Seize nature to surpass strength and divide the measure; array the wild and elegant to break the measure."*

By this, the hidden and obscure may be mirrored, whether their falsehoods or truths remain unproven. If still unclear, proceed with the following method.

**Heavenly Cavern Six Spirits Incantation**
*"Three Primes wondrous cavern, fix the Primordial and flourish the pure cavern.
Uphold and urge the conduct cavern; command the crimson firmament to coil the cavern.
Intent traverses to gather the plum cavern; divide the six red caverns."*

With the right hand form the *Lingbao* seal, gaze upward toward the Gate of Heaven, recite the incantation, and draw *qi* to blow upon the principal malevolent spirit who claims to be a great divine immortal. Use this to observe the celestial realm and discern its authenticity. Should it claim to be a star, verify it directly with the following method.

**Wing Constellation Four Spirits Incantation**
*"Wheel-flower year-different spirit, pure jade moon-wing spirit,
Divide and fix to seize the illuminating sun-wing spirit, rejoice and array to assist the timely wing spirit."*

Form the *Lingbao* seal, recite the incantation, and blow the *qi* of the southeast upon it. Then recite again, invoking the year, month, day, and hour, and blow the *qi* of the established direction upon the principal ghost or spirit to expose its false claims of stellar form or its role in causing disasters through human offenses, thereby revealing the truth.

**Illuminating Essence and Unbinding Form Incantation**
*"Summon repose to arrive at emptiness; the five directions gather intent to complete.
Call the sun to bind intent and shatter; see intent arrive within the count.
Bind principle to complete below; divide *qi* within the rosy clouds.
May dawn gather intent to rest; bind the uncarved to perfect intent."*

Face the sun, form the *Lingbao* seal, recite the incantation, and inhale the *qi* of sunlight to blow upon it. Recite again, draw the *qi* of the five directions from the void, and blow upon the mirror to examine it. For essence-*qi* that has taken form and caused harm over years, use this to distinguish the initial coalescence of spectral illusions and the uncarved block from which essence attaches to humans, tracing the source to reveal the truth. For unauthorized shrines and temples, employ the following method to address them.

**Three Spirits Confronting Inquiry Incantation**
*"Shatter, cut, oppose, and block; exchange constellations to deliver control.
Seize the correct and upright; illuminate repentance to return the hearth."*

Form the *Lingbao* seal and blow the *qi* of the northwest upon the mirror to subdue the defiant and obstinate principal spirits, compelling the mad and deluded to manifest bizarre falsehoods. For unauthorized shrines and temples that demand crooked offerings, force them to appear in form and confront the living. If their authenticity remains unverified, proceed with the following incantation.

**Facing the Four Directions Incantation**
*"Thousandfold scrutiny shifts and alters nature to seize conduct; array and arrive to restrain the black conduct.
Shift gaze to distinguish virtue and rectify conduct; tread and shift traces to depart and enable conduct."*

Form the *Lingbao* seal and blow the *qi* of the four directions upon the mirror to discern the truth or falsity of ghostly and demonic entities, verifying the emptiness or reality of malevolent influences. Opening the four directions, their traces become visible.

**Fourfold Discernment and Harmonizing Form Incantation**
*"Exhaust rectitude to harmonize the black; wood scrutinizes to circulate through.
Depart joy to separate and shift; eight severances love profit.
Cut, cut, cut."*

Form the *Lingbao* seal and blow the *qi* of the four directions upon the mirror to govern all demonic kinds that delude humans according to their desires, drawing them into the body to incite misfortune. Discern their forms and shadows to examine and perceive their roots.

**Six Profound Scrutiny of the Yin Incantation**
*"Endure to govern the distant and true to assist the profound; no greed shatters the profound.
Dawn befits arrival at the profound; call the defiled to confront the profound.
Six whites wheel intent through the profound; image shifts to report the profound."*

Form the *Lingbao* seal and blow the *qi* of the north upon the mirror to illuminate obscure and unfathomable mechanisms, making the unseen visible through this method.

**Seven Grades Discerning Ranks Incantation**
*"Open principle’s wondrous palace; eternal flower departs the palace.
Confront the center to calculate the palace; *Yanluo* wondrous palace.
Seize the malevolent to shatter the palace; treasure city departs the palace.
Confront the defiled *Jiaoxiu* to extinguish depletion and eclipse the sound of transgression."*

Form the *Lingbao* seal, recite the incantation, and blow the *qi* of the southeast upon the mirror, then the *qi* of the southwest upon the *yi*. Discern the orthodoxy or heterodoxy of ghosts and spirits, the magnitude of their ranks, and investigate to reveal them.

*The Great Method of the* Lingbao Wuliang Duren Shangjing*, Scroll Thirty-Five, concludes.*
*The Great Method of the* Lingbao Wuliang Duren Shangjing*, Scroll Thirty-Six.*

**Chapter on Dispelling Malevolence and Rescuing from Distress**

The essentials of the great method comprise three systems: first, the recitation of incantations; second, the deployment of talismans; and third, the performance of ritual procedures.

Incantations are the esoteric language of the heavens above. All perfected beings and the myriad spirits respond to their invocation, descending with the *qi*. Talismans are the celestial covenants of the heavens above, by which all perfected beings are summoned and drawn downward. Ritual procedures govern the bureaus of the immortals, where hosts of perfected beings and the hundred spirits each fulfill their duties. Yet they must be summoned by talismans and incantations, called forth to arrive and dispatched to depart. These are the three systems.

There are also four kinds of retribution: first, the retribution of wisdom; second, the retribution of spirit; third, the retribution of intention; and fourth, the retribution of immortality. The retribution of wisdom is the daily growth of wisdom. The retribution of spirit is the penetration and reach of the numinous. The retribution of intention is the uncommon clarity of perception, which leads to the retribution of immortality.

There are seven prohibitions: first, restrain the mouth; second, restrain the eyes; third, restrain the ears; fourth, restrain the hands; fifth, restrain the feet; sixth, restrain the intention; and seventh, restrain the thoughts. If the mouth does not utter curses or filthy speech, then the incantations will communicate with the numinous. If the eyes do not gaze upon filth or defilement, then they may behold the true spirits. If the ears do not listen to lewd sounds, then they may hear the sounds of the method. If the hands do not touch filthy things, then the mudras may communicate with the spirits. If the feet do not tread upon filth or evil, then stepping the *gang* may enable flight. If the intention does not arise in defiled perceptions, then one may summon and attract true immortals. If the thoughts do not arise in disorder, then concentrated contemplation may bring forth the divine luminaries. These are the seven prohibitions.

There are also five taboos: first, avoid holding infants or nursing children, lest the power of the method be obstructed. Second, avoid frivolously approaching the moon goddess, for meddlesome actions often give rise to demonic interference. Third, avoid angering the spirits with violence or disrespect, for the perfected will then depart far away. Fourth, avoid failing to universally cultivate merit, for virtue will not be recorded in the registers of immortality. Fifth, avoid disrespect and lack of faith, for heterodoxy will then mingle with orthodoxy. If one can first clarify the three systems, then the four kinds of retribution, and avoid violating the seven prohibitions, while carefully observing the five taboos, one may enter the wondrous realm of the great method’s mysterious gate.

When scholars practice this great method, they are often harassed by hosts of demons, leading to the failure of their merit and the accrual of transgressions. They should recite the *Incantation of Wisdom of the Golden Portal and Mysterious Origin Dao Lord for Eliminating Ninety-Six Kinds of Heterodoxies and One Hundred Eighty Kinds of Heavenly Demons*:

*"The *qi* of heaven and earth intermingles, giving rise to all manner of demons and perverse spirits.
Ever employ the true Dao to dispel the miasmic vapors.
First, contemplate: no self, no master.
All dharmas are empty; they cannot be mutually transformed.
Is there a single true realm?
Flying demons and ghostly spirits—
know their dwelling places, truly know the expedient means.
Provisionally empty and existent, the nature of dharmas is the banner of principle.
Abiding in profound stillness, without coming or going.
Knowing the true, one knows the demons above.
Knowing the three characteristics, one distinguishes the four kinds of emptiness.
Origin, prosperity, harmony, and constancy—
heterodoxy does not encroach upon orthodoxy.
Those who confront the soldiers in battle, array your ranks and advance!"*

*Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!*

For this method, first knock the teeth together twelve times, then recite the incantation in secret without regard to the number of repetitions. All demons will then generate good intentions and press their heads beneath the seat. If one wishes to eliminate them, recite the incantation extensively for many repetitions, and the demons will all flee, dissolving in accordance with the incantation.

**The True Talisman of the Upper Prime’s Refulgent Nine Yang Radiance Fire Bell**

When inscribing talismans, use cinnabar to write on yellow silk, facing south. With the left hand, form the Jade Emperor mudra, recite the esoteric name of the Mysterious Perfected, also called the *Lingqi* Spirit-Writing of the Jade Tone, or the *Zudao Xuan Zhen*. Light incense, concentrate the spirit, dip the cinnabar brush, and draw the nine yang radiance of the sun down onto the paper and brush. Then, in accordance with the method, proceed step by step to inscribe, without missing the sequence.

This talisman governs wood sprites, stone spirits, red demons, and inauspicious monsters that disturb and harm the people and their possessions. Inscribe the talisman with the iron cinnabar script, then impress it with the fire bell seal. Bury it a foot and some inches beneath the soil of the original location, and the demonic spirits will conceal their traces, ascending to be delivered as true Dao beings.

If flocks of birds gather and defile the blessed land of forests and ridges, one should petition the Vermilion Radiance Red Emperor of the Southern Marchmount and dispatch a talisman to expel them. This talisman may also be swallowed or worn by people.

To inscribe this talisman, first write the characters for "fire bell," then draw three vertical strokes above the "fire bell" characters, reciting the incantation from *"Yan jing"* to *"yi zhi."* Next, weave five horizontal strokes above the three vertical lines, reciting the incantation from *"Po lian"* to *"fei yang."* Then, turn nineteen times to the lower right of the five horizontal strokes, reciting the incantation from *"San guan"* to *"qi xing."* Next, curve and turn three strokes upward in the form of three dots, sequentially placing them in the center above the talisman, with the brush tail extending to the left, reciting the incantation from *"Dong ru"* to *"Xu huang."* Then, write the character *"chi"* at the lower left of the talisman, extending the final stroke, reciting *"Hao tian you chi."* Next, draw two strokes extending to the right, reciting the incantation from *"Liu jin"* to *"wu qiang."* Then, inscribe two strokes at the top of the talisman, and recite: *"Swiftly, swiftly, swiftly!"* Finally, write the character *"zhan"* within the final stroke of the *"chi"* character.

At the proper position in the ritual, make the petition, saying:

*"To the Primordial Lord of the Long-Life Great Lord of the Qi Clan, this humble disciple [Name] respectfully invokes the true *qi*, and earnestly summons the Flying Celestial Red *Qi* Emperor Lord of the Flowing Metal Fire Bell, the assisting officials Wen and Xiu, and the radiant Shu Guang Yao, to clearly dissolve demonic influences and seal them through capture."*

After the petition, draw the nine yang radiance of the purple light of the sun, and blow it onto the cinnabar and the brush, each once. Then, calm the mind, sit upright, light incense, quiet the spirit, and concentrate on the Vermilion Emperor of the Upper Palace of the Cinnabar Numinous. Exhale nine crimson rays of light into the crown of the disciple’s head, descending to irrigate the divine palace, penetrating and illuminating like the sun. Next, visualize the Three Terraces and Canopy stars within the *niwan* palace, their light suffusing the entire form. Then, imagine two spirits of fiery essence within the eyes, each three inches tall, clad in vermilion robes and wearing red caps, exhaling two beams of fire from their mouths that emerge from the eyes and merge with the light of the Three Terraces stars at the tip of the brush. Hold the breath and inscribe the talisman, swiftly forming the mudra at the end and blowing *qi* onto the talisman. If inscribed with nine-times refined cinnabar, it can revive the dead and animate corpses.

For this method, when the master personally absorbs the *qi* of the sun, at sunrise form the Jade Emperor mudra with both hands, close the eyes, and face the sun with palms joined. Recite the incantation once, then draw the *qi* in through the mouth and nose, swallowing it nine times, and with intention send it down to the cinnabar field. Repeat this for two sets of nine, three sets of nine, up to nine sets of nine.

Then recite the Solar Lord’s incantation:

*"Solar soul, vermilion radiance,
Illumining green with crimson sheen.
Returning auroras, scarlet youths,
Mysterious flames in whirlwind form."*

When the incantation is complete, recite again:

*"Yù zhēn lí."*

Absorb *qi* as before and swallow it down to the Cinnabar Origin. Perform this practice before noon.

For the *qi* of the Great Yin, proceed as before, but only from the ninth day after the waxing moon to the sixteenth or seventeenth day before the waning moon. Absorb nineteen measures of *qi*, and cease thereafter.

After reciting the general incantation, recite the Lunar Lord’s incantation:

*"Lunar spirit, warm and serene,
Fragrant and lustrous, veiled in void.
Graceful and empty, numinous and bright,
Flourishing splendor, jadelike glow.
Pure golden essence, luminous and refined,
Radiant countenance, sharp as a hair’s tip."*

When the incantation is complete, recite again:

*"Jié hēng kǎn."*

Absorb *qi* as before and swallow it down to the Cinnabar Origin.

For the *qi* of the Celestial Pivot, proceed as before, facing due north. Recite the general incantation and absorb *qi* to completion. Then recite the Celestial Pivot incantation:

*"Celestial Pivot, Great Sage,
Sun and Moon’s honored star.
True *qi* descends and infuses,
Prolonging life and enhancing vitality.
[...]
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by law!"*

Absorb *qi* as before and swallow it down to the Cinnabar Origin.

Upon completing the absorption of the Three Lights’ *qi*, knock the teeth nine times and withdraw. After a hundred days and nights of practice, the room will be filled with light, and coughing will emit divine radiance capable of animating beings. After two hundred days, the true elixir of the sun, moon, and stars will coalesce in the cinnabar field. When incantations are recited over objects, they will appear as if dyed in true crimson. For healing and talisman-work, the true *qi* blown upon them will bring immediate peace.

To administer *qi* for healing, have the patient inhale it in a receptive state, and they will naturally feel warmth in the cinnabar field. The efficacy of the practice will be self-evident.

Master Liu Tian Shi Hun Kang said: When inscribing talismans, recite the incantations of the Solar Lord, Lunar Lord, and Celestial Pivot three times each. Absorb *qi* and blow it onto the tip of the brush, then face the southeast to inscribe. Upon completing the talisman, recite each incantation three more times, infusing it into the talisman.

**The Divine Seal of Flowing Gold and Fire Bell**
In the Southern Palace resides Han, Controller of the Fire Bureau, where the vermilion script of flowing fire is kept—a divine seal of golden truth. It gathers the effulgent *qi* of cinnabar clouds and condenses the crimson script of the Three Lights, known as the *Divine Seal of Cinnabar Heaven’s Flowing Gold and Fire Bell*.

Its cinnabar splendor mirrors the sun, its golden fire blazes with brilliance. It summons dragons and invokes thunder, refines souls to ascend as immortals, severs water spirits, dispels yin specters, cures disasters and plagues, delivers from calamity and wards off illness. It burns the Nine Uglies and subdues the Five Demons.

Attached to this seal are three thousand *qi*-attendant cinnabar officials, six hundred Fire Bell generals, and one hundred twenty Golden Light divine youths. They follow the seal’s commands, heeding its authority—this is the master decree of the Red Emperor and the fire mandate of Lord Han.

Concealed within the Cinnabar Flame Bureau and the Radiant Terrace, it is inscribed with deep red jade and sealed with the *Primal Illumination of the Numinous Void*. Every three hundred years, the seal is bestowed upon the officials of the Southern Palace to assist in the transformation and merit-making of the Lower Prime. It is received in the heart and must not be shown to the unworthy. Those who recklessly reveal it will be punished by demotion to the left bureau for judgment.

The seal measures two *cun* and one *fen* on each side, with a thickness of seven *fen*. It is carved from the southern branch of a divine peach tree from the sacred land, on a *bǐng*- or *dīng*-day of the fire phase. Have a craftsman shape it, then bury it in the southeast corner of a tranquil dwelling, seven *cun* deep. Offer one stick of incense daily upon the burial site, perform three bows, and withdraw without uttering a prayer.

On the seventh day, retrieve it and wash away the soil with flowing water. Bathe it in incense smoke, then fill its grooves with true cinnabar. Place it in a cinnabar-yellow silk pouch and secure it behind the elbow. On a *dīng*-day at the *dīng*-hour, face the *dīng* direction and pace the Fire Bell *gāng*. Visualize the true forms of six jade maidens.

Recite the incantation:

*"[...] command, [...] seize,
Enter the seal—swiftly, swiftly, as the Fire Bell seizes!"*

Recite this six times, each time absorbing *qi* and exhaling onto the seal. For seven days, abstain from pork and all pungent or foul-smelling foods.

On the seventh day’s completion, at the *jiǎ*-hour of the eighth day (a *jiǎ*-day), face the *jiǎ* direction and pace the Fire Bell *gāng*. Visualize the true forms of the six *Jiǎ* divine generals.

Recite the incantation:

*"[...], [...] seize."*

Place it within the seal—swiftly, swiftly, as the Fire Command seizes.

Recite the incantation six times, each time drawing *qi* and blowing onto the seal. For two days, abstain from the five flavors of vegetables, fruits, and oils.

On the third day, a *bǐng*-day, pace the Fire Bell *gāng* toward the *bǐng* direction. Face the sun, click the teeth nine times, and visualize the sunlight covering the seal, its rays spiraling ninefold around the seal’s grooves.

Recite the incantation:

*"Hū! Bearer Child, summon the radiance of Yùyí.
The Crimson Emperor floats in the cavernous void, the Southern Gate spouts brilliance.
Jade eyes gleam, ten thousand evils sink into obscurity.
Your servant obeys the master’s command, daring not to delay or disobey.
Ninefold light-qi coils, the *dīng* and *jiǎ* spirits follow in attendance.
By the Primal Sovereign’s oral decree, yin-qi dissolves into mist."*

Recite this eighty-one times, drawing *qi* eighty-one times and spraying it onto the seal. On a *chén*-day at the *xū*-hour, pace the Fire Bell *gāng*, face the Dipper, and click the teeth seven times. Looking upward, recite:

*"Táluó Yùmiǎo, pure light of the Dipper’s dawn.
Divine Child of the Great One, Sovereign of the Kuí Gāng’s primal power.
Mysterious *qi* of the Primal Sovereign nurtures the seal to commune with the true.
Utmost numinous, utmost sagely—encounter evil and it must respond.
Fire Bell’s golden light, rebuke and sever demonic vapors.
The Kuí’s radiant *gāng*-qi shatters ten thousand ills.
One seal brings forth fortune—primal, prosperous, steadfast, and true."*

Recite this forty-nine times, drawing *qi* forty-nine times and blowing onto the seal. Await the intended effect: whether to seal a mountain and summon spirits, issue summons to dragons and sever demons, pacify waters and cross waves, or cure plagues and dispel afflictions.

Press the Fire Bell seal with the left hand, pace the Fire Bell *gāng*, and face south. Visualize the heart’s fire as a thread entering the seal’s grooves, spiraling ninefold around the seal’s perforations, like a net of crimson light. Upon completion, click the teeth nine times.

Recite the incantation:

*"Lesser novice, your servant [Name], respectfully invokes the Lord of the Southern Primordial *Qi*, the Eternal Life Sovereign, the Great Spirit Hàn Jūn Sīmǎ.
Descend with true *qi* into your servant’s seal.
Summon and descend with the *qi*: the Eight Radiant Gods of Golden Truth and Jade Light, the Fire Bell Generals, the Luminous Divine Child, the Three *Qi* Celestial Officers, Wénxiù and Shūguāng, to govern by the seal’s command.
Resplendent heavenly might, incinerate and scour demonic ills.
Hurl fire to strike ahead, let the ringing bells charge behind.
Wind pursues, fire attacks—whatever the seal imprints is prosperous and true.
By the Supreme Emperor’s decree, the divine ministers carry it out.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Fire Bell’s law commands!"*

Upon finishing, draw the pure *qi* of the Upper Palace into the mouth and spread it over the seal, then imprint with it. The seal may be pressed onto sand or stone and buried in water or earth; or imprinted on silk to be swallowed or worn; or used to seal clay; or applied to afflicted areas. In all cases, no more than three applications are needed for resolution.

Avoid impure *qi* contaminating the seal—if it does, the seal will crack and lose its efficacy.

**Seal-Imprinting Mudra:**
From the root of the right hand’s middle finger to the *lí* trigram, then from the *lí* trigram to beneath the nail, lift the flesh into the seal.

Beyond its talismanic use, the Northern Emperor’s Fire Bell seal can also treat cold-induced *qi* pain and similar ailments.

**Method:**
Pinch the *lí* trigram with the left hand (the middle joint of the middle finger, also called the "Sun Sovereign Mudra"), hold the seal in the right hand, and stand two paces away from the recipient. With the seal’s design facing them, declare your dharma rank and invoke the Lord of the Primordial *Qi*, the Great Eternal Life Sovereign. For the recipient’s ailment, beseech true *qi* and solemnly summon the Red and Black Emperor Lords of the Flying Bells and Radiant Pleiades, their attendant officers Wénxiù and Shūguāng, and the luminous seal that subjugates demons.

Draw in the sun’s rays to permeate the heart, blend them into one, then exhale through the nose, threading the *qi* through the seal and coiling it around the recipient three or four times before stopping.

Do not place the seal in dust or handle it roughly, lest you offend the true *qi*. If violated, the attendant officers will not descend, and all efforts in visualization will be in vain.

The left-hand pinch of the *lí* trigram refers to the middle joint of the middle finger, also called the "Sun Sovereign Mudra." Many texts mistakenly use *chén* as the solar mudra, unaware that *chén* represents the Celestial Stem. The yellow *qi* and yang essence nurture the hun-soul and penetrate the void; refining the three *qi* into clarity is why *lí* is used as the solar mudra.

When holding the seal in the right hand for practice, ensure movements are deliberate and unhurried, lest the divine *qi* be startled or scattered. Avoid mimicking shamans to prevent ridicule from the vulgar.

Visualize the sun’s rays coiling around the recipient’s body in threefold layers—hence "coiling three or four times."

**Fire Bell *Gāng*:**
Eradicates great harm.

In the world, there are mad and perverse ghosts and spirits—divide and destroy them. Those that linger after death are ghosts. Those that attach to objects are spirits. Those that deviate from the true Way are demons. Those that arise from the four births and bring calamity are monsters. Those that manifest as baleful omens are anomalies.

If mountain specters, giant foxes, great serpents, or long dragons harm the living, erect the **Three Heavens General Qi Altar**. Have two persons each hold a *hu* of ash, beginning from the *qián* direction, and spread it left and right to encircle the altar once, forming a square six *chi* across. Outside the altar, arrange seven piles of fire, and fill jars with water. At the six daily periods, ascend the altar, wield the sword, and recite the *Divine Lord’s Mandate to Sweep Away All Inauspiciousness* incantation: *"From the Thirty-Second Heaven, to the ranks of the Upper Clarity..."* Within seven days, the harm will be struck down by celestial spirits and cast into the altar. With the sword, dispatch them and cast them into flowing water.

For minor demons and petty monsters, omit fire and water. Instead, spread ash within the altar and inscribe the characters *yán yóu*. Circumambulate the altar at the six periods, reciting the *Sweeping Annihilation* incantation. Within three days, the demon will be imprisoned in the altar, leaving traces or appearing in form. Then invoke the celestial spirits of the altar to bind and send it to the Northern Heaven for punishment.

To fell demonic trees or perverse shrines, encircle them with ash, inscribe the *Sweeping Annihilation* incantation, and place it in the southeast. Silently recite the *Tenfold Invocation*, draw the *qi* of the Heavenly Gate, and project it with the **Jade Clarity Mudra**. Within ten days, celestial thunder will shatter them. For water-washed spring caves, inscribe the incantation on stone and sink it; if it does not sink, recite the incantation as before. Within seven days, dragons and water spirits will be expelled. Further strike them with talismans for immediate effect.

Inscribe the characters *yán yóu* and trace them with the right hand using the **Jade Clarity Mudra**, employing the second finger—no written memorials are needed. If the altar is built of earth, it is even more potent than one on level ground. In urgent cases, do not wait for the altar’s completion.

**Three Heavens General Qi Altar**
*Yán yóu*
*Yán* is the courtyard that binds ghosts. *Yóu* is the chamber that imprisons them. Together, they restrain and control ghosts and spirits. Take one *dǒu* of ash, write the two characters in cinnabar on yellow paper, and place them at the ash’s center. The demonic ghosts and spirits will be captured and subdued within. Alternatively, sink it in water as a water prison or place it in fire as a fire prison—transformations are at your discretion.

For setting up the prison, recite the incantation:
*"Courtyard that binds ghosts, chamber that imprisons them.
Ghosts and demons defy the true—seize and imprison them.
Transformations arise naturally; let none linger."*
Recite the incantation while holding the **Jade Clarity Mudra**, draw the *qi* of the eastern direction, and blow it onto the talisman and into the prison. The remaining procedures follow the *Rite for Dispelling Calamity and Averting Disaster*.

**Dispelling Fire Demons**
When the dead become ghostly beings, they become drought demons. Dogs born with camel-like forms are called fire demons. When clouds array as crimson mist, *qi* swells with scorching heat, and winds roar like galloping horses, fire disasters arise. Hold the *kǎn* trigram, dye black silk with ink, and bind it in five coils while facing north. Visualize the Water Star’s constellation with five streams of azure *qi*, draw them in through the nose, hold the breath for five cycles, and recite the incantation:
*"Child of Metal, I inform you.
Fire overcomes the mother—her child rescues her.
Swiftly fly and scatter, forming rivers and pools.
Seas, rivers, dwellings—fire extinguished, smoke dispersed.
The essence of the crimson demon, buried ten thousand feet deep.
Hasten! As the *Statutes of the Primordial Heavenly Worthy* command."*
Recite the incantation five times in haste, then exhale toward the direction of the fire demon. Instantly, the conflagration ceases, and the fire demon is cast down and destroyed.

**Quelling Water Monsters**
When dark mists arise violently, clouds appear reddish-yellow, and *qi* surges like smoke, fierce winds, lightning, and thunder will follow, and water monsters will stir. Or in rivers and seas, when dark clouds and black *qi* appear, great winds will damage things. First perform the **Fire Bell Rite**, hasten the **Four Mountains Mudra**, and from the *xū* position, circumambulate the Dipper to *chén*. Hold the **Upper Clarity Mudra** and mark it with cinnabar. Bind it with red silk in three coils, hold it firmly, face south, and stand with it atop the head. Visualize the Primordial Heavenly Worthy in the *níwán* palace, silently recite the *Great Brahma Hidden Words* ten times, then shift to the **Jade Clarity Mudra**, face south, and visualize the Mars Star’s rays like fire. Draw them in through the nose and hold the breath for three cycles. Recite the incantation:
*"Crimson imperial *qi*, spirit of samādhi.
By the Primordial Worthy’s decree, the water essence collapses."*
After the invocation, exhale toward the clouds three times. The water essence will fall to earth, and wind and thunder will not harm things.

**Six Ding Talisman for Slaying Water Monsters**
Use a square brick or stone of any size, inscribe the talisman in cinnabar, and recite the incantation:
*"Great spirits of the Six Ding, jade maidens of the Six Ding.
By celestial talisman and mandate, slay and sever the monstrous beings.
Gouge out their eyes, sever their claws, take their brains, split their bellies.
Hasten! As the *Numinous Treasure Talisman Mandate* commands."*
Hold the **Jade Clarity Mudra**, draw the *qi* of the current *ding* direction, and blow it onto the talisman before casting it.

**Six Jia Talisman for Dispelling Curses**
Inscribe in cinnabar on yellow paper, hold the **Jade Clarity Mudra**, and recite the incantation:
*"Eight thousand beings of the upper world, four generals holding the earth below.
Officers and soldiers of the Three and Five dispel evil ghosts; boys of the Four and Six guard your body.
On your left, the Azure Dragon; on your right, the White Tiger.
Above, the Vermilion Bird; below, the Dark Warrior.
Before you, the Merit Clerk; behind you, the Registrar.
If there are curses, return them to their master—if they do not leave at once, the Heavenly Axe awaits.
Hasten! As the Primordial Heavenly Worthy decrees."*
Draw the *qi* of the current *jiǎ* direction and blow it onto the talisman. Wear one talisman, burn one in the central courtyard, grind one into ash and mix it with water to sprinkle throughout the room, and combine one with a black plum and three *cùn* of licorice, decoct them into pills, and swallow. The cursed objects will all be vomited out.

**Vermilion Lake Talisman for Driving Away Locusts**
Use eight peachwood planks, each two *chǐ* four *cùn* long and three *cùn* wide, and inscribe eight talismans in orpiment. Offer tea, wine, and three portions of crimson silk to the **Perfected Lord of Myriad Responses of the Southern Direction** and the **Vermilion Lake Envoy**. He is thirty thousand *zhàng* tall, with red eyes and scorched hair, clad in a crimson robe and scarlet skirt, a cinnabar crown and vermilion shoes, his body wreathed in ten thousand *zhàng* of firelight. In his hand, he wields a samādhi trident wheel, riding the *qi* of the Vermilion Cavern and Vermilion Bird, followed by ten thousand birds.

Invoke thus:
By the decree of the Primordial Beginning’s sacred mandate and the Jade Emperor’s edict, expel and exterminate all vermin and locust plagues. I now summon thee—execute this command without fail. Parents and progeny of locusts, depart swiftly and linger not. Should any insect defy this order, it shall be reduced to dust. *Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes of the Most High!*

Then draw *qi* and blow upon the talisman, bury it with a sword at the eight directions, three *chǐ* deep into the earth. The locusts shall scatter and perish at once, the crops preserved whole, accruing merit for the salvation of the world.

**Upper Register: Talisman of the Three Pure Realms**
**Incantation for the Talisman’s Decree:**
Reverently invoke the Most High Mysterious August One, the Perfected Lord of the Wondrous Dao, the Nine Heavens’ Venerable Elder, the Immortal Palace’s Chief Minister, and the august deities of the Five Peaks. Descend swiftly with true *qi* into this talisman of mine. Wherever the talisman’s decree reaches, demons die and men find peace. *Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the Samādhi True Talisman’s decree!*

For this talisman, form the mudrā of the Three Clarities, inscribe it in vermilion upon yellow paper, and blow upon it with the *qi* of the Heavenly Gate. Further, recite the following incantation over the talisman, blow upon it with the *qi* of the five directions, burn it to ash, and mix with water. Administer thrice daily for all ailments, and recovery shall be immediate.

**Middle Register: Talisman of Auxiliary Protection**
**Incantation for the Talisman’s Decree:**

**Incantation for the Talisman’s Decree:**
Humbly invoke Marshal Xu Laizhong, the Great Marshal of Pursuit and Capture on the Cloud Path of the Nine Heavens of Highest Clarity, along with Jiang Chenyuan, Zhai Shining, and Zhao Ziyu. Act in strict accordance with the talisman’s command: proceed forth with the talisman, seize and subdue demonic entities, and restore health and tranquility. *Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the Statutes and Decrees of the Primordial Descent of Highest Clarity!*

Inscribe this talisman in black upon yellow paper. For each use, prepare eight talismans: one large talisman, to be burned with gold coins within the main gate; and seven smaller talismans. Burn them to ash, stir into heart-extracted decoction, and administer. The response shall be extraordinary.

**Lower Register: Talismans of the Five Emperors**
Humbly invoke the True Lords of the Five Dipper Stars, the Direct Talismanic Deities of the Five Directions and Five Emperors, and the Officials of the Thirty-Two Heavens. By the august mandate of the Supreme Emperor, let the ceaseless winds and fires reverse corpse-infestation and return the dead to peace. Let souls and spirits be harmonized, and the myriad spirits find repose. *Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the Statutes and Decrees!*

For this talisman, first recite the *Xuanyun Incantation*, then form the mudrā of Jade Clarity, inscribe in vermilion, and inhale the *qi* of the Heavenly Gate to blow upon it. Afterward, recite the following incantation, draw the *qi* of the southeast, and swallow with pure water. This talisman averts all misfortune and cures all ailments.

**Method for Salvation with Millet**
On a *jiǎ* or *yǐ* day, facing east, purchase one *shēng* of glutinous millet. Upon returning home, place it before the sacred altar. Remove all dust and husks, selecting one *gě* of pure millet, and place it in a clean tray. Beginning on a *yín* or *mǎo* day, expose it to the stars, moon, and night dew for twelve nights. If any night is incomplete, make up for it in the following cycle. Once the millet has absorbed sufficient *qi*, choose an evening when red clouds or purple clouds resembling burning flames appear in the four directions—this marks the Celestial Worthy’s procession. Sincerely burn incense and bow to the four directions, then place the millet in the open air upon a table. First recite the *Millet Incantation* ten times, then the *Incantation for Deliverance of the Ten Directions* ten times, followed by the *Incantation of the Ten Great Divine Powers* ten times, visualizing the *qi* entering the millet. Next, recite the *Great Brahmā’s Hidden Words* thirty-two times, inhaling the *qi* of the Thirty-Two Heavens to blow upon it. Then recite the *Divine Duke’s Incantation* ten times, inhaling the *qi* of the east to blow upon it. Store this millet in a vessel of gold or jade, then bow to the ten directions and withdraw.

When encountering any illness, take ten grains of millet, recite each incantation once as before, inhale *qi* to blow upon them, and have the afflicted consume them with plain noodles facing east, swallowing with fragrant water.

**Millet Incantation**
Herein, the Primordial Beginning suspends a precious pearl, vast as a grain of millet, invulnerable to all harm.

**Incantation for Deliverance of the Ten Directions**
The Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning expounds the scripture once, that all may attain longevity.

**Incantation of the Ten Great Divine Powers**
The Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning expounds the scripture once. From the boundless and immeasurable ranks of the Perfected Great Divine Powers of the east, to the completion of the tenth recitation, all arrive as one.

**Divine Duke’s Incantation**
The Thirty-Two Heavens, the Thirty-Two Emperors, ascend in ordered ranks to Highest Clarity.

The aforementioned precious pearl is deployed to suppress demonic hordes in mountains and rivers, and to quell the hundred specters and malevolent spirits gathering in haunted dwellings. When *qi* circulation falters, stellar constellations misalign, sun and moon lose their clarity, pestilence spreads, warfare erupts on all sides, or great floods and fires arise, recite this incantation over the millet at dawn or dusk, and cast it upon the afflicted site.

**Precious Register for Breaking Curses**
In all applications of the Precious Register, the correct *qi* of the Five Phases leads as the root of the Five Phases’ correct *qi*, while the rest serve as its function. To cultivate and attain penetrating vision, one must first employ this Precious Register, petitioning the Great Divine Marshals of *Dīng* and *Jiǎ*, and the Four Direct Deities, before use, to ensure communion with the numinous and entry into sageliness.

**Precious Register of the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct of Jade Clarity for Breaking Curses**
Petitioning [location omitted]:
[Text omitted for yin days] [Text omitted for yang days]
*Dào* Treasure, *Fǎ* Treasure, by the sacred decree of True Martiality, expel perverse *qi* or banish malevolent spirits; let true *qi* abide and correct *qi* reside here.
Great General of the Encompassing Heavens, summon the Radiant Ghost King to act in accordance with the decree.

**Precious Register of the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct of Highest Clarity for Breaking Curses**
Petitioning [location], to be enacted in accordance with the method and command.
Respectfully submitted in the year of *Tàisuì* [Year], [Month], [Day], [Hour].
Submitted by the Dharma-ranked official, [Your Name].

**Perfected of the Descent of the Jade Spring of Highest Clarity**
**Perfected Sovereign of the Highest Clarity’s Retinue**
**Perfected of the Conduct of Highest Clarity**

**Envelope:**
**Precious Register of the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct of Highest Clarity for Breaking Curses**
Petitioning [Location]
Respectfully sealed by the Dharma-ranked official, [Your Name]

When inscribing a Precious Register, first burn incense, strike the teeth twenty-four times, and form the Mudra of the Five Peaks and Three Passes with both hands. Recite the Comprehensive Mantra of the Numinous Treasure, invoking from the Thirty-Two Heavens and Thirty-Two Emperors up to the Perfected of Highest Clarity. Draw in the upright *qi*, circulate the mudra, and blow upon the paper. Then, with the left hand forming the Mudra of the Five Peaks, trace the text while reciting the mantra, pressing firmly with the middle joint of the middle finger.

Recite the Mantra of the Stellar Spirits, drawing in the northern *qi* and blowing it into the water. Next, recite the Mantra of the Primordial Heaven, again drawing in the northern *qi* and blowing it into the water. Recite the Mantra of the Heavenly Perfected, drawing in the northern *qi* and blowing it into the water. Recite the Mantra of the Heavenly Ford, saying:

*"Great Perfected of the Heavenly Ford, guard the divine fluid and purify the spirit. With one recitation, sever the ghosts; forever repel the demonic essence."*

Draw in the northern *qi* and exhale it into the water. Then recite the Mantra of the True *Qi*, saying:

*"Stellar Spirit of the True Warrior, sever the malevolent and banish pestilence. Water of true yang, forever dispel all ills beyond ten thousand leagues."*

After reciting the five mantras, offer incense again, recite the Mantra of the Great One, grind the ink, and draw in the *qi* of the five directions to blow upon it. Grind the ink forty-nine times to the left and forty-nine times to the right, reciting one mantra per grind. Invoke the names of the Twenty-Eight Constellations, the Yang Dipper, the Yin Dipper, and the Central Dipper, drawing in the *qi* of the five directions and blowing it into the inkstone.

Hold the brush in the left hand and form the Twelve Scripts with the right, reciting the Mantra of the Five Peaks for Upholding the Body:

*"As this disciple receives the *qi* once each year, even Heaven cannot cover me, nor Earth bear me. Those who strike me shall die; those who collide with me shall perish. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances!"*

Then, beginning with the *mao* script, press firmly:
*"Red apricot, black ink of *chou*, true grinding of *dui*, stockings of *li*, Numinous Treasure at the middle finger’s center."*

Press firmly and recite the Mantra of the Five Peaks and Three Passes:

*"Red apricot, black ink, true grinding, stockings, Numinous Treasure. Arise and transform, seize alone, illuminate and clarify, accomplish the work. Gather the hun-souls, seize the work, gather the hun-souls. Swift messengers of the eight directions, celestial spirits and earthly deities, the myriad numina unite in accord. By the decree of Heaven and Earth, by the command of the Radiant Heavenly Emperor!"*

Recite the three phrases. Upon completion, release the mudra and blow a breath of *qi* onto the paper. Press the middle script of the middle finger as before, without releasing it. Hold the brush in the right hand, position it three inches from the mouth, and secretly recite the Three Heavenly Taboos. Draw in the blue, yellow, and white *qi* of Heaven and blow upon the brush. Then inscribe the register, writing the Six Ding and Six Jia spirits on the reverse for major matters.

On yang days, inscribe the first four Direct Spirits; on yin days, the latter four. On yang days, write the Taboo of the Southern Dipper; on yin days, the Taboo of the Northern Dipper. If the register’s method includes two characters, for exorcising demonic afflictions, write the two characters of the True Talisman. For major matters, write the two characters of the Northern Emperor. For the remaining characters, recite them aloud without inscribing them on the paper, marking them with empty dots.

For example, if dispelling malevolent *qi* or calming illness, say: *"Seize the black malevolent *qi*, extinguish the illness—thus it is."* Malevolent *qi* refers to locusts, hail, drought, or flood—all forms of malevolent *qi*. For demonic afflictions, say: *"Seize the demonic affliction."* Demonic afflictions include malevolent spirits, ghosts, or pestilence.

Then, according to the petitioner’s submitted document, carefully inscribe the decree. For exorcising demonic afflictions, write: *"Swiftly summon the Orthodox Spirits of the Bureau of Destiny, together with the Six Ding and Six Jia within this register, the Four Direct Messengers, to heal the suffering and sever the demonic afflictions. Swiftly restore peace and well-being, manifesting the response in accordance with the decree."*

Then inscribe the year, month, day, and hour of the submission, followed by: *"Submitted by the Dharma-ranked official [Your Name], reverently carrying out the decree as recorded."*

On a Six Jia day, face east in the proper position and sit. Between the *chou* and *yin* hours, form the Mudra of the Five Peaks with both hands, pressing firmly on the middle script of the middle finger. Recite the Mantra of the Five Peaks for Upholding the Body three times, draw in the eastern *qi*, rinse the mouth with saliva, and swallow it. On a Six Jia day, the turbid *qi* is exhausted, and the register may then be enacted.

After inscribing the register, recite each mantra once more from the beginning. Gaze upward to the vast sky, draw in a breath of *qi*, and release both the breath and the mudra onto the register. Immediately affix the seal and seal the envelope, ensuring no one sees it. After sealing the corners, offer incense again and bow nine times toward the Northern Dipper. Secretly memorialize:

*"The Dharma-ranked official [Your Name], in accordance with the petition submitted by [Petitioner’s Name] regarding [Matter], now seeks to enact [Method]. Humbly beseeching the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct of Highest Clarity, the Perfected Sovereign of the Highest Clarity’s Retinue, the Perfected of the Descent of the Jade Spring of Highest Clarity, the Nine August Perfected Lords of the Northern Dipper, the Six Bureau Perfected Lords of the Southern Dipper, the Four Sage Marshal Perfected Lords, to transmit this petition to the Three Heavenly Golden Gates and report it to the Heavenly Ministries and Bureaus. Dispatch the great spirits of the Six Ding and Six Jia, the Four Direct Messengers of Wind, Clouds, *Qi*, and Rain, the Jade Script Spirit Lords, the Generals of the Encompassing Heavens, the Radiant Ghost King, the Eight Script Lords of the Numinous Treasure, the Nine Ugly Emperor Lords, and the Immortal Bureaus of the Numinous Treasure to act in accordance with the register and swiftly manifest the response."*

The official reverently awaits the celestial grace. Respectfully conclude, then recite the Three Heavenly Hidden Taboos one hundred twenty times, drawing in the three-colored *qi* of the Three Heavens and blowing it upon the register. Bow nine times in the heart. Retire, then burn the register along with twenty-one pieces of gold paper and three cups of pure tea in a blazing fire, together with the Four Direct Spirit Lords’ warrants, and await the response.

For praying for rain, report to the Dragon Spirits governing the four seasons’ rainfall, the Earl of Wind, the Master of Rain, the Duke of Thunder, the Mother of Lightning, and the Dragon Spirits of the local rivers, lakes, and deep pools. The method for praying for clear skies is the same.

For addressing locusts, weapons, crabs, rats, or other pests, report to the Silkworm Father and Grain Mother, the Earth Spirits and Grain Spirits, the Spirits of the Three, Seven, and Nine Wildernesses, the Mountain and River Spirits, the Spirits of Forests and Trees, the Earth Spirits, Water Spirits, and Mountain Spirits, and the Orthodox Spirits of the local temples. Swiftly drive away and expel the harmful creatures from the local area, causing them to disperse immediately. Protect the local fields and crops, ensuring the five grains grow in harmony with yin and yang, without damage or loss.

Upon the completion of tasks and the establishment of merit, report the achievements to the Three Heavens and advance by three ranks.

For addressing water monsters, report to the local Dragon Spirits in charge, the Great Spirits of the Six Dings, the Great Spirits of the Six Jias, the Duke of Thunder, the Mother of Lightning, and the Sagely Host of the Five Thunders. Urgently summon them to swiftly capture and restrain the harmful entity, securely imprison it, and promptly dispatch it to the Heavenly Prison to be punished according to the law.

If the stellar lodges deviate from their courses, the sun and moon lose their clarity, or comets arise, humbly beseech the Three Masters and Perfected Ones, the Sagely Beings of the Three Heavens, the Southern and Northern Dippers, the Spirit Lords of the Five Stars, and the Celestial Bureaucracy to memorialize the True Lord Han Jun, the Venerable Master, to regulate the celestial pivot, correct the heavenly divisions, and prevent malevolent qi from encroaching upon the stellar palaces. Thereby, cut off the malevolent qi at once, allow auspicious omens to flourish daily, safeguard the state and its households, ensure peace and quell warfare, and prevent the rise of bandits, floods, or fires, all by the grace of the sagely favor.

If the four seasons lose their proper order and yin and yang fall out of harmony, this falls under the jurisdiction of the Five Emperors. Humbly beseech the Venerable Emperor of the Mysterious Origin, the Five Emperors of the Five Directions—the Green Emperor Gou Mang of the East, the Red Emperor Zhu Rong of the South, the White Emperor Ru Shou of the West, the Black Emperor Xuan Ning of the North, the Yellow Emperor Xuanyuan of the Center—along with the August Sacred Mother of the Earth, the Great Spirits of the Eight Nodal Points, the Twenty-Four Qi, and the Seventy-Two Seasonal Divinities. Humbly implore their sagely compassion to rectify the seasons: restrain the scorching yang, temper the stern qi with warmth and clarity, spread harmonious qi in spring, ensure the growth of all things, halt the severity of frost and snow, usher in harmonious qi, gradually dispel epidemics, and prevent the intrusion of malevolent qi.

For banditry, report to the Great Spirits of the Five Marchmounts, the Earth Spirits of the Nine Provinces, the Spirit Lords of the Great Unity and the Nine Bases, and the Orthodox Spirits of the local City Gods and Earth Shrines. Request each to dispatch their legions of yin soldiers to defend the city walls and protect the people. If bandits or rebels grow powerful, acting lawlessly and rampantly—flooding waters or setting fires—capture the ringleaders, bind their three hun and seven po, and send them to the Heavenly Prison. There, subject them to trials thrice daily, compelling them to reform and return to goodness, causing their malice to vanish like melting ice or crumbling tiles, and restoring peace to the realm.

**Incantation of the Samādhi True Fire for Consecrating Water to Subdue Evil:**
Fire Bell Emperor, Fire Bell Lord, Fire Bell Spirit, Fire Bell General, Fire Bell Youth, Lord of Mars, Lords of Bing and Ding, driving the Fire Chariot, riding the Fire Wheel.
Gentle and warm, yielding earth and firm heaven.

The Qi of the Nine Perfections gathers and seizes inauspicious forces.
The Samādhi True Fire radiates light across ten thousand li.
It illumines heaven and earth, blazing gloriously in the eight directions.
Rivers and seas boil and surge; demons and specters hide in concealment.
The Southern Dipper descends with qi; the Samādhi streams forth its light.
It refines the embryo and transforms the substance, forging the po and invigorating the hun.
Ten thousand demons perish and fall, borne away on rising smoke.

**Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and decrees!**

**Ancestral Dao Mysterious Perfection Incantation:**
Ancestral Dao, Mysterious Perfection.

For this method, select a *wu-wu* or *bing-wu* day, or commence on a *wu-chen* or *wu-xu* day. At the hour following dawn, face the sun and recite the incantation ten times daily, drawing in a breath of solar qi and swallowing it, without regard to the number of repetitions. If the morning hour is missed, at noon face south, visualize the solar qi in abundance, bow in reverence, recite the incantation ten times per cycle, and swallow the solar orb once, without limit to the number of cycles. One myriad repetitions is optimal.

Upon completion of the practice, take water and fill a vessel of bronze or iron. Facing the sun, recite the two preceding incantations, then the Taiyi Incantation. Visualize the Fire Wheel turning within the water, then test its warmth with your hand. If, after one hundred recitations, the water bubbles like fish eyes, the practice has achieved one degree of success. Continue reciting the incantations until, upon testing the water after one hundred or fewer recitations, the work is complete.

**Taiyi Incantation:**
Reverently invoke the Heavenly Perfected of the Great One, the Heavenly Perfected of the Primordial Beginning, the True Immortals and True Persons, who align above with the position of Qian. The Six Ding spirits of the left, the Six Jia lords of the right, I receive the heart of heaven to universally deliver the myriad spirits. By the numinous incantation of the Great One, the Fire Wheel of the South, expel evil and dispel illness, consecrate the water and command its efficacy.

This consecrated water cures all ailments and dispels all malevolent forces.
**Pacify the Five Marchmounts.**
**The Eight Trigrams bring peace and stability.**

If in a household the cauldron rings, the well boils, chickens crow at night, dogs behave strangely, doors open of their own accord, blood is spilt or fires set, objects move by themselves, mountain specters manifest, or if the dwelling is haunted by baleful influences, demonic altars, or spirits occupying the home, offer tea, wine, fruit, gold, paper money, and incense in portions of five to the Five Directions, the Five Emperors, and the Five Marchmounts. Take a square brick, burn it, polish it smooth, and inscribe upon it the aforementioned talisman in cinnabar. Bury it at the center of the afflicted place, and the disturbances will cease, transforming misfortune into fortune.

**The Nine Palaces bring peace and stability.**

For those suffering from annual or monthly calamities, select a day when the Five Fortunes and the Great One are in ascendance, at the hour of *ding-mao-you* (5–7 p.m.), face the appropriate direction, and inscribe two talismans in cinnabar. Place one within a bottle and carry the other on your person for matters of great importance. Then, use nine bottles arranged in the pattern of the Northern Dipper and bury them in a purified chamber. Morning and evening, pray and make offerings, burning incense and making supplications. When the time of calamity arrives, set up the nine positions of the Northern Dipper, present scriptures, paper money, horses, wine, and fruit in gratitude. Carrying the talisman is also efficacious. For minor calamities, inscribe the talisman beneath the Dipper when the stars and moon are visible.

**Establishing the Fire Prison:**
