For mountain demons, one-legged spirits, venomous dragons, and disruptive entities that harass the living, set fires, drip blood, steal property, or take lives—entities that local earth gods dare not restrain and community spirits cannot defend against—establish a Fire Prison to examine and punish them. First, meticulously document each case and submit it to the Heavenly Ministry to await the imperial decree. Once the Fire Officials of the Southern Dipper are dispatched to enforce the mandate, the prison may be established.

To establish the prison, use three *dou* of purified ash in a clean chamber, forming an ash altar nine *chi* in diameter or three *chi* and six *cun*, leveled with a mirror. Place a fire vessel at its center and burn thirty-six stalks of brushwood. Cast three talismans into the fire and recite the **Incantation for Establishing the Fire Prison**:
Red qi and blazing smoke, a searing iron city.
Imprison the guilty ghosts; interrogate them without cease.
The Southern Dipper scorches their bones; the Fire Emperor burns their forms.
Swiftly confess your crimes and origins to bring peace to the people.
Fire soldiers seize and inspect, incinerating the demonic encampments.
Those who dare disobey shall be recorded by the prison authorities.

**Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the decree of the Jade Purity King of Highest Heaven!**

**Fire Prison Talisman.**

Press beneath the nail of the middle finger to draw the qi of the southeast and inscribe it. Recite the incantation:

Six-Handed Lord of the Mountain, dwelling in the hidden valley.
At dawn you float upon Metal of Geng, at dusk you return to Wood of Jia and Yi.
At night you guard Fire of Bing and Ding, four-eyed over the great sea.
Your head rests upon the cinnabar of the north, your feet tread upon the stars of the Dipper.
Thirty-six heavenly gods, swiftly establish the Fire Prison.
When establishing the Water Prison, alter the word to "water." Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the decree of the Supreme Emperor!

First, write a single "fire" character upon the ash altar, recite the incantation, and draw southern qi to blow upon it. Then, starting from the right of the "fire" character, trace a circle to the left, then back to the right, forming two "fire" characters. Recite the incantation once more, then write another "fire" character in the center and recite the incantation again. Next, recite the **Incantation for the Fire Officials**:

Reverently summon the Samādhi Fire Officials—Great Fire Severity, Great Fire Form, Great Fire Abiding—swiftly establish the Fire Prison.
Seize the ghosts and spirits with haste; their retribution shall manifest instantly.
Swiftly heed my words, swiftly respond to my voice.
Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and decrees!

Then recite the incantation:

Emperors of the Fire Bell, Thunder Fire Generals, descend in blazing fire and burn through the hearts of ghosts.
Reverently summon the Fire Bell Valiant Warriors, Fire Bell Generals, Fire Bell Divine Lords, Fire Bell Lads—swiftly send down true fire to burn them, swiftly, swiftly, swiftly!

Upon completion, draw southern qi and blow ten times, then take a mouthful of southern qi and blow into the prison. If capturing fierce and malevolent ghosts, spirits, or baleful influences, summon the Prison Scribes of Fengdu. For all manner of demons and specters, invoke the Five Emperors’ Interrogation Officials. Affix the **Jade Purity Heaven Fire Prison Placard** above the prison and list the Fire Prison divine generals below. Offer incense, flowers, wine, and fruit in worship. Do not submit written petitions; the celestial generals, officers, and soldiers of the Fire Prison shall carry out the capture and enforcement, awaiting your report of their response.

**Fengdu Great Gods**
Reverently summon the Fengdu Dark Corpse Envoys and the fierce divine generals to swiftly come and administer punishment, bestowing severe interrogation and beating.
Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and decrees!

Form the Jade Purity mudra and blow with northern qi.

**Five Emperors of the Numinous Treasure for Interrogation**
Red apricot, Wing Star’s spit, rub true socks past.
Gathered souls descend at once; the Five Agents’ lashes shatter all.
The Numinous Treasure is in my hands; no evil ghost can escape pursuit.
Clasp the mudras of the Five Directions and the Five Emperors, drawing the qi of the five directions to blow upon them.

If venomous dragons or demonic specters wreak havoc, employ the **Talisman of the Wondrous Conduct Perfected** to dispatch the Six Ding and Six Jia to capture and imprison them, rooting out their source before sending them east to Fengdu.

**Establishing the Water Prison**
Press the root of the left ring finger to draw northern qi and inscribe it. Recite the incantation:

The Dark Sea stretches ninety thousand *li*, within it a stone citadel.
Fierce killers guard the gates; venomous dragons devour essences.
Water Officials bind and deliver, pursuing and imprisoning ghosts and spirits.
Those who dare violate heavenly law shall be swept away in rushing torrents.
Swiftly confess your wicked harms, each revealing your name.
Should any refuse to submit, we shall send you to the Heavenly Soldiers.
Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the decree of the Jade Purity King of Highest Heaven!

Form the Kan trigram with the right hand and the Jade Purity mudra with the left, inscribing one **Water Prison Talisman** to cast into the water. Fill a large vessel with water and place it upon the ash altar atop the **Six Heavens’ Round Water Vessel**. Inscribe the **Water Prison Talisman** on a horizontal strip and place it upon the water’s surface. Dispatch the documents to the Water Prison officials and scribes to capture and subdue demonic entities, manifesting their forms upon the ash altar.

**Exorcism Incantation**
Divine Radiance of the Numinous Empyrean, one hundred thousand Heavenly Soldiers—
Swiftly pursue the vengeful souls to manifest their forms within the water.
(For the Fire Prison, say "manifest within the fire.")
Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the decree of the Jade Purity King of Highest Heaven!

**Fire Prison Generals**
Fire Bell General, Fire Bell Divine Lord, Fire Bell Valiant Warrior, Fire Bell Lad.

**Water Prison Generals**
Great General of Frigid Ice, Frigid Ice Valiant Warrior, Envoys of the Five Brooks, Swift and Fleet Envoys.

**Numinous Empyrean Talisman for Subduing Demons and Slaying Ghosts**
For malevolent entities that cannot be subdued, write in cinnabar upon yellow paper, burn to ash, and blow it away—they shall be captured and sent to distant lands at once.
Form the Numinous Empyrean mudra, blow upon the talisman, and point your sword in their direction—evil shall flee ten thousand *li*.
Draw the qi of the five directions; abstain from meat and fish.

**For Pacifying Mountain Demons and Five Manifestations**
Treat the talisman with care; disrespect shall invite celestial calamity.
Upon completing the inscription, recite the patient’s afflictions and command the divine generals—each shall act immediately to capture them, awaiting your arrival to dispatch them.

**Pacifying Sea Talisman**
When crossing rivers or seas and encountering winds threatening to capsize your vessel, inscribe the **Pacifying Sea Talisman**. Visualize the Dipper’s mouth covering your head, the Dipper’s handle pointing forward toward your nose, and your nose aligned with the bow of the ship. Recite the **Disaster-Dispelling Incantation** seven times, cast the **Pacifying Sea Talisman**, then recite the **Pacifying and Stabilizing Incantation** once and blow upon the ship—the winds and waves shall immediately subside.

**Disaster-Dispelling Incantation**
Roll back, roll back! River Earl leads the way.
Dragons are halted at once; ten thousand disasters vanish.
Heavenly qi clears and brightens.
Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the decree of the Primordial Celestial Worthy!

**Calming Waves Incantation**
Water Spirits, Wave Spirits, Lord Feng Yi,
Spirit Lord Wu Zixu, waves still and waters calm.
Celestial Immortals and Earth Gods, the Jade Emperor sets forth.
Dragons crouch and tigers hide; Water Officials submit.
We travel in peace.
Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and decrees!

**Pacifying and Stabilizing Incantation**
The Primordial One pacifies and stabilizes, unfolding the Five Chapters.
Cinnabar script of jade characters, Eight Might Dragon Script.
Preserve and control the kalpas, ensuring heaven’s eternal endurance.

**Numinous Treasure Five Dipper Talismans**
**Incantation for Dispatching Talismans**
Primordial Numinous Writ, immeasurably delivering beings.
No script is unilluminated, no script is unclear,
No script is unestablished, no script is unborn.
Nothing is not repelled, nothing is not averted,
Nothing is not delivered, nothing is not accomplished.
The Flying Celestial surveys below; the Supreme Emperor chants from afar.
Ten thousand spirits pay homage; the Three Realms attend his chariot.
All demons bow their heads; ghostly essences perish of themselves.
Jade chimes resound; the ten directions grow solemn and clear.
Rivers and seas grow still; mountains and peaks swallow mist.
Ten thousand spirits tremble and submit; immortals are summoned in assembly.
Heaven is free of filth; earth is free of demonic dust.
The dark blessings are profoundly pure—vast and profoundly mysterious!

Hasten, hasten, by the command of the Primordial Celestial Sovereign.

This talisman is to be employed on the ten auspicious fasting days: purify oneself, burn incense, present it with the Jade Purity mudra, and blow the true qi of the Three Heavens. Ingest, wear, or install it for pacification.

**Wood Star Secret Talisman**
This talisman remedies Wood-decline, liver diseases, and eye afflictions; it neutralizes toxins, stabilizes the hun-soul, and summons generative qi. Write in cinnabar on green paper, then ingest, wear, wash with, or affix it.
*Mao script, Eastern qi.*

**Fire Star Secret Talisman**
This talisman remedies Fire-decline, heart diseases, and oral afflictions; it augments longevity, stabilizes the spirit, dispels evil, and averts misfortune while summoning perfected qi. Write in cinnabar on yellow paper, then ingest, wear, wash with, or affix it.
*Li script, Southern qi.*

**Metal Star Secret Talisman**
This talisman remedies Metal-decline, lung diseases, and nasal afflictions; it augments qi, anchors the po-soul, and summons celestial qi. Write in cinnabar on white paper, then ingest, wear, wash with, or affix it.
*You script, Western qi.*

**Water Star Secret Talisman**

Write in cinnabar on yellow paper, then ingest, wear, affix, or install it.

The Five Stars array their radiance, illuminating the five directions.

Again, have the patient blow qi, recite the incantation, and blow to press, causing them to cough and expel the needle. Recovery is immediate after no more than three applications. Burn the original talisman to ash, mix with water, and ingest. Avoid pungent foods.

**Moon Radiance Secret Talisman**

*Thus concludes the thirty-sixth scroll of* The Great Method of the Numinous Treasure Scripture of Immeasurable Deliverance of Beings. *Here begins the thirty-seventh scroll.*

**Chapter on Reviving the Dead and Restoring Life**

The Three Perfected Ones’ Flying Dipper is the Dao of halting decay and extending life, the method of augmenting destiny and preserving fate. For all calamities and misfortunes, its efficacy is immediately manifest. When one’s allotted lifespan is nearing its end and disasters weigh heavily, should one wish to perform great meritorious deeds but lack the time to prepare, or have already begun such deeds yet not completed them, and life thus comes to an end, one becomes subject to worldly lament. Therefore, employ the Three Perfected Ones’ Flying Dipper to extend life and augment destiny—at most three days, next five days, or at least seven days—so that one may separately perform rites of supplication to the various heavens, restore the hun and po souls, turn back the funeral carriage, return the spirit and life, and prolong the lifespan. This may be done on the third, twenty-seventh, or during the eight solar terms and three primal origins, the ten fasts, jiazi and gengshen days, or on one’s own life’s original cyclical sign. In urgent cases, no day need be chosen, except when the Demon’s Cudgel (kuigang) aligns with the patient’s or the ritual master’s own life sign—this must not be used. If the celestial count or destiny’s numerical tally reaches nine, it cannot be remedied. The first three celestial stems form the Cudgel (gang), the latter three the Demon (kui); on yin days, this is reversed. If the day of the ritual bath appears peaceful yet the illness lingers, the lifespan will not be long.

In spring, the Dragon; in summer, the Sheep; in autumn, the Dog; in winter, the Ox—when the cyclical stems and branches of the resonant tone (nayin) conflict with the Water element, as in *renxu*, *renchen*, *dingchou*, or *dingwei*. First, sweep and purify the chamber, then arrange nine lamps according to the Dipper’s form. Each Dipper step requires three wicks of lamp grass, filled with clear oil to an even level, using only fresh supplies. Nine portions of five fruits, nine vases of seasonal flowers, nine measures of clear wine, nine cups of pure mountain spring water, nine incense burners, twenty-seven cloud cranes, nine cloud horses, and two *zhang* each of five-colored threads—all must be arranged in order. On the cloud horses, write nine memorial petitions; on the saddle bridges, inscribe nine life talismans for the patient. Additionally, set out nine separate offerings: two portions for the Sheep-Holder and Rāhu Messengers, four for the Four Duty Deities, one for the Earth God, one for the patient’s original cyclical sign, and one for their life’s Perfected Official. Arrange incense, tea, wine, and fruits in order.

Do not allow monks, nuns, women who have recently given birth, those in mourning, chickens, dogs, or garrulous persons to witness this. Do not strike bells or chimes, nor raise one’s voice in invocation. Proceeding thus, one will surely obtain a response.

When entering the altar to make supplication, first offer incense, then recite the *Purification of Heaven and Earth Spell* and sprinkle the consecrated water over the altar, ritual mat, and offering table. Next, light the lamps: in spring and summer, begin from the Dipper’s mouth; in autumn and winter, from its handle. For each lamp, recite the spell once and burn one talisman. The spell reads:

*Resplendent Seven Stars, in the northern quarter’s domain,*
*Beneath the Celestial Avenue, beside the Imperial Court’s side.*
*They govern the people and all things, they regulate yin and yang.*
*Rewarding good and punishing evil, bestowing fortune and dispelling calamity.*
*May the people’s lifespan not be cut short but endure,*
*May the people’s customs know no peril but thrive in health.*
*Within the Dipper dwells the numinous—hear my proclamation!*

After lighting the lamps, perform nine bows, then offer incense again and recite the *Purification of the Altar Spell*:

*By command of the Vast Heaven, flowing metal dissolves and congeals.*
*The Four Sevens’ vast expanse clears defilement, dust vanishes, and purity reigns.*

Recite this nine times, then blow toward the eight directions. After a long pause, perform nine bows again. Next, recite the *Invocation of Petition*:

*I, [your name], a humble servant, now open the rite. Attending are the Golden Lads of Incense, the Jade Maidens of Transmission, the Five Thearchs’ Duty Talismans, the Duty Deities of the Day, the Duty Talismans of the Three Realms—*
*—Upper Realm Duty Talisman: Zheng Yuanxi,*
*—Middle Realm Duty Talisman: Jiao Gongnu,*
*—Lower Realm Duty Talisman: Zhang Yuanbo,*
*—Year Duty Messenger: Cui Shuxuan,*
*—Month Duty Messenger: Lu Jiquan,*
*—Day Duty Messenger: Dou Yangguang,*
*—Hour Duty Messenger: Deng Hengwen,*
*—Together with the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, the Sheep-Holder and Rāhu Messengers—*
*I humbly beseech the Perfected Elder Thearch of the Five Numinous Ones of the Northern Quarter, the Holy Mother of the Nine Heavens, the Nine Luminaries of the Northern Dipper, the Four Sage Marshals, and the Sacred Assembly within the Dipper.*
*I have now established this altar, arrayed the Dipper’s form, and urgently implore the Stellar Heaven.*
*I reverently hope for your sagely compassion, that you descend your true qi, grant my petition, and bestow a response. I, [your name], respectfully speak these words.*

After this, offer incense again and perform nine bows, prostrating on the ground and knocking the teeth thirty-six times. First, visualize the liver emitting green qi transforming into a Green Dragon, the heart emitting red qi transforming into a Vermilion Bird, the lungs emitting white qi transforming into a White Tiger, the spleen emitting yellow qi transforming into a Yellow Dragon, and the kidneys emitting black qi transforming into a Dark Warrior. From the five viscera, five-colored true qi emerge like a long rainbow, shooting straight before the Dipper’s mouth. After a long while, they coalesce into a Jade Pillar of the Immortal-Crossing Bridge. Visualize yourself in proper attire, dressed in the colors of your official rank, with purple qi emanating from your crown. Mounting this purple qi, ascend the Immortal-Crossing Bridge to the Dipper Palace. Each star is as large as a cartwheel, radiant as the sun, containing golden towers and jade halls, jeweled mountains and crystal waters, coral trees, and attendants—all the Nine August Messengers, embroidered-robed numinous officials, Golden Lads, and Jade Maidens. For each star, perform nine bows and present your petition.

After a long while, return to the altar’s base, where purple clouds and rare fragrances appear. You will then see the Sheep-Holder and Rāhu Messengers, resembling Jade Maidens—one holding a golden tray with a sheep’s head, the other wielding a flower branch and sword. They first inspect the ritual offerings, then ascend into the Dipper. If you perceive rare fragrances or see purple clouds, it is the descent of the Nine Stars’ Sagely Assembly. Perform nine bows again.

Then serve tea and offer wine, performing nine bows for the initial libation. After this, read the memorial petition. The ritual host performs three tea and wine offerings, accompanied by three prayers. For the second libation, offer wine three more times, read the petition, and perform nine bows. For the final libation, read the memorial petition for the escorting generals, then burn it in a blazing fire.

The master, along with the Four Upright Three Messengers, the Star Official of One’s Life Destiny, and the Original Chronogram, proceeds to the gate of the Star Dipper Lord of their respective affiliation. For each star, they bow three times at its core, then return before the ritual altar to await the response of the guardians.

Thereafter, the remaining memorial petitions, spirit money, horses, clouds, and cranes are burned. Upon completion, the Dispersing Spirits Incantation is recited:

*"Celestial spirits return to heaven,
Earthly spirits return to earth.
Should they be summoned again,
Let it be as before."*

Then, the Returning to the Brazier and Dissolving Disasters Incantation is chanted nine times, followed by nine bows and the prayer:

*"At dawn, face the Celestial Terrace,
At dusk, lodge within the Nine Heavens’ embrace.
Celestial spirits, through the night, submit their plea,
To dissolve and dispel all calamities swiftly."*

The altar is then dismantled.

If the illness shows no worsening or even diminishes, proceed with the *Yusilu* (Life-Restoring Rite) to replace the name of death with that of life, absolve sins, and resolve misfortunes—thus prolonging life in this world. Prepare accordingly by submitting a memorial of gratitude to the Thirty-Two Heavens, or conduct a *Fuhun Jipo* (Rite for Restoring the Hun and Po Souls).

**Memorial Petition for the Dipper Rite**
*[Official Title] Your Servant [Name]*

Deeply concerned over grave offenses, and further beseeching relief from profound disasters. *[Official Title] Your Servant [Name]*

*[Official Title] Your Servant [Name]*
*Memorial respectfully sealed.*

For each of the Nine Lords, spirit money, horses, clouds, and cranes are offered as per the standard rite. On the saddle bridge of each horse, inscribe the *Seven Primes Talisman* and the vermilion *Dipper Scripture Talisman*.

**Alternative Method:**
Prepare nine grand cloud-horses. On each horse, inscribe the title of the ritual master and the details of the petition, specifying the requested actions. Each horse is dedicated to one Dipper Star Lord, with the phrase *"Humbly awaiting Your sagely decree"* appended.

At the appointed year, month, day, and hour, use the *Flying Mystery Three Qi Jade Chapter Seal* on the ritual platform. On the saddle of each horse, inscribe the *Dipper Scripture’s Auxiliary Talisman*.

Offer nine portions of incense, tea, wine, and fruit, then burn them. At that moment, pray to the Three Perfected Ones, beseeching them to submit the petition and manifest a clear response.

Clasp the *Ziwu Dipper* with both hands, and with a single cloud-horse, present the petition as it flies into the Dipper. Behind the cloud-horse, inscribe the titles of the Three Sagely Perfected Ones. Seal the petition with the cover inscribed: *"To the [specific] Star Lord, respectfully submitted by [Official Title]."* Command the Four Upright Messengers of *Dingjia* to fly the petition into the Dipper.

Take three pinches of ashes, mix them with the pure water of the Dipper Star, consume a small portion, and anoint the five centers (palms, soles, and crown), then await the response.

The vermilion *Seven Primes Talisman* and the talismans for dispelling various malevolent spirits are inscribed as above.

**Chapter on Flying the Spirit into the Dipper**
The August Person declares: Within the mountains, rivers, seas, and lands of the Lower Realm, amidst cities, villages, and hamlets, the spirits of stones, waters, birds, and beasts, the unorthodox deities of the Five Phases, the fierce and malevolent ghosts of the lower earth, the *chimei* (demons) and bewitching specters—all recklessly conjure calamities, engage in heterodox practices, and entangle living beings, defying resolution.

Or, within the Northern *Fengdu* (Netherworld), the divine officials who partake of blood offerings, those connected to ancestral spirits or recently transformed kin, or those embroiled in netherworld litigation that extends to the living—all such lingering afflictions and harms remain unresolved.

By establishing the *Three Celestial Mystic Pivot Sacred Altar* within a purified chamber, prayers are answered immediately, and peace is restored.

**Method:**
Select purified earth, a secluded chamber, or a remote, tranquil wilderness. Construct an altar three feet high. Upon it, arrange the Seven Mansions of the Southern Palace, within which place the Six Offices of the Southern Dipper. At the center, position the Nine Morning Stars, the Three Terraces, the Sun, and the Moon, lighting twenty-one lamps. At the core, place the Purple Tenuity Great Emperor Lord’s central altar. Before it, set a *Dong* (cave) table with twenty-one positions, including the Three Officials, Four Saints, Orthodox Unity Perfected Person, Three Generals, Four Upright Messengers, the Year Star, Earth God, and the Sheep-Holder and Rāhu Lords.

Use five-colored threads, extending from the mouths of the Dipper lamps to the base of the *Dong* table. On the ground, mark a square of three feet and six inches with white chalk, opening gates on all four sides.

Burn the true names of the Two Dippers in the brazier’s flame. The master enters through the Heavenly Gate, flying the spirit into the Dipper, secretly presenting the oral petition to the lofty perfected ones, concealing transgressions, harmonizing the year and destiny. Thus, demonic disturbances cease, the human realm is purified, and responses are wondrously efficacious.

First, pace the Dipper, entering through the handle and exiting at the mouth, then returning to the handle to envelop the body. Pace into the Dipper’s mouth again, bow three times, and on the third bow, prostrate oneself. Visualize the body in accordance with the method: the lower elixir field, clad in white, enters; the cinnabar palace, clad in crimson, enters; the mud pill, clad in purple, enters.

Upon completion, visualize the five viscera’s *qi* in their five colors, riding the spirit. The tongue becomes the *Bridge of Immortal Ascent*, resembling a long rainbow, faintly visible. Gradually, it becomes distinct—a pool of water appears before you, upon which a bridge spans, leading directly into the Dipper’s mouth.

Having ascended the bridge upon the *qi* and reached the Dipper’s mouth, one beholds radiant light shining resplendently like the moon, within which stand jade halls and golden steps. Silently summon the Four Upright Envoys and declare the intent of the offering in full. The envoys enter the Dipper and present the petition to each stellar palace in turn. Then suddenly appear the two envoys, *Qingyang* and *Tuoluo*, descending to inspect the purity of the offering altar, after which they report back to the stellar palace. From within the Dipper, the superior petitions the numinous officials; the master of ceremonies presents the matter, and upon perceiving an intent to grant approval, one bows twice and withdraws.

Again, visualize as before and present the petition within the Southern Dipper, where the *Fire-Bell Great General* and the Six Stellar Lads descend to inspect as previously. After a while, purple clouds and rare fragrances appear, or a crimson light enters the chamber—this marks the descent of the Two Dippers. Those in mourning, women, chickens, dogs, monks, and nuns must be excluded.

**Flying the Dipper:**
Use large paper *cloud-horses*, inscribing upon the saddle-bridge the talismans of the Northern and Southern Dippers. Extract from this scripture and write in vermilion; in the blank space, compose a petition. For each *cloud-horse*, inscribe the name of one stellar lord, presenting the memorial in the usual form. At the moment of burning, recite the proclamation.

**The Life-Nurturing Death-Rescinding Formation:**
The scripture states: It possesses the power to reverse death and inscribe life, to dispel calamities and deliver from misfortune. The *Life-Nurturing Death-Rescinding Formation* is the great compassion of the Perfected. This arcane wonder is left to deliver living beings, with responses manifesting in an instant.

For those afflicted by grave illness or misfortune, inscribe one talisman, along with the cyclical year, month, day, and hour of birth, and the person’s name. Record their lifetime transgressions in full, seal it securely, and offer ten strings of gold coins. On a quiet night, perform the Dipper-pacing ritual, entering the Dipper’s mouth, facing the Dipper, reciting the incantation, and blowing upon the star corresponding to the person’s natal phase before burning it together. After some time, inscribe another talisman, burn it to ashes, and have the person ingest them. Inscribe yet another talisman and have them wear it.

That very night, report how many years of life have been extended. Further, employ the hundred-mark verification method to cross-examine. The talisman incantation reads:

Reverently invoke the Five Star Spirit-Responding Thearchs to harmonize with the life-destiny of so-and-so. Swiftly, swiftly, as the Primordial Celestial Thearch’s decree and ordinance command.

**Format for Burning the Talisman and Petition:**

Fearing past-life karmic debts and present-life transgressions, having unwittingly violated prohibitions, [I] humbly submit this sealed confession, beseeching deliverance from suffering, prolongation of life, and passage through calamity.

Swiftly, swiftly, as the Primordial Celestial Thearch’s decree commands. By the ordinance of the Celestial Master and Perfected Lords.

If no response manifests that night, employ the subsequent talisman and proceed as before.

**Swift Deliverance of Departed Spirits**
The Mystic Master states: When approaching the altar to subdue demonic and wayward spirits, one must ensure benefit for both the living and the dead. First, perform the Prison-Breaking Rite. All procedures for this method align with those of the Grand Purificatory Deliverance of the Departed.

**Prison-Breaking Incantation:**
Supreme Mystic Origin, Supreme Dao Lord,
Instruct your subordinate to wield the talisman, illuminating and shattering the dark peaks.
May the numinous soul depart and be freed.
If subduing a sinful spirit, swiftly, swiftly, as the ordinance commands.

Recite this incantation nine times while facing the Celestial Gate, then blow upon the departed spirit. Thereupon, the soul shall be liberated from suffering, and one may proceed with the Water Refinement Method.

Kan’s script emerges from emptiness—
Withered, it flourishes anew; extinguished, it revives.

Bonds, fetters, and karmic obstructions are remitted, allowing transformation and rebirth.
Refined according to rank, it ascends to the blessed courts.

Once the incantation is complete, press the tongue against the upper palate, envision the body as that of the Primordial Heavenly Worthy, and silently recite the hidden invocation once. Envision golden light filling the mouth, form the Jade Clarity mudra with both hands, blow upon the ashes, and release the mudra toward the northeast. The soul shall then ascend to the Vermilion Palace—this is the essence of swift deliverance; perform it with utmost sincerity.

**Lingbao Summoning-Soul Talisman**
Right: In accordance with the *True Talisman of the Jade Clarity Treasure Register for Summoning the Soul*, report to the spirit officials of the Three Realms and the local domain masters, the divine envoys who summon souls and seize spirits.

By the command of the Most High, swiftly pursue and seize all malevolent and pernicious forces causing harm, detain them without release, and compel the sunken souls to hasten to the Mystic Altar for deliverance. Permit no delay; ensure their swift rebirth.

By this true talisman, transcend and ascend to the Dao-realm. Let it be executed as decreed, transmitted by wind and fire couriers.

**Chapter on Praying for Offspring**

The Mysterious Master said: The methods of the *Lingbao* are boundless in transformation, arising from spontaneity, and cannot be fathomed by mere conjecture. Whether as talismans or scripts, there is nothing they do not penetrate. The gods and spirits of Heaven and Earth, the mountains and rivers, grasses and trees, people and beasts, stars and constellations, sun and moon—all that possesses form is governed by talismanic scripts. This is not because each talisman has its own specific correspondences, but rather that within Heaven and Earth, there is nothing beyond the primordial *qi* of the Origin.

Having arisen from this singular *qi*, wherever the *qi* reaches, it naturally abides. The differences among talismans arise from the variations in the division of *qi*. Beyond the *Lingbao* binding and spirit talismans, there are over two hundred additional talismans, all transformations of this singular *qi*.

**Talismanic Script and Incantation:**
*"Incline the light, turn back the chariot,
Most solemnly inspect the myriad heavens.
Oṃ vajra rāya hūṃ jvalī svāhā."*
*(Red light.)*
*"Oṃ vajra candrāya namaḥ mūlī svāhā."*
*(Yellow light.)*

Form the mudra by pressing the middle fingers together. Write the names: on the left, "Seven Bindings of the Sun"; on the right, "Seven Slayings of the Moon." Visualize the red and yellow light of the sun and moon intertwining and entering the talisman. Draw one breath of *qi* from the East and one from the West, then exhale both while reciting the incantation and forming the mudra.

If a son is desired, move the hand from the *yin* position leftward to *si* and release. If a daughter is desired, move the hand from the *shen* position rightward to *si* and release. Husband and wife face each other—he toward the West, she toward the East. At dawn, consume one talisman, and within a hundred days, a child shall be conceived. For wearing, use the same incantation, writing in cinnabar on white silk: men on the left, women on the right. For consumption, burn the talisman to ash and swallow it.

**The Secret Method of the Supreme Talisman for Nurturing Offspring**
The Most High Lord Lao transmitted to the Nine Heavens’ Holy Mother of the Chamber the *Secret Method of the Nurturing-Offspring Spirit Talisman*.

Lord Lao said: Of all things in the world, none is more numinous than humanity, and thus the human form is most difficult to attain. It is formed from the father’s essence and the mother’s blood, the union of *yin* and *yang qi*, akin to the essence of Heaven and Earth taking shape. Heaven and Earth nurture the myriad beings—flourishing in spring and summer, withering in autumn and winter—yet even they cannot sustain all. How much less can humans? To be without offspring is a grave transgression, for Heaven and Earth cherish life and abhor destruction. I pity those without children, for is this not the greatest poverty in the world?

Now, for the sake of all beings, I transmit this method, bestowed upon Celestial Master Zhang Daoling of the Han to descend to the mortal realm, universally saving those without heirs or left solitary. Instruct the couple to abstain from meat, and each morning at dawn, burn incense and pray before the painted image of the Nine Heavens’ Sage, stating their names and bowing to beseech a child. Each shall swallow one talisman, thereby securing an early conception and a steadfast womb. The child shall be radiant in countenance, luminous in spirit, adept in literature, clever and prosperous, surpassing all others. After forty-nine days of consumption, signs shall manifest: perhaps in dreams of swallowing the sun and moon, or encountering other auspicious omens, which foretell the birth of an extraordinary child.

First, submit a petition to the assembly of the Nine Heavens’ Holy Mother and the host of gods, offering wine, fruit, and fine incense.

**Incantation of the Nine Heavens’ Womb-Nurturing Spirit Talisman:**
*"The true *qi* of the Nine Heavens’ Chamber of Protection gathers..."*

When writing the talisman, face the sacred image, recite the incantation fourteen times, and complete the script as the incantation concludes. Mix cinnabar with vinegar, write on *Coptis* paper, roll into pills, and take with frankincense-infused water.

**Chapter on Invoking Rain and Dispelling Clouds**

The Mysterious Master said: When the *qi* of Heaven descends but the *qi* of Earth does not ascend, scorching fires rage, and drought demons bring disaster. When the *qi* of Earth surges upward, *yin* overwhelms *yang*, and excessive rains flood the land, causing harm. Those who cultivate *yin* virtue await the words of the people; those who perform *yang* merit have their prayers answered.

To request rain, establish a *gui*-character altar; to dispel clouds, erect a *bing-ding* altar. Petition the Valley of the Sun and memorialize the Supreme Emperor; hold the dragons accountable and pray to the Three Officials. When the allotted time expires, present yourself at the Jade Palace. Issue talismanic commands and dispatch thunderous decrees. The *ding* and *jia* spirits act, the Great Unity assists, the splendor of the Dipper subdues demons, and governance restores order. The Four Maidens are assigned, harmonizing and gathering the obscured. Upon success, the myriad people receive blessings, and virtue is rewarded. All things flourish, merits are acknowledged, transgressions forgiven, and ranks elevated. Those who attain this are enrolled among the immortals, their virtue surpassing even that of the divine lords. Those who act negligently shall be punished with reduced lifespans and demoted ranks. All must adhere to these principles.

**Method:**
Rain occurs when Heaven’s *qi* descends, Earth’s *qi* ascends, and *yin* and *yang* harmonize. Drought arises when Heaven’s *qi* descends but *yang* operates alone, Earth’s *qi* fails to rise, and *yin* and *yang* remain discordant, leading to scorching heat and fiery disasters. In some regions, cruel tyranny, resentment, and the suppression of righteousness may also cause such calamities.

When Earth’s *qi* surges upward and *yin* encroaches upon *yang*, while Heaven’s *qi* does not descend, excessive rains and flooding result. This may also stem from those who govern the people—scheming in darkness, wielding poisonous intent, failing to distinguish between punishment and virtue, and secretly harming the loyal and good.

Those who hold true office must cultivate *yin* virtue and secretly pray for the people. If the people submit sincerely and seek aid, this is *yang* virtue. To pray for rain, establish a *gui*-character altar; to pray for clear skies, erect a *bing-ding* altar. Major rituals last three days, intermediate seven, and minor nine, with efficacy determined by the allotted time.

Begin by observing purification rites and reciting the true scriptures of the *Dongyuan* Dragon Texts. Notify the local earth gods and the dragons responsible for rain, the Spirit King of the Valley of the Sun, and the Water Officials. Then memorialize the Great Emperor of Fusang, submit petitions to the celestial bureaus, and present memorials at the Golden Gate to inform the Supreme Emperor. Entrust the Great Unity Sovereign, the Six *Ding* and Six *Jia* spirits, and the Samādhi Fire Casket to restrain water demons and command the Thunder Controller Han.

To eliminate harm from bandits, the cinnabar-feathered fan dispels clouds, and the black talisman tablet governs rain. Summon the dragons to move thunder, recite incantations to spread moisture, and the lake and sea goddesses part the veils to divide the light. The Grand Harmony Sea Consort harmonizes above and below. When the wind howls in response to the summons, clear skies must follow; before rain arrives, the first thunder brings stifling heat and discord.

If the task of ending prolonged rain succeeds, it is not by one’s own virtue or sincerity aligning with heaven and earth—unless the Supreme Mystery bends to things, one must align virtue with the talisman. To pray for rain and invoke moisture:

**Praying for Rain**
First, on purified ground, establish a *gui*-character altar according to the prescribed form. In urgent cases, coat the ground with black mud to form a *gui*-shaped altar. Arrange the offering positions to the north of the altar, ascend the altar at the six watch-hours, and recite the Great Brahmā’s esoteric words or the *Dongyuan* Dragon Texts’ incantations to summon the dragons, setting a limit of nineteen days.

**Initial Three Impurities**
On the first day, notify the local earth gods and the dragons responsible for rain, memorialize the Spirit King of the Valley of the Sun, and the Water Officials of the Bureau of Destiny, all under the authority of the Numinous Treasure Great Dharma Bureau. The notification format follows the submitted edict; if no specific words are given, state the causes of drought, with the rest as per the later form. Alternatively, offer seven portions of incense, tea, wine, and fruit, and dispatch them via the Immortal Bureau.

If no response is received, on the next day memorialize the Great Emperor of Fusang and report to the Three Yuan Water Bureaus, the Donghai Penglai Capital Water Office, and submit a petition to the Supreme Mystery Capital Province, dispatching as before. If still no response, present a memorial to the Jade Emperor, submit a petition to the Three Heavens, and address the divine court at the Golden Gate, beseeching an imperial mandate to be issued to the Water Bureau.

Only then inscribe the vermilion *Summoning Dragon Talisman* and the black *Inducing Rain Talisman* on an iron tablet, and cast it into the rivers or seas. Then notify the Five Thunder Envoys, the *Ding* and *Jia* great spirits, the Wind Earl and Rain Master, and forward the directive to the city gods, the Nine Rivers and Four Seas, and the dragon gods of lakes, pools, and marshlands, setting a deadline for rain and ensuring it is ample and timely.

If no response comes within three days, proceed to the intermediate rite, with a seven-day limit, dividing it into two-day intervals, following the previous procedures. If still no response, perform the minor rite, with a nine-day limit, dividing it into three-day intervals, again adhering to the prescribed forms.

If no response comes after nineteen days, further prayers are not permitted. This may be due to: first, heavenly fate or punitive disasters; second, the supplicant’s lack of virtue; or third, insufficient sincerity. Moreover, the Most High always benevolently saves all things, and the response will not exceed three limits. Any negligence will be investigated by the Three Officials, resulting in demotion or penalized merit.

On the day the response is felt, hold an offering to thank the heavenly grace, and the officials will fulfill their duties.

**Gui-Water Altar**
Follow the standard form, regardless of size. Remove one corner from the northwest and northeast of the upper layer, add two side paths to the middle layer, and remove the southeast and southwest corners of the lower layer.

**Three Heavens Summoning Dragon True Talisman**
**Three Heavens Inducing Rain True Talisman**
The two talismans are inscribed on an iron plate, one foot two inches long and four inches wide. Write the *Summoning Dragon Talisman* in vermilion on the front and the *Inducing Rain Talisman* in black on the reverse, then cast it into waters where dragons reside.

To cast the talisman, take three steps in the *ding*-trigram direction, hold the talisman in the left hand, and wield a sword in the right. Recite the incantation:

> By the mandate of the Three Heavens’ talismans,
> summon the dragons to induce rain.
> The Heavenly *Ding* spirits lead the way,
> the Wind Earl and Rain Master rise.
> Jade dew is sealed, yin and yang obstructed;
> the two *qi* ascend and descend,
> flying winds and rushing rains.
> Dragons on duty, obey the talisman’s command.
> Should any dare disobey,
> the Water Officials will swiftly report.
> The Upper Clarity Heavenly *Ding* spirits
> will slay your form.
> By the Jade Clarity’s numinous mandate,
> you must heed this command.
> Swiftly, swiftly, as the Three Heavens’ statutes decree!

After casting the talisman, retreat quickly to avoid being startled by thunder or water.

**Rain-Praying Memorial and Official Petition Format**
Respectfully invite the Supreme Unity True Talisman, the Five Thunder Envoys, the Six *Ding* Jade Maidens, the Six *Jia* Literary Spirits, the Jade Maidens of the Rivers, Seas, and Lakes to descend at once, carrying out the imperial decree. Notify the Water Bureau of Fusang, the Spirit King of the Valley of the Sun, the Penglai Capital Water Office, the Water Officials of Destiny, the Four Seas and Nine Rivers, and the Three Yuan Water Officials. Also summon the dragons responsible for rain this year, the Wind Earl and Rain Master, the Thunder Duke and Lightning Mother, and the dragon gods of the Nine Rivers and local earth altars. Command them to oversee their respective territories, harmonize yin and yang, raise clouds and spread dew, bestow sweet moisture, and ensure ample rain to relieve the scorched earth.

If any evil disrupts the proper *qi*, beseech the thunder to strike and punish it, upholding heavenly justice. Do not allow rain to be obstructed. With grace from the Most High, may it be so.

**Stopping Rain and Praying for Clear Skies**
On open ground beneath a canopy, establish a *bing-ding* altar, or coat the ground with red mud to form a *bing-ding* altar. Use crimson silk to make a fan, inscribe the *Clearing Skies Talisman* on all eight directions, and notify the Water Officials and the Spirit King of the Valley of the Sun, addressing the dragon gods responsible for rain.

On the second day, submit a petition to stop the rain. If it continues, directly petition the Jade Emperor, dispatching the Great Unity Sovereign, the *Ding* and *Jia* great spirits, and deploy the Samādhi Fire Casket to restrain the water *qi*, sever water demons, and divide yin and yang. Upon success, hold an offering to thank the heavenly grace, and recite the Great Brahmā’s esoteric words at the altar during the six watch-hours.

**Yang Valley Bing-Ding Altar**
Follow the standard form. In the lower layer, add a central path; in the middle layer, add two paths; the upper layer remains unchanged.

**Three Heavens Parting the Jade Path True Talisman for Clearing Skies**
For prolonged overcast skies and rain-induced disasters, establish an altar in the open, cover it with an oilcloth canopy, and make a fan from red crane feathers. Inscribe the *Jade Path Talisman* in yellow upon it. Recite the incantation:

> Metal and water mutually engender,
> yet turn to oppose each other.

Fire and earth *qi* mutually restrain and punish.
Han Bureau enforces the decree, the Three Luminaries shine bright.
Yin and yang are divided and assigned, communicating with the Purple Court.
The Primordial Beginning’s Great Dao: *wu-ji bing-ding*.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Three Heavens’ Supreme Statutes command.

Place the fan at the eight directions and recite the incantation; within an hour, the rain will clear, and the Three Heavens will become distinct.

**Ritual Petition to Cease Rain (Official Protocol)**
Respectfully summon the Jade Maidens of the River, the Jade Maidens of the Sea, the Jade Maidens of the Lakes, the Direct Talismans of Water Speech, and report to the Three Origins’ Water Bureau, the Water Officials’ Offices, the Dragon Gods of Rivers, Seas, Springs, and Streams, the Cloud, Thunder, and Rain Departments, the Wind Earls, and all gods.

This year’s Rain Dragon Gods and Rain Masters: swiftly gather the clouds and withdraw the mists, divide and assign yin and yang, cease the rain and reveal the light, each returning to their domain as a sign of efficacy.

As in the second chapter, so it is said again:
Then invoke the Supreme Unity’s Primordial Lord, the Six *Ding* Jade Maidens, the Six *Jia* Great Gods, the Heavenly *Ding* Warriors, and the Celestial Soldiers to descend at once.
Swiftly gather the water *qi*, sever the water demons, part the springs, open the Jade Path, and manifest the Three Luminaries as a sign of efficacy.

*The Great Rites of the Numinous Treasure’s Boundless Salvation Sutra, Scroll Thirty-Eight* (End)
*The Great Rites of the Numinous Treasure’s Boundless Salvation Sutra, Scroll Thirty-Nine*

**The Numinous Treasure’s Righteous Steps: The Rite of Summoning the Ten Directions’ Flying Heavenly Divine Kings**

All *gang* steps begin with *ding* and rise to stand, always stepping left before right in single strides.

**The Talisman Step for Summoning the Flying Heavenly Beings**
Write the talismanic script of the Ten Directions in overlapping strokes. With the left and right hands rotating in turn, begin at *Zhen* and conclude at the center of the middle finger.

**The Step for Summoning the Officials of the Refining and Salvation Bureau**
Form the mudra for severing the Three Paths and Five Sufferings, rotating both hands in turn from *Zhen*, concluding at the center of the middle finger.

**The Step for Summoning the Numinous Treasure’s Celestial Officials**
Press the centers of both middle fingers, stepping from *Yin* to *Wu*, then revolve the body three times to *Dui* Palace to summon them.

**The Step for Summoning the Officials of the Yellow Register Court**
Press the third joints of the left and right middle fingers, stepping from the center.

**The Step for Summoning the Demon Kings of the Three Realms**
Begin at *Kan*, cross-step to stand at *Wei*, pressing the third joints of both middle fingers to summon the universal talisman of the Three Realms.

**The Step for Summoning the Five Emperors**
Step from east to west, pressing the Metal and Wood mudras with both hands.

**The Step for Summoning the Mighty Spirits of the Eight Directions**
Rotate both hands in the Eight Trigrams mudra, stepping from *Kun* to *Qian* to stand.

**The Step for Reviving the Dead**
Press the centers of the four fingers, passing the middle finger over them, then flick with three fingers, stepping from north to south to stand.

**The Step for Subduing Earthly Deities**
Beckon with both hands at the center of the middle fingers, then flick at *Jia*, stepping from *Zi* to south, then turn back to stand in the central palace.

**The Step for Binding the Forms of Myriad Demons**
Flick from *Zi* to *Wu* with both hands, stepping from *Zhen* to *Qian*.

**The Step for Annihilating Ghostly Spirits**
Flick from *Zi-Hai* to *Shen-Yin* with both hands, standing from *Kan* to *Si*.

**The Step for Binding Demon Spirits**
Flick from *Yin-Shen* to *Si-Hai* with both hands, standing from *Kan* to *Wu*.

**The Step for Sweeping Away Inauspiciousness**
Press the second joints of the thumbs with three fingers, flicking, stepping from *You* to *Zhen* Palace to stand.

**The Step for Revolving the Dipper and Traversing the Winnowing Basket**
Rotate the Dipper of Yin and Yang with the left hand, stepping single strides from the Earth Gate, revolving to enter the Heavenly Pass—twenty-two steps in total—then conclude in the central palace.

**The Incantation for Stepping the *Gang***
*Oṃ kuru gī kudi, ūkūban kuru kha, pa shuo yan di hē mó hōng shè.*
This incantation is universally applied to all *gang* steps.

All talismans herein are formed from the Primordial *qi* of the Original Beginning, manifesting as natural scriptures bestowed upon those who study transcendence. They must be practiced in secrecy. For each *gang* step, a general commands its execution. First, inscribe the talisman in cinnabar on yellow paper and place it before the sacred altar before stepping the *gang*. Upon completion, burn the talisman in the incense burner, and the commanding general will descend before your eyes.

**The Altar Bureau’s Incantations and Mudras: Methods of Sealing**

**The Method of Pressing Characters**
Press the center of the left middle finger and recite:
*Oṃ bān hēn hēn, wūlū mó hēn, sà hē.*

**The Method of Consecrating the Inkstone**
Press the upper joint of the right middle finger and recite:
*Oṃ miǎo mǎng wū shuǎng jū zhī pí tú shè.*

**The Method of Blessing Water**
Press *Zi* with the left hand, hold the water with the right, and recite:
*Oṃ yù dān bó hè, hán jīng tuó luó, jǐng xuán shè.*

**The Method of Consecrating Paper**
Press the center of the left middle finger, hold the paper with the right, and recite:
*Oṃ pú yù tán nà mó luó ā nà shè.*

**The Method of Consecrating Cinnabar**
Press the *Wu* mark with the left hand, hold the cinnabar with the right, and recite:
*Oṃ tuó luó ā nà yuán fàn pú tán shè.*

**The Method of Consecrating Ink**
Press the *Zi* mark with the left hand, hold the ink and grind it nine times with the right, reciting:
*Oṃ xíng xuán tuó, hé yōu lǜ □ shè.*

**The Method of Consecrating the Brush**
Press the *Yin* mark with the left hand, hold the brush with the right, crossing it before the mouth, and recite:
*Oṃ yù kōng luó méng, mó luó ā yì, xū yuán shè.*

**The Rite of Offering to the Brush**
On the days of the Six *Ding* and Six *Jia*, prepare twelve sheep-hair brushes, twelve sticks of ink, twelve ounces of cinnabar, and two inkstones. On the day of *Jia-Zi*, arrange them upon a table facing the Heavenly Gate, along with twelve cups of jujube broth and one incense burner as offerings. Ensure no one else witnesses this. The ritual master forms the mudra with both hands, left *Zi* and right *Wu*, crossing them before the mouth.

The Summoning Incantation states:
By this rite and method, brushes, ink, cinnabar, and inkstones are now arrayed beneath the Heavenly Gate. Humbly we invoke the divine officials of the *Lingbao* Dharma Division, the Golden Lads and Jade Maidens, the marshals, scribes, and soldiers—may all manifest their true *qi* and enter herein. When the adept employs these tools, may they respond to the incantation’s intent and instantly attain communion with the numinous.

Incantation:
*Oṃ ā hǎn fǎ yán, mó yí ā shì mì luó pú tí.*
*Pó lóu sà luó, fàn nà zǒng jiān guǐ shén shè.*

Upon completion, flick the mudra, draw in three breaths of *qi* from the Heavenly Gate and twelve breaths in total, then blow them into the brush. Inscribe the talisman within the brush.

The Talisman-Writing Incantation:
Divine brush, luminous and bright,
By the August Emperor’s command you take flight.
The Three Realms heed your decree,
All spirits revere and attend to thee.
Inscribe talismans and registers true,
Penetrating the darkest depths anew.
Within the Mysterious, the Supreme Sovereign reigns,
The August Perfected of highest domains.
At the center, the Five *Qi* align,
Merging with the hundred spirits divine.
Swiftly, swiftly, by the *Lingbao* Great Law’s decree!

The Brush-Consecration Prayer:
Divine brush, attuned to the numinous,
In harmony with the Jade Clarity thus.
Inscribe talismans to slay ghosts,
Cure illness and bring peace that endures.
All calamities and myriad woes,
Wherever directed, shall crumble and go.
Deliver the souls of the departed,
Where the talisman reaches, its power imparted.

The Talisman-Activation Incantation:
Great *Lingbao* Dharma,
Primordial script of the Origin’s truth.
The vast and formless Dao,
Embodied in the Three Clarities’ birth.
*Qi* descends into the talisman,
Where it arrives, peace shall reign.
Slaying demons, preserving life,
Eternal protection without end.

For both scripts, form the Jade Clarity mudra, draw *qi* from the Heavenly Gate, and blow it upon the brush.

The Great Rites of the *Lingbao Wuliang Duren Shangjing* conclude with Scroll Thirty-Nine.
The Great Rites of the *Lingbao Wuliang Duren Shangjing* begin with Scroll Forty.

**Chapter on Returning to the Origin and Expounding the Mysterious**

All who gather as immortals and seek the Dao must know: if the spirit does not return to its root, it will not be numinous; if *qi* does not revert to its origin, it will hold no treasure. The Dharma possesses the *qi* of the Five Talismans and Five Numinous Ones, which can purge the five viscera of filth and impurity, purifying body and mind. Only then, through reciting the Dao and contemplating the True, will natural enlightenment arise, the Dao and its methods respond with efficacy, and divine transformations become unfathomable.

Those who cultivate the True must distance themselves from sensual distractions, uphold fasting and precepts, remain loyal to family and state, aid others and benefit the world, and tend to incense and rituals with diligence—thus swiftly attaining resonance with the divine.

The Dharma prescribes Five Talismans, each inscribed in cinnabar on silk of five colors, half an inch square. At dawn, burn incense, enter the oratory, ingest the *qi* of the Five Numinous Ones, reduce the talismans to ash, mix with well-flower water, and consume facing the five directions. After seven days of this practice, one may summon the Eighty-One Great Divine Officials and employ the Eighty-One Methods of Universal Salvation. Through flying petitions to the Celestial Emperor, one may deliver all orphaned souls—whether claimed or unclaimed—across the Nine Provinces and Three Realms, including those slain in battle, loyal ministers, righteous scholars, and those who met unjust deaths. By this Great Dharma, all shall be universally delivered. It may also be invoked to pray for rain, universally cure all illnesses, and achieve responses without fail.

**The Eighty-Onefold General Incantation**
First approach the seat, where the Eight Convergences and Nine Radiances naturally form the script. All myriad spirits conceal themselves within. Upon completing the invocation, visualize within the cinnabar field a swirling chaos of ninefold radiance, billowing and ascending to return to the root of life. After a long while, ascend to the Eight Effulgences, where *qi* enters the Mysterious of Mysteries. Within the Mysterious abides the August One, who welcomes the assembly of the Ten Thousand Perfected. Whatever is recited or supplicated shall summon the myriad spirits in response.

**The Five Numinous True Talismans**
**General Incantation**
Nine Radiance, Three *Qi*, Seven Governors, Five Constants.
The August Highest descends from on high, bringing the primordial yang.
Summon the myriad spirits to activate the talisman.

This talisman is inscribed in cinnabar on blue silk. Using the *Lingbao* mudra and the *qi* of the Primordial Ancestor, burn it upon the incense to summon the myriad spirits. It must not be used lightly.

**Total Incantation of Eighty-One Characters**
*Lán míng chǒu, xuán ā luō. Lóng zhān xū, yán tán yóu. Yuán fú bǎo, qiān lì chán. Shēn bō pó, méng fàn tiān. Chǒu duó shàn, yóu míng lí. Jǔ qiān jué, lóu yì miǎo. Fàn guāng shǒu, jiān zhú luò. Jiā qié fú, lī dà zǔn. Sān mó miào, biàn kūn fù. Dào qián chì, míng lún hé. Miè mó zì, juān yīn wěn. Dā hēi tuó, yù fù mù. Piān zhēn jiǔ, qì xū liú. Shàng xiān chì.*

The above mudras and incantations all belong to the secret methods of the *Lingbao* tradition. Whenever practicing, silently visualize the primordial ancestral *qi*, recite the eighty-one characters in the heart, then apply the eighty-one talismans. This is the natural Dao for delivering the living and saving the dead, exorcising and beseeching blessings. There is nothing beyond this—only advanced adepts may hear and know of it. Those who recklessly reveal it will bring misfortune upon nine generations.

The esoteric essence of penetrating the mysterious is the root of all methods. To attain it, one must focus on guarding the One; to practice it, one must rely on divine efficacy. When the One is preserved, the spirit responds, and numinous resonance knows no bounds. Guarding the spirit makes the spirit numinous, and *qi* gathers like treasured abundance. When spirit and *qi* abide, inner and outer radiance shines. Response and resonance become unimpeded, and one reaches the celestial perfected. Within the perfected dwells the spirit, the Great Lord of Longevity. When the perfected and the spirit resonate, one ascends to the imperial court on high. One’s name is inscribed in the Jade Register, and for ten thousand kalpas, one enjoys blessed honor. Those who know and advance in the Dao will naturally comprehend its wondrous principles. Those who know and grow lax will have their forms extinguished for all time. Those who recklessly reveal or slight these teachings will cause their seven ancestors to suffer punishment. Be cautious and heed this—heavenly law is not lenient.

**Chapter on the Heaven-Opening Jade Contracts**
The August One said: A contract is a bond, a celestial covenant. The Heavenly Worthy bestows jade contracts upon those destined for immortality, to await their ascent as immortals. Passing through the Heavenly Gates, none may obstruct them. These jade contracts, distributed among the celestial officials—like the administrative bureaus of the human realm—each govern their own domains. How could one casually intrude? Thus, Heaven establishes these jade contracts to grant to those who cultivate immortality. Even if one’s allotted lifespan ends and the body returns to the Great Yin, possessing this jade contract allows direct passage to one’s destined realm. Presenting the Heavenly Decree, one transcends earth and soars through space, relying on this contract to traverse the Stem Winds. With the left supporting the community and the right assisting the altars, the contract aids the ascension of those attaining perfection. Only those who have personally assumed official duties may receive it. Violators will be punished by Heaven.

**True Essence and Primordial Qi** (*Zhēnyuán Hùnjié*) **mixed and bound**, piercing straight through the **Heavenly Pass** (*Tiān Guān*).

**Sun and Moon** (*Rìyuè*) **radiance unified**, **Heaven and Earth** (*Tiāndì*) **cycling in harmony**.
**As swift as the Law Command (Lùlìng).*

Next, upon completing the **Chapter** (*Cāozhāng*), immediately use the **left-hand Fighting Seal** (*Zuǒshǒu Dǒuzhòu*) to draw from the **heart** (*Xīn*) to the **hairline** (*Fàjiè*).
Next, strike (*Dàn*), transforming the body into **dry wood** (*Kūmù*). The **Nine Phoenix Spirit Official of the South** (*Jiǔfèng Zhēn Guān*) spits fire, burning the body into **ashes** (*Huījìn*).
Suddenly, a **great wind** (*Dàfēng*) arises, blowing the ashes away—only the **Primordial Qi’s origin** (*Yuánshǐ Zhī Qì*) remains, where a **white Qi** (*Báiqì*) emerges, forming the appearance of a **True Person** (*Zhēnrén*), visualizing the **Five Fighting Seals** (*Wǔdǒu*) enveloping the body. Immediately, proceed with the **Communicating Qi Step Over Passions Mantra** (*Tōngqì Bù Gāng Zhòu*).

At the **ninth step** (*Dìjiǔ Bù*), gaze toward the **Heavenly Gate** (*Tiānmén*), bowing in **three obeisances** (*Sāngǒng Sānbài*), then rise and sprinkle **sword-water** (*Jiànshuǐ*) in the **four directions** (*Sìfāng*).
Upon completion, bow again in **three obeisances** (*Zài Sāngǒng Sānbài*), then on the **tongue pillar** (*Shězhù*) above the **palate** (*Shàng È*), visualize beneath the **tongue** (*Xiàyǔ*) a **purple cloud chariot** (*Zǐyún Zhī Chē*), carrying **historians and soldiers** (*Shǐbīng Mǎ*) from the **ten directions** (*Shífāng*).

The **Primordial Qi** (*Yuánshǐ*) then ascends the chariot, visualizing the **heavens above and the earth below** (*Tiānshàng Dìxià*) both as **empty void** (*Kōngrán*), **silent and devoid of all things** (*Jìwú Suǒyǒu*).
The **seal** (*Zhòu*) states:

*"The **Purple Chariot** (*Zǐchē*) now turns the **Earthly Axis** (*Dìzhóu*),*
*its **white Qi** (*Báiqì*) ascends from the **Lower Dantian** (*Xià Dāntián*),*
*directly surging the **Mud Pellet** (*Níwán*),*
*soon seeing it enter through the **Golden Gate** (*Jīnmén*),*
*only perceiving **ten thousand golden lights** (*Jīnguāng Wàndào*),*
*illuminating and reflecting upon oneself.*

Next, visualize **one’s own body** (*Zìjī*) emitting **white jade light** (*Báiyù Zhī Guāng*), rising from the **fontanelle** (*Zhào Dǐngmén*) above, intersecting with the **golden light** (*Jīnguāng*), encircling and penetrating the body—**interior and exterior** (*Nèiwài*) **radiant and clear** (*Yíngchè*).

Suddenly, a **treasure pearl** (*Bǎozhū*) appears suspended in the **void** (*Xūkōng*).
The **Primordial Qi** then silently bows in **heart meditation** (*Xīn Lǐ*), petitioning **matters of truth** (*Shìlǐ*).

Upon completion, soon the **pearl emits ten thousand golden jade lights** (*Bǎozhū Zhōng Yǒu Wàndào Jīnyù Zhī Guāng*),*
*illuminating the **Ten Directions’ World** (*Shífāng Shìjiè*),*
*all at once made manifest.*

A **True Person** (*Zhēnrén*) then appears, taking the **Chapter text** (*Zhāngwén*) from the **Primordial Qi’s** hand to present it to the Most High (*Tàishàng*).
After a brief moment (*Shǎoqǐng*), a **Jade Boy** (*Yùtóng*) delivers the message (*Chuányán*), and the **Primordial Qi** bows **three times** (*Zài Sānsān Gǒng*) before withdrawing.

Visualize descending from the **Heavenly Gate** (*Tiānmén*) to the **altar platform** (*Tántiǎo*),*
*where the **Primordial Qi** meets with the **Subsequent Awareness True Qi** (*Cìjué Zhēnqì*),*
*the **Three Purity Qi** (*Sān Guāng Zhī Qì*) merging and interpenetrating,*
*and with intent, guide it into the **Lower Dantian** (*Xià Dāntián*).

**Chapter and Petition Format** (*Zhāngbiǎo Shì*):
*"When inscribing a Chapter and Petition, first rinse the hands and face, tidy the attire and headgear, purify the chamber and burn incense, and as per the ritual, hold the brush in the **eighth division of the sky** (*Shàngkōng Bāfēn*), equivalent to **eight-tenths of a cubit** (*Shěngchǐ Yīcùn Zhī Bāfēn*).*
*The lines shall follow the **‘crawling ant’ standard** (*Xiàotōng Zǒuyǐ*),*
*each line containing **seventeen characters** (*Měiháng Shíqīzì*).*
*The width of each line shall be **one inch and two-tenths** (*Hángkuò Yīcùn Èrfēn*)."*

**Formatting and Taboo Rules for Chapter and Petition:**

*"The character **臣** (*Chén*) shall not occupy the first position in a line,
the character **鬼** (*Guǐ*) shall not appear at the beginning,
nor shall it reveal the dying or the living,
or expose another’s given name or surname.

The phrase **‘Sincerely terrified, I bow twice’** (*Chénghuáng Chéngkǒng Zhì Zàibài*) shall not be broken across lines.

Below the word **‘with report’** (*Yǐ Wén*), leave one inch of space for the second bow.
The surname **臣** (*Chén*) shall be three lines above **‘with report’** (*Yǐ Wén*).
**‘Tàiqīng Xuányuán’** shall be three lines above **臣** (*Chén*).
**‘Tàisuì’** shall be three lines above **‘Tàiqīng’** (*Tàiqīng*), and three lines after **‘Tàisuì’**.
If insufficient space remains, add an extra sheet.
**‘Tàiqīng Stage’** shall contain **fifty-two characters** (*Wǔshísìzì*), with the **‘drill-hole’** (*Zuān*) length set at **two inches and four-tenths** (*Èrcùn Sìfēn*).

**Petition Text:**
*"On this [date], at the [time],*
*I humbly submit a petition on behalf of [person] for [matter],*
*sealed with a square envelope and complete with official stamps.*

*I present it to the [named] Palace and its governing Bureau for the officials there.*
*I pray for an official copy to be delivered to the **Three Realms’ Most Honored Sovereign** (*Sānjìng Zhìzūn*).*
*I shall follow the petition and present myself for audience,*
*humbly awaiting a divine response.*

*Already, the officials of the day have received the petition and delivered it to the appropriate Palace.*
*I must now submit the petition in full to the **Three Realms** (*Sānjìng*).*

**Humbly,**
*I submit this petition to the **Sacred Office of [position]** (*[certain] Shèngwèi*),*
*humbly praying for the **Sacred Mercy** (*Shèngcí*),*
*that You specially grant me an audience of the submitted petition.*

*I pray that it not be grouped with similar petitions for review,*
*but be presented directly to **The Supreme Sovereign, Jade Emperor of the Golden Threshold and Exalted Tower** (*Shàngdì Jīnquè Chónglóu Diàn*),*
*and entrusted to the **Celestial Maidens of the Azure Waist and Winged Reception** (*Qīngyāo Chéngyì Yùnǚ*),*
*and the **Vermilion Bird and Constant Yang Boy Attendants** (*Chángyáng Zhūquè Tóngzǐ*).*

*Upon receiving Your decree,*
*I shall reverently listen to Your command and await Your summons.*

*I also pray for Your special instruction to be issued to my affiliated place of worship for proper observance.*

*Above, I proclaim the **Dao’s Benevolent Mercy and Goodness to All** (*Dàodé Cíbēi Hǎoshēng zhī zé*),*
*below, I express the sincerity of the living and the dead seeking Your favor.*

*I dare to intrude upon **Your Sacred Hearing** (*Shèngqīng*),*
*and humbly submit this petition.*

**Year** ___ **Month** ___ **Day**,
*[Position] [Name] humbly petitions.*

**Petition Format for the Celestial Master** (*Zào Tiānshī Zhàngshì Sàn tán Zhūbiǎo yòng*):
*[Position] [Name] humbly states,*
*that tonight, I am conducting a scattered altar ritual.*

*I deeply reflect that my preparations for the altar and ritual offerings were not proper,*
*my reverence in approaching and departing was lacking,*
*and I have violated the ritual laws.*

*Now, I humbly submit a **Red Tablet Petition** (*Zhūbiǎo*) to the **Three Realms’ Celestial Threshold** (*Sānjìng Dìquè*),*
*to confess and seek forgiveness.*

*I deeply reflect that the format of my submitted **Red Tablet Petition** does not comply with the Heavenly standards.*
*I must now submit it in full for notification.*

**Humbly,**
*I record this petition and submit it to the **Three Heavens’ Grand Master of the Orthodox One Dao** (*Sāntiān Dàfǎshī Zhèngyī Jìngyìng Zhēnjūn*).*

*I reverently pray for **Heaven’s Mercy** (*Tiāncí*) to perceive my ignorance,*
*to have pity on my humble self and others,*
*to pardon my failure to grasp the **True Qi** (*Zhèngqì*),*
*and to forgive my shortcomings.*

*I humbly pray for Your special grant of an **Instructional Decree** (*Zhǐhuī shūzuǒ*)*
*to remove the outer seal,*
*to rectify my errors as evidenced,*
*and to directly present this petition.*

*I am overwhelmed with fear and reverence,*
*and humbly submit this petition.*

**Year** ___ **Month** ___ **Day**,
*[Position] [Name] humbly petitions.*
