**Secret Incantation for the Nine Heavens’ Celestial Immortals** (*Kēqián Mìzhòu*):
*"Nine Heavens’ Celestial Immortals, always born from Dao transformation,*
*Divine Chamber of Supreme Splendor, your abode reflected in pearls and jade,*
*Retired Residence of Vermilion Radiance, receiving duties from the Jade Purity,*
*Ten revolutions, nine returns, seven merges into five,*
*Divine radiance ascends together, brandishing the whip in the Imperial Court,*
*Dao reaches the Three Transformations, body and spirit merge in harmony,*
*The Jade Emperor’s scattered blessings, the hidden mysteries of the Feathered Scriptures,*
*Thousands of True Ones incline their wheels, the Five Stars command the True Ones,*
*Unfurling the humble cloth and feathers, the Imperial Court’s vast array,*
*Left: the Divine Tiger commands, Right: the Golden Soldier bears arms,*
*Nine Heavens’ military expedition, flashing the fiery bells,*
*Extinguishing demons and annihilating heretics, slaying evil and seizing essence,*
*Wind and fire blaze forth, the Six Heavens crumble,*
*The Northern Du abyss is exposed, the Nine Demons freeze in the cold smoke,*
*Those who stray from the Dao are punished, those who follow the Dao are saved,*
*The Supreme Sovereign commands, and the Divine Soldiers enforce it,*
*Ten thousand evils are tested and destroyed, ten thousand ghosts have no respite,*
*Any who dare to obstruct, shall be handed over to the Heavenly Executioners,*
*Heretics shall be slaughtered, poisonous ones shall be executed,*
*Divine Soldiers guard and protect, capturing evil and slaying essence,*
*The Six Heavens decree punishment, their might subduing all spirits,*
*The Treasure Spirits drive away filth, the celestial expanse clears for the Three Pure Ones,*
*Ten thousand True Ones receive their duties, all gathered in the Imperial Court,*
*The Six Symbols harmonized, the Seven Scenes radiant,*
*The Divine Wind scatters demons, the Dao field is purified,*
*The Divine Blessings dispel ghosts, the Jade Emperor blesses life,*
*The Nine Heavens ride the command, capturing True Ones and commanding spirits.*

**I pray for the fulfillment of Your Imperial Command,*
*so that the Dao may be established.*

*I bow and submit this incantation and petition,*
*following the ritual instructions as prescribed,*
*to proclaim the incantation and strike the law-drum twenty-four times.*

*To the **Supreme Daoist Lord of the Primordial Mysteries and Five Agents** (*Tàishàng Xuányuān Wúshàng Lǎojūn*),*
*I summon the **Functional Officials** (*Gōngcáo Shǐzhě*),*
*the **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords** (*Zuǒyòu Lónghǔ Zhēnjūn*),*
*the **Incense-Bearing Officials** (*Pěngxiāng Shǐzhě*),*
*and the **Three Qi Orthodox Deities** (*Sānqì Zhèngshén*),*
*urgently to ascend and open the gate for the **Three Heavens’ Primordial Daoist Lord** (*Sāntiān Xuányuān Tàishàng Dàojūn*).*

*I now burn incense and submit this petition,*
*wishing to receive the **Eight Directions’ Orthodox True Officials and True Qi** (*Bāfāng Zhèngzhēn Shēngqì*),*
*to descend into my body.*

*May my invocation reach swiftly,*
*and be presented directly to the **Supreme Jade Emperor of the Ultimate True Dao** (*Zhìzhēn Wújí Dàdào Yùhuáng Zūnshì*).*

*I kneel long in spirit,*
*and humbly summon from within my body:*
*The **Five Bodies’ True Officials of the Functional Bureau** (*Wǔtǐ Zhēnguān Gōngcáo Lì*),*
*two **Direct Envoy Officials** (*Zhíshǐ Gōngcáo*),*
*two **Orthodox One Functional Officials** (*Zhèngyī Gōngcáo*),*
*two **Healing Disease Functional Officials** (*Zhìbìng Gōngcáo*),*
*two **Left and Right Celestial Envoy Officials** (*Zuǒyòu Guānshǐzhě*),*
*two **Divine Judges of the Yang** (*Yángshén Jué Lì*),*
*one **Divine Judge of the Yin** (*Yīnshén Yāng Lì*),*
*one **Officer of the Scarlet Chariot and Red Symbols** (*Kēchē Chìfú Lì*),*
*one **Officer of the Whip-Brandishing Gale** (*Gāngfēng Qízhì Lì*),*
*two **Divine Officials of the Relay Horses and Petitions** (*Yìmǎ Shàngzhāng Guānjūn*),*
*and all others, each two in number.*

*Those summoned must attire themselves in fine and visible robes,*
*adorned with crowns and trailing ribbons,*
*maintaining their dignified bearing,*
*and stand before and behind me,*
*all receiving my spoken words,*
*and separately opening the gates to the **Four-Faced True Officials** (*Sìmiàn Zhēnguān*) in this locality,*
*to inspect with their **Qi** (*qì*),*
*to summon and examine the **Officials and True Ones of the Two Primordial and Three Heavens’ Four Beginnings and Six Celestial Stems** (*Èr Xuányuān Sāntiān Sìshǐ Jiǔzǐ Zhū Guānjūn*),*
*the **Two Lords of the Scarlet Radiance** (*Chìjǐng Zǐ Èr Zhēnjūn*),*
*the **Thirty-Five Officials of the Five and Seven Scarlet Yang** (*Wǔqī Chìyáng Sānshíwǔ Guānjūn*),*
*the **Twelve Lords of the Four Beginnings and Five Elders** (*Sìshǐ Wǔlǎo Shí'èr Zhēnjūn*),*
*and the **Three Officials of the Heavy Descent and Examination** (*Sānguān Chóngxià Kǎozhào Zhū Guānjūn*) along with their attendants.*

*I ascend and open the gates to summon:*
*The **Supreme Daoist Lord** (*Tàishàng Lǎojūn*),*
*The **Supreme Elder** (*Tàishàng Zhàngrén*),*
*The **Most High Primordial Daoist Lord** (*Wúshàng Xuányuān Zhēnjūn*),*
*The **Celestial Master and His Successive Teachers** (*Tiānshī Yìshī Xìshī Sān Shīzhě*),*
*the **Direct Officials** (*Diǎnzhě*),*
*the **Officials, Attendants, and Soldiers** under Your Gate,*
*and the **clerks and minor officials** who carry out Your commands,*
*all before and behind me.*

*With fasting and purification, morning rituals and gate-openings,*
*I submit petitions, incantations, and talismans,*
*and pray for the summoned officials, soldiers, and all True Ones in this locality,*
*as well as all spirits and deities,*
*to guard and protect my body."*

I now receive the merit and rewards, as follows:

With utmost reverence, I bow prostrate to the ground and present a petition to the **Supreme Daoist Lord** (*Tàishàng Lǎojūn*), one copy.

I open the sealed envelope and, with humility, read the petition aloud. Next, I take out the petition and recite the incantation:

*"Five-colored smoke ascends to carry the petition to Heaven.
Five-colored **qi** reaches the petition to the Emperor.
Let no **errant qi** of this low official dare to interfere.
Swiftly, as the **precepts** command!"*

Having finished reading the petition, I pass it over the incense and kneel to read it once more. Then, I hold the petition to my heart and perform the ritual:

With solemnity, I dispatch the **Five-Body True Officers** (*Wǔtǐ Zhēnjūn*) within my body,
the **minor officials and clerks** (*xiǎo lǐ*), the **Twelve Book Clerks** (*shí'èr shūzuǒ*),
and the **Functional Censor Officials** (*Gōngcáo shǐzhě*), all strictly arrayed in ceremonial attire,
their **crowns and pendants** (*guāndài chuí yīng*) properly aligned,
their **demeanor and bearing** (*wěiyí*) in order,
their **brushes sharpened and ink ground fine** (*mó mò diǎn bǐ*),
their **swords girded and records prepared** (*pèi jiàn zhì lù*),
to swiftly convey this petition on my behalf.

They ascend to the **Three Celestial Registries** (*Sān Tiān Cáo*),
responding to the petition as matters arise.

Should any errors or omissions appear within this petition—
unfaithful words, misplaced phrases,
or inconsistencies in meaning—
the **Functional Censor Officials** shall correct them with their **keen brushes and sharp pens** (*cháng máo lì bǐ*),
registering missing characters (*tuōzì wéi zhù*),
and settling erroneous ones (*wùzì wéi dìng*),
so that no **Direct Official** (*Diǎnzhě*) may be delayed.

I then close my mouth and contain my **qi** (*hán qì*), ascending directly to the **Supreme Daoist Lord’s** (*Tàishàng Lǎojūn*) **Three Celestial Registries of the Boundless Dao** (*Wújí Dàdào Sān Tiān Cáo*) before,
without hesitation.

The **Left Officials** (*Zuǒguān*) oversee the passage,
while the **Right Officials** (*Yòuguān*) verify the process.

At the appointed time for my requests, the summoned arrive.
For my **warding** (*yáng*), the malevolent retreat.
For my **assistance** (*jí*), the afflicted are relieved.
For my **petitions** (*shēn*), they are granted.
For my **ritual appeals** (*zòu*), they are delivered.

Should any **errant qi** of this low official,
or **wayward spirits and malevolent demons** (*yé jīng guǐ zéi*),
intercept my petition along the **pathways and clouds** (*dàolù yúnwù*),
preventing its ascent—
they shall be recorded and consigned to the **Northern Prison of the Celestial Unity** (*Tiān Yī Běi Yù*),
judged according to the **Ghostly Precepts of the Mysterious Capital** (*Xuándū guǐlǜ zhèngfǎ chéngzuì*),
to uphold the **Celestial Constitution** (*Tiānxiàn*).

I, [Name], kneel before the altar,
awaiting the **Mysterious Grace** (*Xuán'ēn*) to manifest its response.

After a long while, I perceive the **Three Generals** (*Sān Jiāngjūn*),
the **True Officers** of left and right (*Zǔoyòu Zhēnjūn*),
the **Functional Censor Officials** (*Gōngcáo shǐzhě*),
the **Stationary Horses** (*yìmǎ*) bearing the petition,
all riding in **celestial chariots and mounts** (*chéngchēng mǎ*),
with **purple clouds and splendid canopies** (*zǐyún huágài*) shielding the petition.

In an instant—though but a fleeting moment—
I traverse countless ten-thousands of **li** (*mànlǐ*),
my **qi** now red and radiant (*chìhóng qì*),
the clouds and mists dispersing (*yúnwù dàngdàng*),
yet no **haze or mist** (*xiáyì*) lingers on either side,
only the **trees of boundless treasure** (*Duōbǎo shù*),
ascending as if hundreds of **li** high (*shēng rú shùbǎi lǐ*),
when suddenly I see a **horizontal path** (*hénɡdào*), the **Yellow Celestial Path** (*Huángdào*) of the sun and moon.

Passing the **Yellow Celestial Path** (*Huángdào*), I gaze far ahead,
where, about five or six **li** distant (*wǔliù lǐ*),
a **purple cloud** (*zǐyún*) appears faintly (*yǐnyǐnrán*),
advancing through it, I see the **Heavenly Gate** (*Tiānmén*),
and enter it, pausing but a few steps before halting.
The **attendants and spirit officers** (*shìwèi língguān*) also stop,
except for the **General of the Left** (*Zhōu Jiāngjūn*), the **Direct Officials** (*Zhíshǐ*), and the **Jade Boy** (*Yùtóng*) bearing the petition,
who proceed forward.

The **Jade Maiden** (*Yùnǚ*) presents the petition at the **Jade Altar** (*Yùàn*),
the **Direct Officials** (*Zhíshǐ*) transmit it to the **Functional Censor** (*Fángcáo*),
and we move to the **Western Gate of the Jade Enclosure** (*Yùquè Mén xi*),
where I pay homage to the **Celestial Master** (*Zhēngyī Zhēnrén*) **Grand Censor of the Three Celestial Registries** (*Sān Tiān Dàfǎshī Ménxià Dàdūgōng Zhāng*),
bowing twice in reverence (*liǎo*), and explaining in full the purpose of the petition.

The **Celestial Master** (*Tiānshī*) consents (*nuòliǎo*),
and I then stand outside the **Phoenix Hall’s Golden Gate** (*Fènghuáng gé Jīnmén*),
when shortly a **celestial boy** (*xiāntóng*) in **scarlet robe and dark cap** (*zhūyī xuánguān*) emerges from within,
taking the petition from the **Jade Boy** (*Yùtóng*) and presenting it to the **Supreme Daoist Lord** (*Tàishàng*).

A little while later, I see myself led into the presence,
where the **Supreme Daoist Lord** (*Tàishàng*) sits upon the hall,
adorned in **nine-colored clouds and mist** (*jiǔsè yúnxiá*),
wearing the **Nine-Virtue Crown** (*Jiǔdé guān*),
flanked by the **True Persons of the Mysterious Left and Right** (*Zuǎnxián Èr Zhēnrén*),
and another **Supreme Unity** (*Tàiyī*) in **scarlet robe** (*zhūyī*).

The **Supreme Daoist Lord** (*Tàishàng*) reviews the petition,
and the **Supreme Unity** (*Tàiyī*), following his will,
signs it upon the **Jade Steps of the Supreme Clarity** (*Tàiqīng Yùdì*),
and writes the character *依* (*yī*, "to comply") beneath.

A small **celestial boy** (*xiāotóng*) then collects the petition
and delivers it to the **Right Censor Officials** (*Yòuzhí Guān*),
who distribute it to the **today’s Direct Censor Officials** (*jīntì zhí cáo guān*).

I bow in my heart and take leave of the **Supreme Daoist Lord** (*Tàishàng*),
then bow twice again as I depart the **Jade Enclosure Gate** (*Yùquè Mén*) to bid farewell to the **Celestial Master** (*Tiānshī*).

Together with the **Direct Censor Officials** (*Zòuchāng Zhíguān*), I return in triumph to the **Altar of Petition** (*Bàichāng tán*),
rise, and report the matter.

Upon reporting, I take the petition and burn it in the **northwest of the altar**.

If this were an ordinary petition for a mortal,
the **True Officers** and **soldiers and generals** would simply carry the petition forward.

But if this were a **petition of cultivation** (*xiūxíng chāngbiǎo*),
each one would proceed with me to the **locality’s True Officers** (*lǐyù Zhēnjūn*).

The **True Officers** return to their **flame furnace** (*Lú*).

I, [Name], have completed the petitioning.
The **Functional Censor Officials** (*Gōngcáo shǐzhě*) and all **spirit officers** (*língguān*) dispatched from my body,
as well as the **minor officials and clerks** (*yījiān xiǎo lǐ*),
all enter through my **Gate of Wondrous Virtue** (*Zhōngmiào Mén*),
returning to their left if they were from the left,
and to their right if they were from the right (*zài zuǒ huánzuǒ, zài yòu huányòu*),
wrapping around my body and bones (*chuánshēn ràoɡǔ*),
pervading the **Heaven and Earth** (*mí lǒn tiāndì*),
guarding the **hundred channels** (*yíngwèi bǎimài*),
and resuming their positions in the **palace chambers** (*gōngshì*),
as before—without fail.

The **Scripture of the Soul’s Treasure** (*Língbǎo jīng*) and the **Scripture of the Boundless Treasure** (*Wúliàngdù rén shàngjīng*) conclude in the **Fourth Volume of the Great Daoist Precepts** (*Dàfǎ juàn zhī sìshíyī jìng*).

The **Scripture of the Soul’s Treasure** (*Língbǎo jīng*) and the **Scripture of the Boundless Treasure** (*Wúliàngdù rén shàngjīng*) conclude in the **Forty-Second Volume of the Great Daoist Precepts** (*Dàfǎ juàn zhī sìshí'èr jìng*).

**The Chapter on the Primordial Net’s Flow and Transformation**
The Yellow Stone and Red Pine True Persons say:

The heavens are most exalted and pure, yet they bear the sun, moon, and stars.
The Dao is most wondrous and sacred, yet it hosts celestial guests and feathered immortals.
The divine essence dwells within the body, relying on refined **qi** to manifest as human form,
and leans upon the spirit as its sovereign.
When these three—**qi**, spirit, and essence—reside or gather,
they can merge with the hundred spirits,
soar through the boundless void,
ascend to the three realms above,
descend into the abyssal darkness below—
unbound by direction, unobstructed in presence,
piercing through like a dagger’s edge,
endless in transformation—
none surpass this method.

All who cultivate the True Way must follow a graded path, advancing with measured steps.
Their practices, whether of high, middle, or low attainment,
accumulate through diligent effort,
naturally achieving mastery.
The primordial threads unfold:
a single thought suffices to roam,
the spirit soars to the imperial gates,
instantly ascending the three pass barriers,
traveling freely between heaven and earth.
With talismans and incantations,
they wield spirit and **qi**,
calming the **gāng** winds into stillness.
They transcend the ancestral eons’ palaces,
with ten thousand spirits in attendance,
then return to the Primordial Void’s domain.

Let those who cultivate the True Way guard this teaching carefully.
To reveal it recklessly to the unworthy
brings retribution across ten thousand eons—
how could one not be warned?

**Talisman of the Precious Register**
Written on yellow paper with cinnabar ink,
the complete incantation reads:
*"Commander of Authority, erase the register of slaughter,
East Pole’s Upper Birth—name invoked!"*

This talisman may be worn or carried,
used to transcend the soul and spirit.
When the Heavenly Gate opens,
close your eyes and recite the True Law.
Beyond the body lies another self—
this is the method of transcending humanity.

*Urgent, as the cosmic ordinance decrees.*

Each **jiǎzǐ** cycle (sixty-year cycle), at the hour of **Rèn** (入靖, entering tranquility),
face east, recite the **Yùhuáng Dùe** (玉皇诀),
draw **qi** from the **Dòu** constellation,
then take one breath of eastern **qi**,
settle into stillness,
and inscribe sixty **Precious Register Talismans**,
or sixty **Official Lords of the Sixty Heavenly Stems**—
either suffices.

Each day at dawn, recite an incantation over water and ingest a talisman. The rest are carried in green pouches.

At the three *yuan* and three *huì* on *gēngshēn* and *jiǎzǐ* nights, when stillness prevails, enter the chamber. Wear the *bǎo lù* inscribed on *jiǎzǐ* day, grasp the *Mào* characters with both hands, close your eyes, and still your mind. Hold your tongue to the upper palate, swallow a breath of *qi*—then sense an outer body, its garments, hue, and form identical to your own before you.

A star altar rises nine *chǐ* two *cùn* high. The Sun stands to the left, the Moon to the right, the Southern Dipper behind, the Northern Dipper before. The Vermilion Bird leads ahead, the Dark Warrior follows behind, the Azure Dragon flanks the left, the White Tiger the right, their wings shielding you. You drift upward until you stand before the altar, stepping *dīnggāng* three paces, ascending one grade to circle the altar counterclockwise.

Recite the secret incantation in silence:

*"Dao of the Immortals, vast and boundless,
Home of Yuan Shǐ’s primal origin.
I ascend this altar, purifying spirit and thought,
Seeking the Most High’s grace—grant me the elixir’s glow.
Its nectar’s essence, fragrant with *qi*,
Drink I take—now I may tread the *gāng*.
Five Visceral Deities, straight as incense’s flame,
Hear my sacred words—each finds its peace.
Swiftly, as the Law decrees."*

When the incantation ends, release the *qi* and enter the *dìhù*. Circle left again, reciting silently:

*"Yuan Shàng Dàluó, Yuan Shǐ’s Jade Purity,
Palace of the Jade-Clear—true teachings pass through.
Hear my secret words, transform my mortal frame,
Take the jade mist to cleanse my spirit’s core.
Now I tread the *gāng*, walk the Emperor’s path,
Pay homage at the golden gate, bow to the Jade Sovereign.
Swiftly, as the Law decrees."*

When the incantation ends, gather the *qi* and enter the *Tiānmén*—this is the third altar.

Within the *Tiānmén*, two immortals appear: a jade boy and jade girl, bearing incense and delivering messages, six in total. Kneel, close your eyes—then a divine figure descends on five-colored clouds, clad in *Shàngqīng* robes, bearing the Jade Emperor’s seal, its golden script radiant. Your name is called, and another presents a jade cup filled with misty nectar. The Northern Dipper’s *qi* is black, the Southern Dipper’s red, the Sun’s crimson, the Moon’s white, and the Three Enclosures’ *qi* swirls in five hues—each stream merging into the cup. Receive it, bow twice, and drink.

Release the *qi*, descend the altar, and silently recite the *Língshū* twice. Soar as though in heaven, flying into the Northern Dipper. The Three Enclosures’ stars crown your head as you walk—from *Kuì* to *Wěi*, turn and re-enter the Dipper, six paces to exit, forming the Three Enclosures’ shape.

Exit the Dipper’s mouth, circle left seventy-seven times (forty-nine steps), passing through the Fire Star, then eastward through the [missing] gate. A total of eighty-one steps (nine nines) bring you to the Solar Ancestor’s court before the Most High.

Turn right and proceed north to west, eighty-eight steps (eight eights) to the Lunar Ancestor’s court before the Celestial Sovereign. Circle outward, then left, right, left again—seven revolutions like a ring. This is the *wúsè jiè*.

Fix your gaze to see immortals from the *wúsè jiè* welcoming you. You then traverse the ten directions, paying homage to the Thirty-Two Heavenly Sovereigns and Twenty-Eight Constellations. At each constellation, step *dīnggāng* twelve times in return—three hundred thirty-six steps total—until you reach the Dipper.

Borrow the *Jī* Star’s brilliance to return straight, gazing toward the Northern Dipper’s *Tiānwěi* and the *Jiāofēng* peaks. Turn southward, forty-nine steps to pass through the Fire Star’s palace again. After thirty-six steps (six sixes) through the Lunar, you reach the Water Star. From the Water Star, eastward sixty-four steps bring you to the Solar’s side, completing the Wood Star. Retracing, you pass the Water Star again, borrow its brilliance to emerge beside the Solar—eighty-one steps to complete the Metal Star.

Proceed carefully to the Dipper’s mouth, thirty-five steps to enter the Earth Hour. From Earth, return to the Metal Star. After Water and Wood, you face north toward the golden gate’s towering grandeur—the abode of Dàluó’s Three Pure Ones.

Advance eight steps, kneel twice, and recite the incantation in silence:

*"[Incantation continues...]"*

「The humble earth-walking disciple, by fortune of past blessings, has been granted the secret precepts of the sacred Master’s transmission, enabling an audience at the Celestial Hour. Concentrating the spirit to enter *Jìng* (tranquility), the nine *qì* (vital essences) are purified, and the body beyond the body is attained—thus achieving *Fēitiān Chuǎng* (flight to the heavens).

The disciple is unworthy of such heavenly favor, yet yearns ardently for the sacred Master. With utmost reverence, prostrating head and body in double obeisance, he recites the incantation in silence:

*"Again the incantation:*
By fortune, the disciple receives the dark bounty,
Thus meeting the sacred Master,
Midnight, the spirit ascends,
With one heart, he pays homage to the Emperor.

The disciple humbly reflects: though of mortal constitution and stubborn nature,
Logic cannot transcend the lofty.
With devoted sincerity toward filial piety and fraternal duty,
He hopes to gain grace and favor.
His plea is fulfilled,
And the sacred favor is received.

May this solidify the Dao/Way of his heart,
Clarify his spirit and illuminate his *qì*,
Command all spirits to obey his will.
All shall heed his decrees.

The disciple humbly prays for heavenly mercy,
To grant his petition and bestow as he speaks.
So he prostrates again in double obeisance and departs,
Then beholds his true form,
Returning to his own body at the *tóngmén* (crown),
And incants it:

*"Incantation of the Serpent and Cicada:*
Serpent and cicada, serpent and cicada,
Shedding shell, leaving dust.
I now worship the True Form,
Ascending to pay homage to the Azure Clouds.
Desiring to make the spirit and the man,
Seal debts and conceal form,
Take steps to depart,
The secret precept is potent and true.
Suddenly entering through the *tóngmén*,
This completes the *Bùgāng* (steps of the Five Powers).

If the humble one practices this,
He need not exceed five steps.
If he earnestly seeks the method of flight,
None is greater than this."

**The *Fēibù Tú* (Diagram of the Flying Steps) of the Primordial Halberd:**

The *Tàiyī Wēiyán Miàogēng Zhēn* (Supreme One’s Subtle Speech, Most True Transformation),
Born from me, attains natural enlightenment.
A single thought of the seven celestial seats,
Summons the three souls to follow and welcome.
The Jade Sovereign’s precept reaches the Heavenly Sovereign,
The Northern Dipper’s Three Platforms measure the steps.
Ascending directly to the Golden Halberd, circling the Vermilion Node,
The voice subsides, only the incense of the *Zhuàn* (sealed script) and cloudy fragrance remains.
Within the body, the Five Powers of the *Wǔxìng* (Five Stars) serve as officials,
Ten thousand spirits in unison, their sincerity pressing like a crowd.

Reaching the Nine Passes where the Primordial is obstructed,
In moments, the crane-like ascent arrives at *Liáoyáng* (Luminous Sun).
At the gate of *Liáoyáng*,
Before the Master, he prostrates and presents his memorial.
He awaits the imperial decree’s return,
Confessing his mortal offenses before the throne.

The disciple’s reckless ambition seeks to ascend,
Deploying his *qì* to rise in clouds and seek the Jade Gate.
By fortune, he passes the *Gāngfēng* (halberd winds) without hindrance,
Yet the Golden Gate reveals myriad difficulties.

Within these difficulties, the precept is easily spoken yet hard to grasp,
In the blink of an eye, he reaches the imperial presence.
The Five Masters and a thousand saints gather on either side,
Their crimson talismans beneath the Nine Radiant lights shine fresh.

He must perform his merits to join the ranks of the immortals,
Worship the sacred and ascend to the True Form—let no difficulty deter him.
The wondrous logic is not excessive; excess leads to confusion.
At another time, he may attain it more leisurely.

Those who share the Dao/Way and study together,
Knowing the secret precept, must not delay in worship.
Once the precept is received, the sins are apportioned,
Swiftly, the immortal chariot descends to the mortal realm.

Though this *Dēngtān Jué* (Supreme Halberd Precept) is now revealed in the heavens,
Even when transmitted to scholars and practitioners,
It must be kept secret in practice.
Preserve the spirit in silent petition,
The past attainments in the mysterious diagram,
Only emptiness and annihilation remain,
Purification and stillness in the void.

**The *Fēishén Xuánjué* (Secret Precept of the Flying Spirit):**

The Primordial Official resides in the *Kǎn* (water) position,
The ancestral *qì* (vital essence) of the elixir field responds to the elixir origin.
The Five Generals ride white steeds,
The Flying Dragon and mounted attendants lead the way ahead.

The liver spirit’s green *qì* wanders to the celestial crown,
Transforming into a dragon chariot ascending the Nine Mysterious realms.
The lung spirit’s youthful attendant holds the banner and node,
Clad in red, guiding to the *Níhwán* (muddy pellet).
The muddy pellet’s eight layers open the *Fǎlún* (law wheel),
Piercing the celestial passes, form responds to spirit.

When the spirit departs the body, it mounts the white steed,
Circumnavigating the Dipper, traversing the steps of *Jī* (the Great Enclosure).
Through the Great Enclosure, it passes thirty-two constellations,
Entering the *Gāngfēng* (halberd winds), ascending the Nine Heavens.
Each has a birth gate to recognize carefully,
The purple elixir and white jade are the celestial passes.

Further crossing the Five Spirits to the Great Desert,
Arriving at the heavenly gate to pay homage to the Emperor.
Before the Primordial Sage, the guide leads the way,
In accordance with the cosmic order, he knocks at the Jade Barrier.
Vast and boundless, the Great Dao/Way naturally opens,
His memorial ascends, the spirit hastens to the Supreme Luminosity.

Returning through the Five Constants to the Sun and Moon,
He cycles endlessly, beholding the Primordial Lord.
The Primordial Lord enters his abode, the spirit is concentrated and tranquil,
Already descending the celestial script, revealing the Jade Text.

**The *Zàoxīn Zhāng Xuánjué* (Secret Precept of the Memorial to the Heart):**

For any memorial to the heart,
First, one must purify the heart and eat vegetarian food.
Write a draft memorial,
Do not let words harm the meaning,
Nor meaning be obscured by words—
The recounting of events must be precise and to the point.

Once finished,
Use white paper three inches long by two *fēn* (分) wide,
Write in neat characters as desired,
With utmost reverence, holding incense.
Write it on the same day,
Do not delay until the next day.

Complete the writing in a single stroke,
Do not pause or rest during sitting or lying.
Further reduce the legal title to one line only,
Do not write two lines.

If unable to write himself,
Have another write it for him,
But the prohibitions remain the same.
He must eat vegetarian food and bathe,
Burn incense while writing,
Not alter, scratch, or add to the text,
Nor omit or write carelessly,
Nor reduce strokes or converse with others.
Violators shall surely face severe retribution.

Once written,
Perfume it with fine incense,
Seal it immediately,
Sprinkle *lóngnǎo* (aloe-wood powder) on the memorial,
Then roll it up.
Finally, stamp it with a seal,
Using the *Fāngjiǎo* (corner symbols) to open the heavenly gate.

For major matters,
Or when already prostrating yet no response is received,
Use yellow paper with vermilion writing,
Called the *Zhūzhāng* (vermilion memorial),
Which is swift and shall surely gain resonance.

On the day of the memorial,
Whether early or late,
Within the *Jìngzhì* (tranquil chamber) or the Dao/Way hall,
Or before the sacred image,
Prostrate twice and burn incense.

First recite the Jade Sovereign’s precept,
Summoning the method he practices,
And the spirits dispatched in the memorial.
State the matter clearly,
Await the opportune moment to present the memorial,
Silently petitioning its intent,
Again and again, earnestly imploring.

Once finished,
Prostrate once more in double obeisance,
Read the memorial aloud in a low voice,
Then immediately proceed to the incense altar,
Extinguish the candle and approach the sacred image,
Standing upright, his thoughts focused—
From his elixir field, the Primordial Lord of the One Beginning ascends gradually,
Sitting before the muddy pellet.
He himself kneels before the Primordial Lord,
Silently petitioning the matters in the memorial,
Detailed and heartfelt,
Praying and imploring four times.

Or, if there is a natural response,
The Primordial Lord may descend in thought to answer,
Or a voice may be heard within his ears.»

If one can truly transcend the body and communicate through spirit, the response shall be even more precise—never contrive with deliberate intent to match expectations.

After the memorial is completed,
Imagine the Primordial Lord descending back into the elixir field,
And oneself returning to the incense altar,
Placing the memorial into the iron frame,
Securing it firmly with incense,
Then sealing and dispatching the attendant officials to guard and deliver the memorial to its destination.

Once done,
Use a purified hemp wick to burn it,
Without tearing the memorial.
After the burning,
Return to the original standing place,
Calm the mind and still the thoughts,
Waiting to hear the response.

After a long while, bow in gratitude and depart.
If a red-sealed memorial is added,
Dispatch the Yellow-Armored Jade Maidens accordingly,
Following the original ritual.

The memorial’s ashes are cast into a long-flowing stream.

**灵宝无量度人上经大法卷之四十二竟**
**灵宝无量度人上经大法卷之四十三 运神合景品**

In ancient times, at the dawn of the Great Calamity,
The Five Epochs unfolded,
The Primordial Lord revealed the Cosmic Diagram,
And the Crimson Script was inscribed—
Characters vast as a *zhang* in width,
Eight-cornered with radiant bristles.

Descending the *qi* of the Golden Tide below,
It formed the patterns of the Nine Heavens,
The Western Element’s Tortoise Mountain,
Enmeshed in fourfold nets,
With the Twenty-Eight Constellations intertwined,
And the Thirty-Two Heavens revolving around it.
The Sun, Moon, and Five Stars converged within,
Above which stood twelve layered halls of jade and gold,
Where the Jade Mother of Azure Elixir, the Daoist Sovereign of the Western Element’s Tortoise Terrace—
The Queen Mother of the West—resided.

There exists the Tortoise Mountain’s Primordial Registrar,
Overseeing the true writings and jade characters of all immortals.
Within its void realm,
The Big Dipper and the Winnowing Basket revolve,
Measuring the Five Constants in thirty-five divisions,
Uniting the *qi* of the Upper Primordial.

And there are the Inner Forbidden Jade Officials,
Residing in the Queen Mother’s Western Jade Terrace,
Known as the **Lingxu Palace**.
There is also the **Lingxu Separate Hall**,
Where the Great Sovereign Jade Infant Empress—
The Nine-Spirit Supreme Mysterious True Immortal Queen Mother—
Presides over the Nine Spirits’ duties.
She rotates the Dipper at dawn,
Presenting memorials and petitions to the Thirty-Two Heavens,
And the Three Heavens’ Jade Gates.
No petition reaches without the Lingxu Immortals’ words,
No memorial advances without the Nine Spirits’ tablets.

The Great Sovereign, by command,
Records the scriptures in their entirety.

The Nine Dawns of the Northern Dipper
Are the Nine Dawn Sovereigns of the Central Imperial Primordial One,
With traces manifesting in nine forms.
One may ascend upon them to fly through the void,
Assisting the Celestial Sovereign above.
Their stellar transformations are boundless,
Their titles and ranks countless—
Impossible to enumerate fully.

Within lies the High Sovereign of the Central Purple Micro Heaven,
Whose invocation of a single star grants a lifespan of myriad thousands,
His name inscribed on jade tablets,
Where ten thousand deities gather in festive homage.
After seven years of cultivation,
His essence disperses, his form dissolves,
Transforming all things,
Mingling with the obscure and dark,
Soaring through the Great Emptiness,
Ascending to the Jade Purity.

As the *Dadong Yujing* states:
*"The Hall of Jade Chambers, the Palace of Jade Towers, the Golden Hall—*
*Though distant beyond the Three Realms and Nine Heavens,*
*They are yet unreachable.*
*Yet near within one’s own Nine Palaces of the Muddy Pellet,*
*Each a span in measure,*
*If preserved, the True One is attained,*
*As Heavenly *qi* merges with one’s natural *qi*."*

Thus the scripture says:
*"The spirit within the human heart,*
*Containing wondrous wisdom,*
*Wisdom penetrating the causes of the Dharma Realm,*
*From causes arise conditions,*
*Conditions and thoughts spontaneously evoke responses.*
*Preserve the Muddy Pellet and the body,*
*Uniting with the Nine *qi*s in virtue,*
*As if standing within a Jade Gate—*
*Then one attains the name ‘Communicating with the Jade Registers,’*
*And the Nine Mysteries ascend the soul."*

For the Nine Palaces of the Muddy Pellet,
If preserved as the Nine Heavens and Three Realms’ Jade Gates,
The Celestial Emperors are seen above—
Majestic and present—
While the body, preserved as oneself,
Is imagined in the Lower Elixir Field,
Like a deep spring in a secluded valley,
Where all hundred spirits gather and merge into one body.

Preserve the body as a lotus pod,
The Most High entering the Muddy Pellet,
Ascending as if rising above the Nine Heavens,
To pay homage before the Jade Gates’ Emperor.

According to the Master’s instructions in the *San Dong Xuanke*:
*"Though the Celestial Sovereign is distant and wondrous,*
*He resides near within the Muddy Pellet Palace.*
*Its halls and chambers are of the Seven Treasures,*
*Windows and doors naturally partitioned.*
*The Ever-True, Ever-Mysterious Responds,*
*Riding the scene upon purple clouds."*

This reveals one’s own Three Pure Ones,
Corresponding above to the Mysterious Realm,
As Heavenly and Human merge,
And essence-*qi* mutually support each other within the Nine Palaces.

It is also said:
*"Neither born nor extinguished,*
*Yet born from the lotus—*
*Transcending the Three Realms,*
*With a compassionate heart unraveling the world’s snares."*

This reveals that the Heart’s Primordial is the Primordial Lord’s divided spirit,
Residing within the Ninefold Divine Membrane,
As the master of human life within the heart.

When presenting memorials to the Nine Palaces within oneself,
Fly through the Mysterious to meet the Dao,
Carefully reviewing the memorial’s words,
Communicating with spirit by spirit,
As heart and spirit illuminate—
All hidden matters are known,
Without doubt or hesitation,
Lest one invite divine retribution.

Take the day of one’s birth as the foundation,
Carve the talisman from *zhi* wood,
Five *cun* long, two and a half *cun* wide,
Using the official measure.

Pierce a hole at the top,
Thread it with five-colored silk and fasten it to the elbow—
Left for men, right for women.

It may only be used during memorial presentations.
Before presenting the memorial,
Let no one see it;
Store it in a crimson silk pouch,
And during clear starry nights,
Offer incense, flowers, fruit, and wine beneath the Dipper,
Along with twelve portions of purified *zhi* wood broth,
To the Nine Dawns of the Northern Dipper,
The Two Celestial Emperors,
And the messengers of the **Heaven-Piercing True Talisman**.

Three days before the memorial presentation,
Wear the talisman and the memorial symbol,
Fastening them to the elbow,
While fumigating the talisman with incense,
Reciting the incantation three times:

*"Heaven’s Support is impartial,
The Celestial Symbol communicates the Mysterious.
No depth is hidden, no darkness obscured,
No response goes unperceived.
The talisman bears the diagram,
Divine soldiers answer the call.
My rank is that of the Upper King,
My station ascends to the Celestial Metropolis.
Swiftly, as the Heavenly Sovereign’s Purple Micro decree."*

After fumigating with *xiang* incense,
Wear it at the elbow,
Then swallow the talisman and memorial symbol,
While maintaining a pure and refined visualization.

At the time of the memorial presentation,
Its efficacy shall be divine.

For all spoken or written memorials,
And those dispatched with sealed orders,
After summoning the spirit officials,
The response shall be swift.

Keep it hidden from others’ knowledge or sight.

The response shall be as with an echo—
Abundant auspicious clouds and strange fragrances arise,
Luan cranes and sweet dews descend,
Golden mists and celestial breezes prevail,
The heavenly *qi* becomes serene and harmonious,
Accumulated darkness clears instantly,
Sweet dew nourishes all things,
Heavenly spirits manifest visibly,
The memorial ashes ascend into the sky,
Divine radiance envelops the altar,
Ten thousand mysterious responses—
None shall be absent.

**Instructions for the *Xin Zhang* Talisman**
The talisman paper must be four *cun* long and two and a half *cun* wide. In spring, use blue paper; in summer, red; in autumn, white—all inscribed in vermilion. In winter, use black paper with white powder ink. Beyond the seventy-two days of each season, on the eighteen designated days, use yellow paper inscribed in vermilion.

When inscribing the *Xin Zhang* or *Tai Ping Fu*, face the auspicious direction and swallow with pure water.

When ingesting the talisman, place it on the tongue, gaze eastward, and inhale the celestial *qi* (as green) through the nose into the mouth, visualizing it as green. Then, gazing upward, inhale the crimson *zhenqi* (true *qi*) through the nose, merging it with the green *qi* in the mouth. Next, gazing downward, inhale the yellow *qi* into the mouth, blending the three colors into a radiant, sun-like luminosity. Within this light, retain the talisman as a single grain and swallow it with water.

For the *Xin Zhang*, place its ashes in the mouth and follow the talisman’s precepts. Only after receiving a response—whether granted or denied—may one submit the memorial. **Do not reveal this lightly.** After receiving confirmation of alignment, one may then speak to the ritual officials.

**Ascending the Spirit to Perfection**
In accordance with the Master’s instruction: The Spirit is the sovereign of the form. When the sovereign resides, the form is steadfast; when the sovereign scatters, the form is in peril. Common mortals only nourish the form, yet never preserve the essence to safeguard the sovereign.

As the *Xī Shēng Jīng* states:
*The Spirit can traverse the Dao; the Dao can ensure eternal abode.
The Spirit can make the form soar; it can also move mountains.
The Spirit’s greatest treasure is the Three-One.
One is the child of the Dao, the ancestral progenitor of myriad beings, the arcane essence of all True Ones.*

For those who cultivate and direct the Spirit, harmonize the visions to ascend the Mysterious, merge with the Dao to manifest the Chapter—when paying homage to the Celestial Sovereign at the Golden Gate—practice the silent ascent into the Dao of the Highest Clarity.

First, bathe in purity and enter tranquility, refining the form and guarding the Spirit. With prolonged practice, the Dao will naturally unfold, and there shall be no limit to what can be achieved.

If you wish to petition or supplicate, then mount the celestial chariot to the Court of Supreme Clarity, and according to the matter at hand, present your entreaties. Thus, the most essential method is complete.

**Bathing to Purify the Form**
Select the day of **Dōng Jǐng** (the Eastern Well) to bathe. This is when the sun and moon reside in the Eastern Well constellation. At dawn, take pure water from that direction, brew a decoction of peach bark and bamboo leaves for bathing—this is called *refining the corpse’s pristine essence*. Even the immortals, when wandering the mortal realm, use this bath.

Moreover, bamboo is hollow yet internally pure and white, while peach repels malevolence and dispels filth. Thus, these two are used to purge the turbidity within the form.

From the *Tàishàng Jiǔ Biàn Shí Huà Yì Xīn Jīng*, as recorded in the *Zhēn Yuè* (True Revelations), Chapter Three of *Cháng Qī*.

If you have at home the **Five Fragrances** decoction, use it to bathe the five viscera, achieving their cooling clarity and purifying the dust and grime.

Peach bark (white),
bamboo leaves,
white mugwort,
fragrant white atractylodes,
sweet cyperus,
green aloeswood.

Use these in any quantity to brew a bath. When entering your chamber for daily recitation and cultivation, you may also use this to rinse your mouth. Though other talismanic waters may suffice, none compare to this.

This is also called the **Five Nodes Pure Fragrance Bath**, to be taken on days of Eastern Well.

For instance, on the first day of the first month, the **Chéng Shù** constellation moves westward; when the **Jǐng** star aligns directly with the sun, it is the day of Eastern Well. On the tenth day of the first month, it is also the day when the **Jǐng** star aligns with the sun. The rest follow similarly.

**Entering Tranquility and Concentrating the Spirit**

Each day at the **Zǐ hour**, enter your chamber and sit upright facing the direction of your **living constellation**. Knock your teeth together thirty-six times, then close your **qi** for thirty-six breaths. Exhale to the navel above, inhale to the navel below, maintaining a continuous, subtle flow. Then close your eyes and quietly contemplate: visualize the sun and moon radiating light throughout the chamber—the sun in the east, the moon in the west.

Next, visualize the **Sun Sovereign** exhaling red **qi** in nine rays, circling your body to the left, and the **Moon Sovereign** exhaling white **qi** in ten rays, piercing your body to the right. Let your inner and outer being become transparent, with nothing obstructed.

If you have ailments, repeatedly cultivate this visualization to dispel them.

**Refining the Form of the Greater Sun and Greater Moon**
First, visualize your body as withered wood. Then, visualize red **qi** transforming into fire, and again, visualize fire emerging from your heart, consuming your entire form. In an instant, all turns to ash.

From the ash rises smoke, naturally transforming into five-colored **qi**, swirling within and forming an infant resembling yourself.

Visualize within the sun a **Supreme Sovereign of the Day**, clad in crimson robes and crown, seated at its center. Below him stand the Five Emperors, dressed in the robes and headgear of the five directions, attending beside him.

Clasp your hands firmly and gaze toward the sun. Draw in **qi** nine times through your nose, letting it enter your heart. Within your heart, the solar symbol burns brightly as a fire, vast as a cauldron, its nine purple rays piercing the Three Fields and the **Níwán** (cinnabar field), all illuminated by solar light. Your entire form is refined and cleansed, inside and out, and your **qi** returns.

Enter your chamber, close your eyes, and sit upright. Visualize the **Greater Moon** in the direction of the **Eastern Well** constellation. Clasp your hands firmly and visualize the **Moon Sovereign’s Consort** exhaling ten white rays of light, like pure silk, gradually transforming into water. This water bathes the infant within the white **qi**.

As soon as the bathing is complete, gradually restore the infant to its original form—clothed and crowned—then inhale the yellow flowers’ water and the moon’s yellow **qi**, dispersing it across your body. After some time, you will feel yourself immersed in yellow **qi**, a refreshing coldness, signifying the arrival of true **qi** within your body. Your limbs, organs, and meridians are all filled with this yellow **qi**, purifying your body, and the myriad spirits gather.

**Dividing the Spirit at the Jade Terrace**
The light between your brows is the **Three Heavenly Gates**. Three *cùn* into the left browbone lies the **Vermilion Platform and Green Chamber**. Three *cùn* into the right browbone is the **Yellow Gate and Purple Door**, like the palaces and gates of earthly princes.

Both are constructed of green and yellow jade as terraces and gates.

One *cùn* into the brow is the **Bright Hall Palace**, where the Three Court Gods reside—these are the **Divided Spirits of the Emperor of Eternal Life**.

Two *cùn* in is the **Chamber of Mysteries Palace**, where the **Yellow Emperor and Laozi** reside as **Divided Spirits of the Most High**.

Three *cùn* in is the **Cinnabar Field Palace**, where the **Heavenly Emperor of the Upper Primordial** resides as the **Divided Spirit of the Jade Sovereign**.

Four *cùn* in is the **Extreme Suppression Palace**.

Five *cùn* in is the **Jade Purity Palace**, where the **Jade Purity Goddess** resides.

These three palaces are the **Divided Spirits of the Supreme Clarity, Upper Clarity, and Jade Purity**, dwelling within the **Níwán**.

On auspicious days of the **Six Jia**, visualize the celestial emperors solemnly positioned above the **Níwán**. Visualize your body as a lotus root within the lower **Dan Tian**, deep as an abyss, then ascend through the middle **Dan Tian**, passing the **Huàgài** (flower canopy), crossing the **Chónglóu** (layered towers), piercing the **Jīnmén** (golden gate), and passing the **Yùhù** (jade door) to reach the **Níwán**. There, you present petitions and await responses as your will. Then, you descend once more through **Yuánshǐ** (Primordial Beginning) and return to the lower **Dan Tian**.

Do this daily. For any petitions or inquiries, you may await divine responses and foreknowledge of future events.

The **Seven Ancestors** were lightly dismissed and forever sunk into the Northern **Tíng**—never to be pardoned across ten thousand kalpas.

**The Rite of Sacrificing to the Dan Yuan True Person**
The Dan Yuan True Person is none other than one’s own **Shényuán Huáng** (Divine Primordial Sovereign) manifesting in form and descending **qi** into the body, becoming the master of life. Use one’s preferred **sùshí** (vegetarian food), fragrant tea, wine, and fruit. On the **Yuánchéng** (Primordial Hour) of one’s natal day, enter a purified chamber and divide one’s dwelling into four parts.

Visualize three figures as **fǎshī** (masters of the Dao), bowing and yielding according to ritual. Let them freely partake in food and drink as you will.

Burn incense and recite the incantation:
*"Dan Yuan guards the spirit—
Within and without, guard the True.
Left and right, three times seven,
Assist me in celestial completion.
Swiftly, as the **Yuányáng Zhǔ** (Primordial Yang Master) decrees."*

Upon finishing the incantation, resume seated posture and burn one **jīnqián** (gold coin) and one **yúnmǎ** (cloud-horse talisman) each.

When complete, always visualize them at your sides—
Wielding sword and axe,
Or holding **liújīn huǒlíng** (flowing gold fire bells).
When walking, they lead;
When halted, they follow;
When seated, they stand to the left;
When standing, they stand to the right.
Within a hundred days, results will manifest.

When angered, keep them distant.

**Practicing the True and Entering Samadhi**
The Dao does nothing, yet nothing is left undone.
The heart may be verified, yet not by mere intellect.

What is *knowing*? What is *responding*?
Intellect dispels intellect, verifying emptiness and responding to it.
When response has no origin, emptiness is the Dao.
Unified, all affairs are complete.

One is the root; affairs are the gate.
Affairs return to One; One abides eternally.
Abiding has no form—
A provisional phrase to guard emptiness.
Guard the void, and longevity follows.
Awaken to impermanence, and the Dao endures.
Reside in stillness within, and virtue expands outward.
Within, coiled like a tortoise;
Without, virtue manifests.
Forgotten are form and appearance;
Extinguished are mind and perception.
No dust clings to color;
The heart returns to truth.
The body rests in stillness;
The mind grows steadfast.
Fragrance and stench are equal;
The heart merges with emptiness.
Sweet and bitter are one;
The heart turns to substance.
The body feels abandoned;
The mind remains unshaken.
The will does not stray;
The heart does not scatter.
Ever concentrated,
The vital essence remains whole.

Use without limit,
Yet forget the means.

First, burn incense, gather the spirit, and sit upright, guarding **mǔ** (mother) with **zǐ** (child).
The spirit is the **qi**-child; **qi** is the spirit-mother.
With each inhalation and exhalation, govern the spirit over **qi**, circulating endlessly above and below, entering and exiting in soft continuity.

By day, open the ears and close the eyes;
By night, open the eyes and block the ears.

Whenever the mind stirs with inner or outer thoughts,
Suppress it with the mind.
Say: *"I am attending to [such-and-such], and will not indulge this thought."*
Simply count the breaths.

First, the mind stirs often, with little stillness—
Endure all phenomena without attachment.
Second, the mind is still, with few distractions—
Withdraw the mind into stillness.
Third, the mind is equally stirred and still.
Fourth, the mind is still, with few distractions.
Until spirit and **qi** merge as one,
Breath and the embryo unite,
And the mind remains purely still—
Then a single thought may arise.

First, practice silent morning reverence to the **Sān Yī** (Three-One) Dao,
Mastering silent reverence and petitioning with **bàizhāng** (white chapters).
When serving the **Xīnzhāng** (Heart Chapter), also silently petition above.
During samadhi, silently reverence—
And visions will appear.
Thus receiving the Emperor’s intent,
It is your own **Tiānzūn** (Celestial Venerable).
Why seek above when it is already within?

**The Efficacy of Petitions**
The **zhāng** (petition) opens the gates of the Nine Heavens and reaches the **Tàishàng’s** (Supreme Sovereign’s) throne.
It rescues from calamity, elevates from obscurity, and none surpass its power—it is the foremost method.
If a devout **jīngchéng dàoshì nǚguān** (ascetic male or female adept), detached from worldly affairs, who recites the scriptures without interruption, may present a petition to the heavens. Instantly, dangers are averted, and one may traverse the **yōumíng** (dim realm).
Thus, the **Tàishàng** descends commands to the celestial bureaus, transmitting them to the **yōumíng** (netherworld), ordering the relevant departments to register the name for a higher rebirth, removing them from the **sǐjí** (death ledger), extending their lifespan, and increasing the **kǎosuàn** (karmic calculations) of their **yōuhún** (netherworldly souls). Even those bound by **jūbàn yōumò** (netherworldly constraints) may be pardoned, their **zuìshū** (guilt registers) burned, and they attain a **shēngdào** (rebirth in the Dao).

For ordinary **zhāijiào** (ritual fasting), **qí’ēn** (petitions for blessings), **liáo zāi xièguò** (expiations for disasters and transgressions), the petition only reaches the **xīngjiè Tiānmén** (Star Domain’s Heavenly Gate), where **Zhōu Jiāngjūn** (General Zhou) and the **Zhí Rì Guān Lì** (Direct-Sun Officials) record the matters by category for submission.

If the **fǎshī** (ritual master) or **jìjiǎo** (sacrificial officiant) lacks **déxíng** (virtue and conduct), or if their **zāiqì** (impure *qi*) offends, they are consigned to their respective **chénghuángsī** (City Gods’ bureaus). If they are neither a **fǎshī jìjiǎo** nor one lacking virtue, they are often obstructed by **xiàguān gùqì** (low-ranking officials’ *qi*), or by the **bàntiān wǔyǒu xié shén** (half-heaven’s afternoon and evening malevolent deities), intercepted along the **yúnlù** (cloud path), and the petition never reaches its destination.

When ordinary sacrificial officiants and ritual masters act to save and heal the people, acting on behalf of Heaven to transform and enlighten, they are received by General Zhou of the Middle Realm and the Direct-Sun officials, who escort them to the **Tiānshū Yùan** (Celestial Pivot Bureau). Their petitions and memorials are then submitted alongside those from the ten thousand nations.

If errors are made, they are likewise sent to the City Gods’ bureaus. If they violate no statutes or fail to adhere to proper procedures, they are subject to Heaven’s own penalties.

When sacrificial officiants and ritual masters pray for the longevity of emperors and kings, avert wars and calamities, seek heirs, eliminate great harms, or universally save and deliver through supplication, their petitions are passed by General Zhou and General Ge to the **Sān Tiān Mén** (Three Heaven Gates). General Tang and the Direct-Sun officials convey them directly to the **Tiān Shěng** (Celestial Province), where they are immediately transcribed and swiftly awaited for a response.

If they can summon a **yángshén** (solar spirit) to personally present the memorials, they may go directly to the Three Heaven Gates, face the golden threshold, and humbly lay out their words in supplication, receiving direct edicts—thus exempting them from these regulations.

When practicing the **Língbǎo Dàfǎ** (Numinous Treasure Great Method), the **Sān Tiān Shí Tiān** (Three and Ten Heavens) receive the petitions through the **Yùnǚ** (Jade Maidens), the **Língguān Yùnshén Huìdào Gōngcáo** (Spirit Officials Assembling the Dao), the **Wèizhēn Shànglì** (Guardian Officials of Truth), the **Chuán Yán Zàoshì Xiānlì** (Messenger Celestial Officials), the **Jīnlóng Yì Lóngqí Lì** (Golden Dragon Relay’s Dragon Cavalry Officials), the **Lónghǔ Gōngcáo** (Dragon-Tiger Functionaries), the **Wǔsè Xiùyī Yùtóng** (Five-Colored Embroidered Robe Jade Boys), and the **Língfēi Liùjiǎ Yùnǚ** (Spiritual Flight Six Jia Jade Maidens), who transmit the memorials.

If there are mistakes or deviations from proper form, they are corrected at the Three Heaven Gates within the **Tiānxiàng** (Celestial Mirror), and the memorials are then transcribed anew. If they conform to the proper format, the memorials ascend immediately, for they have secured the **Sān Tiān Hé Tóng** (Three Heaven Concord) and the **Tàishàng Fúqiè** (Supreme Most’s Talismans), ensuring no obstruction.

For those drafting memorials, on the fifth day of the fifth month each year and on the **suìchú** (Year-End) day, silently recite the hidden name **"Línwù Ěr"** (three characters) of the Three Heavens ten thousand times within a day and night to receive the Three Heavens’ descending *qi*, aligning with the Concord. Before submitting a memorial, recite this name several hundred times, grind the ink, and invoke the *qi* of the Three Heavens upon the brush and paper. If writing the **Yùhào** (Imperial Title), recite it several dozen times. When rolling up the memorial, pass it over incense, and have an official seal it—recite several dozen times as well. This ensures swift ascent without delay.

When writing memorials, use pure paper, never placing them on beds or mats. The length should be one *chǐ* five *cùn*, with no more than twelve lines per sheet. In leap months, add a thirteenth line corresponding to the twelve months and twelve times. Each line should contain eighteen characters, connecting the Nine Heavens above with the Nine Earths below.

The titles **"Chén"** (Subject) and names must not be exposed, nor should feet be bare. Do not break or fold the subject’s name, nor write **"shēng"** (life) or **"sǐ"** (death) openly. Gods and ghosts must not be invoked by name. The **"dùntóu zàibài"** (kneeling prostration) must not disrupt the lines.

When mentioning the **"Tàisuì"** (Year Lord) and the subject’s surname, lower the first three characters. When mentioning the **"Zàibài"** (prostration), skip three lines, then write on the fourth. The same applies to the **"Dàoshén"** (Dao-spirit) and the subject’s surname. These lines stand above the rest, with eight *fēn* of space above and alignment with crawling ants below. Write with one or three breaths of *qi*, never exceeding three *cùn*. Skip three lines after the Year Lord, writing on the fourth. If the paper ends after the Year Lord, only one line remains—this may be continued onto a new sheet. Only after the **Sān Shī** (Three Teachers) have inscribed their praises does the memorial ascend.

When the subject is the sovereign, the child the parent, the wife the husband, the younger brother the elder, the grandson the ancestor, or the guest the host, the petition ascends without fail. Conversely, if the parent is the child, the sovereign the subject, the husband the wife, the ancestor the grandson, or the host the guest—though propriety and sincerity may be observed—even if the memorial ascends, the matter may only partially succeed. This must be carefully considered.

The method of drafting memorials begins with the sacrificial officiant or ritual master humbly confessing their unworthiness and failings in office. Then, they present the petitioner’s case, followed by an account of their transgressions and repentance. Next, they beseech mercy, pardon, and deliverance, and finally, they request official intervention. Avoid excessive or deceitful language, nor should hidden faults or falsehoods be concealed.

If this format is followed, the memorial will surely ascend and swiftly evoke divine response. If not, it will sink like a stone into the sea, yielding no spiritual efficacy, instead inviting retribution. How could there be blessings?

The common folk, ignorant of these principles, and greedy ritual masters who accept bribes for memorials—both bear fault. This must be approached with utmost caution.

The Three Heavens’ bureaucracy beneath the Celestial Gate is entirely under the jurisdiction of the **Yuqing Great Demon Kings** and the **Celestial Officials**, who oversee all matters. For instance, the **Tai Xuan Demon King** serves as the **Deputy Prime Minister**, while the **Lingmo** records deeds and misdeeds. This is not merely a demonic ledger—it is a **comparative reckoning of merit and fault**. The **Zhi Mo** (制魔) functions as the **Imperial Edicts Office**, akin to the **Hanlin Academy** of mortal realms.

To discern merit and fault with absolute precision—without moral failings—how could one attain such clarity? Moreover, the world lacks true talent. Most ritual masters merely follow outdated templates, writing memorials without regard for proper format or compliance.

Take the old memorial format: *"Encomiums belong solely to the Most High."* Yet if the memorial originates from the **Ta Qing officials**, it is submitted before the **San Tian Ta Qing Dongshen Jinque Supreme Lord Laozi**—but this is merely the **Ta Qing Tianzhong**, not the Most High. The **Most High’s Golden Gate** refers to the **Ta Qing Liaoyang Golden Gate**, hence the phrase *"Encomiums belong solely to the Most High."*

To the right, as in *"Your servant’s name"*—today’s ritual masters do not write *"Your servant [name]"* but instead *"[full name]"*, which is entirely improper.

Within these texts, there are **multiple violations of ritual precepts**—how could one uninitiated in **Zhenren** doctrine comprehend them?

For example, **Master Li Zhenren**, the enduring ritual master, composed memorials for the **Yang and Xu Zhenren**—only then was he deemed a true master. Later, he became the **Dongtian Master**, and now he has ascended to true office. How could the unworthy compare?

Later scholars, tracing his original texts, found them to be **authentic editions**, such as the *Qian Er Bai Guan Yi* or the *Tianshi Jingzhong Qingguan Jue*. When applied to practice, they align somewhat with **Heaven’s decree**.

When submitting memorials, if the format is correct, one must **kneel and present** incense, oil, firewood, rice, talismans, and ceremonial robes—according to one’s means, but never entirely lacking. If a vow is made and the matter is resolved, it must be repaid; one cannot neglect it.

In urgent cases, a **verbal memorial of gratitude** may suffice. If a written memorial is submitted, the reply must also be in writing—**no deviation is permitted**. If the **Celestial Tribunals** find no record of the case, **punishment will follow**.

For urgent memorials and **exorcism petitions**, ten sheets of **blue paper** must be knelt and presented—blue being the color revered by the Celestial Officials. This is a brief overview; **secret and detailed precepts are documented elsewhere**.

**Awaiting the verification of the Secret Edict.**

Gather and harmonize **jing** (essence), **qi** (vital breath), and **shen** (spirit), directing them into the **dantian**. The three deeds and six senses transform the yin-**qi** into pure yang, cultivating a robust, **buoyant** (乾健) body that aligns with the Dao, only then may one enter the realm of the spirit.

Wait within stillness until a divine light emerges—like the sun, or five-colored purple-**qi**, or crimson auspicious-**qi** descending to irrigate the **brain’s marrow** (泥丸), the heart, or the body. This is the true Dao-**qi** entering the body, called **tongsheng** (通生). **Tongsheng** is called **obtaining the Dao**. Though named thus, in truth, there is nothing obtained.
