When the fast is concluded (散斋之时), one must present the **Supreme Petition of Gratitude (谢玄表文)**,
Along with the **supplementation of rank (补职状)** and the **scripture count (经数目名字)**,
And perform the **ritual of atonement to the Three Officials (三官谢罪礼)**.
Upon completion of the **petitions and offerings (文状)**, one must again return thanks to the **Five Masters (五师)** for their blessings."*

**The Petition to the Three Masters (请三师仪):**

**The Scripture Master (经师):**
With **golden tablets (金简)** and **sacred texts (灵篇)**,
And **precious scrolls (琅函宝诰)** that have flowed to the **unworthy disciples (末学)**,
One should **revere and honor (尊仰)** the **true Master (真师)**.
Using **green silk and golden buttons (青丝金钮)** to swear one’s earnest devotion,
And **flower-embroidered satchels (采蕊笈)** and **cloud-patterned bags (云囊)** to seek the **profound truths (奥旨)**.
When performing the **fast and worship (修斋祀)**, one must first **offer to the Scripture Master (奉经师)**,
Gazing upward to the **True Compassion (真慈)**,
And bowing to the **Dharma seat (法席)**.
We, your humble servants, tremble with **awe and reverence (恐悚)**,
And are **burned and purified (战灼)** in this sacred endeavor.

**The Register Master (籍师):**
With **golden tablets (金籍)** and **soft jade pages (柔玉成篇)**,
The **Secret Books of the Supreme Sage (上圣之秘书)** record all **hidden truths of the departed (夭之隐讳)**.
Accumulating **meritorious deeds (功)** and **virtue/power (德)**,
Even the **lightest good (纤芥)** is not overlooked.
Ascending in rank to **true perfection (真)**, one progresses through **countless kalpas (劫年)** without decline.
Thus, when performing the **fast of rectification (修斋直)**, one must **offer to the Register Master (奉籍师)**,
Gazing upward to the **True Compassion (真慈)**,
And bowing to the **Dharma seat (法席)**.
We, your humble servants, tremble with **dread and humility (局踏)**,
And are **bowed in reverence (俯望)** to the utmost.

**The Liberation Master (度师):**
With **scriptures and talismans (经箓)** in hand, we truly **revere the Patriarch (祖师)**,
And **transcend the mundane to attain the true (拔俗超真)** is through the **Teaching Father (教父)**.
How could **later disciples (后学)** dare to forget **establishing goodness (立善)**,
Or be **lost in confusion (迷涂)** while yet attaining the **profound intent (旨归)**?
Both **hidden and manifest beings (幽显)** follow in accord,
And the **principle (道)** unites past and present.
Moreover, **Chen Sheng and Fan Zeng (陈胜范)**—
When performing the **fast of liberation (奉度师)**, one must **offer to the Liberation Master (奉度师)**,
Gazing upward to the **True Compassion (真慈)**,
And bowing to the **Dharma seat (法席)**.
We, your humble servants, tremble with **fear and solemnity (兢栗)**,
And are **filled with pleading (哀祈)** to the utmost.

**The Hall of the Precise Mind (精思堂) or Hall of Preserving the True (存真堂):**
The **Celestial Venerable of Golden Truth (金真演教天尊)**,
The **Directly Impressed Spirit Official (直印灵官)**,
The **Sword-Bearing Child (掌剑童子)**,
The **Ritual-Bearing Spirit Official (掌仪灵官)**,
The **Supervising Inspectors (监察使者)**,
The **High Function Supreme Master presiding over the altar (临坛主盟高功大法师)**,
The **Great Master of the Assembly (都讲大法师)**,
The **Supervising Master of the Fast (监斋大法师)**,
The **Scripture-Attending Master (侍经大法师)**,
The **Incense-Attending Master (侍香大法师)**,
The **Lamp-Attending Master (侍灯大法师)**.

**The Hall of the Underworld Officials (冥官堂) and its Venerable Positions (圣位):**
The **Celestial Emperor of the Eastern Peak (东岳天齐仁圣帝)**,
The **Celestial Emperor of the Southern Peak (南岳司天昭圣帝)**,
The **Celestial Emperor of the Western Peak (西岳金天顺圣帝)**,
The **Celestial Emperor of the Northern Peak (北岳安天元圣帝)**,
The **Celestial Emperor of the Central Peak (中岳中天崇圣帝)**,
The **Great Sovereign of the Underworld Bureau (酆都地府大帝)**,
The **Nine Terraces Earthly Sovereign (九垒土皇君)**,
The **True Lord of the First Seven (一七太素妙广真君)**,
The **True Lord of the Second Seven (二七阴德定休真君)**,
The **True Lord of the Third Seven (三七洞冥普静真君)**,
The **True Lord of the Fourth Seven (四七玄德五灵真君)**,
The **True Lord of the Fifth Seven (五七最胜耀明真君)**,
The **True Lord of the Sixth Seven (六七宝宿昭成真君)**,
The **True Lord of the Seventh Seven (七七泰山正道真君)**,
The **True Lord of the Hundred Days (百日无上正度真君)**,
The **True Lord of the Minor Auspicious (小祥飞魔演庆真君)**,
The **True Lord of the Great Auspicious (大祥五化威灵真君)**,
The **Ten Kings (十王)** and their **subordinate officials (案分诸司官典)**,
The **Underworld Officials of the Nine Abysses (九幽地狱冥官)**,
The **Underworld Officials of the Ten Great Abysses (十大地狱冥官)**,
The **Underworld Officials of the Eighteen Abysses (十八地狱冥官)**,
The **Underworld Officials of the Twenty-Four Abysses (二十四狱冥官)**,
The **Underworld Officials of the Thirty-Six Abysses (三十六狱冥官)**,
The **Underworld Officials of the Great and Small Iron Encircled Mountains (大小铁围山无间地狱冥官)**.

**The Invocatory Scripture (祝文):**
Beneath the **Nine Abysses (九泉)**, in the **long night (长夜)**,
The **Underworld authorities (阴官)** preside over the **punishment bureau (掌罪之司)**.
In the **Ghostly Realm (鬼趣)**, they wield **executive power (执刑之府)**.
The **suffering souls (苦魂)** endure **judgment (考)**,
Between **ten thousand deaths and rebirths (万死万生)**,
And **wandering spirits (滞爽)** face **calamities (罹殃)**,
Coming and going in endless cycles.
Not through the **mercy of prison officers (狱吏)** do they arrive,
But by the **sentient beings’ own karmic crimes (众生造罪)** they are summoned.
Without the **Great Fast of the Sacred Treasure (灵宝之大斋)**,
They would not depart from the **dark Underworld (幽阴之暗府)**.

We humbly beseech the **Five Sacred Mountain Celestial Venerables (五岳圣尊)**,
The **Underworld Lords (酆都地主)** and **Chief Underworld Officials (冥官主者)**,
The **clerks of punishment (考罪曹僚)**,
To follow the **Celestial Venerable’s talismans and commands (天尊之符命)**,
And open the **heavy gates of the Underworld (地狱之重门)**,
To proclaim the **true talismans of the golden registers (金箓之真符)**,
And pardon the **guilty in the dark prisons (幽关之罪对)**.
To **transcend the prison bounds (超离狴犴)**,
And **ascend to the Southern Celestial Palace (升陟南宫)**,
To universally **receive the benevolent grace of the Great Auspicious (一扬泰之恩)**,
And together **enter the Mysterious Primordial Dao/Way (玄元之道)**.
May **blessings endure for the living and the dead (福资存殁)**,
And **benefits extend to all sentient beings (利及有情)**.

**The Hall of the Spirit Officials (监生堂) and its Venerable Positions (圣位):**
The **True Lord of the Nine Celestial Extenders of Life (九天延寿益算君)**,
The **True Lord of the Nine Celestial Restorers of Corpse (九天回骸起死君)**,
The **True Lord of the Nine Celestial Storers of Fortune (九天储福定命君)**,
The **Great Spirit of the Nine Celestial (九天监生大神)**,
The **Holy Mother of the Nine Celestial (九天卫房圣母)**,
The **Six Celestial Registers (六甲保胎符吏)**,
The **Child of Delivery (送生童子)**,
And **all True Lords of the Nine Celestial (九天一切真宰)**.

**The Nine Celestial Spirit Talismans for Life Extension (九天监生符):**
Fly, **Mysterious Qi (玄之炁)**, and **form into true scriptures (结成真文)**.

**The Opening of the Corpse and the Awakening of All Sentient Roots (死骸开度万品生根):**
The **Right Heaven Scripture of the Jade Talisman (右天书玉符)**, inscribed in the **Hall of the Spirit Officials (监生司)**, placed upon a single incense altar for veneration, shall be seen by the departed—**and thus their spirits shall naturally tremble and radiate brilliance (亡人见之，自然百骇流光)**.
To **ward off the malevolent glow of blood (禳却尸血之光)**.

**The Venerable Positions of the Celestial Physician (荡秽天医所圣位):**
The **Lord of the Wandering Impurities (运秽神君)**,
The **Lord of the Dissolving Impurities (解秽神君)**,
The **Lord of the Gathering Impurities (收秽神君)**,
The **Lord of the Repelling Impurities (却秽神君)**,
The **Lord of the Eliminating Impurities (除秽神君)**,
The **Lord of the Severing Impurities (斩秽神君)**,
The **Lord of the Extinguishing Impurities (灭秽神君)**,
The **Lord of the Washing Impurities (洗秽神君)**,
The **Lord of the Shattering Impurities (破秽神君)**,
The **Lord of the Scouring Impurities (荡秽神君)**,
The **Four Spirits of the East, West, South, and North—Lords of Dissolving Impurities (东西南北四灵解秽神君)**,
The **Lord of the Celestial Physician’s Merit and Fate (天医度厄绩命君)**,
The **Magpie and Crow Envoys (鶣鹊使者)**,
The **Celestial Physician’s Hall of Officials—Venerable Child Saints (天医院官童圣众)**,
The **Envoys of the Supreme One’s Healing Virtue (正一洽病功曹使者)**,
The **Six Celestial Generals of Disease Healing (六甲治病将军)**,
The **Minor Officials of the Lancing Stone (砭石小吏)**,
The **Spiritual Child of the Sacred Pharmacy (尚药灵童)**.

**The Venerable Positions of the Receptive Refining Bureau (受炼司圣位):**
The **Nine-Light Child Saint of the Opening Radiance (开光尊神九光童子)**,
The **Great Generals of the Left and Right of the Azure Heaven (丹天左右卫大将军)**,
The **True Person of the Marvelous Dao—Initiator of Soul Refining (妙行真人炼魂始者)**,
The **Soul-Refining Envoys of the Fire Bell Spirits (火铃灵童炼魂使者)**,
The **Envoys of the Water-Fire Pools (掌水火池使者)**,
The **Generals of the Twelve Vital Qi (十二生炁将军)**,
The **Great Spirit of the Dao of the Celestial Immortals (掌天仙道大神)**,
The **Great Spirit of the Dao of the Earthly Demons (掌地狱道大神)**,
The **Great Spirit of the Dao of Humanity (掌人道大神)**,
The **Great Spirit of the Dao of the Spirits (掌神道大神)**,
The **Great Spirit of the Dao of Beasts (掌畜生道大神)**,
The **Great Spirit of the Dao of the Hungry Ghosts (掌饿鬼道大神)**.

**The *Scripture of the Spirit Jewel’s Limitless Dao* (灵赛无量度人上经) and *Scripture of the Jewel of the Dao’s Limitless Dao* (灵宝无量度人上经)—The Great Dao Chapters (大法卷) Forty-Seventh and Forty-Eighth concluded.**

**The Ritual of Ascending the Platform and Reciting the Invocation Chapters (登坛演祝品), the Ritual of Ascending the Platform and Reciting the Dao Chapters (登坛演法章).**

This incense offering—rooted in the boundless void (杳冥), its essence the empty expanse (虚空)—
Unshaken by the eight winds, unstoppable by ten thousand men.
Today, plucked with hand and offered to the sacred platform (法坛),
Devoted first to the Supreme Emperor of the Invocation (上祝皇帝).
May I humbly pray that in the post-Heavenly era, You remain ageless as the rising sun,
Ever the sovereign of the Great Dao, eternally the benevolent ruler of the land.

This incense offering—devoted to the ministers of the current age (当朝宰辅),
And all noble officials (百执公卿) of my Dao and my realm.
May I humbly pray that with one virtue (一德) You ascend to heaven’s firmament and endure eternally,
And with six tortoises (六鳌) bear the earth to balance its governance.
May those adorned with jade and wielding gold all rise to the highest paths,
Climbing dragons and consorting with phoenixes, ascending to the celestial realm.

This incense offering—devoted to all virtuous scholars and faithful in this assembly (在会一切贤士信人).
May I humbly pray that the Dao’s nature is profound and clear,
And all beings instantly awaken from their afflictions.
Though guilt be mountains high, may they forever break free from limitless entanglements,
And each soul’s essence be refined as jade, their names inscribed in golden script.

For the departed ancestors of my lineage, may they all attain auspicious rebirth,
And all sentient beings transcend the bounds of the dharma-realm (法界).
Next, I recite the **White Text of the Supreme Seat (升座白文)**—
*"Natural Primordial Beginning (自然元始),*
*Whose numinous wind stirs the void’s resonance (灵风鼓空洞之章).*
**The *Scripture of the Limitless Dao of the Soul’s Jewel* (无量度人) refines the vital qi of the Yang of the Five Phases (丹阳之炁).*
**The *Three Luminaries of Clarity* (开明三景) nurture all divine spirits (普殖神灵).*
With the **Five Elements of Transformation (混化之五文)** and the **Nine Revolutions of Divine Mechanism (妙神机之九转),**
They enter and emerge, bearing yin while embracing yang,
Existing or vanishing—deep-rooted, firm as the stem.
When struck in true stillness, they respond; when sensed in profound emptiness, they open.
Yet how much more so: the self-born cling to earth and sink their souls,
While those who attain the One are light and pure, their spirits floating with ease.

Thus, among the thirty-six divisions of esoteric teachings,
Only the **Soul’s True Essence (灵本真)** is unique.
Granting the **Thousand Two Hundred Official Titles (锡千二百之官章)** to rescue the wandering,
Even bones abandoned in the wild, when touched by the **Soul’s Immortal Talisman (长生灵符)**, emit smoke and revive.
The **Purple Qi** passes the mountain gates,
And when the **Marvelous Dao’s True Scripture (妙法真经)** is recited, the caldron’s boiling ceases.

In all directions, teachings flourish; in myriad forms, beings are born.
If called "Great," then the six extremes are not distant.
If named "Dao," then all beings receive their portion.
Without the **Supreme Primordial (太元)**, no single law could stand;
To those who hold sentience, all wonders are ineffable.

I bestow the **Three Ordinances of the Emperor (三箓之简文)**,
And mark the **Nine Platforms of the Scholar and Commoner (九坛之科式)**.
Both the living and the dead receive blessings,
And all ages follow in reverence.
Yet alas, the paths of yin and yang are divided,
And the principles of life and death are obscure.
In vain do we yearn with broken hearts,
Unknowing where to seek the ultimate.

Only the **Supreme Dao’s Descent of the Soul-Returning Ordinance (太上降返魂之箓)**,
And the **Mysterious Capital’s Rite for Crossing Death (玄都出度死之仪)**,
Can be solemnly invoked—
Their sacred efficacy alone is trustworthy.

Thus, I purify my heart and uphold the precepts,
Repel evil while preserving sincerity,
Using black hair instead of shaved scalp marks (割发之纹),
And gold treasures to pledge my solemn vows (质盟之信).
With humble words and earnest supplication,
I bow my hands and pray to heaven,
Having bathed in humility and diligence,
Unable to suppress my devotion.

Though I have hidden my body in the forests and mountains,
And set my resolve among the mists and clouds,
Studying esoteric ordinances in the **Mysterious Platform (玄坛)**,
I am ever ashamed of my failure to ascend as a **Flying God (飞神)** in the **Lofty Hall (寥殿)**.

Now, with this encouragement,
I strive to cleanse myself.

My mind is void—then the heart resonates with the **Great Emptiness (太虚)**;
My resolve and wisdom are steadfast—then the light of wisdom is unobstructed.
I exalt the **Mysterious Standard (玄范)** and chant the **Empty Hymns (空歌)**,
Their **Lingering Dragon’s Sound (琳琅之音)** echoing through the ten directions,
And the **Vital Qi of the Dao’s Conduct (梵行之炁)** filling the eight extremes.

The **Golden Dragon** leaps in flight,
The **Divine Tiger** races with swiftness.
When the **Jade Edicts (玉札)** are issued, even the loftiest peaks and valleys bow in reverence;
When the **Sacred Decrees (符命)** are proclaimed, the **Yin Abyss (酆幽)** obeys and follows.

I cast fire ten thousand li,
And revolve within the **Great Furnace of the Alchemist (大冶之炉)**.
I let the **Eight Bell Incense (流铃)** descend,
And shatter the **Cold Hills’ Chisel (寒丘之锷)**.

Thus, I draw in the essence of the sun and moon,
And illuminate the night’s platform.
I gather the **Rectified Qi of Heaven and Earth (天地之正炁)**,
And rescue this numinous consciousness (灵识).
Above, I rely on the **Dao of the Heavenly Venerable (天尊之道)**,
Below, I praise the **Humble Ministers of the Dao (樵木之臣)**.

With the assembly united in heart,
I open the **Numinous Feast (灵席)**.

**Opening the Platform and Invoking the Sacred Chapters (开坛启请词章):**
A disciple of the **Yellow Ordinance Great Fast (黄箓大斋)**, [name] certain,
Prostrates twice with reverence,
And now reveals my sincere devotion,
To implore the celestial audience.

I reflect that we dwell in the dust of mundane affairs,
And labor long in the realm of secular splendor,
Lost in the vast sea of suffering,
And mired in the endless cycle of karmic dust.

Fortunate indeed, by past merit we have some virtue,
And aspire to the **Pure Void (清虚)**.
Though deaf and blind to worldly ways,
Our hearts revere the **Supreme Dao (至道)**.
We seek to ascend gradually to its mysteries,
And rescue all beings from the fate of existence and annihilation.

We intend to renew ourselves,
And wash away the sins of our past days.

From today onward, within the九州 and all lands,
Loyal ministers and righteous scholars
Have perished for their devotion to the state,
While filial sons and obedient grandsons
Have lost their lives in safeguarding their families.
Some wander in foreign lands,
Frozen and starving, their spirits consumed.
Others lie exposed in distant villages,
And die from want before their time.
Some are seized by cruel tyrants,
And killed to repay old debts.
Others fall in war’s calamities,
And suffer disaster for past karmic causes.

The **Chaste Widows of Unyielding Virtue (抱贞坚之烈妇)**,
And the **Men of Pure Devotion (怀赤心之正人)**,
Though they offend no one, are slain by sudden rage,
Cut down by the edge of blades.
Or infants, weak in vital qi,
And the aged, frail and infirm,
Who die from improper habits or poor nourishment,
And are left to drift along the roads,
Or to perish in the wilderness.

Some abandon themselves in despair,
Leaping into rivers or flames,
Drowned in the waves or crushed by winds,
Or perish in storms while sheltering in homes.
Others, by mistake, drink poison and drown in the depths,
Or are devoured by ferocious beasts in the wild.
Their bodies fall in perilous places,
And their lives are taken by the law.

Even more, those afflicted by **Wind Labor (风劳)** and **Cold Qi (气泠)**,
Whose lifespans are exhausted and end,
Face endless suffering in sorrow,
And mourn the distant path home.
In the boundless darkness of the underworld,
They lament the years until rebirth.

If they do not depend on the **Dao’s Power (道力)**,
How could such souls ever ascend?

I have heard of the **Yellow Ordinance Great Fast (黄箓大斋)**,
Whose merits and virtues are beyond measure.
The **Deep Mystery Fast (洞玄醮法)** possesses vast divine power,
Capable of rescuing all beings from the **Endless Ocean of Suffering (无边沉泉之苦)**,
And saving countless souls from the **Five Ages of Karmic Retribution (亿万期劫之魂)**.

The **Golden Ordinance (金箓)** pardons past transgressions,
And the **White Tablet (白简)** grants the **Liberation of Effortless Bliss (逍遥快乐)**.
To attend this fast three times,
Is to avoid the five torments—
How much more so if one devotes oneself entirely to its construction!

The humble disciple hears that the venerable Master, widely spreading the **Teachings and Laws (教法)**, magnificently elucidating the true **Dao/Way (真风)**, expounding the **Pure Stillness of Non-Action (清静於无为)**, and rescuing the living and the dead from the **Lower Earth (下土)**, has achieved his **virtue/power (功)** and fulfilled his **practice (行)**, all revered by the multitude. His **virtue/power (德)** is noble, his **Dao/Way (道)** esteemed, and all pay homage.

The disciple prays for the Master’s boundless compassion and pity, humbly hoping he may deign to grant approval and temporarily bestow the **Celestial Dao (仙斿)**, descending to preside over this **fast/ritual assembly (斋会)**, guiding the essential principles and uplifting the sacred rites. As the **Grand Overseer of the Altar (总宰坛场)**, he may broadly expound the **盟真**’s sacred precepts, so that his **virtue/power (功)** may benefit both the **living and the departed (幽显)**, and his blessings extend to all. This is beyond the disciple’s ability—all stems from the Master’s **Dao’s Transformation (道化)**. The disciple bows twice in reverence.

The Master replies:
*"The disciple is a humble, lowly being, a mere scholar beneath the thatched roof. Though he has received the **Dao/Way (法)** from an enlightened teacher, alas, his own self remains unrefined.*

*The humble disciple hears that within lies a marvel beyond, and within lies a truth that naturally manifests without. Yet, as an unlearned mortal, he is still entangled in worldly affairs, lacking the primal **Dao’s Power (真妙之元)**. How could he possibly propagate the **Supreme Dao/Way (至道)** outwardly?

*He wished to dwell in secluded mountain caves, abandon wisdom, and conceal his light, practicing **breathing techniques (吐纳)** to cultivate the **Three Morning Elixir (三晨之华)**, refining the **Nine True Essences (九真之液)** to nourish the **Embryonic Immortal (胎仙)**, perfecting both form and spirit. Only then could he aid others and rescue the living, expound the **Dao’s Transformation (阐化)** and propagate its teachings. Yet, he has been granted this sincere request—how could he dare refuse? Though unworthy of this task, he humbly petitions the Master for guidance.*

*The disciple further entreats: With utmost sincerity, we again offer our earnest supplications, hoping the Master’s wisdom may illuminate our path. The humble disciple hears that the **Orthodox Celestial Master (正一天师)** received the **Elixir Scripture (丹书)** from Mount Jing, yet hesitated to refine it, fearing it would be of no benefit in the mortal realm and bringing shame to the **Three Realms (三境)** at the heavenly gates. The **Wondrous Rescue True Lord (妙济真君)** obtained the **Jade Ordinance (玉箓)** from the Western Chu, immediately aiding beings and drawing his home to ascend through divine grace.

*This is the saying: first cultivate outward **virtue/power (外德)**, then refine inner **Dao’s Power (内功)**. The outer and inner support each other, with sincere devotion spanning the days. Pointing toward the **Caverns of Immortality (洞天)**, he embarks on celestial wanderings, and his **Dao’s Transformation (惠外修)** grants blessings to the unrefined. At the **Immortal’s Gate (仙阙)**, he summons the winds and clouds with his **Dao’s Power (道化)**. Since ancient times, the **Highest Immortals (高真)** have followed this path.

*The disciple prays that the Master may emulate the **Dao’s Transformation (灵迹)** of ancient Immortals, establishing a **Law for Aiding the World (济世之律梁)**, continuing the **Immortal’s Legacy (古仙之遗业)**, and refining the **Ladder of Rescue (拯度之梯航)**. He humbly hopes the Master may open the **Gate of Convenience (方便之门)**, eternally providing the **Path for the Living and the Dead (存亡之路)**. Countless suffering souls shall achieve rebirth, and beings in heaven and earth alike shall cherish the Master’s compassionate blessings.

*Moreover, the **fast/ritual altar (法坛)** is already prepared, and the moment of opening is at hand. We earnestly beg the Master to descend in compassion, granting us this **Gate of Convenience (方便)**. The living and the dead shall receive the **Enlightenment of Great Peace (开泰之恩)**, and all beings, from birth to death, shall benefit from the Master’s **Dao’s Transformation (提携之化)**. We are overwhelmed by this boundless mercy.*

*The Master again grants the request: Though the disciple has made three humble petitions, his sincerity is acknowledged. You have resolved not to evade this duty. Fearful of disrupting the **perfect fulfillment (圆成)**, I shall reluctantly comply, devoting myself wholeheartedly to your wishes. All shall receive extraordinary blessings.

*Through this **opening of the altar’s merit (开坛功德)**, the **Seven Celestial Temples (七庙)** shall be honored above. Wandering the **Great Void (太漠)**, I shall refine my **Dao’s Power (真)** in the **Celestial Pure Realm (碧落之天)**. Following the **Jade Emperor (玉皇)**, I shall nurture my **Dao’s Transformation (素)** in the **Luminous Mist Domain (明霞之境)**. Next, I shall purify the **Nine Earths (九土)**, dispelling the **mists and dust (氛尘)** and silencing the **Four Directions’ smoke and fire (四夷烟燧)**. In times of wind and rain, there shall be nourishment; during autumn harvests, no sickness shall arise. Locusts and plagues shall be annihilated, and all departed souls shall ascend to the **Dao’s Realm (道境)**. The **Four Existences and Six Paths (四生六道)** shall all attain **wondrous bliss (妙乐)**.

*Now that the **sacred rites (威仪)** are prepared and the time of opening has arrived, let us not further decline in humility but instead hold this matter in highest regard.*

*The disciple thanks the Master: We have been graciously granted the Master’s approval, and our gratitude knows no bounds. With deepest reverence, we bow twice and invite the Master to ascend the altar.*

**Ascending the Altar and Opening the Fast:**
*"He who gives birth to heaven and earth, governs the sun and moon, and nurtures all beings—this is the **Dao’s Function (道之用)**. He who imparts teachings and sets precepts, transmits **Dao’s Power (戒)** and grants **sacred talismans (符)**, rescues the living and guides the dead—this is the **Dao’s Compassion (道之慈)**. The **Yellow Ordinance and White Tablet (黄箓白简)**, descending to rescue the **Netherworld’s Path (冥途)**, universally aiding the departed—this is the **Jade Pure Celestial’s Special Pardon (玉清之曲赦)**. The **Dao’s Function (明道之用)** and the **Dao’s Compassion (运道之慈)**, along with the invocation of the **Jade Pure Celestial’s Special Pardon (玉清之曲赦)**—this is the **Dao’s Path (道)**.

*It depends on humanity’s devotion; if sincere, it moves heaven and earth, and touches the spirits and deities, both near and far, deep and hidden. It responds as if echoing across valleys. It depends on sincerity—if not the right person, even sincerity may fail to reach its mark.*

*Now, the humble disciple obeys the Master’s command, establishing this **fast/ritual platform (法席)**. With utmost reverence, he invokes the **Dao’s Power (真灵)**, transcending and guiding the departed souls to ascend to **Immortal Rank (仙品)**."*

「Now, I humbly follow the ritual teachings, meticulously arranging the solemn rites. With the **vermilion seal (朱章)** I summon the spirits, with the **fragrant elixir (兰汤)** I purify the defilements, with the **brilliant lanterns (华灯)** I illuminate the path, with the **precious banners (宝旛)** I guide the deities. I employ the **sacred talismans (灵符)** to descend into the **Nine Abysses (九幽)**, and offer **devotional provisions (供养)** to benefit the **Six Realms (六道)**.

First, I take refuge in the **Three Treasures (三宝)**, then I proclaim the **precepts (戒)** to the **Nine True Ones (九真)**, retrieve the **wandering souls (幽魄)** from the **Southern Hall (南宫)**, and erase the **darkened names (黑名)** from the **Northern Bureau (北府)**. I administer the **Great Daoist Elixir (大法药)** to rescue those lost in sin, hold the **Great Daoist Lamp (大法炬)** to dispel the darkness of the abyss, and spread the **Great Daoist Cloud (大法云)** to cover all beings. Such are the **merits and virtues (功德)**, beyond all measure.

If one like me has mistakenly taken on the knowledge of another, and now serves the **Jade Platform (瑶坛)**, how dare I not be vigilant in my heart, seeking mercy from the **Supreme Sage (太上)**.

I hope that the **Highest Truths (高真)** will descend in compassion, that the departed may ascend in spirit, that their **transformed countenances (易容颜)** may be refined in the **Nine Refineries (九炼之庭)**, and that their **extinguished grudges (消冤)** may be answered in the **Three Officials’ Bureau (三官之府)**. Relying entirely on the **Dao’s Compassionate Will (慈悲之愿)**, I pray they may all journey together to the **Land of Dao and Virtue (道德之乡)**.

Furthermore, I hope that those of the same platform may expound and extol the **teachings of the Dao (教典)**.

With this **offering of incense (一瓣香)**, I pay homage to the **Sacred Scriptures (法语)**. May it ascend to the **Three Realms (三境)**, descend to the **Nine Abysses (九幽)**, traverse the boundless **kalpas (浩劫)** and always reach its mark, ride the **Wheel of Retribution (圆轮)** and forever respond.

I now burn this incense in the **offering furnace (向炉)**, dedicating it to the departed soul of **Master So-and-so (亡过某人)**.

I humbly pray that their **imperfections and burdens (瑕累)** may be absolved, that they may **severely transcend earthly attachments (迥脱尘根)**, and swiftly ascend from the **Realm of Impermanence (有漏之乡)** to reach the **Shore of Non-Action (无为之岸)**. May their **true essence (真源)** rest in **profound stillness (湛寂)**, and no **law (法)** remain.

**Deluded thoughts (妄念)** scatter and **ten thousand entanglements (万缘)** arise. To **awaken to them (悟之)** is to transcend the **Great Transformation (大化)**, to be **unaware of them (昧之)** is to sink into the **Path of Delusion (迷途)**.

Moreover, this **floating and restless concern (浮爽之忧)** has not yet grasped the **essence of rebirth (返胎之旨)**.

Thus, the **Great Dao (大道)** pities the suffering of all beings, and **pledges the Sacred Talismans (盟真垂济度之章)**. A single thought of ascension is **hiddenly connected (潜通)** to the **spirit insects (肸蠁)**. The **clustered heavens (丛霄)** are vast and boundless, yet not even a **hair’s breadth (纤毫)** separates them.

I bow in gratitude for the **curved and encompassing grace (曲照之恩)** and feel indebted to the **favor of spirit guidance (迁神之惠)**.

I, **Certain Disciple (某式)**, follow the **plain talismans (素简)**, and am entrusted to the **mysterious officials (玄司)**. Having already received the **command to list the grievances (诉列之诃)**, I dare not neglect the **task of copying and presenting (誊陈之事)**.

Now, with the **hundred spirit officials (百灵司)** present and the **four qi (四炁)** clarified, I solemnly arrange the **rites (威仪)** and conduct the **scriptural rituals (章御)**. Though my **curtain of understanding (帷)** is but newly raised, how can it match the **prayers of the faithful (请祈)**? I still hope to join the **same stream (同流)** and together **manifest the wondrous responses (共彰妙感)**.

**Talisman of Refining and Ascending, Scripture of Proclaiming Precepts, Request for Answer (炼度说戒升座请答章)**

The **Daoist (道士)** pays three obeisances and kneels to speak:

We disciples have heard that the **Great Dao (大道)** expounds the **teachings of Compassion (慈悲之教)**, and all beings benefit from the **mercy of salvation (济度之恩)**.

Following the **Golden Rituals (金科)**, we solemnly present this **pure and solemn fast (浄醮)**. Now, the **True Immortals (真仙)** have descended to witness, and the **talismans and records (符录)** may be displayed.

The **blessings extend to the Three Paths (三途)**, and the **merits surpass the Nine Nights (九夜)**. We pray for the **bestowal of liberation (开度)** and the **rescue from your sinking (拔尔沉沦)**.

The **answer comes (答云)**: *"Jade Ancients (玉古)."*

The **Golden Precepts** reveal the **treasured talismans and sacred symbols (宝箓灵符)**.
The **Nine Nights and Three Paths** rely upon the **refinement of the soul and tempering of the spirit (度魂炼魄)**.

It should be entrusted to the **worthy adept (上士)**, not transmitted to the unworthy.
Yet, this humble servant—how dare I alone bear such a great request?

Again kneeling, I say:
The **Three Realms (三界)** descend in witness, my heart utterly sincere.
If the **talismans and talismanic rites (符箓)** are displayed upon the seat,
then the **sacred rites (灵仪)** truly rely upon this to ascend to Heaven.

I humbly decline with modesty—
how could I presume to pray so boldly?
Yet, I align with Heaven’s will and follow the hearts of all.

May you **pity the sinking souls of the Nine Nights (九夜之沉魂)**—
this is truly the **Daoist master’s compassion (道师之慈惠)**.
Since sincerity is certain to reach its mark,
I await the swift arrival of the **auspicious banner and flag (幢节)**.

**Answer:** *"We have heard that you act on Heaven’s behalf, benefiting beings and aiding humanity. This is because the Daoist’s worth is exalted and enlightened, fulfilling the hopes of all. Yet, our capacities are shallow and insufficient—how can we fulfill such requests?"*

Again kneeling, I say:
I have repeatedly submitted petitions to the Three Realms,
and the **feasts and seats (斋心)** have already been spread in the four directions.
With a heart as fervent as the heavens, I endure suffering and sorrow, awaiting your decree.

I humbly beseech the **Great Master of High Merit (高功大法师)**—
may your words flow like a spring, your virtue embrace the boundless.
Hasten the **auspicious flags (羽旆)** to descend broadly,
and proclaim the **sacred texts (灵文)** to bring wide salvation.

For the **Three Paths and Five Torments (三途五苦)**, may you grant the **mercy of rescue (拯拔之仁)**.
For the **stagnant spirits and lost souls (滞魄幽魂)**, may they truly rely upon the **blessings of ascension (超升之泽)**.

I am utterly devoted in my earnest prayers.

**Answer:**

The **Great Master** replies:

*"The **auspicious flags (羽旆)** have been summoned again and again with utmost sincerity and trust.
Since the **true and sacred (真灵)** has condescended to descend, how dare I, a humble and ignorant one, fail to report it?

By **virtue (义)**, I cannot refuse—
by **rites (礼)**, I must present it fully.
The **talismans and spells (符箓)** are solemnly prepared and placed upon the **jewel-axe (宝轴)**,
while the **souls and spirits (灵魂)** are refined and ascended at the **Crimson Peak (朱陵)**.

May the **Great Assembly (大众)** proceed first,
and I shall follow in their wake.

Now, I beseech the **True Master (真师)** to chant:

*'The Dragon Han [era] begins with the **auspicious laws (盟律)**,
through countless **aeons (劫劫)**, liberating **heavenly beings and humans (天人)**.
The **Sacred Treasure (灵宝)** opens its boundless enclosure,
ferrying across the **wheel of birth and death (生死轮)**.

This is the **Dao of Compassion and Mercy (慈悲道)**,
capable of reviving the withered and bringing honor to the decayed.
None but my **worldly teacher (世师)** could truly grasp the depths of the **dark and obscure (幽冥)**.
The **Sacred Treasure Scriptures (灵宝无量度人上经)** conclude in the **Great Law Volume (大法卷)**—the forty-eighth and forty-ninth.

**The Chapter of Descending and Summoning Talismans and Commands (降召符命品)**.

The **Imperial Sage (皇人)** declares:
*'There are wondrous courts (妙庭) of great splendor,
with golden gates and jade halls—
all formed by the **qi (炁)** of **Primordial Origin (元始)** and the **Sacred Treasure (灵宝)**,
natural patterns that govern the divisions of the ten thousand heavens.

For those who practice **Daoist discipline (行持)**—
if they establish the **Sacred Treasure Altar (灵宝坛)**,
they must inscribe the **True Summoning (真召)** and **Sacred Summoning (灵)** talismans,
to transform the altar grounds into the **golden gates (金阙)** and the **boundaries of the Daoist conduct (梵行之界)**,
then the rites may begin.

**The Talisman of the Highest Clarity’s Sacred Treasure Descending the True (上清灵宝降真符)**
**The Talisman of the Highest Clarity’s Sacred Treasure Summoning the Spirits (上清灵宝召灵符)**

Within these two talismans,
there are twelve **spirit officials (符吏)** overseeing the altar.
When inscribing, use the **Jade Purity Decisions (玉清诀)**,
and with the **three qi of the Heavenly Gate (天门三炁)**, blow the seals to complete them.

The **Mysterious Master (玄师)** says:
*'The **Primordial Sovereign’s (元皇)** talisman of the True and Sacred (降真灵符)**,
and the **Void Sovereign’s (虚皇)** talisman of Summoning the Spirits (召灵灵符)**,
are the natural chapters of the **three heavens’ mysterious and correct qi (三天玄正气)**,
to summon the **three primal assemblies of the Daoist spirits (三元众真)** and the **ten thousand spirits (万灵)**.

**The Talisman of the Highest Clarity’s Sacred Treasure Summoning the Heavenly Spirits (灵宝召天真符)**.

Those **heavenly spirits (天真)** who respond to the summons
must rely upon the **Primordial Sovereign’s (太上元始) Jade Edict (玉敕)**,
dissolving their forms as recorded above.

**The Heavenly Spirits’ Sacred Positions (天真圣位)**.

For those who lack **earnest faith (笃信)** in their studies,
the **Five Sacred Mountains (五岳)** will test them.
If they **leak the secrets lightly (轻露泄密)**,
the summoned spirits will not manifest.

All **Daoist spirits, heavenly beings, and sacred souls (三天仙真灵神)**,
must follow the talisman and appear before you.
Without **sacred texts (神文)**, this is a **false summoning (妄召)**.
Though one may **reflect deeply and strive diligently (精思苦彻)**,
a single misstep may be answered by a thousand trials.
Some who descend may **subject the recipient to demonic tests (魔试)**.

Those who receive the talismans
must follow the **Mysterious Capital’s (玄都) prescribed methods (赍格)**—
weave **three plain silk fabrics (三素缯)**,
according to the year’s measure (随年尺),
and bring them to the **teacher of the scriptures (有经之师)** to be inscribed.
Sit and **meditate upon them with the mind (心记)**,
but do not **write them down (载於文)**,
lest **ghosts, spirits, birds, or beasts (鬼神禽畜)** observe and **leak the secrets (切视漏泄)**.*'

The **Celestial True Ones**—
The **Divine and Wondrous True Person of Chen** (辰妙行真人),
the **Great True God of You** (酉至真大神),
the **God of Immortality Who Grants Life Without Death** (亥度人不死之神),
the **Lord of Southern Extremity, the Eternal Master** (申南极长生君),
the **Lord Good Life, the Venerable Master Han** (午好生韩君丈人),
the **Southern Celestial Overseer and Registrar of Fate** (离南上司命司录),
the **Venerous God of Extended Lifespan and Fateful Calculations** (延寿益算度厄尊神),
the **Great God of Endless Life Who Revives the Corpse and Grants Boundless Immortality** (寅卯丑离回骸起死无量大神未长生度世无量大神未),
the **Five Elders, Imperial Lords** (五老帝君),
the **Junior Marshals of All Heavenly Hosts** (中指下诸天丞相),
the **Jade Emperor’s Supervising God of Birth** (玉皇监生大神),
the **Three Officials of Zi** (子三官帝君),
the **Eight Heavenly Lords of the Eastern, Southern, Western, and Northern Quarters** (中亥子东方八天帝君, 南方八天帝君, 西方八天帝君, 北方八天帝君),
the **Master of the Eastern Dipper Who Governs Fate** (东斗主算君),
the **Record-Keeper of the Western Dipper** (卯西斗记名君),
the **Northern Dipper God Who Releases the Dead** (酉北斗落死君),
the **Southern Dipper God Who Bestows Life** (子南斗上生君),
the **Central Dipper’s Great Chief** (午中斗大魁君),
the **Central Five-Star Magical King** (中指中青天魔王),
the **Red Heaven Magical King** (卯赤天魔王),
the **White Heaven Magical King** (午白天魔王),
the **Black Heaven Magical King** (酉黑天魔王),
the **Yellow Heaven Magical King** (子黄天魔王),
the **Central Ten-Thousand-Unity Lord** (中指中千和万合君),
and the **Four-Fingered Departure from the Netherworld** (四指中过离至卯).

The **Great Lord of Eternal Life** (长生大君),
the **Celestial and Formless Prince of Zi** (子玄无英公子),
the **White Primordial Venerable God of Chen and Chou** (寅丑白元尊神),
the **Grand Fate Overseer, the One of Perfection** (巳未太一司命君),
the **Lord of Peach Blossom and Harmonious Extension** (酉桃康合延君),
the **Bearer of Talismans and Scriptures** (辰巳执符把箓君),
the **Guardian of Life and Root of Fate** (子丑保命生根君),
the **Central Five-Qi Harmonizing Lord** (大指中中理五炁君),
and the **Central Mixed Hundred Gods Lord** (中指中混合百神君).

---
**Summoning Talisman for Celestial Officials and Ministers**
*(君吏圣位)*

**God of Divine Command** (神公受命君),
**Universal Sweeper of Inauspiciousness** (普扫不祥君),
**Eight-Powered Spitter of Poison** (八威吐毒君),
**Fierce Steed of Four Directions** (猛马四张君),
**Heavenly Ding as Vanguard** (天丁前驱君),
**Great Marshal with Banners** (大帅仗旛君),
**Flame-Hurler Across Ten Thousand Li** (掷火万里君),
**Flowing Bell of Eight Directions** (流铃八冲君),
**Golden Axe of Preemptive Slaughter** (金钺前戮君),
**Mighty Heavenly Executioner** (巨天后刑君),
**Butcher of Ghostly Corpses** (屠割鬼爽君),
**Unceasing Wind and Fire** (风火无停君),
**Thousand-Thousand Beheader** (千千截首君),
**Ten-Thousand-Thousand Severer of Forms** (万万剪形君),
**Bright Inspector of Ghostly Camps** (明检鬼营君),
**Golden Horse Relay Station** (金马驿程君),
**Primordial Cavern’s Jade Calendar** (元洞玉历君),
**Mixed Cavern’s Vermilion Text** (混洞赤文君),
**Deployer of the Five Classics** (敷落五篇君),
**Lord of Vermilion Script and Jade Characters** (赤书玉字君),
**Eight-Powered Dragon Text** (八威龙文君),
**Rotating Dipper and Basket** (旋斗历箕君),
**Opener of the Eight Gates** (上开八门君),
**Flying Heavenly Law Wheel** (飞天法轮君),
the **Great Magical Kings of the Desire Realm** (欲界大魔王),
the **Great Magical Kings of the Formless Realm** (无色界大魔王),
the **Great Magical Kings of the Form Realm** (色界大魔王),
the **Conductor of Demonic Spirits** (束送妖精君),
the **Beheader of Ghostly Hosts** (斩馘鬼锋君),
the **Imperial Decree to Earthly Spirits** (敕制地祇君),
the **Passage Lords of All Heavens** (历关诸天君),
the **Universal Herald of the Three Realms** (普告三界君),
the **Soul-Guiding Lord of Zhu Ling** (魂度朱陵君),
the **Reformed and Reborn Lord** (受炼更生君),
the **Dissolver of All Inauspiciousness** (消诸不祥君),
and the **Recommender to the Celestial Immortals** (保举上仙君).

All these **ministerial lords** are under the **jurisdiction of the Law Department** (法部之驱使).
When invoked by their divine titles,
**pray to the Heavenly Registrars** (念诸天校录),
**until the Heavenly Lords descend in audience** (至诸天临轩).

---
**Summoning Talisman for the Ten-Directional Flying Heavenly Kings**
*(召十方飞天神王符)*

The Master says:
*"The Ten-Directional Flying Heavenly Kings possess supreme **virtue and power** (威德),
their **achievements and strength** (功力) are profound,
and their sacred transformations are beyond comprehension.
At the dawn of the **Red Brightness Eon** (赤明劫),
within the **Floating Dust Realm** (浮黎国),
when the **Celestial Registries** (图校录) were first established,
they received the command of the **Primordial Most High** (元始至尊)
to oversee the **records of the Three Realms and Ten Directions** (三界十方一切图录),
measuring the **lightness and heaviness of sins and virtues** (罪福轻重),
and chronicling the **depth and shallowness of merits and offenses** (功过浅深).
According to their **destined stations** (随方量品),
they **transcend the limits of the boundless** (无极度人).

Each has **ten-directional flying attendants, officials, and soldiers** (十方飞天使者吏兵),
with **hundreds of millions of chariots and cavalry** (亿乘万骑).
All who **venerate and revere them** (兆能崇重尊仰敬奉)
shall, in matters of **delivering the living and rescuing the dead** (度生救死),
dispatch **flying heavenly messengers** (飞天使者) to petition the **Divine Kings** (神王),
begging for **salvation and deliverance** (乞行救度).
Write the **location in vermilion** (朱书方位),
and according to the matter, **annotate below** (各随事注於下).
Wear, swallow, burn, or affix as **amulets for suppression** (吞佩烧服贴镇),
and **immediate divine response** (立获神应) shall be granted."*

The Master says:
*"The methods of invocation and service are governed by **secret edicts** (密旨).
**Guard against reckless disclosure** (慎无妄泄),
for transgression shall bring **calamity and retribution** (犯之必至殃考).*

On auspicious days, select ancient *Feng* wood (枫) and craft a **Nine Palaces Plate** (九宫盘).
Six inches square, inscribe the **Eight Trigrams of the Nine Palaces** (九宫八卦),
erecting **upper and lower palaces** (上下二方) within the central palace.
Use **three unrefined colors** (三素之色) for the **embroidered silk** (彩缯).

If one desires to use *Ping* wood (栢) to make a **Divine King Position Tablet** (神王位牌),
round in face, one inch or so in diameter,
commence the invocation from the **first day of the month** (初一日).
For all matters of **salvation and deliverance** (度),
write their words in **vermilion** (朱),
cast into the **rectangular direction** (直之方),
and **immediate divine response** (响应) shall be granted.

**No matter is beyond its efficacy** (无所不治),
**no matter is beyond its service** (无所不服),
**no matter is beyond its reach** (无所不至),
**no matter is beyond its deliverance** (无所不度).

On the **first, eleventh, and twenty-first days** (初一、十一、二十一),
the **Eastern Divine King** (东方神王) descends.
On the **eighth, eighteenth, and twenty-eighth days** (初八日、十八、二十八),
the **Southern and Northeastern Divine Kings** (南方、东北方神王) descend.
On the **fourth, fourteenth, and twenty-fourth days** (初四、十四、二十四),
the **Western Divine King** (西方神王) descends.
On the **fifth, fifteenth, and twenty-fifth days** (初五、十五、二十五),
the **Northern Divine King** (北方神王) descends.
On the **third, thirteenth, and twenty-third days** (初三、十三、二十三),
the **Southeastern Divine King** (东南神王) descends.
On the **sixth, sixteenth, and twenty-sixth days** (初六、十六、二十六),
the **Southwestern Divine King** (西南神王) descends.
On the **seventh, seventeenth, and twenty-seventh days** (初七、十七、二十七),
the **Northwestern Divine King** (西北神王) descends.
On the **ninth, nineteenth, and twenty-ninth days** (初九、十九、二十九),
the **Upper Divine King** (上方神王) descends.
On the **tenth, twentieth, and thirtieth days** (初十、二十、三十日),
the **Lower Divine King** (下方神王) descends.

The Master says:
*"All shall follow the **Divine King’s descending day** (神王下降直日) for use,
and the **direction of the Divine King’s jurisdiction** (所主之方) shall be the same as the **direction of divine response** (神应之方).
Minor matters need not be invoked;
only major matters may be applied to **Daoyuan** (朝元),
all under the **Divine Kings’ guidance and pathfinding** (开道引前)."*

**Ritual of the Flying Heavenly Treasure Platform** (飞天宝台之式):
**Talisman-dispersion form** (符散形),
**Imperial Edict** (敕) invoking the **Ten Directions’ Limitless Flying Heavenly Divine Kings and Immortals of Longevity** (十方无极飞天神王长生大圣),
commanding them to **descend in unison** (齐驾降临).
Write the **year, month, and day with full Daoist titles and surnames** (年　月　日具法衔姓),
and the **talisman of invocation** (其符召).

**Invocation of the Ten Directions’ Flying Heavenly Divine Kings** (遣十方飞天神王咒):

**Eastern Limitless Flying Heavenly Divine King** (东方无极飞天神王忽),
jurisdiction over **Yanzhou** (兖州).
Invoke with **Zhen script** (震文),
the **sent-forth incantation** (遣咒) reads:
*"Seven stillnesses of Dao’s birth (七静道生),
seven visions of non-birth (七观无生),
**Yuan Shi** (元始) contemplates the body,
**Feng Chen** (飞晨) enters **Xuan Zhen** (玄真).
Eastern **Divine Sage** (神圣),
holding the **Imperial Edict without pause** (秉敕无停).
Swiftly, as the **Supreme Daoist Legal Edict** (灵宝大法律令)."*

**Southern Limitless Flying Heavenly Divine King** (南方无极飞天神王飞),
jurisdiction over **Yangzhou** (扬州).
Invoke with **Li script** (离文),
the **sent-forth incantation** reads:
*"**Ling Du** (灵都) of nine passages (九通),
**wan qi** (万炁) intermingling at the center.
**Divine Edict** (神敕) descends once,
none dare disobey.
Swiftly, as the **Supreme Daoist Legal Edict**."*

**Western Limitless Flying Heavenly Divine King** (西方无极飞天神王云),
jurisdiction over **Yuzhou** (豫州).
Invoke with **Dui script** (兑文),
the **sent-forth incantation** reads:
*"**Xian Si** (仙司) oversees all records,
**Yu Bao** (玉宝) resides in the void.
**Divine Edict** (玉敕) descends once,
none dare disobey.
Swiftly, as the **Supreme Daoist Legal Edict**."*

**Northern Limitless Flying Heavenly Divine King** (北方无极飞天神王无镜),
jurisdiction over **Jizhou** (冀州).
Invoke with **Kan script** (坎文),
the **sent-forth incantation** reads:
*"Establish **Yuan** (元) in **Xuan Xu** (玄虚),
**Jimo** (寂妙) enters the **non-being** (无).
**Divine Edict** (神敕) shatters and subdues,
**Yun** (雾) flees like clouds at the crossroads.
Swiftly, as the **Supreme Daoist Legal Edict**."*

**Northeastern Limitless Flying Heavenly Divine King** (东北无极飞天神王梵),
jurisdiction over **Qingzhou** (青州).
Invoke with **Gen script** (艮文),
the **sent-forth incantation** reads:
*"**An Yang** (安阳) flourishes with **Ling** (灵),
**Bao Huang** (保黄) safeguards the **flying groups** (飞群).
The **rectangular talisman’s command** (直符所制),
all **ten thousand gods** (万神) respectfully listen.
Swiftly, as the **Supreme Daoist Legal Edict**."*

**Southeastern Limitless Flying Heavenly Divine King** (东南无极飞天神王那),
jurisdiction over **Liangzhou** (梁州).
Invoke with **Xun script** (巽文),
the **sent-forth incantation** reads:
*"**Jiang Li** (绛力) conceals its subtlety,
**Tai Zhen** (太真) holds the **Xuan Zhu** (玄珠).
The **Imperial Command’s summoning** (敕命摄制),
**wind horses** (风马) gallop in haste.
Swiftly, as the **Supreme Daoist Legal Edict**."*

**Southwestern Limitless Flying Heavenly Divine King** (西南天极飞天神王度仙),
jurisdiction over **Xingzhou** (刑州).
Invoke with **Kun script** (坤文),
the **sent-forth incantation** reads:
*"**Kong Ji** (空寂) radiates at dawn,
**Han Jing** (含景) holds the **Yu Xu** (玉虚).
The **talisman’s command** (符命所遣),
none dare **conceal or store** (运储).
Swiftly, as the **Supreme Daoist Legal Edict**."*

**Northwestern Limitless Flying Heavenly Divine King** (西北无极飞天神王玃无),
jurisdiction over **Xu Zhou** (徐州).
Invoke with **Qian script** (乾文),
the **sent-forth incantation** reads:
*"**Xian Si** (显德) oversees all,
**Jing Fan** (静梵) enters **Xuan Ying** (玄英).
The **jade talisman’s command** (玉符一下),
none dare **linger or halt** (留停).
Swiftly, as the **Supreme Daoist Legal Edict**."*

**Upper Limitless Flying Heavenly Divine King** (上方无极飞天一神王瑛),
jurisdiction over **Yongzhou** (雍州).
Invoke by **striking the middle finger downward** (中指甲下),
the **sent-forth incantation** reads:
*"**Yuan Gai** (圆盖) of the **Law Wheel** (法轮),
**Fu Bo** (扶搏) radiates **Qian** (乾).
The **jade talisman’s command** (玉符一敕),
directly **constructs at the Imperial Court** (直造帝前).
Swiftly, as the **Supreme Daoist Legal Edict**."*

**Lower Limitless Flying Heavenly Divine King** (下方无极飞天神王落),
jurisdiction over the **Five Prisons, Netherworld, and Ming Tao** (五狱地府冥曹).
Invoke by **striking the middle finger** (中指中),
the **sent-forth incantation** reads:
*"**Yue Du** (岳渎) and **Cang Ming** (沧溟),
**Zong Chong** (宗崇) reveres the **Divine Edict** (灵敕).
The **jade talisman’s command** (玉符所遣),
what **pardon** (赦) dare not **obey** (遵)?
Swiftly, as the **Supreme Daoist Legal Edict**."*

**General Invocation of the Ten Directions’ Divine Kings** (总召十方神王咒) reads:
*"**Tong Xuan** (洞玄) **Zong Xian** (宗先),
**Ling Zhi** (灵枝) of **Yuan** (元).
**Tai Yi** (太一) **Left Scribe** (左史),
**Yùqi** (御气) flies through **smoke** (飞烟).
**Yong Yong** (雍雍) **Kan Kan** (侃侃),
**Bao Fu** (褒服) **Fēi Xiān** (飞仙).
In an instant, **ten extremes** (十极),
oversee **ten thousand heavens** (万天).
**Āluónàyì** (阿褴那易),
**Póbùzhǎn yán** (婆步昙延).
**Yuǎn luò nàgū** (远落那顾),
**Chéngmìng yùchén** (乘命玉宸).
Entrust the **attendants at the altar** (侍坛),
to **proclaim and deliver** (宣化度),
as **law and register** (如律如编)."*

**General Sent-Forth Incantation** (总遣咒):
*"**Āluónàyì** (阿褴那易),
**Pólián póbù** (孛连婆步).
**Dáluò zhǎn yán** (达落昙延),
**Jué lún nàgū** (厥沦那顾).
**Jì zhāng fēichí** (赍章飞驰),
with **clouds and mists** (以云以雾).
**Long zhào bǎo huán** (龙召宝环),
**xuē jiǎn zhèng wù** (削简正误).
**Cuò zì wéi zhèng** (错字为政),
**luò zì wéi zhù** (落字为注).
**Wú lìng shàng guān** (无令上官),
**diǎn zhě qiǎn qù** (典者遣去).
The **Ten Directions’ Divine Kings** (十方神王) respond,
each **leading heavenly soldiers and cavalry** (领天兵万骑),
capable of **communicating with the Ten Directions** (通信十方),
**summoning all immortals** (招及群仙),
**seizing and executing dark demons** (收斩阴魔),
**subduing and taming ghostly generals** (制伏鬼师).
**Do not invoke recklessly** (不可妄遣)."*

**Ritual for Summoning All Gods to Return** (召集万神启还符具还无叙玄品):
**Invoke the Nine Yin Talisman** (召九阴符):
*"**Sù Huá** (素华) **Yin Jing** (阴精),
**Chen Yao** (晨耀) unites with **He Ming** (合明).
**Hun Ming** (混冥) **Tai Zhen** (太真),
**Hui Fan** (回反) **Tāi Yīng** (胎婴).
**Qīng Yāo** (青腰) **Yu Nǚ** (玉女),
**Fēi Xiāo** (飞霄) **Yǔ Qún** (羽裙).
**Right Attendant at the Imperial Pavilion** (右侍帝轩),
**all demons bound in form** (群魔束形).
**Follow my harmonious script** (随我熙篇),
**lift and safeguard souls** (提摄魂灵).
**Clasp blessings and gentleness** (袭庆柔顺),
**settle and pacify the Imperial Court** (安镇帝廷).
Swiftly, as **law and decree** (如律令)."*

「**Invoke the Nine Yang Talisman** (召九阳符):
Nine Yang Godly Dharma (九阳神梵), **Yuan Jing** (玄景) **Jing Ying** (晶英).
**Zhen Guang** (真光) **congeals and coalesces** (凝结), **returning and transforming** (反易) **Tāi Yīng** (胎婴).
**Tai Hua** (太华) **Golden Boy** (金童),
**oversees all celestial constellations** (总统天星).
**Follow the talisman to drive and command** (随符驱役), **guard and merge** (侍卫合并).
**Repel evil and dispel filth** (辟邪去秽), **crush and annihilate demonic spirits** (摧灭妖精).
**Divine talisman proclaimed below** (灵符告下),
**harmony with Dao, eternal life** (与道长生).
Swiftly, as **law and decree** (如律令)."

**Right talisman** (右符) **on yellow paper with vermilion script** (黄纸朱书),
**Left hand** (左手) **invokes the Heavenly Emperor’s Secret** (上帝诀), **Tian Men Qi** (天门炁).

---

**Talisman of Jade Purity** (玉清符):
*"When the **Jade Purity Talisman’s script** (玉清符文) reaches its place,
**All gods gather in response** (万神咸从)."*
**Right talisman** (右符) **on yellow paper with vermilion script** (黄纸一朱书),
**Jade Purity Secret** (玉清诀),
**Middle finger** (中指) **with the Central Scripture of Yuan Shi Zu** (中文元始祖炁),
**blown into the talisman** (吹入符中).

---

**Talisman of High Purity** (上清符):
*"When the **High Purity Talisman’s script** (上清符文) reaches its place,
**All gods respectfully follow** (万神敬从)."*
**Right talisman** (右符) **on yellow paper with vermilion script** (黄纸朱书),
**High Purity Secret** (上清诀),
**Middle finger** (中指) **with the Upper Scripture** (上文).
**Divine Essence of Lingbao** (灵宝真炁) **blown into the talisman** (吹入符中).

---

**Talisman of Supreme Purity** (太清符):
*"When the **Supreme Purity Talisman’s script** (太清符文) reaches its place,
**All gods respectfully heed** (万神敬听)."*
**Right talisman** (右符) **on yellow paper with vermilion script** (黄纸朱书),
**Supreme Purity Secret** (太清诀),
**Middle finger** (中指) **with the Lower Scripture** (下文).
**Supreme Purity Hun Yuan Qi** (太清混元炁) **blown into the talisman** (吹入符中).

---

**Talisman of the Upper Realm** (上界符):
*"**Postal Dragon and Celestial Officials** (驿龙骑吏) **race forth with fiery urgency** (星奔火冲)."
Swiftly. **Right talisman** (右符) **on yellow paper with vermilion script** (黄纸朱书),
**Middle finger** (中指) **with the Central Scripture** (中文), **Tian Men Qi** (天门炁).

---

**Talisman of the Middle Realm** (中界符):
*"**Shaking Earth and Mounting Heaven** (播地撼山),
**Direct the talisman’s mighty forces** (直符威兵)."*
Swiftly. **Right talisman** (右符) **on yellow paper with vermilion script** (黄素朱书),
**Middle finger** (中指) **with the Central Scripture** (中文), **Di Hu Qi** (地户炁).

---

**Talisman of the Lower Realm** (下界符):
*"**Imperial Spirit’s Edict and Command** (帝灵敕命),
**Imperial Spirit vanishes into the waters** (帝灵没水)."*
Swiftly. **Right talisman** (右符) **on white paper with vermilion script** (白纸朱书),
**Middle finger** (中指) **with the Central Scripture** (中文), **Dou Qi** (斗炁).

---

**Talisman for Directing the Day Official** (日直功曹符):
*"**Jade Emperor’s Sacred Power** (玉帝灵灵), **ascending to the Three Purities** (上彻三清).
**Direct the Day Official** (直日功曹), **hasten to descend with urgency** (疾速降临).
**Jade Purity’s Edict and Command** (玉清敕命),
**Edict summoning all spirits** (敕召众灵).
**Above connects to the Limitless** (上通无极), **below penetrates to the Dark** (下彻幽冥).
**Seize demons and capture ghosts** (收魔摄鬼), **daring not to linger** (不敢久停).
**Supreme Edict and Command** (太上敕命), **fiery urgency to descend** (火急降临).
Swiftly, as **law and decree** (如律令)."*

**Right talisman** (右符) **on yellow paper with vermilion script** (黄纸朱书),
**taken from the Day’s Secret** (搯本日诀), **seized from the Hour’s Qi** (取本时炁),
**Edict incantation** (敕咒曰):
*"**Mysterious Official of Jade Scripture** (玄曹玉文), **established for merit-making** (立功之官).
**Oversees High Purity** (主治玉清), **reports to the Three Heavens** (奏报三天).
**Heavenly Emperor has command** (上帝有敕), **rapidly dispatch divine light** (速下神光).
**Respectfully summon the Official of this Day** (谨召某日功曹), **by decree swiftly arrive** (依律速至).
Swiftly. **The Three Five Messengers** (三五使者), **Direct Day Talisman soldiers** (直日符兵),
**Merit-making Officials** (功曹走吏),
**hearing my summons, hasten like clouds** (闻吾呼召，急急如云).
Swiftly."

---

**Talisman for Summoning the Local Deities** (召当界土地符):
*"**Buoyancy of Heaven** (乾天精灵), **Seven True Yuan Jun** (七真元君).
**Five Dou Hua Gai** (五斗华盖), **entwined around my form** (缠络我形).
**Body adorned with Seven Stars** (身佩七星), **flowing golden fire bells** (流金火铃).
**Illuminating all directions** (照彻十方), **penetrating to the distant and dark** (洞及杳冥).
**Universal proclamation to the local deities** (普告当境，土地正神).
**Demons dare not trespass** (魔无干犯), **ghosts dare not act mischievous** (鬼无妖精).
**Sever their heads ten thousandfold** (千千截首), **mutilate their forms a hundred thousandfold** (万万剪形).
**If they remain still, there will be blessings** (安则有庆), **if they move, there will be no life** (动则无生).
**Local deities, each preserve peace and security** (土地正神，各保安宁).
Swiftly, as **law and decree** (如律令)."

---

**Talisman for Summoning the Community Deities** (召社神符):
*"**Mihàn Yīpàn Zhà** (讫埵弥泮咤)."*
**Right talisman** (右符) **for all matters** (凡有事系),
**summon the Five Mountains and their officials** (召五岳岳吏使之).
**When inscribing the talisman, take the Gen Scripture** (搯艮文),
**recite the incantation seven times** (念咒七遍).
**To summon the City’s Inciting Deity and the Community’s Order** (欲召城惶社令应土地典者),
**all employ this method** (皆用此),
**take the Kun Scripture below** (搯坤文於其下).
**First inscribe the name** (先书名), **then use the talisman to summon** (次以符召).
**This talisman was once used to summon the South昌 Community Elder** (此符昔尝召南昌社伯), **and it proved effective** (用之验).

---

**Talisman for Dismissing Demons Before Presenting Petitions** (命魔前袪符):
*"The **Imperial Official** (皇人) says:
**When submitting petitions and offerings** (夫拜表上章),
**and paying respects to the True and the Emperor** (朝真谒帝),
**one should first, at the altar steps** (宜先於坛陛),
**burn the talisman for dismissing demons before presenting petitions** (焚命魔前袪之符),
**to clear the path** (开通道路)."*

*"**When guiding the deceased soul** (夫度亡魂),
**also use yellow paper with vermilion script** (亦以黄纸朱书),
**seven inches wide, nine inches long** (阔七寸，长九寸),
**sealed with Qing Yao** (青腰封),
**take the Heavenly Emperor’s Secret and inscribe it** (搯上帝诀书之),
**draw the Lingbao Zu Qi through the talisman** (取灵宝祖炁贯注符中),
**while the Five Emperors’ Great Demon Hand holds the banner of the dismissed demons** (脊五帝大魔手执命魔之旛),
**leading and guiding as they proceed** (引导而行),
**passing through the Three Realms** (经过三界),
**all gods dare not detain or delay them** (万神不敢拘留)."*

---

**Secret Incantation for Dismissing Demons Before Presenting Petitions** (牒命魔杀鬼前袪符吏):
*"**Imperial Official’s Secret Incantation** (命魔密咒) says:
**The Imperial Official** (皇人) says:
**Whenever this incantation is recited** (凡诵此咒),
**one should face west-north** (当面西北),
**harbor the Qi of the Nine Heavens** (存九天之炁),
**manifest the nine-colored light** (化九色之光),
**descend and pour over the body** (降灌兆身),
**forming a perfect circle** (而成圆象),
**illuminating all directions** (光映十方)."*

*"Then **inhale the Qi and Mysterious Light** (吸炁玄光入口),
**swallow the saliva nine times** (咽液九过),
**knock teeth nine times** (叩齿九通),
**and harmonize the Qi** (而通炁).
**Bow twice** (再拜),
**visualize the Yuan Shi Tian Zun descending in golden light from the void** (想元始天尊降於空玄之中)."*

*"Then the incantation reads:
**Yellow Central Scripture Qi slays the demonic sect** (黄中策炁斩祆宗),
**detect and subdue the powerful demonic spirits** (察制强精断邪翁).
**Supreme has command, Supreme’s Residence** (太上有命太上房),
**hasten to summon the Northern Emperor to the Jade Palace** (急召北帝诣玉宫).
**Receive and uphold the威令, proclaim to the Demon Lord** (受承威令宣魔主),
**the Five Qi roiling and clashing with the Command** (五炁蓊郁与命冲),
**concealed within the Jade Scripture’s square** (秘藏玉文方就隆).
**The Three Heavens’ illumination, the Six Heavens’ termination** (三天运明，六天运终).
**Worthy are the virtuous** (贤者哉).
**From the *Lingbao Yushi Reniao Jing*** (出《灵宝玉符人鸟经》)."*

*"Upon completion of the incantation,
**harbor the Yuan Shi Tian Zun descending in golden light** (存元始天尊降金光),
**entering from the crown of the head into the body** (自顶门而入兆身),
**reaching the Vermilion Palace** (至于绛宫),
**forming the Elixir of Golden Liquid** (结成金液之丹),
**light filling the eight extremes** (光充八溢),
**inner and outer radiance clear** (内外莹明),
**all gods respectfully listen, the Three Realms stand revealed** (万神敬听，三界廓然),
**then withdraw by plucking the middle finger** (然后挑中指中而退)."*

*"**Secret Incantation for Clearing the Path** (执符开通道路密咒曰):
**Yuan Shi** (元始) **ascends and leads** (登引), **Heavenly True Great Deity** (天真大神).
**Supreme Sage of High Worth** (上圣高尊), **Mystic Conduct True Person** (妙行真人).
**Ten Directions of the Limitless** (十方无极), **Great Deity of Ultimate Truth** (至真大神).
**Tilt the light and return the chariot** (倾光回驾), **oversee the True and guide life** (监真度生).
**All-Heavenly High Officials** (诸天丞相), **South昌 Imperial Pavilion** (南昌上宫).
**Han** (韩) **Chief Record-Keeper** (司主录), **Overseer of Life’s Great Deity** (监生大神).
**Holding the divine tablets and registers** (执箓把籍),
**all assemble before the Emperor** (齐到帝前).
**Follow the guidance of the departed** (随所应度),
**strictly inspect all Heavens** (严校诸天).
**Universal proclamation to the Three Realms** (普告三界),
**Limitless Deity’s Sacred Domain** (无极神乡).
**The Domain of Springs and Curves** (泉曲之府), **Northern Capital of Luo Can** (北都罗酆).
**The Three Officials and Nine Registries** (三官九署), **the Twelve River Sources** (十二河源).
**Ascend to absolve ancestors** (上解祖考), **countless eons of kindred relations** (亿劫种亲).
**Swiftly erase the register of sins** (疾除罪簿),
**annihilate the roots of evil** (落灭恶根).
**Dare not detain or delay** (不得拘留),
**forcefully merge with the demonic throngs** (逼合鬼群).
**Yuan Shi’s Talisman Command** (元始符命),
**elevate at the appointed hour** (时刻升迁).
Swiftly, as **the Supreme Long-Life Emperor’s decree** (如长生大帝律令)."*

*"Recite three times,
**take Tian Men Qi and blow one breath onto the talisman** (取天门炁一口吹符上),
**and strike the incantation** (弹诀).
Then **take the Scripture for Breaking Filth** (再搯破秽诀),
**burn the talisman at the Ghost Gate** (烧符於鬼门上)."*

「Again, the incantation states:
**Yuan Shi’s Talisman Command** (元始符命),
**elevate at the appointed hour** (时刻升迁).

Master Zhang Wanfu said:
Before **the Celestial Venerable** (天尊) expounded the **Scriptures** (经), the **demon kings of the Three Realms and Hundred Worlds** (诸天三界魔王), the **Great Demons of the Five Emperors** (五帝大魔), all were the **ancestral deities of ten thousand spirits** (万神之宗), commanding the **hosts of ghosts**, roaming the **vast heavens**, and calling themselves **Heru** (赫奕), matching the **Celestial Sovereign’s** (天) achievements in power, wielding **menacing influence and malevolent poison**, afflicting and tormenting the multitudes.

Both men and women, through **prayer and ritual offerings** (祷祝鼓舞), sought to **honor and revere** them with **awe** (以敬畏迎).

After **the Celestial Venerable** expounded the **Scriptures**, the **hundred demons were subdued** (百魔伏化), and **the Divine Official** (神公) received his command, sweeping away all **inauspicious omens** (不祥), so that **demons dared not trespass** (魔无干犯) and **ghosts dared not manifest as fiends** (鬼无妖精). Once the demons were subdued by the **Celestial Venerable’s holy transformation** (天尊圣化), they became **the lofty saints of the Hundred Worlds** (诸天上圣), **the True Ones of Wondrous Practice** (妙行真人), leading the **celestial chariot** (策驾) and **pioneering the Dao** (前驱), sweeping away dust and opening the path.

Thus, when the **saints** (众圣) wish to **ascend to heaven** (进天), they first recite the **demon kings as pioneers** (前驱策驾) in their **ritual invocations** (念).

The **Scripture** says:
*"The Demon King reverently accepts his duties,
therefore he is able to **pay homage to the Celestial Sovereigns** (朝诸天)."*

Thus, the **practice of transcending the mundane** (步虚) requires first **contemplating the command to subdue demons** (存思命魔).
Here, the **threefold invocation of the commanded demons** (三朝命魔) is complete—all as Master Zhang Qingdu has spoken.

Master Zhao Dao Sheng revised the **Yellow Arrow Ritual** (黄箓仪), believing that **internal affairs end with the midday invocation of the commanded demons** (午朝命魔), as it was based on the **original Zhenghe Golden Arrow Ritual** (本政和金箓).
This is where his understanding faltered; it is not the **intent of the Scripture** (经旨).

**Sacrificial Offering and Invocation to the True Lord of Dark and Mysterious** (玄武祭祝章)
The **imperial subject** (皇人) says:
**The Dark and Mysterious** (玄武) is the **manifestation of the Primordial Dark** (玄元之化身), embodying the **two celestial lodges of Xu and Wei** (抱虚危之二宿), and merging the **two essences of water and fire** (合水火之两精). His voice **resonates through the Nine Heavens** (声振九天), and his might **subdues the demonic legions** (威降魔部).

For those who **practice Daoist discipline** (行持之士), when they **pay homage to the True Lord** (朝真望阙), entering **serenity and focusing their spirit** (入靖存神), they all invoke the **Dark and Mysterious Deity** (玄武之神) through the **sacred talisman of spiritual communion** (通灵符), perform the **Daoist ritual** (法箓), and **drive away pestilence** (驱除瘟), **slaying malevolent demons** (剪灭邪魔). If their **devotion and practice are sincere** (察其行道之心纯), they will be **recommended to the Jade Emperor** (保举於玉帝).
With **pious hearts**, their offerings and invocations are never in vain.
This is the **companion talisman** (从将者) within the **Soul-Treasure Dao** (灵宝法).

**The Invocatory Scripture** (祝文)
**The Celestial Hearer is humble** (天听甚卑), yet **heeds all spoken words** (有言而必察).
**The Divine Mirror is near** (神鉴不远), so that **no wish remains unfulfilled** (无愿而不成).
When **the horn moves, the palace responds** (角动角而宫应宫),
and **when sincerity is felt, virtue summons virtue** (诚感诚而德召德).
Even if **the wicked fast and bathe in purification** (虽恶人斋戒沐浴),
their **devotion to the Emperor is sincere** (事帝惟恭).

For the **uninitiated**, their **Dao is shallow and their injuries swift** (夫末学道浅疾伤), yet they **gain blessings through incense offerings** (行香获福), **reverently petitioning the Celestial Venerable** (仰启玄天大圣), and **taking refuge in the Northern Pole Deity** (依皈北极之神).
They **draw upon the radiance of the sun** (禀日光) to **form their bodies** (生形),
and **absorb the essence of yin** (含阴精) to **receive their substance** (受质).
They **nurture the spirit** (生神灵),
and **cultivate courage and vigor** (长勇猛),
**solely dedicated to Daoist practice** (惟务修行),
**assisting the Jade Emperor** (辅玉帝),
**beheading demons and fiends** (斩妖魔),
**thus saving all beings** (斯救群品).

He **wears the purple robe and golden belt** (佩紫袍金带),
**rides upon the Azure Tortoise and Vermilion Serpent** (履苍龟巨蛇),
**whose sword’s light pierces the void between Xu and Wei** (剑光射虚危之间),
**whose spirit-qi divides the Wu and Qi regions** (神炁冲吴齐之分).
**The Six Ding spirits** (六丁) **escort him before** (前拥),
**the Eight Sha spirits** (八煞) **follow him behind** (后随).
He **commands all spirits** (神统万灵),
**dominates the Five Great Mountains** (威镇五岳),
**soars through the heavens and overturns the earth** (腾天倒地),
**pulls lightning and races through the clouds** (掣电奔云),
**shatters demons and fiends** (破碎妖魔),
**scatters malevolent ghosts and thieves** (飘荡鬼贼).
All **hundred spirits obey his command** (百灵咸遵戒令),
and **minor ghosts dare not reveal their forms** (小鬼不敢现形).
Thus, **the people suffer no untimely deaths** (人民无横夭之尤),
and **the land enjoys peace and prosperity** (家国有安宁之庆).
All **petitions are answered** (所祈必应),
and **all responses are communicated** (有感咸通).

I, **the humble subject**, am fortunate to **participate in the Great Dao** (参大法),
**receiving the sacred chapter of the Soul-Treasure Dao** (受灵宝之玄章).
**Wearing the seal and performing talismans** (佩印行符),
I **follow the celestial decrees of the Primordial One** (应天元之节度).
I **establish this ritual altar** (建兹坛陛) to **ward off filth and evil** (秽恶侵凌),
and **invite your luminous spirit** (舍尔灵明) to **temporarily reside here** (叨啖有室).
It is **not through false reliance on the power of the deities** (非假威神之力),
but **how else could I attain such ease and joy** (曷为逸乐之方)?

At this **auspicious hour of descent** (式逢下降之辰),
I **specially present these offerings** (特启供陈之礼).
I **humbly hope** (仰冀) that your **divine light shines upon us** (神光晖映),
that your **holy power subtly permeates** (圣力潜通).
May **the spirit not become a ghost** (神不鬼) and **the ghost not become a spirit** (鬼不神),
May **the righteous not be confused with the wicked** (正不邪) and **the wicked not be mistaken for the righteous** (邪不正).
May you **fulfill all just petitions** (克应有求之愿),
and **dispel all unjust calamities** (潜消无妄之灾).

Thus, **peace and governance flourish** (即使靖治兴隆),
and **the demon kings tremble in fear** (魔王畏惧).
I **earnestly seek to record my merits** (早着功勋之籍),
and **quickly attain the Great Dao’s accomplishments** (速成大道之功).
I **bow my head and kneel twice** (臣稽首再拜).

**Summoning the Jade Talisman of Dark and Mysterious** (召玄武玉符)
**The Five Blessings descend, the Six Truths are established** (福德立降玄真六字).
This talisman **invokes the Block of Kan** (搯子文), and the incantation is:
*"The **Brahma Path** (梵行) **pervades the Ten Directions** (诸天), encircling all **worlds** (十方).
**The Boundless Great Deity** (无量大神) **all originates from my body** (皆由我身).
I **command this talisman**: wherever it goes, **the Dark merges with the Mysterious** (混玄合冥).
**Swiftly, swiftly, as the decree** (急急如律令)."*

**Sacrificial Offering and Invocation to the Northern Pole** (供侍北辰祭祝章)
I **reverently hear** (恭闻) that before **the Great Ultimate was divided** (太极未分),
**the Three Talents were set aside** (舍三才) to **encircle the One Qi** (周一气).
Once **the Two Principles were distinguished** (两仪既判),
**the Seven Governors were aligned** (齐七政) to **balance the Four Seasons** (均四时).
The **Lunar Lodge of the Great Dipper** (斗极) **was positioned in the Central Heaven** (运斗极於中天),
and the **celestial stations were arranged beyond the constellations** (布星躔於象外).
**The stars were assigned to govern transformations** (分司阐化),
and the **Northern Pole was established to uphold heaven** (立极承天).
The **Eight Kings** (八王) are the **ancestral deities of the myriad worlds** (万汇之宗),
and the **Seven Saints** (七圣) are the **forebears of all beings** (众生之祖).
They **command the qi of the seventy-two seasonal divisions** (总七十二候之炁),
and **govern the twenty-eight lunar mansions** (运二十八宿之司).
They **rotate the Dipper Enclosure** (旋转斗垣),
and **circuit the earth’s track** (周临地轨).
They **serve as the celestial chariot’s wheels** (为车而调理纲纪),
and **bow to the Pole** (拱辰) to **regulate the cosmos** (统制乾坤).
Their **words and tongues are the messengers** (喉舌是司),
and they **hold the pivot and mechanism** (枢机是握).
They **demonstrate the time indicated by the stars** (示魒星之所指),
so that **the Four Seas know the seasons** (四海知时).
They **observe the radiance of the star-qi** (观罡炁之有辉),
and **all Eight Extremes are blessed** (八纮咸福).
The **Three Celestial Enclosures harmonize in color** (三台齐色),
and the **Nine Spirits align in light** (九炁同光).
They **hold the celestial balance above** (掌天上之机衡),
and **determine the calamities and fortunes below** (定人间之祸福).

The **Han Emperor Ming** (汉明帝) **gazed upon their luminous guidance** (仰瞻光范),
and **Master Zhang** (张天师) **received the true Scripture** (参受真经),
**establishing the Mysterious Dao in the dusty world** (立玄教於尘寰),
and **liberating the common folk from the worldly net** (脱凡愚於世网).
Even more so, **all living beings** (动植) **have refuge here** (实有依皈).

I, **the humble subject**, **reverently practice the Great Dao** (恭行大法),
**salvaging and guiding those living and dead** (济度存亡).
If I **do not rely on the rotation of the Two Dippers** (不藉二斗之回旋),
or the **sequential order of the Kan and Li stars** (运坎离之逆顺),
I **could not complete the Daoist practice** (欲成道法).
I **owe it all to the Celestial Balance** (全假璇衡).

I **humbly encounter this hour of descent** (伏遇下降之辰),
and **specially prepare the offerings of lamps and candles** (特具灯烛之供).
I **humbly hope** (伏冀) that the **Seven Stars observe and judge** (七星垂鉴),
and that the **cloud-chariot temporarily departs from the Pivot of the Heavens** (云軿暂离於枢霄).
The **Two Emperors** (二帝) **greatly descend** (丕临),
and their **feathered chariots rest upon the ritual platform** (羽驾权驻於坛墠).
They **record the names of the living** (注上生籍),
and **erase the names of the dead** (勾落死名).
The **true qi of the Seven Elements** (七元之真炁) **constantly replenishes** (常充),
and the **spirit lords of the Five Zang organs** (五脏之神君) **each preserve their domain** (各保).
I **early gain the Dao of True Constancy** (早获真常之道),
and **quickly cultivate the wind of purity** (速成清净之风).
I **bow my head and kneel twice** (臣谨稽首再拜).

**Summoning the Jade Talisman of the Northern Dipper** (召北斗玉符)
**Silently invoke the Four Characters of the Celestial Balance** (默运璇玑四字).
This talisman **invokes the Block of Kan** (搯子文), and the incantation is:
*"The **Celestial Balance and Jade Talisman** (璇玑玉衡),
**halt all wheels at once** (一时停轮).
**Wielding the talisman and grasping the ritual** (执符把箓),
**we all align before the Emperor** (齐到帝前)."*

Thousand harmonies unite, ten thousand merge in truth—
naturally attaining the Real.
**Swiftly, swiftly, as the Supreme Gem’s Grand Legal Edict commands.**

**Summoning the Chapter of the Body’s Spirit**
The Mystic Master says:
All who recite the sacred texts,
offering repentance and beseeching grace,
must thrice daily at midday honor the Mystic.
At every Daoist practice,
offer incense at the six solar hours.

The three daily offerings are:
at sunrise, noon, and sunset.
Other rituals follow their own methods.

The six solar hours are:
midnight, dawn, meal-time, noon, feeding-time, and dusk—
the six yang hours.
The so-called six-hour incense offerings
are precisely these six times.

The incense ash must not be from hearth-fire,
for it contains hidden dragon dung—
a great taboo of the Dao.
Instead, use pine or cypress branches,
burned to ash and stored in a furnace.
To achieve fierce flames and abundant fragrance,
let the smoke rise in one surge—
sincerity ascends with it,
untainted by lingering haze.

If reciting, let the smoke be unbroken,
a continuous thread.
Within the burning incense,
avoid pungent vegetables, gamey meats,
bitter herbs, or creatures with shells or fur—
lest you profane the Celestial Worthies.

The Supreme Extremity Immortal often mixes willow and bamboo ash
with mallow stems and leaves, pounded into blocks,
with a touch of sweet osmanthus—
and it lacks nothing.
This incense not only lights swiftly,
but burns long—
neither fading nor smoldering.
Used abundantly, it blazes fiercely;
used sparingly, it lingers.

The Immortal also often takes ancient vine roots,
washed in clear springs,
dried in sunlight,
then mixed with greenwood incense and *Scrophularia ningpoensis*,
pounded and burned—
purifying impurities, attuning sincerity,
summoning the Celestial Worthies and inviting the Immortals.
No harsh or pungent fumes may be used.

The method of burning incense:
calm the mind, focus intent,
single-minded in devotion.
Do not turn back to the smoke—
contain the *qi*, steady the breath,
and silently pray as you bow.
The principle of heart-bowing:
lest the Nine Palaces tilt,
keep the body upright,
bending only as the heart directs.

The sovereign of the body lies in *shen* and *qi*.
When *shen* and *qi* align,
the True is communicated, the Mystic reached.
If *shen* wanders and *qi* is carved away,
how shall the gods respond to prayer?
Much less when the body’s Gem is whole,
for the soul resides in the *shen*—
thus, heart-bowing is *shen*-bowing.

The *Lingbao* Five Talismans’ Secret Sequence
contains a method to summon the gods.
This is the foremost of ten thousand Dao,
the first of all methods.

Its practice is on days:
*Jiazi*, one’s birth-day,
the second and sixteenth of the month,
and the last day—
five times monthly.
Enter the Chamber of Tranquility,
purify the heart and mind,
delight in simple foods and pure drink,
offering eight kinds of fruit alone.
Face east, sit upright,
gather the heart, still the *qi*,
settle the breath, calm the spirit for a time,
then offer incense three times,
and strike the teeth twenty-four times.

The incantation:
*"Dan Yuan True Person, Tai Yi True Person,
Tao Kang True Person, Tai Guang True Person,
You Jing True Person, Shuang Ling True Person,
Mei Shen Heavenly Spirit, Nao Shen Yuan Xian,
Ding Shen Dong Wang, Er Shen Jiao Nü,
Mu Shen Ying Ming, Fa Shen Chang Shou,
Bi Shen Tong Ling, Kou Shen Dan Zhu,
She Shen Dan Huang, Chi Shen Wei Shi,
Hou Shen Hu Bin, Jian Shen Yu Ling,
Shou Shen Yun Yin, Xin Shen Hou Hou,
Gan Shen Lin Lin, Fei Shen Zhu Zhu,
Qi Shen Yu Lu, Wei Shen Zu Zu,
Pi Shen Bi Bi, Shen Shen Piao Piao,
Dan Shen Huo Huo,
Dan Tian Shen Cang Jing,
Da Chang Shen Tuo Tuo, Xiao Chang Shen Liang Liang,
Yang Shen Qiong Ying, Yin Shen You Ling,
Bi Shen Yin Yin, Xi Shen Ou Ou,
Yao Shen Kong Nan, Zu Shen Xuan Yuan,
Da Li Tian Ding."*

Call them three times:
*"You who dwell within my body,
take your seats before, behind, left, and right,
each in your proper place.
Today is a lucky day—
we sacrifice to you.
Eat and drink to your fill,
drink until drunk, feast until sated,
and stop only when satisfied."*

After the prayer,
imagine a hundred or so spirits as if they were real,
and bow to them in greeting,
offering food and drink until satisfied.

Again, the incantation:
*"You who are now drunk and full,
rejoice without end.
On lucky days, when summoned, you will come.
On ordinary days, do not leave me.
All future fortune and misfortune,
report them to me one by one.
I know my body harbors you,
and you know my sorrows.
If there are immortal elixirs,
bring them to me and take them from me.
Let me share my food with you.
Nurture all living things until the kalpa’s end.
Now return to my body,
each to your domain."*

**Swiftly, swiftly, as the Edict commands.**

The Mystic Master says:
Know before it happens,
die in the body and ascend to the Primordial,
transcend to the True—
this is the priority.
After ten sacrifices,
you may converse with the spirits.
After a hundred sacrifices,
you may attain the elixir of immortality,
golden pills, and spiritual mushrooms—
food and drink both complete.

A single leak of this teaching
wastes ten years of effort,
rendering your own practice ineffectual—
**guard it carefully, do not transmit it recklessly.**

*The Lingbao Scripture of Boundless Salvation for All Beings*
*Upper Volume, Great Method, Scroll Forty-Nine*
*The Lingbao Scripture of Boundless Salvation for All Beings*
*Upper Volume, Great Method, Scroll Fifty*

**The Chapter of the Illuminating Lamp Breaking the Prison**

Take the fire of the **Great Sun**.

The Mystic Master says:
In the past, the Ancestral Master spoke of the *Three Primordial Edicts* and the **Illuminating Lamp Method**—this is the most solemn and weighty of all teachings.
Yet when the **Dark Obscurity** is pierced by a single light,
all torments cease and all sufferings are stilled;
the iron prison is boundless,
but with illumination, its gates swing open.

The **Yellow Edict Method** comprises the nine rites of the **Nine Abyssal Offerings**, including the **Returning Radiance Wheel Lamp**, the **Nine Canisters of Divine Light**, and the **Nine-Prison Lamps**.
It dispels the darkness of eternal night,
illuminates the sufferings of the **Three Paths**,
borrows the **Daoist Sage’s** wisdom and power,
and shares the **Highest Saint’s** radiance and glory—
piercing the cold bars,
universally opening the **Netherworld’s** soil.

At the start of the **Illuminating Lamp** ritual,
the **Dharma Master** writes the **Palm of Illumination** with cinnabar,
first at **midday**, reciting the **Returning Radiance Divine Incantation**,
using the **Sun-Mirror** to capture the **Great Sun’s** true *qi*,
and lighting a single torch before the **Celestial Sovereign’s** image.

At night, the **Great Dharma Master** and the two **Attendant Lamp Masters** stand before the image,
perform nine prostrations,
and strike their teeth nine times.
They pray for the **Yellow Edict Offering’s** intent,
then perform nine more prostrations.

The **Great Dharma Master** kneels long,
whispers the **Divine Incantation of the Lamp’s Illumination** three times,
strikes his teeth three times,
holds the talisman,
and with the *qi* of the **Sacred Image**, blows upon the talisman,
before the **Celestial Sovereign** to request the lamp’s light.

Advancing three steps,
the two **Attendant Lamp Masters** again request the light before the **Dharma Master**,
forming three torches,
then proceed to distribute the lamps to the **Three Abodes**.

When the ritual concludes,
they grasp the remaining torch and combine it into one,
the **Great Dharma Master** holding the torch before the image,
performing nine prostrations before retreating.

Thus, the **Illuminating Lamp’s** light shines through the **Netherworld’s** darkness,
and the **Dark Obscurity**’s beings attain liberation through its opening.
