From [native place], along with household members [names],
Submits this plea with sincere intent.

「Humbly, it is for the departed certain one, whose lifespan was but [X] years, [Y] months, [Z] days, and [W] hours, born at [time]. Yesterday, in the year [X], month [Y], day [Z], at [time], he passed away at [location] and was interred at [burial place]. Deeply concerned for the spirit’s lingering consciousness, yet to fulfill its natural course in life.

Now, upon reaching the [specific Daoist festival or memorial date], with utmost sincerity, we have meticulously prepared the **Ten Methods of Offering** (十方法信) at [location] and invite [number] Daoist priests to [location], to solemnly establish the **Supreme Yellow Arrow Great Fast** (無上黃箓大斋), spanning [X] days and nights.

We beseech Your Reverence to perform the **Pure and Bright Funerary Rites** (浄醮) for the departed [name], to atone for his sins and transgressions, and to bestow merit upon the living and the dead. May Your Reverence also extend Your compassion to those enshrined in the **Hall of the Departed** (升度門), to our ancestors, descendants, and kindred spirits, and to all beings in the **Six Realms** (六趣) and **Three Realms of Suffering** (三涂), the **Nine Abysses** (九幽), and **Five Paths** (五道), as well as to the spirits of the netherworld, the lingering souls, and the solitary shades. Through the power of virtuous causes, may all ascend to the **Daoist Celestial Realm** (仙界).

With sincere devotion, we humbly submit this petition to the **Law Position Masters** (法位法師). May Your Reverence, in Your boundless compassion, grant this request and, according to the prescribed rites, perform the ascension and salvation.

We dare not presume upon Your favor, awaiting Your divine edict.

**Closing Words:**
In the year [X], on the [Y]th day of the [month], [day of the Heavenly Stem and Earthly Branch cycle], residing in [surname] [given name]’s household of [native place], we have purified ourselves in fasting and piety, bowing twice with utmost reverence. We now address the **Venerable Master of the [Daoist Sect] Sect** (某洞法師先生).

Mindful of the **Dao’s vital breath** (祖炁) and its primordial origins, all things return to the **Cosmic Covering** (覆被). The **Dao’s source** (道源) first emerged, and its transmission flows through the **True Orthodox Lineage** (真宗). Indeed, the **Highest Learning** (上学) is profound, and those who deeply grasp the **Mystic Profound** (重玄之教) are worthy of this invocation.

We earnestly pray that Your Reverence, who embodies the **Pure Dao**, penetrates the **Void of the Heart** (虚寂), and comprehends the **Three Mystic Caverns and Four Auxiliary Teachings** (三洞四辅), serves as the **Teacher of the Ten Directions and Three Realms** (十方三界之師), and opens the **Gate of the Dao** (户牖於玄门) as a **Vessel of Salvation** (舟航於苦海) across the **Sea of Suffering**. Both mortals and deities revere Your **virtue** (德), and the hidden and manifest alike receive Your **grace** (恩).

We humbly hope that Your Reverence, moved by boundless compassion, will descend upon this **Daoist Assembly** (道场), accepting our offerings and performing the rites. Through **divine intervention**, may the **Three Realms and Ten Directions** (三界十方) be illuminated, and Your commands bestowed in **sacred talismans** (符), to rescue the souls from the **Nine Abysses** (九泉) and extinguish their suffering. May the **Auspicious Clouds** (庆云) descend endlessly, and the **Spiritual Wind** (灵风) gather, so that the departed’s remains dissolve into mist.

Thus, the spirits of the departed may receive their due and attain the **Fruit of Ascension** (登真之果). Further, we hope that all **Six Paths of Consciousness** (六道) and **Nine Mystic Realms** (九玄) may achieve **Liberation** (解脱), reaching the **Shores of the Mysterious and Remote** (希夷之岸). Our reliance upon Your guidance is profound; our words, though inadequate, are offered with utmost sincerity. We humbly pray, awaiting Your favor.

**Invocation:**
As the **Highest Master** (高功) ascends to the **Sacred Platform** (升座), the **Assembly of the Law** (法众) stands in order, and the **Ritual of the Hall** (启堂法事) begins, the disciple submits his words and concludes. The **Highest Master** then presents the incense and intones the prayer:

*"Within the **Floating World** (浮黎国内), amidst the **Jade Capital Mountains** (玉京山中), for countless aeons the **Vital Breath** (炁) has congealed into mist, and countless beings have attained **Sincere Communication** (通诚达信). The **Root of the Soul** (根盘) lies beneath the **Cynomorium Forest** (骞林), while the **Auspicious Radiance** (瑞蔼) fills the **Boundless Void** (太虚空). The **Sacred Incense** (宝香) burns in the **Golden Furnace** (金炉), and all beings in the **Three Realms and Ten Directions** (三界十方) bow in reverence.*

*"With incense burning, holding the talisman, we now present our plea:*
To supply the **Three Pure Ones** (三清) and the **Three Realms** (三境), the **Ten Extremes** (十极) and **Ten Directions** (十华), the **Supreme Ultimate Truth** (無上至真), the **Daoist Scriptures** (道经), and the **Ten Thousand Spirits and Ten Thousand Truths** (千灵万真) with the **Yellow Arrow Sacred Rites** (黄箓宝斋), invoking the **True Sovereign** (真宰) to respond with grace.

We pray that You, **riding the Dragon and the Phoenix** (骖龙驾凤), **walking upon the Void** (步虚), descend to this **Daoist Assembly** (道场), witnessing our **meritorious deeds** (功德) and aligning with the **Mystic Profound** (奥妙同元).

For the **One Ultimate Truth** (一真) yet to be fully revealed, its **statutory origin** (布机) stems from the **Three Primordial Breaths** (三炁). The **Doctrine of the Absolute** (寂寂至无之宗) and the **Natural Transformation** (荡荡自然之化) were born from the **Primordial Sovereign** (象帝), hidden within the **Void of the Mystic Caverns** (空洞之中). **Primordial Beginning** (元始) unfolded the **Five Classics** (五篇) in the **Azure Clouds** (碧落), while **Mystic Cavern** (洞玄) revealed the **Ten Degrees of Perfection** (十度) in the **Original Chapter** (本章).

The **principle of eternal generation** (生生之义) is boundless and inexhaustible. The **source of transformation** (化化之源) is nameless and unfathomable. It governs the **opening and closing of the Two Primordial Forces** (两仪), enabling all things to be **transformed and perfected** (化成). Its **virtue** (德) is inherently benevolent, standing alone in the **Way of Everlasting Generation** (常生之道). Its **merit** (功) is without end, for who can comprehend the **True Sovereign’s** (真宰) **mystic designs** (筌)?

The **Dao is beyond naming** (非常道), and its **name is beyond naming** (非常名). It does not abandon mortals nor does it forsake the myriad things. From the **Three Sovereigns** (三皇) onward, the **Dao and humanity were whole**. By the **Five Emperors** (五帝), the **Dao withdrew from humanity**. As **human deceit prevailed** (人伪胜), **Heavenly Principle** (天理) perished, and **illusionary realms** (幻境) obscured **enlightened awareness** (觉性). Unable to preserve life yet clinging to the **Spirit** (神), mortals further strayed from the **True Dao** (本真) and adhered to falsehood.

Life and death arise from this **mechanism** (机), and all beings return to it. **Right mindfulness** (正念) is obscured by **greed, anger, and delusion** (喜怒贪嗔), while the **True Dao** (真常) is abandoned for **dream and illusion** (梦幻泡影). Thus, beings invite their own **ruin** (死坏) and depart from their **original nature** (本真).

Mortals are not spared the **ghostly retribution** (鬼责) of their sins, as the **blades of ice and frost** (雪刃霜锋) strike without mercy. The **flaming fires of the Hell Realms** (炎炎烈火狱) and the **chilling pools of the Cold Hills** (峨峨丘寒池) await them all, born from a single **errant thought** (一念). Their cries of lamentation know only the **inevitability of karma** (宿命).

Yet the **Body of Salvation** (救苦化身) remains unmet, and the **grace of the Supreme** (霈恩) does not reach them. Their **sins persist** (众罪), and their **suffering knows no end** (流吹不息).

Only the **Supreme Sage** (太上) can rescue them by the **hair’s breadth** (拔领), spreading the **Yellow Arrow Scriptures** (黄箓之文) and establishing the **Bright Daoist Precepts** (明真之典). With the **Five Phoenixes and Eight Cranes** (五凤八鸾) as Your chariot, You seek salvation in the **Ten Directions**. With the **Nine Dragons and Two Tigers** (九龙二虎) as Your talismans, You open the **Six Paths of Rebirth**.

You transform the **Cloudy Ford** (云浦) into the **fermented rice of the Snowy Fields** (雪腴之醴), and dissipate the **fiery veils** (火翳) into the **Spiritual Light of the Sacred Treasure** (灵宝之光). The **Sword Trees** (剑树) are felled, and the **Boiling Cauldrons** (镬汤) still the waves. You summon all **netherworld officials** (阴冥之主吏), who obey Your **sacred rites** (济度之科条).

The **Three Realms** (三界) all submit in devotion, and all beings rejoice. When the **Nine Volumes** (九卷) are complete, the **Spirit of the Beautiful and Radiant** (丽华) is liberated. When a single soul is saved, the **Northern Emperor** (北帝) requests further supplication. This is the **Supreme Cause** (无上之缘), yielding the **inestimable Fruit** (难量之果).

Indeed, from the **Primordial Sovereign** (元皇) onward, the **Dao’s transformations** (敷化) have unfolded, and the **sages have transmitted its teachings** (列圣流通)."

「The *Sutra* is divided into thirty-six sections, yet the **Great Rite of Salvation** (黄箓) takes precedence in saving souls.
The **fasting ranks** (斋列) span seventy-two degrees, but the **Yellow Rite** (黄箓) alone stands supreme.

The **Daoist sage** (葛左玄) received the **Great Cavern’s Essence** (大洞之旨), while **Zhang Jing** (张静应) restored the **Orthodox One’s Scriptures** (正一之文).
The **Dao’s origins** (源) branch into myriad schools yet flow boundless and unobstructed, while its **teachings** (法) unfold through sutras and traditions, continuous and unending.
Not only does it encompass **universal merit** (功德) of vast breadth, but it also upholds **forbidding precepts** (禁戒) with solemn authority.

No mere **sincere devotion** (丹诚) suffices—it must be **single-minded and pure** (惟一惟精)—for the **Yellow Rite’s Grand Framework** (大范) cannot be perceived or witnessed by the unworthy.

Now, I, **Official of the Yellow Rite Great Fast** (黄箓大斋官), having taken refuge in the **Ten Extremes** (十极), humbly petition the **Three Heavens** (三天), bearing **filial piety and reverence** (先思孝) to extend salvation across countless generations, and through fasting and merit-making, to bestow blessings upon all **virtuous souls** (群爽).

I present **embroidered silk** (纹缯) with meticulous preparation, and hold **sacred vows** (质信) with grave solemnity.
I widely invite the **pure and tranquil** (清静之流), and establish the **Assembly of Illuminating the True** (明真之会), hoping to attract **worthy disciples** (上士) to propagate this **Great Dao** (大道).

Alas, I am but a **living corpse in the dusty world** (尘世行尸), a **novice of the Mystic Gate** (玄门末学), presuming to receive the **Ninefold Blindfolded Precepts** (九盲之戒), and to grasp the **Three Caverns’ Scriptures** (三洞之文). My understanding has yet to penetrate the **True Essence** (洞真)—how could I ever achieve such **perfection of form and spirit** (形神俱妙)?

My **virtue is shallow** (德惟翦薄), and I cannot make **heaven and earth unite in harmony** (天地同归).
Thus, I ought to be **cast aside and silenced** (隳肢体而黜聪明), to dwell in **mountains and marshes** (山林), and to sever all **worldly traces** (尘迹), lest I sully the **Dao’s sacred words** (丹词).

Yet, after the **fierce trials** (战灼), I now recognize the **depth of my devotion** (精虔之至), and dare not neglect the **sacred rites and precepts** (科简), praying to the **Azure Sovereign** (苍昱).

With **unwavering foolishness** (愚不转之心), I proclaim the **Dao’s effortless transformation** (无为之化).
How unlike **carrying mountains to cross the sea** (挟山而超海), or **severing cranes to mend ducks** (断鹤而绩凫)—such futile endeavors!

A **short rope cannot draw water from a deep well** (短绠不可以汲渊), and the **Great Framework** (大方) will surely scorn me.
Fortunately, the **karmic conditions** (因缘) are favorable, and I have been **guided by worthy teachers** (自翊赞得人), all of whom are **jewel tortoises of the Law Sea** (法海之元龟) and **master craftsmen of the sect** (宗门之大匠).

They **mutually uplift and inspire** (更相汲引), not disdaining even the **lowly and foolish** (凡愚).
Together, we shall **abide by the precepts** (受於戒言), striving to **fulfill the rites of sacrifice** (祀事).

Moreover, the **sacred rites and precepts** (科条) are fully recorded, with **merits and demerits clearly delineated** (功过悉分).
The **books of the Three Officials and Five Emperors** (三官五帝之书), the **registries of the Nine Departments and Four Offices** (九府四司之录), are **without omission or error** (毫分无失，纤芥不遗).
I dare not **overlook or slight** (简慢) these, lest I **destroy the blessings of my devout offerings** (隳荐修之福).

I must **pledge to heaven and earth** (盟告天地), **swear by the spirits** (质誓鬼神), and **pour forth my sincere heart** (罄丹心), harboring no **contrary thoughts** (异念).
I shall **make my merits shine in the sacred register** (功标丹简), allowing the **Seven Ancestors** (七祖) to **ascend to heaven** (生天), and **not let my sins bind me to the dark ledger** (罪结黑书), lest I **fall into the Nine Abysses** (九玄之堕地).

At the **moment of ascending the platform** (登坛之际), and at the **beginning of receiving my duties** (受职之初), all shall **hold fast to their vows** (秉誓言), and **submit to the Holy Judgment** (干圣鉴).

Now, the **fasting hall is solemnly prepared** (斋庄既肃), and the **pledge has been proclaimed to the heavens** (盟告云周).
With **jade pendants chiming** (佩玉锵锵), their sound **resonates across the Ten Directions** (见十方之振响).
In **majestic rites and dignified conduct** (威仪济济), I **invite the myriad saints to witness** (仰万圣以临观).
With **pure and unified resolve** (洁志同诚), I **raise the victorious rites** (举扬胜事).

The **Mystic Gate’s Rite of Salvation** (度亡玄局) begins: **Master of the Mystic Gate** (玄师) instructs,
*"Having accepted the sacred words* (既承投词), chosen a **auspicious site** (吉地), and selected a **propitious day** (卜日) to announce the fasting,
command all **kindred souls and like-minded disciples** (同志) to enter the **Pure Hall** (靖所) and fast in unison,
and to **pre-notify the Heavenly Expanse** (上穹), dispatching **sacred petitions** (修札) to the **Ten Heavens, Nine Earths, and Nine Provinces** (十天九地), without fail.

**Recite the sutra’s titles** (持诵经号), and **proclaim the rites and teachings** (敷宣科教).
**Burn incense and perform the fast** (行香修斋), **erect the platform and offer the tablets** (建坛贡章),
and **summon the spirits to manifest** (召摄视现).
**Issue sacred talismans and commands** (颁符命) to await **their responsive appearance** (感通),
for **merits are complete and spirits manifest** (功周幽显), and **names are inscribed in the Jade Pure** (名刊玉清).
All under heaven **hold gratitude for the virtue** (普天怀德), and **ascend swiftly on the appointed day** (克日飞升).

The **final injunction** (诀) is as follows:
The **words of acceptance** (投词) are the **pledge of the Yellow Rite disciples** (大斋弟子之词).
Their **intent must be filial, merciful, loyal, and upright** (孝慈忠直), **earnest and without selfishness** (恳切无私), only then may they be **granted salvation** (允度).

**Choosing an auspicious site** (吉地) means selecting **sacred mountains, Cavernly Heavens, or blessed lands** (名山洞天福地), **Pure Halls, Mystic Platforms, or Daoist temples** (靖庐玄坛宫观).
It must **not be a battlefield** (兵阵战场), **slaughterhouse, prison, or place of death** (屠坊刑狱), nor a **birthplace, grave, or defiled ground** (生产冢墓).
All other **pure and untainted lands** (秽恶之地) are considered **auspicious sites** (吉地).
It is **not permissible to begin** (开建) without one.

**Selecting a propitious day** (卜日告斋) must fall upon the **Three Elements, Eight Festivals, Five Sacrificial Periods, and Ten Rectifications** (三元八节，五腊十直), the **Three Assemblies’ Days** (三会之日), or the **auspicious anniversary of the departed** (亡灵七七周祥讳日).
It must also align with the **time of universal salvation** (普度之时), particularly on **Heavenly Grace Days** (天赦甲子), when the **sacrificial period, festival, or elemental cycle** (元腊节会) coincides.
Such days are **propitious** (吉日)—without them, the rites may not commence.

The **announcement of the fast** (告斋) marks the **initial resolution** (立意之初), **communicating with the Mystic Origin** (通达玄元).
The **day of beginning** (某日) is the **commencement** (始也).

**Kindred souls** (同志) are those who **share the same resolve** (志同).
**Kindred disciples and platform-mates** (同学上道) are those who **share the same teacher and platform** (同师同坛之友).

**The spirits of the Pure Hall** (靖所) are **both manifest and latent** (幽显).
If one is not **worthy**, the **harmonious qi** (和气) will not arise, and **they will not enjoy the merits of the rites** (有享功果).
From the **day of announcing the fast** (告斋之日) onward, one must **enter the Pure Hall** (入靖所), **avoiding all worldly affairs** (不交人事), and **fast for a hundred days, ninety days, forty-nine days, or thirty-two days** (对斋百日，九十日，四十九日，三十二日), as deemed appropriate.
The **duration of fasting** (量) should be **proportionate to the number of souls being saved** (所度亡者多寡), and the **extent of ritual preparation** (修文备事).
Do not **restrict the rites** (狭) for fear of **insufficient provisions** (阙), nor **expand them** (广) without proper cause.

**Seven days prior** (前期七日), one must **notify the Three Realms, Nine Earths, Ten Heavens, Ten Dao Paths, and the Nine Provinces, Northern Capital, and Netherworld Registries** (十天十道，九州北都冥府等).
At the **beginning of the fast** (告斋之始), one must **urge the karmic connections** (劝缘) of the **principal fast participants** (大斋之首), as well as those who **seek salvation for departed souls** (求度亡魂之家), and the **kindred disciples and platform-mates** (同志同学之人).
All must **fast and bathe in purity** (斋戒沐浴), and **recite the True Scriptures** (持诵真文).

The **True Scriptures** (真文) refer to the **sacred sutras, incantations, and titles** (荐拔亡魂经咒尊号) for **salvaging and elevating departed souls** (亡魂).
These include:
The **Great Cavern True Scripture** (大洞真经), the **Spiritual Treasure Sutra Collection** (灵宝诸经),
the **Nine Heavenly Divine Treasures’ Sacred Tablets** (九天生神宝章), the **Two Classics of Dao and Virtue** (道德二篇),
the **Yellow Court Jade Scripture** (黄庭玉经), the **Sutra of the Three Paths for Salvation and Nine Abysses for Liberation** (救苦三涂步虚九幽拔罪真经),
the **Sutra of the Sweet Dew Divine Incantations and True One** (甘露神咒真一等经),
and the **Divine Incantations of the Lingpan Heavenly Sage’s Illustrious Title** (琅函天尊睿号神咒).

**Three days before the rites commence** (开建前三日), one must **proclaim the fast’s intentions and teachings** (敷告修斋词旨), and **petition the Rectifying Yearly God** (关告直岁神君), the **Dragon Gods of Rain** (行雨主雨龙神), and the **local earthly deities** (里域土主).
One must also **invoke the City Deities, Mountain Gods, and Han Deities** (城隍山林，孟长汉真), as well as all **associated mountain officials** (属岳之司), and the **sacred lands of all Cavernly Heavens** (一切洞天福地), and the **celestial ranks of all spirit assemblies** (诸天仙曹等处).
Each must be **summoned and dispatched** (各召差神兵) to **guard the Daoist altar** (卫护道场), and to **banish malevolent and poisonous entities** (斥遂凶毒之物), **purifying and dispersing defiled qi** (浄荡秽恶之炁).

During **prolonged drought** (久晴之时), one must **ward against adverse winds and rains** (防虞风雨).
If **rain persists for too long** (久时阴雨), one must **seize the first clear day** (克日借晴).

Additionally, one must **select the most responsive spirits of the locality** (当境灵应), those **most revered by the people** (众人所钦之神), to **stand directly before the platform** (直坛) and **prevent and deter evil** (防非止恶).
This is to **warn away all non-Daoist demons and malevolent spirits** (警非道妖恶之众)."

On the night before the first day, at the hour of sunset, gather the Daoist disciples and ritual attendants at the site of the altar construction to rehearse the solemn rites and ceremonial decorum. At dawn, assemble the congregation and present yourselves before the Master of Rituals to request his ascent to the altar. Purify the altar of defilements, and from this point onward, conduct the rites for either seven days and nights, five days and nights, three days and nights, or one day and night—performing the Dao for three periods, offering incense six times, and reciting the scriptures ten revolutions. Proclaim the scriptural injunctions and admonitions, and in accordance with ancient rites, present the ritual petitions and tablets in proper sequence. Display the Five Directions’ sacred diagrams, invoke the trustworthy talismans of gold and jade as prescribed, and issue the imperial edicts and summons—all in strict adherence to the ritual laws, summoning and subjugating spirits to manifest their responses and demonstrate their efficacy.

After the fast is completed, with all hearts aligned and the ritual fulfilled, disperse the altar and offer thanks. Declare the merits achieved and duties fulfilled, with the Three Officials recommending you, the Five Emperors recording your name, the celestial hosts rejoicing, the Most High bestowing grace, and your rank ascending among the immortals. Your virtue extends to both the living and the dead, securing ascension to the heavens.

Should there be any deviation or error, no pardon shall be granted.

**The Sequential Rites of the Mystic Bureau**

The Mystic Master says: Since the Patriarch transmitted the ritual teachings and established the Great Fast, each has its proper order, all in accordance with the Mystic Bureau’s directives. For petitions, proclamations, and memorials—whether for the fast’s intent or requests for scriptural texts—they must all originate from the Great Master’s intent and be composed by his disciples. Do not rigidly adhere to outdated conventions, lest they confuse the sacred texts. Speak only what is scripturally verified; what is merely plausible but ungrounded in the Dao must not be codified within its laws. Over time, such deviations may proliferate, turning into customary norms—white stones mistaken for jade, semblances of truth without substance—thus tarnishing the purity of the Dao.

First, rehearse the ceremonial decorum. On the day before the altar’s establishment, prepare the site. At dawn on the appointed day, present the petition, request the Master’s ascent to the altar, and before the Nine Masters, submit the ritual tablets to the Mystic Bureau. The Six Officials shall present the Mystic Petition, receive their seals of office, and then proceed to the Three Treasures’ images to commence the incense offerings.

On the day the Dao is performed, first burn the pre-notification talismans within the altar to summon the Nine Provinces’ community orders, the Three Realms’ divine officials, the Five Peaks and Nine Provinces, the Netherworld’s Northern Capital, the local city gods and mountain spirits, the River Deities and Yearly Lords, the Rain-Dispelling Dragon Gods, and their attendant officers and guardian spirits. All must assemble beneath the altar to cease the rain and secure clear skies, as per the proclamation. Then, encircle and ascend the altar, offering the White Chariot and White Horse Tablet, the Road-Opening Tablet, and petitioning the Five Emperors and Four Officials of the Celestial Bureau, the Three Celestial Star Palaces, the Heavenly Tribunal’s Three Halls, the Ten Celestial Treasures of the Soul’s Jewel, the Southern and Northern Dipper Palaces of the Four Extremes, the Four Sage Teachers’ Offices, the Three Officials’ domains, the Five Peaks’ Life-Decreeing Deities, the Thirty-Two Heavens, the Purple Forbidden Enclosure’s Upper Palace, the Fire Celestial Palace of the Red Sky, the Double Celestial Palace of Bright Clarity, the Five Palaces of the Han Officials of the Red Sky, the Five Elders of the Eastern and Western Celestial Peaks, the Celestial Sovereigns and True Persons, and those who intervene in the Law—all must be systematically invoked. Proclaim the True Symbols for Saving Suffering and the Supreme Most High’s Edict of Pardon for Ascension to Heaven.

Having done so, declare the Dao’s ritual penance and recite the True Scriptures. At dawn, conclude the rites; at noon, perform the Dao again, petitioning the Three Heavens with white tablets, the Nine Heavens’ Treasures, the True Symbol for Breaking the Underworld’s Seal, and offering the Tablet for Breaking the Black City’s Path, while chanting the Ten Kings’ Rites.

In the evening, perform the Dao once more, proclaiming the Rites of the Boy Saints for Saving Suffering and Ascension to Heaven.

At the first watch of the night, perform the Dao outside the altar, issuing summons and petitions to subdue spirits and guide them to the altar, welcoming the departed souls for purification. Offer the Tablet for Washing and Refining, proclaim the Rites of Washing and Refining, summon the spirits to the Three Treasures’ presence to receive the talismans and take the precepts, return the souls to their proper forms, and recite the Ten Prayers with food offerings.

Next, extinguish the Radiant Wheel Lamps and the Nine Cauldrons’ Divine Lamps, proclaim the Nine Abyss Rites, and let the Master break the prisons. Then summon the Nine Underworlds and Six Paths for purification, followed by the unrestricted night fast, instructing and admonishing the spirits until complete. Welcome the souls to view their reflections and manifest their forms.

At the midpoint of the night, ascend the altar to perform the Dao, offering the Tablet for the Departed’s Transfiguration and practicing the Nine Refining Transformations into Immortality. Proclaim the True Symbol for Extracting the Souls from the Netherworld, the True Symbol for Ascending to Immortality and Extending Life, and the Long-Life Talisman. Summon the couriers of the underworld, read the Contract of Mutual Agreement, and proclaim the Rites of Release.

Next, pray at the Fire God’s Court, where fish and dragons are separated, and burn the memorial scrolls for the Reeds, the Enclosures, the Gourds, the Dragons, and the Boy Saints.

When the fast is complete, purify the altar and hold the grand ritual. Invoke the Five Directions’ sacred diagrams, offer the Tablet of Thanks for Grace, request permission to return to the Mystic Master, present the Red Tablet of Merit and Thanks, and pray for official appointment. Conclude the fast.

Such are the prescribed rites; none may be omitted or altered. Whether the fast lasts seven, nine, or fourteen days and nights, each must be conducted with meticulous precision, neither rushed nor delayed. Even a three-day fast or a single day and night must follow the proper sequence—any deviation disrupts the ritual order, confounding the sacred laws and inviting ridicule from the Netherworld’s officials. The Three Officials will record your transgressions, the Four Bureaus will investigate, and though you perform the rites, your merits will yield but a fraction of their potential. Scholars must therefore adhere strictly to these precepts.

The Five Elders’ original conduct is recorded in the *Three Revelations of the Yellow Talisman*; even they, having avoided the Underworld, much less those who personally practice the Great Teachings and universally save the souls of the Netherworld. If the fast is completed ten times, the blessings extend to the heavens and earth, the ten directions and three realms—immortals, humans, ghosts, and even flying creatures and armored beings—all benefit from your virtue. The Demon Kings will respectfully recommend you, the Most High will rejoice, the Three Officials will declare your merits, the Five Emperors will record your name, the Patriarch will bestow the Imperial Flying Talisman, and the Golden Gate will descend with the Red Flower and Feathered Palanquin. The Seven Ancestors will be elevated from the Northern Palace, and the Nine Mystics will be removed from the Register of Death. Your mortal flesh will transmute into the Dao, your form into the divine, and you will ascend to the heights of the Three Heavens. Having swallowed the Golden Elixir and donned the Immortal Talisman, you shall ride in thousands of chariots and tens of thousands of horses, ascending in broad daylight. The Three Heavens will grant you rank according to your merits.

One may attain the rank of **Upper Clarity True Person**, or ascend as **Upper Clarity Sage Lord**, or become **Left Marshal of the Supreme Polarity**. Only then will one attain profound enlightenment and universally rescue all beings without distinction—such virtue is the fruit of one’s deeds.

You must strive earnestly, exhausting your resolve to practice accordingly.

**The Ritual of Settling Trust and Dignity**

The Classic says: Ancient worthies were pure and sincere, embracing the Dao and nurturing virtue, neither covetous nor desiring, self-sufficient in all things. With sincere intent alone, they could achieve resonance—no need for wealth or treasures, harmonizing with the primal and true.

In the degenerate age, people are deceitful and false, valuing wealth above life, discarding their own existence for profit, harboring innumerable evils within while outwardly consorting with malevolent forces, leading to their inevitable ruin without ever awakening.

Thus, I decree the dispersal of such greed.

First, internal calamities will not arise; second, external calamities will not manifest. With inner and outer tranquility, all sufferings will be dispelled. Therefore, to pledge sincerity, one must prioritize wealth.

If wealth can be relinquished, the heart will follow. The virtuous and enlightened communicate with the unseen—according to one’s intent.

The lofty heavens and vast earth, the Mysterious Sage and Supreme True Ones—none can be attained without trust, none can be moved without sincerity. The attainment of resonance lies in trust itself.

Thus it is said: Those who study the Dao, bearing gold and jade, pledge their hearts to the heavens.

**Thirteen Gold Dragons**
Ten for the Ten Directions, three to be cast as per the ritual.

**Ritual Specification:**
The Son of Heaven, Empress, and Crown Prince use **Superior Gold**.
Officials of the Three Ranks and below use **Middle Gold**.
Those of the Nine Ranks and above use **Secondary Gold**.
Commoners use silver overlaid with gold.
Each measures **three inches and six divisions** in length.

The Dragon is the celestial courier, transmitting messages to the heavens. The Dragon’s mission comes first.
Carrying the tablet, it ascends to convey trust to the Three Officials and secures the altar to communicate sincerity to the Ten Extremes.
The method of Settling Trust begins with the Dragon.

**Omissions:**
If omitted, it will be reviewed by the **Yin Officials’ Bureau**.

**Eleven Segments of Settling Colors**
Ten for the Ten Directions, one for the Command of Trust.
East: nine **Azure Patterns**, South: three **Crimson Patterns**, West: seven **White Patterns**, North: five **Black Patterns**, Above: thirty-two **Emerald Patterns**, Below: thirty-two **Yellow Patterns**, and the **Central Yellow Patterns** twelve each—totaling **one hundred thirty-six**.
The Son of Heaven uses **match-length**, nobles **yard-length**, commoners **foot-length**.
The Command Pattern’s fabric: The Son of Heaven and nobles use **purple**, commoners use the **Five Phases’ natal sound colors**.
The match, yard, or foot length is determined by one’s natal command, with an additional unit to extend life’s trust.

**Ritual Specification:**
The Patterns symbolize the Five Phases’ hues, embodying the Ten Directions’ qi, descending to the Ten Heavens, reaching the Five Emperors, communicating with the True Ones and effecting sincerity, petitioning fate and invoking spirits—this must not be omitted.
If omitted, it will be reviewed by the **Heavenly Officials’ Bureau of Mysterious Capital**.

**Ten Sets of Ten-Directional Paper, Ink, Brush, and Inkstone**
Each direction uses **twelve sheets**.

**Ritual Specification:**
When establishing a ritual to practice the Dao, or to rescue countless ancestors and filial parents, or to petition blessings and grace, safeguarding against calamities and disasters—
The Four Departments and Five Emperors, the Three Realms and Ten Directions, will record virtuous deeds and examine transgressions.
One must use paper and brush to document merits and virtues, settling them across the Ten Directions—this must not be omitted.
If omitted, the Ten Heavens and Five Emperors will not record their merits, the Nine Tribunals and Three Officials will not absolve their offenses.
If omitted, it will be reviewed by the **Three Officials’ Bureau**.

**Ten-Directional Incense and Flowers**
**Ritual Specification:**
Incense is used to achieve resonance and dispel impurities.
Flowers are for their fresh purity, symbolizing auspiciousness and rarity, petitioning blessings and invoking the True Ones—incense and flowers are fundamental.
Incense should be **deer-hide paper** to descend the True Ones; flowers should be fragrant and wood-born.
If flowers are unavailable, use **five-colored cuttings** to settle the Ten Directions—this must not be omitted.
If omitted, it will be reviewed by the **Yin Officials’ Bureau**.

**Twenty-Four Thousand Candied Persimmons**
**Ritual Specification:**
Wealth is the means by which people sustain life—without it, existence cannot be established. People value wealth more than their lives.
Thus, the ritual requires wealth to pledge sincerity to the Heavenly Officials—this must not be omitted.
If omitted, it will be reviewed by the **Heavenly Officials’ Bureau of Mysterious Capital**.

**Two Pecks and Four Dou of Rice**
**Ritual Specification:**
Rice is the foundation of sustenance—people rely on it for life.
Thus, the ritual uses rice to pledge trust to the Heavenly Officials, augmenting one’s rank and blessings—this must not be omitted.
If omitted, it will be reviewed by the **Heavenly Officials’ Bureau**.

**Two Dou and Four Sheng of Oil**
**Ritual Specification:**
Oil belongs to the **Yin category**. Within Yin, Yang is generated—oil settles Yin while the Officials nourish the Yang light.
If omitted, it will be reviewed by the **Yin Officials’ Bureau**.

**Twenty-Four Jin of Charcoal**
**Ritual Specification:**
Charcoal belongs to the **Yang category**. Within Yang, Yin is generated—charcoal settles Yang while the Officials support the Yin qi.
If omitted, it will be reviewed by the **Yang Officials’ Bureau**.

**Three Wooden Tablets (Three-Sided)**
Each **one foot two inches long**, **two inches four divisions wide**, **two divisions thick**.

**Ritual Specification:**
Tablets are for **recording** and **declaring**. They record the world’s merits and declare an alliance with the Supreme True Ones, rectifying the upper and lower realms.
The Son of Heaven uses **jade**, which possesses the Nine Virtues, honoring the trust of Heaven and Earth.
Others use **mallow wood** or **camphor wood**.
Inscribe the **Five Phases’ celestial cycles**, the **state’s name**, the **year, month, and day of the ritual**, and the **master’s name**.
Cast them into **sacred mountains, caves, spirit springs, dragon caves**, or within the ritual altar.
Declare to the **Three Officials of Heaven, Earth, and Water**, making the ritual’s intent known and reporting to the higher realms.
If omitted, it will be reviewed by the **Earth Officials’ Bureau of the Nine Capitals**.

**Ten Jade Discs for the Ten Directions**
Each **two inches four divisions in diameter**, **two divisions thick**, hollow in the center.
Cast **three Dragon Discs**.

**Ritual Specification:**
Jade embodies **chastity and purity**, capable of pledging resonance with the Supreme True Ones—thus, it serves as trust.
If casting the **Dragon Tablet**, use **green silk and gold knots** to bind it.
Green silk symbolizes **sacrificial hair**, gold knots symbolize **blood libation**, declaring to the Three Officials.
The **Dragon Discs**:
- **Heavenly Officials’ Disc** is round,
- **Earth Officials’ Disc** is square,
- **Water Officials’ Disc** is six-lobed.

**Ritual of the Three Officials for the Ten Directions**
The **Son of Heaven** uses jade; nobles and officials below him use **zhi wood** instead.

If omitted, it will be reviewed by the **Earth Officials’ Bureau of the Nine Capitals**.

**Method for Casting the Three Dragon Tablets with Twenty-Seven Gold Knots**
Use **nine gold knots** to bind the **three Dragon Tablets**.
Each **Dragon Tablet** requires **twenty-seven knots**, each **nine divisions in diameter**, rounded on the outside like an **encircling band**.
The state uses **gold**; commoners use **silver or copper with gold coating**.

**Further, the Imperial Ritual for the Altar of the Ten Directions**
When constructing an altar for the **Ten Directions’ Celestial Worthy**, the **Five Sacred Mountains**, and the **Three Luminaries of the Water Realm**, adorn each with **embroidered silks of corresponding hues** and secure them with **jade discs and golden dragons**.
Additionally, inscribe the **Five Elders’ True Scriptures** on the **five directions**, displaying the **jade characters** openly, and solemnly pledge to all the **Heavenly Beings**, observing **threefold offerings** for mercy, repentance, and atonement.
Use **five sections of willow wood** and **square tiles** in the prescribed manner, binding them with **colorful silk** inscribed with the **Five Phases’ Qi** to secure them.
On the evening of the **Five Directions’ Altar Dissolution**, hang these at the **five directions**—thus, one may **ward off celestial calamities**, safeguard the **imperial mandate and cosmic cycles**, avert **poisonous harm**, and deliver the **myriad people**.
Then, **life and death depend upon it**, and the blessings are **inexhaustible**.

Use **five brushes**, **five inkstones**, **five tablets and inkstones**, **five sets of counting rods**, and **five hundred sheets of paper**, distributed across the **five directions**.
Divide **five stones of rice** as **luck rice** and **five thousand coins** as **life money** among the **five directions**.
Each paper is sealed and inscribed with:
- **Eastern Dipper** for calculating fate,
- **Southern Dipper** for granting life,
- **Western Dipper** for recording names,
- **Northern Dipper** for determining death,
- **Central Dipper** for recording virtues.

Further, carve **five wooden boy figures**, each holding a **zhi wood box** containing the **True Scriptures**, and burn them during the **Altar Dissolution Ritual**.
Alternatively, use **two stalks of teca grass** as **Dragon Banners**, with **two boy figures**—the left holding a long staff, the right grasping the **Dragon Cord**—to await the day of the **Altar Dissolution**, when they bind the **white tablet and command** with iron thread to the **Teca Dragons**.
Deploy the **two banners of Derivation and Return to Yellow** for the boy figures to carry.
The **Method** states: This is called **"Teca Dragon Carrying the Body"**—a **wind and fire relay transmission**.

Moreover, for those practicing the ritual, preserve the **light of the Three Pure Ones**, the **Three Luminaries**, and the **Three Days’ Light**, combining them with **True Fire** for refinement until the fire is exhausted.
The **transmitted light** ascends as **purple clouds**, and the **departed souls** ride upon its **qi**, attaining rebirth in the **Heavenly Realm**.
Next, the **Soul’s Treasure Officials** escort **soldiers and horses** with **two talismans**, accompanying the deceased to the **Celestial Gate**, where they verify identity and ascend to the **Dao’s Domain**.

**Imperial Ritual and Symbolic Array**
The **Method** states: The **Supreme Three Worthy Ones** dwell upon the **Mountain of Mysterious Capital, Jade Celestial City**, within the **Seven Treasures’ Mysterious Altar** and the **Purple Micro Palace of the Upper Celestial**.
The **Ten Directions’ Celestial Worthy** of the **uppermost world** descends **three times daily**, circling in attendance, holding **talismans and command scrolls**, bearing **banners and flags**, reciting **profound scriptures**, traversing the void with levitating steps, performing **music of the Celestial Hook**, scattering **divine flowers and marvelous sights**, with **luan birds dancing and phoenixes soaring**—thus, the **Three Realms rejoice**, and the **Ten Thousand True Ones celebrate**.
Now, the **ritual of the fast**—ascending the altar and offering prayers—**represents the Mysterious Capital, Jade Celestial City**.
The **imperial ritual’s methods and forms** are all complete.

The **Imperial Ritual** states: **Elemental Lord** expounds the **Soul’s Treasure Mysterious and Marvelous Method** of **transcending the first degree**, gathering all **celestial beings** at the **Platform of the Heavenly Treasure of the Void**. The **Heavenly Hosts** march in procession, with **sun, moon, and stars**, **celestial globes and jade balances**, **birds, beasts, luan, and phoenixes**, **crimson carriages and green banners**, **flag-draped standards**, all coming to pay homage to the **Worthy**.
Thus, those who perform the ritual, constructing the **altar’s steps**, follow the **Heavenly Methods** to deliver the **myriad people of the lower world**.

**One Pair of Banners**
Made of **five-colored silk**, with **five layers** above and below, suspended by a **golden staff** bearing a **luan phoenix beak** and **ribbon sash**.

**One Pair of Standards**
Covered with **pearl-draped nets** in an **eight-layered, angular design**, mounted on a **wooden staff**, with **dragon on the left and tiger on the right**, their **mouths clasping ribbon sashes**.

**One Pair of Flags**
Resembling **banners**, but without **dragon or phoenix mouths** holding the sash; instead, **three layers** of **five-colored silk** are suspended by a **staff**.

**One Pair of Jade-Pearl Banners**
Adorned with **pearl brocade and jade pendants**, the **golden phoenix mouth** holds them, suspended by a **staff**.

**One Pair of Five-Star Folding Fans**
Carved from wood and painted in **golden hues**, with **stars and constellations** on the upper half, **Five Sacred Mountains** in the middle, and **seas and marshes** on the lower half; mounted on a **crimson staff**.

**One Pair of Crane Feathers**
Carved from wood to resemble **crane wings**, mounted on a **crimson staff**.

The **Imperial Ritual** states: When ascending the altar and performing rites, it is **to substitute for Elemental Lord’s manifestation**.
First, **construct the symbolic array** to **command the Ten Thousand Heavenly Beings**.
Within the **four cardinal directions** of the altar, arrange the **stars, constellations, mountains, marshes, and earthly mandates**, erecting the **Five Phases’ Qi Gates**, each according to the **Great Method**, without negligence.

**Crowns, Robes, Swords, and Pendants for the Ranks**
The **Method** states: **Attire** is for **ritual distinction**.
Ascending the altar to pay homage to the **True Ones**, there must be no disorder—**scriptures and diagrams** must be complete, **official ranks and status** clearly marked, **command scrolls** properly arranged, **high and low** in accordance with **law and degree**, from the **Master of Orthodoxy** to the **Lecturer**, with **ceremonial propriety** as the **standard measure**.

**Master of Orthodoxy**
Wears a **dark crown**, **crimson robe**, and **yellow skirt**, with a **crimson apron**; adorned with **twenty-four strands of red-and-white jade pendants**; carries the **Sword of Beheading Evil**, **two feet four inches** long.

**Master of Purple Void**
Wears a **dark crown**, **yellow skirt**, **yellow robe**, and **yellow apron**; adorned with **twenty-eight strands of green-and-purple jade pendants**; carries the **Sword of Illuminating Yang Light**, **two feet eight inches** long, and also the **Sword of the Five Emperors’ Summoning Spirits**, with **bright jade pendants**.

**Master of Cavern Spirit**
Wears a **dark crown**, **yellow robe**, **green robe**, and **yellow apron**; adorned with **thirty-two strands of white jade pendants**; carries the **Sword of the Three Primordials of Great Unity**, **three feet** long, and also the **Sword of the Three Sovereigns and Great Unity**, with **green jade pendants**.

**Master of Cavern Mystery**
Wears a **peony-patterned crown**, **yellow robe**, **purple robe**, and **purple apron**; adorned with **thirty-two strands of luminous jade pendants**; carries the **Sword of the Eight Scenic Waves’ Soul-Dispelling**, **three feet six inches** long, and also the **Sword of the Five Emperors’ Awe and Spirit Commanding Evil**, with **plain white jade pendants**.

**Master of Cavern Truth**
Wears the **Crown of Primordial Beginning**, **green robe**, **purple apron**, and **purple apron**; with **green lining and outer layer**, adorned with **thirty-nine strands of jade and pearl embroidered pendants** and **embroidered shoes**; sits upon the **Soul-Dispelling Eight Scenic Waves’ Platform**, holding **jade tablets and jade scepter**; wields the **Soul-Dispelling Sword**, with **jade pendants and pearl tassels** hanging on either side; bears **front and back talismans for summoning spirits and true essence**, or wears the **Cloud-Nascent Robe of the Immortal**.

**Master of Great Cavern**
Wears the **Crown of Primordial Beginning**, **yellow robe**, **purple apron**, and **Five-Colored Cloud-Nascent Robe**; adorned with **swords and pendants**, as with the **Master of Cavern Truth**.

**Master of the Three Caverns**
Wears the **Crown of Primordial Beginning**, **yellow robe**, **purple apron**, and **Nine-Colored Cloud-Nascent Robe**; bears **no sword or pendant**.

As with the ranks of high and low above, all are **attired in the sacred Daoist robes** for **ascending the altar to commune with spirits and True Essence**.

**Baohai Clouds** say: The **sword** is for **banishing evil and restraining wrongdoing**, its **awe subduing demons and spirits**. The **pendant** governs **movement and stillness**, **advancement and retreat**, adhering to the **central measure of harmony**, each with its own **hierarchical distinctions**.

The **Great Celestial Truth’s Supreme Daoist Ritual** encompasses **ten thousand forms and myriad names**, infinite transformations—from **palaces and towers** to **condensing qi and solidifying clouds**, the illusory presence or absence of essence**, never fixed in place**. Sometimes it manifests as **floating halls and empty chambers**, shifting in voids. Sometimes as **golden gates and jade towers**, materializing in the empty space. Sometimes it **encompasses the cosmos**, or **shrinks into the minutest hairs**. Yet even in its **feathered robes and cloud-garments, misty attire and jade pendants, pearl banners and precious emblems, flying seals and crystal caps, crystal scepters and rainbow standards, phoenix-borne chariots and dragon-wheeled palanquins, sun-flags and moon-banners, crane-drawn carriages and twisted-horned steeds**, though it embodies the **divine transformations of the Way**, it still observes **graded distinctions in rank**.

Thus, the **sacred Daoist robes for communing with True Essence**, the **swords and pendants**, the **caps and garments**, are modeled on the **Supreme Truth above**, while **establishing ritual standards for mortals below**. If one **observes strict purity**, maintains **serene silence in a quiet chamber**, concentrates the **spirit and harmonizes the qi**, and **wanders in emptiness with a tranquil mind**, then in **secret communion with the Great Emperor** or **hidden reverence at the Mystic Gate**, without concern for **distinctions in attire**, one will naturally grasp the **essence of spiritual resonance**. High and low, all ranks, **will dissolve into unity**.

Such as when **teaching and transforming the people**, **expounding and upholding the Dao of purity**, each follows **proper stages and sequences**, perpetually **serving as eternal models**. In **paying homage to True Essence**, the **altars are filled with reverent devotees**.

Those who **profoundly uphold the Dao** follow these precepts, and they are the **grand splendor of the Mystic Gate**.

**Oath of the Sacred Transmission for the Daoist Adept**
The **Imperial Sage** says: The **Supreme Dao of the Lingbao** is the **root and origin of the Great Law**, the **hidden resonance and inner sounds of the Celestial Sovereigns**. It is **not something mortals below can perceive**.

One must **select and refine the worthy**, ensuring their **spirit and virtue are inwardly steadfast**, their **ritual bearing is solemn and dignified**, their **words and deeds are trustworthy**, their **compassion and mercy align with filial piety and loyalty**, their **conduct is disciplined and upright**, their **mind pure and straight**, their **aspirations directed toward the Mystic Sage**. Only such a person is **fit to practice and uphold the Supreme Dao**, to **save and guide beings across life and death**.

If their **words and deeds are flawed**, their **filial piety and loyalty are lacking**, their **mind and conduct are deceitful and crooked**, their **flattery and hypocrisy betray truth**, their **inner virtue is absent**, their **outer bearing is disordered**, then **shallow and vulgar folk**—how could they **ever move the divine and awaken the spirits of heaven and earth**?

One must **scrutinize the wise and foolish**, **distinguish the ranks of the immortal**, and then **solemnly receive the oath**, submitting a **formal declaration to the Three Heavens**, awaiting their **response**. Only then may one **select an auspicious day** and **confer the transmission according to the ritual**.

For **adepts who uphold the Dao**, after **half a decade of practice**, they may **grant salvation to five individuals**. After **one full decade**, they may **grant salvation to twelve**, but **no more thereafter**. Yet even this, the **Lingbao scriptures** are **not the full extent of the true law**.

If **nobles and ministers** desire to **save their nation and uphold the perilous**, to **preserve and secure the imperial lineage**, those who **receive this Great Law** must **offer one hundred twenty taels of gold**, **five-colored silk and brocade each thirty-six bolts**, **cinnabar and green silk each twelve taels**, **one hundred twenty shi of rice for assurance and prosperity**, **one hundred twenty thousand coins in gold**, and **thirty-six jin of oath-incense**.

If **common folk** desire to **save and guide beings across life and death**, to **ascend to the Mystic Ancestor**, they must **offer thirty-two taels of gold**, **five-colored silk and brocade each twelve bolts**, **cinnabar silk nine taels each**, **twelve shi of rice for assurance and prosperity**, **one hundred twelve thousand coins**, and **six jin of oath-incense**.

For **adepts who have attained the Dao through cultivation**, they must **offer nine taels of gold**, **one bolt of purple brocade**, **one tael of green silk**, **one tael of cinnabar**, **one jin of oath-incense**, and **one hundred sheets of ritual paper**, along with **one set of offerings from each of the five directions** in **money and rice**. Those **without means to practice the Dao** may **use two-thirds of these amounts**, but **nothing must be omitted**.

For this **law is secret even to the Supreme Heaven**, its **prohibitions are most grave**. Even **celestial beings and immortals** must **bring gold and treasures to the Upper Palace of the Mystic Gate** to **receive transmission**, hence **it cannot be casually revealed**.

If **adepts of the Dao** wish to **transmit the sacred law to those who uphold the ritual**, they must **diligently report each case to the Heavenly Tribunals**, following the **required offerings** as specified earlier. **No private concealment is permitted**.

If **transmission is withheld** due to **stinginess in lending worldly wealth**, or if **one spies and steals** to **acquire the offerings**, then **the adept is forbidden from granting salvation**. If **transmission is recklessly conferred**, the **Dao will not flourish**, the **spirit and virtue will not attend the scriptures**, and **demons will prevail**. Both **adept and disciple** will **suffer profound calamities**—this must be **strictly guarded against**.

If one **strictly follows the ritual precepts**, then the **Celestial Sovereigns will rejoice**, the **demons will submit**, and the **myriad spirits will pay homage**. At the **moment of opening the altar for transmission**, the **crowd of True Ones will oversee and guide**, bestowing upon us the **Dao and its law**. As the **Dao spreads and demons retreat**, **separation and union occur naturally**, **invoking the Sage and gathering the spirits**, **saving the living and guiding the dead**. Through **accumulated merit and steadfast practice**, the **fruition will be achieved in no time**.

**Inscription of the Sacred Tablet**
On the **year, month, day, and hour** of such-and-such, in the **state and county of such-and-such**, the **person of such-and-such** **hereby offers gold and treasures with a sincere heart**.

In accordance with the **ancient precepts of the Mystic Gate**, they **solemnly pledge to the Ten Heavens**. With **prostrations and reverent bows**, they **receive the Supreme Lingbao Daoist Scriptures**, the **hidden and profound texts of rank**.

Following the **ritual bearing**, they **practice the Dao**, **dissolving all inauspicious influences**, and **universally saving the boundless**. On the **day of receiving the Dao**, their **name is recorded in the Southern Palace**, where **myriad spirits stand guard**. Their **body transcends the Three Realms**, their **rank ascends to the Immortal Gathering**, while **demon kings bear witness** and **True Ones supervise**.

The disciple, **hereby humbly adheres to the Great Law**, **propagating the Divine and True**, **universally saving both Heaven and humankind**, daring not to conceal or transmit it lightly, **pledging by the Heaven-in-Heaven**.

After receiving the Law, the disciple dares not to divulge it carelessly to those below. Should they betray this oath, they shall be consigned to the **Ghostly Bureaus**, their lifespan diminished, their karmic tally reduced, enduring **ten thousand kalpas of trial**, forever sinking into the **Wheel of Rebirth**, and bringing calamity upon their **seven generations of ancestors**.

Today, a **deed of covenant** is hereby established as a solemn vow.

The succeeding disciple, **humbly named** [Name], born on the **day of such-and-such** in the year of [Year], son of [Father’s Name], **humbly receives the summons from the Celestial Qi Lord of Heaven**. They **reverently accept the transmissions of**:
- **Yuan Shi Tian Zun** (Emperor of Primordial Beginnings),
- **Tai Shang Dao Jun** (Celestial Sovereign of the Highest),
- **Tai Shang Lao Jun** (Celestial Sovereign of the Highest, the Venerable Old Master),
- **Tian Zhen Huang Ren** (The Heavenly True Man),
- **Miao Xing Zhen Ren** (The Marvelous Conduct True Person),
- **Zhu Tian Da Sheng** (The Heavenly Great Saints),
- **Wu Lao Da Di** (The Five Elderly Emperors),
- **Fei Tian Shen Wang** (The Flying Heavenly Kings),
- **Wu Di Da Mo** (The Five Emperors as Great Demons),
- **San Guan Wu Shi** (The Three Officials and Five Teachers),
- **Zhou Tian Xing Su** (The Circumpolar Star Hosts).

**Deed of Covenant and Talisman Formula**
On this joyous day, **[Name]** has received the transmission, passing through the **Heavenly Passes**, **petitioning the annihilation of the Three Evils**, **severing earthly bonds**, **ascending the Five Gates**, their name inscribed in the **Great Mysterious Register**, under the **oversight of the Demon Kings**, unrestricted by the **Heavenly Gates**.

The **Eastern Dipper** records their fate, the **Western Dipper** logs their decrees, the **Northern Dipper** decrees their death, the **Southern Dipper** grants their rebirth, the **Central Dipper** oversees their great destiny—**all supervising the myriad spirits**.

**Qing Di** guards their soul, **Bai Di** attends their spirit, **Chi Di** nourishes their qi, **Hei Di** circulates their blood, **Huang Di** presides centrally—**no god surpasses them**.

The **Five Emperors as Great Demons**, the **lords of the myriad spirits**, **proclaim this to the boundless**, and all spirits heed. The **Three Realms and Five Emperors** declare the **Upper Clarity**.

This deed is entrusted to the disciple **[Name]**, to be held as their **treasured talisman**, leading to **descent into the Flying Heavenly Observatories**, where the **Celestial Sovereign sings afar**, the **myriad spirits pay homage**, the **Three Realms attend in procession**, **demons bow in submission**, **ghostly intelligences perish of their own accord**, and **all spirits tremble in awe**. They shall **summon the gathered immortals**, their **dark wisdom piercingly clear**, their **great compassion boundless**.

**Swiftly, as the Lingbao Great Law’s covenant deed and statute is transmitted.**

**Lingbao Modification of True Perfection Vows**
At the **Lingbao Transmission Platform**, the **vow and deed** are solemnly entrusted to the succeeding disciple **[Name]**, who **humbly adheres to the Great Law**, **receives the vows in unity**, and **lists them as follows**:

**The Ten Lingbao Aspirations**
1. **Aspire to eternal life with joyful resolve**,
2. **Transcend death and enter rebirth**,
3. **Refine qi and ponder form**,
4. **Save all sentient beings**,
5. **Bring peace to the world**,
6. **Awaken all beings to the Dao**,
7. **Elevate the ancestors’ ascent**,
8. **Forever depart the Ghostly Bureaus**,
9. **Attain perfection in both form and spirit**,
10. **Merge with the Dao and realize True Perfection**.

**The Five Lingbao Precepts**
1. **Avoid killing or harming**; always practice patience and rescue.
2. **Avoid jealousy and envy**; always uphold benevolence toward others.
3. **Avoid theft or lust**; always act with honesty and rectitude.
4. **Avoid greed and corruption**; always cultivate shame and remorse.
5. **Avoid hatred, resentment, or vain adornments**; always practice frugality and compassion.

**The Ten Lingbao Oaths**
1. **Never indulge in drunken rage or wrath**,
2. **Never endure hunger, gluttony, or forced labor**,
3. **Never harbor broad ambitions or distant thoughts**,
4. **Never sever ties with non-humans**,
5. **Never acquire unjust wealth**,
6. **Never blame the Dao or reproach the teacher**,
7. **Never enter sacred temples recklessly**,
8. **Never misuse sacred texts or talismans**,
9. **Never profane secret scriptures**,
10. **Never harm ghosts or spirits wantonly**.

**The Ten Lingbao Virtues**
1. **Cherish the aged and comfort the orphaned**,
2. **Pity the poor and aid the widowed**,
3. **Rescue and relieve the suffering in darkness**,
4. **Distribute elixirs and medicines**,
5. **Revere all beings equally**,
6. **Diligently practice talismans and elixirs**,
7. **Constantly recite sutras and spells**,
8. **Widely construct scripture images**,
9. **Diligently observe fasts and precepts**,
10. **Redeem and spare lives**.

This deed **lists the vows without omission**, from beginning to end—**mind and body unretrogressing**, thereby **transcending the Three Woes and avoiding the Six Realms**.

The **Heavens guard and protect**, the **myriad saints revere and submit**. One must **diligently practice, observe fasts, and uphold precepts**, with a **calm and solemn heart**, **clear intentions**, **single-minded devotion**, **unified thought**, **inner and outer purity**, and **harmony with nature**. **Examine your own heart**—if you uphold the precepts and practice the Dao, you shall be **the model for the Three Realms** and **the reverence of ghosts and gods**, **summoning the True Ones and communicating with spirits**.

When **form and spirit both attain perfection**, the Dao **will not fail you**. **Diligently practice and truly receive**—**do not let demonic speech deceive you**. **Heed this deed solemnly.**

**Issued on the [Year] [Month] [Day] [Time] by the Transmission Master [Name], holding the Lingbao Heavenly Immortal Sacred Edict from the Three Heavens.**

「Humbly acknowledging that since the primordial chaos was first established, the Original Beginning opened the cosmic diagram, and the **True Scriptures** radiantly illuminated the layered heavens, while the **Celestial Characters** were spread forth in the **Green Fall** [i.e., the Pure Land of the Buddha]. The **Divine Spirits** descended in substance, and the **Qi Treasures** gathered in form, containing the **Original Qi** within the **Great Emptiness**, governing the **yin-yang** through the cycles of **cold and heat**, overseeing the **Three Realms**, and restraining the **host of demons**.

The **purple bamboo and jade tablets**, the **resplendent case and sacred scrolls**, are **scriptures ranked as the highest class**, with their **Dao** alone reigning supreme in the **Central Palace** [i.e., the highest celestial realm]. They are the **source of all laws** and the **origin of profound mysteries**. The **hosts of the heavens** hold them in utmost reverence, and only those who **diligently toil** may hear them. After careful discernment of the **wise and foolish**, they shall follow the **ancient ordinances**.

Having sworn allegiance to the **Ten Heavenly Lords** and presented the **Celestial Petition**, bearing **nine taels of gold** as a sacred offering. If the **secret scriptures** are revealed carelessly, the calamity shall extend to the **Nine Ancestors** [i.e., the nine generations of ancestors]. Now, the **successor disciple** [Name], on this very day, **earnestly presents** nine taels of gold, a bolt of purple silk, one tael of cinnabar, and a corner of fragrant incense. If [Name] is a **public official, commoner, or layperson**, additional offerings shall be made as per the **standard measures**.

Humbly recording that the **native life-force of this disciple** was born in the [Year] [Month] [Day] [Time].

Deeply reflecting that [Name] has long held a **pure heart and resolute will**, steadfastly **guarding the Dao with untainted sincerity**, diligently following the **clear precepts** and swearing allegiance to the **Transmission Master**. Having already received the **auspicious reward**, it is fitting to **bestow celestial honors**.

**Recommending Master**: The **Universal True One Flying Heavenly King**, the **Great Sage of Eternal Life**, the **Limitless Great God**.

**Supervising Master**: The **Thirty-Two Heavenly Sovereigns**, the **Mysterious Conduct True Person**.

**Transmitting Master**: The **Universal Lingbao Heavenly Venerable**, the **Emperor of the Dao of Great Emptiness**.

**Scripture Master**: The **High Illumination Great Marshal of the Nine Heavens**, the **True Lord of Divine Merit and Miraculous Salvation**.

**Registering Master**: The **Thirty Heavenly Lord of Support and Auxiliary Teaching**, the **First and Most Serene Lord of Tranquil Response**, the **Transmitting Master**, the **Great Law Master of the Mysterious Middle Teaching**.

**Degree from the Eastern Dipper**: The **Lord of Recorded Calculations**.
**Degree from the Southern Dipper**: The **Lord of Supreme Life**.
**Degree from the Western Dipper**: The **Lord of Recorded Names**.
**Degree from the Northern Dipper**: The **Lord of Falling into Death**.
**Degree from the Central Dipper**: The **Lord of Great Success**.

In accordance with the **Lingbao Original Precepts**, it is decreed that [Name] shall be **granted the sacred transmission** and **diligently uphold** the **Upper Clarity Lingbao Great Dao**. The **prison official** [Name] is hereby appointed as **Mr. [Name]**, **Imperial True Person**, **Supervising Official of the Southern Palace Refinement**, overseeing the **Yellow Talisman Hall** affairs.
